Held my wedding dinner at Jubilee Garden Restaurant. Torrence and Banquet Manager Kent were very prompt in their replies. They guided us through the procession and the program, constantly assuring us that things will turn out well. They were also very helpful, polite and generous.

The food was delicious and value for money. Portions were big and our guests loved the food.  Thank you so much for making our wedding dinner such a special one. Greatly appreciated.

(Photos featured were taken during our food tasting session.)

Visited Jubilee Garden several times with the family.

Food's consistently good (not mind-blowingly good, at least at that price point, but you should have a comfortable and enjoyable time). The premium items are are only one serving per table (understandably so but still a bit of a bummer, especially with the chilli crab. The 4 of us had to ration and felt wanting a bit more).

I must add though that service was fantastic - all the service staff were polite and attentive without being intrusive -  kudos to the experienced and well trained staff!

Definitely worth trying this ala-carte buffet Chinese restaurant and eating here again!  Good service from the staff - keep it up!  Since the food from the restaurant was surprisingly tasty, the cuisine must be pretty promising for wedding banquets.  For those who loves zhi char, the food at this restaurant is a must-try!  Highly recommended!

I found the information regarding what they actually offer lacking online so I talked to a friendly male staff about it. They mainly do buffet and wedding packages but they also actually offer ala carte menu as well. This review is more for posting their ala carte menu photos for the benefit of everyone. I will go back for the food someday.
Price is okay. Food taste i find it average overall. It was quite empty inside the restaurant during weekday evening time....

Good place for quantity only. Food quality is poor, you get what you pay for. Service attitude needs to be improved, staff were annoyed when they can’t fit the dishes on the small tables and they started stacking plates, expecting us to balance it. They also ‘reminded’ us about waste charge when we couldn’t bring ourselves to eat unpalatable fish with soil taste - we left behind  bones and some meat. Perhaps they expected us to finish the bones too. Will not revisit
Came here with company for CNY lunch. Buffet style. Not bad. Their service is good. Food tastes not bad. Price is affordable too. Will be back again another time.

We had the ala-carte lunch buffet on 24 July. Quite good value with the birthday promo. Food is generally above average. The crabs and prawns are fresh. But the steam cod fish is not fresh as it has a weird smell and the clams have too much sand. Service is excellent especially the waitress called Ah Qing who is very attentive and can anticipate our needs. Food is served quite fast and hot. We will be back and hope they have new dishes.

It was a great dinner evening today at TPY Safra and most of all they were so kind to call back my friend who make the reservation , to inform her that I have left my purse there after my dinner .
Ps. Thank you to Mr Wu 🙏🏻to wait for me at the Safra lobby to hand me back the purse. Much appreciated with your kind gesture. 🙏🏻
Pros:
Very clean place  - Spacious , great for wedding dinner , no cuts of plates and bowl and they were all squeaky clean! 👍🏻
Affordable buffet price with great taste !! Good quality amount of food for 2 person ✌🏻
Friendly reception & attentive service staff :)
Cons:
No credit card promotion . Only Safra member 10% discount

The food seems like all precooked. Was Served right after you order. Chilli crab was the worse we've eaten, tasteless and full of starch. Pig's trotter vinegar, the meat were all dried up and there was a piece full of hair, really spoil appetite. Deep fried tilapia was OK except that for 9pax, they gave a very small fish.
Good food and service. Too full!!! We enjoyed the food alot and will be back again.

Jubilee is a strange place indeed. A restaurant that's not really a proper restaurant per say. Looks like Safra wanted to maximise its rental income, so they simple compartmentalize the ball room into 4 sub dinning areas and leased them to Jubilee to operate as a restaurant! Good is that we booked 1 table and hv the whole sub dinning hall to ourselves. Bad is that next dinning room is hosting a D+D of sorts, so we had to put up loud noises as they had a karaoke competition for entertainment. Believe you me, wasn't that pleasant when you have to put up with extremely terrible loud voices screaming into the mike...not quite the SG got talent show!😰😱

Foodwise, the quality is surprisely decent and not the usual mass produce type of food. Out of the 8 dishes on offer from the set CNY menu, I would say only the last 2 dishes....fried rice wrapped in lotus leaf n the red bean soup with glutinous rice balls are so so. The other dishes are good. Tasty and generous in portions. I liked the shark fins soup and stewed abalone with mushrooms especially! (Ok .... No disrespect to those anti shark fins activists...its just my personal choice). The prawn ball in oat flaks was also brilliant...piping hot, fresh n crunchy. The fish was humongous! Also quite fresh so would have been good if it was simply steamed instead of cooked with bean paste sauce. Still good nevertheless.

4 stars for food and 3 stars for the 'loud' ambience. 3.5 stars average. Perhaps good to visit the main branch in Katong.
The lotus wrapped rice could be more fragrant and the yam paste can be more thicken. Their chicken and abalone dish can be a plus point for events.

we have company dinner here,
i tried a lot of new food here.
the staffs were so kind.

Not the best of location for wedding lunch/ dinner. The tables are packed together and staff kept asking guests to shift their chairs so they could squeeze through to serve food and top up drinks. Table planning/ positions could have been done better.

Utensils are sub standard. Almost spilled the soup due to the chipped/ broken bowl.

Food wise, it could be better. Glad that there is a  McDonald's on the ground floor.
Quality of food was pretty good for ala carte buffet dinner. Good customer service.

Called to make booking and was told will be given birthday boy/girl for free if we meet the number if pax. Upon arrived, can’t find my booking record, and charges are also different as communicated over the phone. Suggest to take down the person name if you make phone reservations. The china lady who handle us at counter and payment was not friendly honestly. The food & service acceptable except the admin part.

It kinda ruined our marriage, even after 4 years later my husband and I still argued due to this. Couples please reconsider if you want to hold your once in a lifetime wedding in this restaurant. Here is the post 4 years ago

I host my wedding banquet on 08 Dec 18 at qianxi TPY and it was a disaster. My name was wrongly printed in the dinner menu. I didn't know dinner menu were supposed to print our name in full and no one advised.
The display TV outside is showing my wrong name as well! my guests did not know is my wedding! This is basic knowledge but yet overlooked by your management. I have emailed to your management and was simply ignored. I guess this feedback will be as well ignored!

A year later we went back to complete our meal in the same restaurant, the waitress accidentally spilled hot water onto my feet. No it wasn’t busy as we are the only table being served by one waitress at that point in time.

If anyone wish to host their wedding there think twice! new brides beware ! If you considering the same restaurant it might ruin your once in a lifetime wedding!

Situated at level 3 of Safra Toa Payoh, this place consists of at least 3 ballrooms which are customized for different events as listed on their website. I was there for a wedding, and there was also a D&D happening. Food was mostly good while service can be improved. Note that my experience is that of during a wedding.

2nd visit. Alacarte buffet
Nice food, good ambience and friendly staff. Recommended

Went for the ala carte buffet for CNY. Surprisingly, this style is not bad. Not all dishes are good tho but for the price it is. The jelly fish cold dish is my favorite. Char siew and the garlic slice pork are good. The chilli crab is surprisingly good. Meat are fresh n firm. The abalone soup is not bad. Not too salty. Overall value for price is there.

Our senior ladies' choir was invited to perform song item and join the Christmas dinner. The restaurant packed about four hundred guests. The food dishes were served promptly. Dishes well presented, adhered to menu of choice by Host. Service good, ambience decor pleasant. Stage and sound system set up available, as the venue  facilitate karaoke, a key attraction.

The food was fair. The cold dish was good but no 'WOW' factor. The egg prawn was good but the noodle dish somewhat bland. The duck was well done but the fried chicken was quite dry IMHO. If you are planning a corporate function...it would be ideal but for a special dinner function such as wedding orba milestone birthday celebration...might want to give this  a MISS.

Nice environment.
Mini ballroom feel
I'm here attending CNY dinner.
Nice food and friendly STAFF !🤗

Promotion ended but outside still put old poster. Only told us that promo ended when paying bills. Portion of one time dishes quite small for our big group of 7, not worth it when u come as a big group because the food portion same as another table of 3 or 4.

Ordered a voucher on fave for a 7 course meal that included cold starter, shark's fin soup, cod, prawns, abalone, Ee Fu  noodles and mango pomelo sago dessert. The dishes were distinctively tasty, with the cod being very generous as well as the sharks fin. Prawns were well cooked in a unique sauce that we all enjoyed. We definitely hope to be back

The service is the worst I have ever experienced, no exaggeration. The servers here act like they’re not in the service line.

1) They lied to us that there’s no wine served when we clearly saw a few tables with glasses of wine. Only when we pointed it out then they served it to us.

2) They complained numerous times to our face when we nicely asked to have our plates changed or tea refilled, which I think is quite a standard for Chinese banquet.

3) When we called for one server, she just gruffly signaled for us to ask another server and walked off.

Not worth it to hold your event here even if it’s cheap, as the service ruins it for everyone. I really wonder if the people who are giving 4 or 5 stars are their own people trying to increase their rating.
Our favorite buttet lunch
Rubbish service. Forgot about our order and then made it the customer’s fault

Budget type of ala carte buffet... Where you get to order as much as you want for those dishes that you always never had enough of during wedding banquets. Haha.
Prawns, chicken, whole fish etc...

If you are looking for a chinese restaurant that is  very reasonable in price, great food and good location then do consider this restaurant. The waiters and waitresses tend to be elderly but they are very friendly. If there are special functions going on, parking may be challenging. However, there is always the valet.
Wonderful ambience for a small gathering.  Good food served at Jubilee Garden Restaurant.  Very friendly environment plus cheerful staff to enhance our meal at this location.

Good environment for company event.
They provided big LCD screens for the event and provided tech support throughout the event.
The services provided are above the expectations.
However, the food quality is inconsistent and can be further improved upon.
Per person Ala carte free flow of ordered dishes.  Try the fried Soon Hock fish. It is very good
Service is good. Overall food is not bad but certain food eg fried chicken wing taste like overnite food.
Cheap price for what you're able to eat. Taste though, although not fantastic, is fairly good considering how low the price tags are
Not a good experience in this banquet. waitress keep ask us to push chair in. refilling drinks - a waitress pour water into sprite. tea into beer. serving food in a attitudes manner.
Food was ok, felt the serving was less for a table of 10pax..Place was big to hold big events.The speaker volume was quite loud. Could have volume down abit.
Came for weekend buffet lunch. Food was good, especially the chili crab. Good varity and fresh. Recommend the seabass.

The buffet is terrible and disappointing, small portion, served dishes very slow and didn't serve dishes like prawns and pork in the end, moreover they deleted the negative comments on Facebook page to hide the truth, horrible
Not bad buffet spread! But note that there are additional charges on drinks and starters!
Cod fish not cooked, chili mud crab very small. Not much variety of food to choose
Attended Chinese wedding here. Food and service is good at lower rates than most hotel banquets.
Worst service ever. Problems in bringing wine, problems even in changing plates. Service staff could complain and argue back with diners. I cannot fathom how a restaurant could operate like this.
Nice dishes order by organization which for the event. Service is good. Will join next event again.
Their buffet is definitely more worth it then their set meals 😁
The place is spacious as they have moved their seating are into one of the ballrooms.
Come here to eat buffet with bro and relative, price reasonable and service is fast although is al-carte buffet
Good food, comfortable seating. All you can eat.

珍味

Wanted to try a nearby Thai cuisine but it was not opened yet.

We then settled for this zichar stall at another coffee shop.  The white beehoon (白米粉@S$5.50) and san lou hefen (三捞河粉@S$5.50) were not too bad, better than expected.  The serving of white beehoon was quite big.

You may want to give it a try if you are around here, and run out of idea on what to eat.
Very tasty San Lao Hor Fun and beautifully fried plate of fibre and crispy hae bee.

Have been a regular at the stall especially enjoyed their claypot tofu which comes with lots of gravy. First time ordered delivery as my whole family down with Covid-19 and they willing agree to deliver despite knowing our conditions. Thanks so much!

They served authentic Chinese home cook Zi Char with down to earth pricing. Previously from Toa Payoh West CC, they are now at Blk 126 Toa Payoh Lor. 1

Don’t miss out their savory golden Tofu, aromatic spices curry fish head and their new dish garlic pork!

Am a regular client of this stall. Even that I am not spared but to suffer very bad service and rude attitude from the lady taking orders today. We ordered our simple dine in meal together with take away. It was about 6pm. Not busy hour yet. The dine in food came really fast. After we finished, the take away was not ready. I was surprised. No choice but wait. End up, I was made to wait another 15 to 20 minutes for the take away. Not only that, one of the orders was wrong. 新洲米粉 became 新洲河粉. May be I mountain tortoise, never know 新洲河粉 ever existed. In a not so polite manner, she said she will change for me. But I am not prepared to wait another 15 mintues to change the order. And she argued and lied with a straight face saying my wife told her to start preparing the take away only after we finished our meals. Wonder who in the right mind would do that in a coffee shop Zichar stall with smoking corner just a few steps away. Without my wife to verify on the spot as she already left to run some errands, I had to take the lady's word, and left, not so happy of course. Obviously my wife did not tell her that.
Everyone makes mistakes. Just admit with the correct attitude. No big deal. Why tell lies to cover a mistake? Moreover, to a regular client.
Very good Zi char, good cooking, dishes quite typical. Excellent fishhead steamboat

Portion is very small for large.  Was charged $40 for 2 portions of large noodles and $20 for 2 miserable pieces of toufu with a few minced pork at the top. Total $60.  Really a ripped off coz the large portion is like medium.

Update: Ate at another zichar store today and spent $86 for 5 medium dishes and rice. Medium portion was like zhenwei's large. There was even leftover coz we were so full after the meal. Really value for money unlike this zhenwei. Will not patronise Zhenwei again.
One of the best zi char stall around in Singapore and most importantly the price is very reasonable, was surprised of the total bill after ordering so much. Will definitely visit again.👍👍👍
My favorite dish from this Zi char  stall
Decent place with good food and great prices! Yummylicious for a simple place like this. Ample parking all around too.

Friendly and attentive staff. Nice cosy environment. Food is good and delicious. We especially love the assam curry fish head, quite spicy yet taste good. Do try their dessert as well. Overall worth coming again for dinner.

Located just 5mins+ walk from Potong Pasir MRT, Gu Ma Jia serves a decent varieties of local 煮炒 that are simple yet delicious.

The Assam Groupa Fish Head was quite spicy and goes very well with rice. Kyoto pork ribs were very tender with appetising sweet and sour sauce. Salted egg prawns were very fresh but otherwise pretty normal. What surprise me was the ying yang kai lan which was served with deep fried shredded kai lan leaves and crunchy kai lan stems.

Staff were very prompt in service and  friendly as well. Recommended to make reservations during Friday night and weekend to avoid not being able to get seats. Pricing were reasonable as well.

Overall definitely one of the better zi char restaurants option in Singapore.

There are plenty of dessert cafe and bar next to it for after meal chilling sessions as well.

Don't let it's humble shopfront fool you. The food is nothing less than legendary. My elder brother stays nearby for years and I have passed this store countless times. Strangely on the eve of his relocation, he suggested to dine here and he has never been here before. It was a last minute reservation (made 30mins before we arrive) and it looks a little empty for a saturday night.

Honestly I didnt harbour much expectations and ordered mainly the signature items which are less likely to go wrong. The dishes were promptly served and oh boy.. i was so wrong. The chicken soup is flavourful and though most of us didnt like chinese parsley and there was abundance in it, we slurped our bowls empty in no time (skipping the parsley of course) and found ourselves wanting more! The assam fish we've had before were mostly a tad too sour and this was amazingly balanced, the fish was cooked just right. Despite swearing to go on a diet, i had to have half a portion of rice to go with the sauce or I will sleep with regrets.

The final dish that came which sealed the deal was the signature prawn noodle. Gu ma jia is located just steps away from a famous prawn noodle available in single portions at a starting price of $5 while for this, the only size comes in a huge claypot at $30 but I will gladly choose this in a heartbeat. The broth is rich and yummy of course but what's shocking is there is wokhey. Show of hands, who had prawn noodles that had wokhey?

The other dishes that I didnt mention does not mean it wasnt crazy good. I just didnt wanna give any more spoilers. Go explore places that may not seem instaworthy, for a change, and they might surprise you with a dinner that you will remember for life.

Gu Ma Jia kitchen is simple and unpretentious. What you see is what you get

Sometime simplicity is all you need. Don’t need the pompous and filtered photos which looks good but end results is disappointing.

It was a celebration for a colleague returning for a short stint at Korea.

There were 5 of us hence five dishes.

Service and waiting time were generally ok. As this was a treat by the boss, I didn’t know the actual price. However I have glance at the menu and the prices are reasonable.

Certain dish only come in standard size whilst other have different sizes. Make sure you check when ordering. You can ask them to help you estimate the dish size based on your group size.

My favourite dish was the Asam fish filet. They packed a punch in terms of sour and spiciness. On that day they ran out of the whole fish hence the filet.

If you crave for home taste cooked food, I would recommend this kitchen.

Simple Zai Char Chinese cuisine restaurant
First time visiting, ordered stir-fried ginger & spring onion beef, broccoli with mushrooms, bitter-ground melon soup.
Soup was good & tasty..
Very nice and delicious home cooked foods. Good service and boss Gu Ma is very polite and friendly 😀 👍 😊 🙏
This is third time come, everytime come the standard is there, food are very nice , the price also reasonable 👍🏼😋

The food is all very delicious. Went there to get a whole fish, which I looked forward to but too bad, they are out of all the whole fish and crabs. So we went ahead to order the rest and its all delicious. Worth the price. The place was very quiet at 7pm, as if I booked the whole place for myself. Service was great. Just too bad I can't get my whole fish. Will definitely come back for more, hopefully there's a whole fish available next.
Big portion, im soooo amaze, very quick serving with great food
Not bad..will try more dish next visit
Awesome place to enjoy a family Chinese dinner with strong flavours and all dishes are tasty. Worthy

Simple yummy home cooked Chinese food done well near Potong Pasir. The place has been around for more than ten years. And one of the best thing, you allow BYOB for wines for $10 corkage. We are definitely coming back here to try other dishes!

Love the food. Taste like home cooking which is always excellent. Very personable service too by friendly staff. Malaysian chefs and staff. I think I remember a famous food blogger says if all the Malaysian chefs go home, our zhi cha stalls will suffer. I believe so.
We had the claypot tofu which was full of roast pork and melt-in-the-mouth tofu and 3 cups chicken with a sauce that tastes like satay marinade. A tad too sweet for me. The hot Pulot Hitam dessert comes with a scoop of really frozen vanilla ice cream. Hubby really loves the combi. Will return again with other family members and friends.

My parents tried once on their ala carte dishes and it was not too bad. But this second time we ordered the set meal, which was unfortunately not to my liking at all. Have to say the curry fish head is not too bad, normal. But the rest of the dish... is really not my kind of food. Average or slightly below average. Will not return again. I noticed many people are waiting to be seated, probably the taste suits old people more.

Zichar style food at zichar pricing with aircond. Very fast service, pleasant servers. Able to call in advance to make reservations.

Food quality wise (perhaps it’s the dishes that I ordered), I don’t think it’s exceptional. Some dishes were tad too salty, some lack the final
Oomph.

Perhaps I’ll come back to try the curry fish head that everyone is raving about.

Zichar place with aircon and a heart in what they serve. The claypot tofu is one of the best we ever tasted. Nothing to complain. Little boy loves the roasted pork inside while his daddy likes this kind of toufu very much (someone should put this as an official guideline for all Zichar places: only this kind of toufu should be used for claypot). The shrimp paste chicken has crispier skin. We tried the signature Kyoto rib in yam ring (because don’t have the vegan Assam fish that day 😭😭). Rib is tender but a bit “porky”. Prob won’t try again for that price.  Would like to recommend the hot honey lemon. Much better than expected. 😋😋

The food is delicious and nice, reasonable price. You Should try their assam fish head. really nice! however the place is not near any mrt, the fastest way is to take a grab or take bus no. 23 from Boon keng Mrt and alight before expressway if you are not driving.

It’s my first visit here and I was pleasantly surprised by the food and service. We were seated on level 2 which was empty.

Please order the Gu Ma pork ribs! They are so delicious!!

Do make a reservation as they are famous and get really crowded.
Enjoyed our dinner at Gu Ma Jia. Home cooked vibe, attentive service, friendly vegetarian options. Highlight was the yuanyang vegetable, will be back to try the Assam Fish curry!
Looking for a fish head curry takeout and tried it out here. Wasn’t disappointed. Both taste and price  ($30) were on point. The Assam had a real kick and fed 3 for dinner.
Great food and service. Has a very reasonably priced set meal of all their specialties. Assam fish is a must have!

Old school eatery that really delivers on price and quality. The setup is rather utilitarian, but the staff are attentive and welcoming.

The fish head curry is their famous dish which really delivers. The assam curry is tangy and spicy, touched by sweetness from the vegetables and pineapple. The fish head is meaty, unlike many places. All of it comes together to make a well-balanced whole.

On the downside, the famed Kyoto pork is a little dry and flavor doesn't seep all the way through the meat. Makes for a very instagrammable dish though because of it's flaming presentation.

Overall, the food is good and the price point is very reasonable, leaving you with a sense of satisfaction.
Food was nice. Service is good. But quite pricey for a private dining restaurant which have kopitiam chairs as seats.

We only had a sambal chicken rice bowl and sambal fried tanghoon for lunch. Both were good enough for us to think of coming back with friends to try more dishes, especially the fish head curry. Will update!
Had family gathering for dinner. Love their Assam fish head and other dishes. Yummy and delicious. 😋😋

Never had a bad dish here. Clam bee hoon has the wok taste, fluffy Oyster omlette, tasty spinach soup. Just disappointed they ran out of pork ribs and we didn't know had to order crab day in advance.

Great and attentive service too - I asked for cup of hot water to b sterilise baby's pacifier and waiter even brought tongs for it!!

The best food!! Very home cooked feel...
Service is tip top first class!!! Must try the Assam fish head and the clay pot wine chicken!!! Fantastic!!!

Cosy zi char place! Food is fragrant and tasty. The ubin lala beehoon has good wok hei and the lala is very fresh. They are generous with the egg too. The marmite pork ribs were a little hard but was ok overall. The belacan Kang Kong was delicious, though a little bit on the salty side! Staff were courteous and friendly. Highly recommended place for dinners w bigger groups. You can make reservation here via Chope.

Yummy food, fast service.

We ordered Assam fish head, XO prawn noodles, vinegar pig trotters, yam ring with scallops, belachan sweet potato leaves, kai lan. All the dishes were delicious, particularly the yam ring which was crispy and came with fresh vegetables too.

Price slightly on the high side, but worth the splurge.

Homely place with awesome friendly service with much smiles. Lots of dishes to choose from. Because there are only two of us, we ordered ala carte dishes like spicy seafood mee sua and beef teriyaki.

Love their drinks too, especially iced honey lemon tea.

Would definitely want to come back again to try the Zhi char

service is good, Ubin Lala Bee Hoon very delicious and the price is $18 (take away $19),hot plate bbq sweet and spicy thai style sotong price is $22, claypot 3-cup wine chicken small portion is $15. Overall is good

Food is good but was so disappointed with the service. Its Mother's Day and I understand that they will be busy but when I was ordering and asked about how long it will take, they told me ot will take 20mins. I was willing to wait. But after 30mins, they still tell me sorry, waiting dor one more dish and I was still patiently waiting until its 45mins. I went to the kitchen there and tell them I've waited for 45mins. And they said sorry but do I still want my order, they are really busy. How can 20mins become 45mins? And they came up a few dishes in 20 mins and a few dishes in 45mins? Just very disappointed. No matter how good the food is, service is very important.
Excellent Zi Char place known for its assam style fish head curry ($30). I had belachan kangkong too and it is very fragrant and well cooked.

Their Asam Fish head is awesome .
Staff is very good and polite.
Worth it to pay a visit .

A comfortable place to eat.
Air conditioned Zi Char place.

Food generally served pretty fast, price is slightly more expensive than external zi char.

Would recommend if you looking for a comfortable place to eat
Food was good ordered their signature
I was expecting good food because of the reviews here but the food was really really salty. I wasn't able to finish my Kampong fried rice. Even the lettuce dish is salty.
Must try will be the sesame oil chicken soup. 2 levels available with good aircon environment.

First time there - looks extremely popular at lunch. May need reservations at lunch.  Two of us, their specialty was the curry fish head and a plate of veg, and two hot drinks -$50.  Seems a tad expensive for half a head which was a little small to me.  Forgot to take the pics of the food.

Will try to bring my larger family here and give it a go- seems to have a variety of dishes.

食物好吃到......令人流泪。Ordered crab bee hoon. Crab was ultra fresh and super sweet. Shell was cracked perfectly so eating is a breeze. Bee hoon is quality so it remains tangy till the end. Soup taste so good that makes my last day of 2019 so touching.... Please keep up the standard. Will be back.

Gumajia offers delectable dishes suitable for whole family. The highlight should be their assam fish head.

Kids should love their Prawn paste chicken wing and Prawn roll.

first time visit. ordered crabs, pork ribs, hotplate tofu and sweet potato veg. overall food is very good. will come again to try their signature assam fish head. Gu Ma is very friendly and recommended other dishes for us to order in the next visit
Pleasant air-conditioned environment for dining. Food is palatable and lunch deals come with a free drink.
Loved the Assam curry! The second discovery was the kailan 2 ways. The fried kailan leaves were shiok! Overall a very satisfying meal

After dine-in was lifted to 5 pax, my friends and I wanted a cosy and family style eating place.  Location should be convenient with MRT station nearby.
We made our reservation at Gu Ma Jia Private Kitchen.  The lady who took our reservation was very friendly and thoughtful.
Our table was reserved at level 2, which was not noisy. It alowed my friends and I to catch up after not meeting one another for 35 years.
Food was great with generous portion.   Price was very reasonable.   Staff was friendly and attentive, even came to ask us how was food.
Overall, ambience, food and staff were great!
Family style cooking. Love their fried egg plants.
One of my fav restaurants to go when I crave "home cooked" dishes. Good value for money. Friendly service. Pepper crab is awesome. Place is cosy. 2 thumbs up for the crew 👍🏻👍🏻
Disappointed travel from Bukit Batok it just like most ZIchar so outstanding but ok

A dining place you must try if you are near macpherson.All their dishes are delicious and value for money.
👍👍👍👍👍👍

Ordered their 4-5pax delivery menu. Food came within the delivery window however it was not kept in a warmer bag when it arrived. Food were cold and unpleasant to eat. They could have at least make an effort to keep it in a warmer bag. 2 stars for their delivery. 5 stars for their dine in.

Was there on a weekday lunch around 12pm+. It was not very crowded. The service was very fast. We ordered food for 6 people and each paid around $16.50. The duck skin is crispy and meat is soft. The char siew has a nice char and nice fat to lean ratio. Overall, it's not bad but a bit salty and has MSG.

The char shao was lean so it is suitable for older folks but it certainly didn't look like what the pics in sign board.  When my duck and Chartham rice  order was taken I was asked if I  wanted to add an egg or anything else so I added bean sprouts but I didn't expect a whole plate of beansprouts to be served so damage was $13.30.Would be better if staff could inform me. Beansprouts were quite crunchy but a little salty for my liking. The place is loud and the staff voices were very loud.  Not my first place to have a nice quiet meal especially when food is jsut avg

Expensive, bad service and bad food. $5.50 for a packet of soya sauce chicken with mostly bones. What a cheating eatery! I bought this for my child and ended up there was very little edible part. Service was prompt but without smile, bordering on rude. I was a regular many years ago but since the change of boss, it’s bad service and bad food.

Meat was sparse and there is no price list displayed throughout entire shop. You will only know the price after you ordered. $6.5 for this plate with no add ons. Nothing special but charge premium. Be warned

One of my go-to places for wanton noodles. Their Pork lard is amazing! Soup is on the peppery side. Char siew is sweet & to my liking.

Price wise, it's $6 for a bowl of noodles with char siew & veg and also comes with a soup containing 3 small wanton.
Nice place for roast duck and char siew(recommendation is to order the streaky version aka 半肥叉烧). Comes with a side bowl of thick & flavourful umami gravy to drizzle on white rice.

Qtr roast duck=$17. Mixed char Siew & roast
Meat=$16. One braised egg=$1. Noodle kosong=$2. White or chicken rice=$1 each. Total damage= $38 for 3 paxes. Price on the high side but the quality of their char Siew and roast duck is good & above average.
Would recommend the char siew wonton noodles from this shop! The dumplings are also well filled.

Rice used not very good quality, when you have char siew sauce it doesn't taste good. The noodles were better.

Shrimp dumpling is huge, $1 each. Although lots of meat with a small whole shrimp in it, I would describe it as very rough execution, which is a menu item you can skip.

With noodle and rice charged at $5.50, which is good court pricing, I would not say it was value for money. Food good enough to satisfy your hunger or crave for roast meat, but not a place to visit due to quality/value of meal.

I have to say it’s priced on the high side for a central hub hdb area. But the noodle was just very well done with just the right amount of seasoning and the roast duck leg was excellent.  I’ve paid much much more for worst food at Holland village. I read many comments about price verus quantity.  I rather eat high quality then quantity.  It doesn’t get 5 stars because $9 for my noodle priced out a lot of older uncles and aunties.

Knew it was pricey when i went. Still got taken aback when bill came. Haha

Food is good. Roast duck good. Charred char siew is power. Roasted meat is good too.  Noodles are very Q.

Dumpling soup is mediocre.

Don’t know about the service as there was no dine in due to covid. But tar pow was fast and pleasant. Will definitely go back as i did not expect michelin service with the michelin pricing.

Food was good, but on the expensive side. $6.50 for roast meat & char siew rice in a casual (not even food court) setting. 2pax, spent $19.50

Attitude sucks as we were carrying takeaway bread when we enter, and the cashier, shouted no outside food. Seriously, you really think we would buy bread just to eat at your small stall? Prefer to spend my money somewhere

They have 2 servers who stood outside the stall to take takeaway orders.  The other small skinny lady was good with order, but the plumper china lady was bad. She took the wrong order the first time, now she shortchange me when she gave me back my change (not sure if she is keeping the coins or she really forgot.  Regardless, she’s a very careless person). If I see she’s the one taking order there, I wouldn’t buy from this stall.

Wow so much controversies. I like the food. Highlights are the charred char siew and roast meat. The meal pictured was about $38, for 3 pax. Was lucky as the crowd wasn't bad on Sunday 12pm. They served the food very quickly. Will be back again if there isn't any queue. Nice food though slightly ex.

Love their soy sauce chicken,  char siu and roast pork. Reminds me of the way they serve it in Ipoh -  Cantonese style. Their condiments of chili and ginger oil sauce are also really good. Like in true Cantonese fashion, some of the staff have the attitudes to match (ok, I am stereotyping) and that's the main reason for the low ratings - but I didn't have a problem each time I was there and the taste is just great!

We got half a duck, a mixed platter of char siew and roast pork and individual bowls of noodles. The food, including the noodles, was pretty salty. Apart from the duck, the rest of the food came in small portions. This is especially so for the noodles, which cost $2 each. The char siew was the saving grace of the meal though. The noodles also came with lots of lard pieces.

Service was also quick.

I have been eating this place for quite a few years and never had much problems with the staff. Price wise, agree its rather pricy. However, their meat is rather tender and juicy. Especially like the sio bak. You can request for oily rice. The chilly sauce for the chicken is really appetising

Was having training at the nearby hdb hub. Visited this place for lunch. Ordered the simple wanton mee noodles. The char shu was good, but the wantons and the noodles were normal.  They included pork lard in the noodles and that’s why it’s pretty flavorful. Paid $5 for the wanton mee which I thought was slightly on the high side.

Overpriced experienced
Roast duck and char Siew for two persons is $16. Just Noodles alone is $2 per plate. While the duck taste good but too overpriced.

Paid $5 for a bowl of soya sauce chicken noodle, portion that came was small for the price paid, prob equivalent to $3.50 at other shops. Noodles was alright, done right qq and springy. Sauce is ok, abit saltish but taste better when dilute with soup. Soup quite tasteless, balances out salty sauce. Chicken breast was soft and tender. Slightly dry but tasty

Other reviews say it all. Will not visit again

Value for money 1/5
Taste 3/5

Yummy Chicken, Roasted Pork and Chashao pork. The options to have it with rice , noodle or koay teow is awesome! They have a few kind of steam soup such as watercress, lotus root and salted vegetable duck soap.
Prompt service, decent portions, but server attitude isn't the best here. 3 stars for taste of soy sauce chicken and charsiew, nicely charred and tender chicken

Totally...black shop (黑店)。If you notice, there is no pricing at shopfront. They keep upselling too. Take  ginger sauce also, cannot..will not return to dine here. Smallest plate is $4.50， achar dunno is they just add-on to your plate and charge or what. No, thank you.

26/05/18
Slightly above average and pricey Cha Siew and roast pork rice. The dark sauce is nice but the meat portion is too small to fill the stomach. The chilli sauce is nice too. Seriously need to improve their customer service.
Always one of our fav places to eat roasted meats and clay pot rice. Servers have always been friendly and chitchat with our lil girl too. Very homely place ！

My grandparents purchased Cha Siew from this shop and they changed them $12 for this amount! What's worst is that majority of the pieces are burnt!

Please do not patronize such unscrupulous vendors who take advantage of the elderly. This shop is a real disgrace and having it located in the heartland (Toa Payoh) where many old folks live is even worst.

I did not even what to give a rate but unfortunately, the minimum rating of 1 star is required for the comment to be posted.

One of the best char siews I've had, but the portion of meat is rather small for the price ($4 for char siew rice). Comes with a nice small side of achar though. Beansprouts are delicious, with a generous topping of fried onions and pork lard, but expensive at $4. Dumplings were stuffed incredibly full with a whole prawn and a good amount of meat, but were rather pricey at $4 for 4 as well.
Ordered takeout for 2 pax and was shocked to see the amount of meat was so little! SGD18 for this is ridiculous. Will definitely not visit them again.
Food tasted ok but u only know the price of the food after u r billed. Pricey.
Personally feel the food slightly above average but not like fantastic, price on the high side !

The duck rice is not nice and is very expensive. $6 per plate just only a few pieces of meat on it.
I go other place eat duck drumsticks is only $5.5.

I just to brought 2 package of rice. 1 is duck and the other one is chicken rice. I ask for the sambal chili the boss keep insist say no . I say I exchange for the sambal she shouted very loud SAY NO. she say that chili only for noddle I keep telling her I exchange she just SAY NO NONO. Omg I will never go back again anymore.

Wanton Mee. Nice Roast Duck. HK style with Honey Roasted Char Siew. Comparable to Kay Lee Roast.

Lots of takeaways. Try their Chinatown Claypot Chicken... Authentic.
Ordered the roast pork, char siew and roast duck. The roasted meats were very good.

Decided to go there for dinner since many years haven't tried.
No menu and price list to order from, and specifically told the staff that we wanted small portions of roasted duck, roasted meat and char siew, dumpling soup, 2 plate of rice and one plain noodle.
When they served, it was one quarter duck, and another plate of roasted pork and char siew which seemed to be able to serve 4-5 when there are only 3 of us.
And come with the bill of almost $43 for 3 of us! Probably the most expensive roasted meat that I have ever taken, other than Kam's Roast.
Some of the reviews commented that it is like black shop (黑店) which I would not deny having that feeling too.
On a fair note, the food is not bad but does not justify the exorbitant prices.
There is a lady who seemed to be the lady boss, seated there and busy with her accounts (maybe calculating how much money they have grabbed), and with rather poor attitude.
I would have given one star, but decided to give one more for the old uncle and old auntie for their good service.

Roasted pork/cha siew rice doesnt come with soup. Beansprout is overly salty and not crunchy enough.  There is something that i cant fathom as well.  My mum asked for dark soya sauce to be placed on the sauce plate but they say they could only pour soya sauce on our plate and not on the sauce plate.  For chilli and light soya sauce,  it is okay to pour into the sauce plate.  When asked the rationale,  they just said it is a rule set by the female boss.  Attitude was slightly rude.

Awful experience! Buy at your own risk. No price menu available. Did not expect a packet of char siew and siew york rice to cost $6! Order 3 packets and add one egg each to 2 packets. Total cost $19.40. I politely ask for the breakdown, the server on my left very fiesty and unhappily provide the breakdown, $6 a packet, egg 0.70 cents each. After she took my order, she had the order written on a piece of paper and clipped with an olden days wood cloth clipper. She threw my paper order into a basket to display her unhappiness. I kept quiet waited for order to be ready and left. Seriously, many places out there serve fantastic roast meat and char siew. The food is overpriced, as it is a simple setup like a coffee shop, and the server attitude is unpleasant and rude. No STAR at all!

Overpriced for $11 bucks food
Will not recommend not very clean and their air freshener is right on top on diners. Auto Spray all over u!

A China Chinese staff asked my pregnant wife to bring a baby chair and place it by herself. I got speechless about this rubbish service. Food is nothing special but price is too high considering poor service and lack of hygienic. It it interesting that this type of food stall still can survive. I will never come here again for the rest of my life.

The roast meat are nice, but the owner and staff attitudes are horrendous and overly greed driven.

If you dine in, be prepared that before you finish eating, they start to clear your plates to chase you again. They can do that because they already made you paid upfront, whether you finished your food or not, it’s none of their business anymore.

The owner is too egoistic that customers will patronise them no matter how bad their service are.

A lot of up selling when you place order, their pricing is not cheap to begin with.

Recent bad experience was they imposed ( no signage or notice , just simply refused your order if you want to share the portion ) a minimum order ( of one person set ) per person when this is a hawker food stall !

Avoid if you can, there are better food around.

Da bao 3 packets of char siew rice this evening and was surprised I was charged $16.50! There was no price list.

The portion is normal, packaging is normal using paper wrap, and while it tastes alright, it does not justify that exorbitant price when I can get similar quality elsewhere for abt the half the price.

Over priced, would not recommend.

As mentioned by others a huge problem is a lack of transparency with prices. They just insist on taking your order without being upfront on prices. Same with drinks. Server got the order wrong adding chili to the wrong bowl and rectified it by scooping it out with a spoon and dumping it into another bowl then looking irritated at my surprised expression. Honestly, the noodles are quite decent with a nice texture and the char siew was good with a nice honeyed glaze. Roast pork was too salty. However, this stall will not get anything higher because of the very aggressive staff touting you to eat here and pressurizing you to order without knowing the prices which are fairly exorbitant for what you’re getting. It’s a hawker stall but there are still minimum standards of service.

Ordered Charsiew Rice Add meat S$7/- i got shocked and tried to find the price on the sign board.... To my dismay, no price...

I got my order in less than 3mins which is very fast. They had about 4 or 5 workers around which probably explains the cost of the food..

Had to come here because passed by Toa Payoh area and didn't make any reservation for lunch. Food quality is alright, can't fault them on this, we had soup dumplings, been sprout, roast pork for 4 and 1/2 a roast chicken. Didn't go for duck, and char siew ran out. We just order anything that came to mind because our party of 4 is pretty hangry. Pricing wise, yes they didn't have prices listed and the bill came to be slightly higher than your avg hawker or kopitiam roast meat stall but not entirely unreasonable (avg. S$13 per pax including a drink each). Would I come here again? Perhaps, only after I have tried other places along the food alley stretch here...

Below average roast meat, poor service, overprice.
- No menu to see the price. Ordered 1 plate of 散拼 18$ (roast duck, roast pork, char siew).
- 1st bite, make me wonder why so many people eating compare to row of  stall beside it? Taste cannot make it, oily fatty and not crispy.
- Rude uncle using the dirty cloth to wipe the chair just before we are sitting down.
Zero star for it.
Not very long queue on a Sunday 1pm. I personally like the roasted pork. Crispy skin and savory. Just the noodles abit towards the soft side so i gave it a 4 star. Fast service. Affordable.
Seriously overprice and rude service. Avoid at all cost
Food poisoning and diarrhoea for me and my entire family including the elderly, after dabao-ing. Not even fantastic. Eat at yr own risk
So many times recieved with burnt meat! Boycott this shop please!
Good and almost authentic HK style roasted meat/poultry, pork/duck skin are crispy when you dine in. Once you order take away, that crunchy feel no longer there, just normal meat.
Food quality is mediocre. Quantity is very little too. Won’t be eating from them again.

IMO absolutely the best Hor Fun in SG and beyond....soup base uses Pork Belly soup (猪肚汤0 that's been prepared ahead....resultant Hor Fun is steeped with subtle flavours and wok hei....and floating in between the Hr Fun is the pork lard ...heavnely
Tasteless horfun and ee mee. Worst ee mee ever eaten! Went to buy after reading review... but totally disappointed! Will never go again!

Standard dropped after the son took over and prices are super high now.
Not recommended.
Nice food with reasonable price.
Food still tasty...
cheap n nice foods

Terrible attitude ladies at the counter. Like as if owe them money. They are like boss.
Won't recommend if ladies dun change.

1 nonya fish head
1 assam fish
1 vege
1 salted egg sotong
1 roasted chicken
1 pork knuckle
1 har cheong gai

All these for only around $100. Amazing! And the food was rather tasty too. I liked the salted egg sotong!

Probably best known for their $12 fish head, food was good but service level may vary depending on when you head down.

Dinner times are busy and seats might be hard to come by.
Food is good, just the cashier lady she needs to know some manners! She was very bossy and rude when ordering food from her
I like the bee hoon here.

(Translated by Google) The food is really delicious, but the service on the floor is really bad. I came to consume it, not to see your faces. I wouldn’t want to come here if it wasn’t for the good food.

(Original)
食物的确非常好吃，可是楼面服务真的很差，我是来消费的，不是来看你们脸色的，要不是为了食物好吃我也不想来这里消费，

Really wanted Mala Xiang Guo and thought this shop would be it. But turns out it wasn’t even spicy or flavourful.

The sauce was diluted with water and not enough herbs or spice to stir fry the ingredients. Was Disappointed as it is run by china natives.

Won’t think I’ll be back here again. 😞😕

Ordered Mala Xiang Guo. It didn’t seem like it’s stir fried, more of boiled in the chilli/spices and then drained the soup, doesn’t have the mala Xiang Guo fragrant. Price wise slightly expensive ($27.2 for 2 persons meal). Ingredients were really fresh tho, but found hair in the food. Will not patronise again.

Food is cheap! Total damage $45.50 for 4 mains and some skewers.
Highly recommend suan cai yu, tomato egg and skewers. 5/5
The broth in suan cai yu was really flavourful and addictive. Great to have on a rainy day.

As for the spinach dish, the vegetables is towards the dry side. But taste wise is okay. Would give it a rating of 3/5.

For the dumpling, was pretty disappointing. Soup was bland & dumpling was tasteless. Rating 1/5.

Overall, for the price point, food is worth it! Would definitely visit again to try their grilled fish & mala!
Fried tomato egg is well done. However, the lamb skewer was undercooked. Skewer meat is also very fatty.
Tastless diluted grill fish.. ordered spicy mala fish.. tastless, very diluted, a kind of sour..
Average food. Taste is ok but price is on the spicier side. Take note they charge $1 for packaging.
Authentic Sichuan Mala hotpot and grilled Fish. Value for money at $2.28 per 100 grams of food..Must visit if you missed Chengdu street food...
Interesting grilled fish that is kind of fried.
The grilled fish is nice.  With the price of $19.80, can get a fish with 4 vege as sides. Cheaper a lot than other grilled fish shop at city area. Worth a try.
Just plain spicy taste ,not edible, will not visit again. The worst I had tasted in whole of SG
Ordered the 水煮牛 and 酸菜鱼 via foodpanda. Wife felt the latter was "fishy" but perfectly fine for me. Beef could be more tender but the taste for both was really good. Will return for sure.

Terrible service attitude.

Stand right in front of the shop trying to make eye contact with the staff but both their staff seated people that comes after me. I don’t blame the people behind but when I asked why do you all ignored me, the staffs confronted that I was looking down at my phone. In fact I was trying to show my vaccination status but they clearly didn’t check.
Surprisingly they treated other customers pretty well. I guess I was judged by my outfit as I was wearing decathlon shirt and shorts but most of them were wearing ‘classy’ outfits.
1 star for having this place in TPY int to fix sudden Chinese BBQ crave 😆

p/s: I visited this place on 22 Sept 2021 evening.
pps: They didn't check my bf vaccination status as well.
Nice food,friendly staff and affordable pricing
Repeated customer, always my to go for china foods. Have tried many things over the menu and always was impressed! Delightful services and affordable prices! Highly recommended!!
I tried the mala xiangguo mid spicy, no gravy, ingredients not fresh which i told them remove from display. Total $17 with rice and drinks for 1 person, not as what i expect from review.

I would say of the mala xiangguo I ate in the northern part of SG, this stall in Central SG is decent. Ordered small spicy, with rice, came up to 13.40. The ma and la is quite on point for small spice. Though I only gave 4 stars because the xiang is missing.

My current favorite place to eat in Toa Payoh. Food tastes very authentic, very spicy and numbing on my first visit couple of months back. After many visits I realized that they have toned down the ‘ma’ and ‘la’-ness, I asked and was told that they received feedback that their dishes were too spicy and numbing hence they toned them down to suit local taste more. If you would like to try their ‘original’ taste, simply tell them that you want authentic and original level of spiciness when you are ordering!

We were most pleasantly surprised at the quality, quantity and value of the food at this eatery.
A delicious fish, big enough for three persons with a hearty appetite, can be had for less than $20.
Would highly recommend Hong Fan to anyone looking for good mala fish or mala xiang guo at an unbeatable price! And by the way, service here is prompt and friendly too!
The staff super bo chap and rude, I just left the shop without ordering anything.
Tried their non spicy version - loved it!
one of the best mala fragrant hotpot i ever tried. good balance of the fragrance and taste.
Ordered from GrabFood and the container is filled with 75-80% chilli. Rest of it is pathetic portion of meat/veg. Stop scamming and exploiting through online orders 😡
Better than both the Koufu stall and Gourmet Paradise stall. A little in the oily side and the 小辣 has got a kick to it

one of the to go mala when in toa payoh
price is quite ok and service is fast
One of my favourite eatery to order from Grab. Love their soup based Mala.

Mala hotpot, inexpensive, can try.

Good service, fast n spicy
Service was slow. Ordered and waited for 30 minutes when the other tables already had their order served. As if they needed to plant the vege before cooking them 🙄
Really Authentic, generous portion, value for money, can't get enough of it!
Mala fans must come here to try, but food abit salty, rmb to request less salty
Spicy Spicy Spicy 🌶🌶🌶🌶🌶
Ingredients were not fresh at all.
Good food, friendly staff, service also good
Nice food
Very spicy
Food was nice.
Great

(Translated by Google) This is a small shop I've been to recently. Chongqing spicy grilled fish, double-cooked pork, shredded cabbage, etc. are all good. Basically, according to the local tastes, the dishes are salty and oily, but they are delicious and the prices are very reasonable. With a bottle of ice and snowflakes, that's it. . . You may have to wait for a table during meal times.

(Original)
这是一家我最近常去的小店。重庆麻辣烤鱼，回锅肉，手撕包菜等等都不错。基本上以本地人的口味，菜是偏咸偏油，可是好吃，价格也很合理。配上一瓶冰雪花，那可是。。。吃饭时间或许得等位。

(Translated by Google) I write Chinese because I want my boss to see it. It used to be really delicious, although the price was more expensive than other places. But after this time, I will never consume it again. I take out medium spicy food, but it is not the taste and spiciness I have eaten all the way. Tonight I ate exactly like a super spicy chili boiled dish, not fried. The taste, and too much chili pepper and chili oil. Really can't eat, can't maintain the standard, customers can't keep

(Original)
我写华语是想老板看的到。以前的确很好吃，虽然价钱比别的地方来的贵。但是过了这次我再也不会再消费了，我外卖中辣，却不是我一路以来吃的味道和辣度，今晚我吃的完全就像一个超大辣的辣椒水煮菜，没炒的味道，而且过分离谱多的辣椒和辣椒油。真的无法吃，没法维持水准，顾客是留不住的

(Translated by Google) The grilled fish is crispy enough, the portion is big enough, the taste is good, and the price is reasonable

(Original)
烤鱼够香脆，分量够大，味道不错，价钱合理

(Translated by Google) Fried Pork, Mapo Tofu and Spicy Chicken are signature dishes. Must try!

(Original)
小炒肉，麻婆豆腐 and 辣子鸡 are signature dishes. Must try!

(Translated by Google) My experience is that if you have it, you have it, and if you don't have it, you don't have it. Make it clear in advance 😓

(Original)
我的体验是，有就是有，没有就是没有。要事先说清楚😓

(Translated by Google) Cheap and good taste.

(Original)
物美价廉，好味道。

(Translated by Google) Grilled fish, stir-fry, chicken, oyster, delicious, will come again

(Original)
烤鱼 炒菜 鸡公煲 好吃 还会再来

(Translated by Google) Over delicious, elephant

(Original)
Qua ngon,tuyet voi

(Translated by Google) good to eat.

(Original)
好吃。
Prawn and pork rib noodles has the best pork ribs ever. Tender and juicy. I had the dry version and the chilli has a good kick. Most enjoyable bowl at only $4

Decent bowl of prawn noodle at $3.50 with generous servings of ingredients.  Includes 2 good size prawn and love the pork lard generously spread among the noodle.  Soup could be more robust but otherwise can’t really complain at this price point.
Pretty delectable czechar in comfortable foodcourt. No crowd on weekends.

Food 7.5/10
Customer service 6/10 - just because you request chili padi and staff shows a face like you owe them money, very buay gan wan to bring it to you.
Cleanliness of the table and seat 6/10 - at least it's well positioned.

Bring tissue along as some tables have small pieces of food remains there left uncleaned.

Overall : 7/10
Must try the white beehoon, super flavourful, it’s the dry type, one of the best in Singapore

Ordered the salted egg diced chicken rice which is $6 on their menu but was charged $7 and had to pay another 70¢ for the egg which usually came with it.

Apparently it is only $6 during the "lunch promotion" but nobody informed me when I ordered. I'm ok with paying more but I wished that this was clarified before I was charged for the food.
Aircon zichar inside grains & hops. Contact number 69171659.
The menu here is quite special. Cooking is OK. Aircon helps keep you cool. If not enough, you can order a beer from Grain and Hops which runs the food court.
More like traditional restaurants,  my daughter wedding dinner, going again next week for father's day dinner

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Always a go to if near the area, mouth watering dishes at very affordable price. 1 meat 1 vege starts as low as $3+. Often crowded during lunchtime and still have food available  when i have late lunch even at 3+pm. Staff are friendly and helpful. Highly recommended and have been visiting for 5 years.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: One of the good Nasi Padang in S’pore. They only serve lamb Rendang on Friday. Live the way they flavoured and spiced the meats. Vegetables are cooked just right. Long queue during peak hours. Lastly, very affordable!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Went for nasi padang (breakfast). Good spread of dishes. Fried chicken is very crispy. Only that Belachan chilli not power enough. Desserts are decent, the gula melaka gravy very sweet. 😅

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Went there during lunch hour. The queue moves very fast and they’ll reserve tables specially for bigger groups.

The teh tarik is a must try.

Can’t wait to come back to try more dishes.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Wonderfully flavoured Malay rice. Delicious and tasty. Popular place but the queue moves quite quickly. Reasonable price. Recommended 👍

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
My favorite place for Muslim food… food are freshly prepared, spoil for choices on types of dishes, very appetizing seeing the display of their dishes , end up I want order some of everything.

The goreng ayam, mutton randang is a must!

Every I eat there- clear my place clean clean. Lol.

The price is on the high side for a meal.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Enjoyed the lamb rendang, sotong masak hitam, and sayur lodeh with rice ($9). The lamb rendang was more spicy and sweet than typical.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Economical Nasi Padang place for the people from nearby offices.  Might get very busy in lunch time. But the food is delicious and portion size is good.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Ordered mutton, egg n vegetable. Taste delicious and price really reasonable. Best of all the service, everyone’s really friendly and patient when u order. Do come n try!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
This shop is always crowded and very little parking around here.
Finally, I stepped into this shop as early as 730am

Ordered a simple kopi Tarik 1.20 and a nasi lemak 2.80 which is at reasonable prices.

Didn't know is Michelin standard.  The wall paper said it all.

Lots of customers always.
The rendang looked really tempting to me.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Been wanting to try this place for the longest of time but unfortunately they do not operate on the weekend plus this place is kind of out of the way from my office. Tried going there once after work but they were already closed for the day. Apart from this shop, I believe they also do catering.

Happen to be running some errands around Tai Seng and decided to check out this place.  It was already closed to 2pm when I reached. There isn’t any crowd. Dish selection was quite limited as well. Managed to choose 3 dishes, Ayam goreng, stir-fried cabbage and begedil.  I paid SGD$6.50 which includes a can drink.

Food was delicious, Ayam goreng was crispy and it was topped with the crispy bits. Meat was tender as well. Begedil was also quite nice. Pricing wise, quite reasonable for me. This stall is quite accessible, about 5 mins walk from Tai Seng Mrt station. Should come earlier if you want to have more dishes to choose from.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Super nice Malay Food, will definetely come back again for second round haha

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
A first try and I am hooked. I saw the lady give the chicken wing with a chop and it made it so easy to savour it.
There was effort in sprinkling the chicken with very delicious crumbs.
The gravy from the fish curry had a unique scent. The fish was fresh without the fishy odour.
Next time I could do with a bigger portion of nasi.
Going there after 2pm will be easy for my ears as I believe that this is a popular joint

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Very popular Nasi Pandang. Well priced and generous portions

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: yummslicious! Nasi Padang the way it should be, plenty of meat, seafood & vegetables choice. Affordable too

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: I love their delicious food and friendly service 👍🏻

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Happy I avoided the lunch crowd by arriving at 1115am. The food stall has been around a long time and has a string of awards and good reviews to their name. Come come. Don't miss. Parking is horrible but bear with it for the delicious nasi padang.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Taste nothing fantastic but can do, meat and chicken well cook. Pricing acceptable and some are cheap. Please don't come at lunch hours, as many offices around very crowded and very hard to find a seat. After 1.45pm or before 12 noon is the best times.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Good nasi padang place. Price reasonable. Crowded lunch hours. If coming in groups more than 4 pax, it is advisable to come after 1pm. Ample parking space within nearby warehouses.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Food was. Love the varieties menu. Would surely come again. Normally crowded during lunches.  Parking may be a but limited unless U park 3 min away. But no regrets abt the food.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Good food! Clean environment! Decent pricing. Nasi padang has extortionate prices at some places but that was not the case here.  Had a super satisfying meal. Will definitely return again!!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Reasonably priced and tasted good in general.  There are many choice for dishes of fish, chicken, squid, beef and et.  Like many said, avoid lunch hours, the Q can be very long, and you will likely have negative impression on the hospitality.  The sambal offered wasn't spicy to me, but you might think otherwise.

Lastly, will I visit the shop again? if I am visiting the area, probably yes, otherwise don't think I will travel far just to eat here.  :D

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Just normal Malay food, nothing great..excuse me!! This is not padang food ok. If you guys state this as nasi Padang then something is wrong with your taste buds.some dishes lack of spice.
This eatery is just good to fill up your tummy.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Very pleasantly surprised to have found this Nasi Padang spot here in this side of the country. It's very very popular, especially during lunch times. Good for small groups; try not to come in large groups expecting there to be seats. The ayam penyet is amazing. The nasi padang can be a little pricey, but that's nasi padang for you. Just point and choose what you want, then pay later. They have a system running. Just make sure you order the Ayam Penyet (smashed fried chicken)!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: I gave it my first try recently and it was amazing! The beef rendang was cooked to perfection; each bite more tender than the previous. The chicken wings had a really strong flavour to it too which I personally love. The sayur lodeh was good, but I only had 3 pieces of sayur... Was a little taken aback by that. Nonetheless, parking can be a pain in the area so do avoid peak hours. The queue was fast. In and out in less than 5 during peak hour on a weekday, Post-Cb.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: I have always enjoyed Muslim Delights nasi padang, no doubt about that. Today one of ur servers (tall dark skin moustache guy) gave me attitude when i asked for more gravy as if i owe him a living. As a paying customer, this is not the way to treat your customer, i will appreciate if you can educate this server, thank you.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Alot of choice to choose for nasi padang. Very long queue during lunch time.

Price wise abut expensive, but worth it as the food is very good.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Shiok nasi padang...

Many dish choices available!

Everyday a special dish (like Briyani) is available.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: So far, I've tried Lontong and Mee Hoon Soto. Both are nice. Sambal tumis not very spicy, which is good. Their epok2 sardine is a must try. Tasty n ample of sardine inside.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Food still good, it's been a while to dine in here.  Today asked for less rice, with tempeh, sayur lemak, and ayam penyet.  And to down with a teh tarik.  All for $4.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Great tasting nasi Padang. The portions are generally quite sizable and the dishes are absolutely tasty. The rendang was reasonably tender but I felt the Sayur lodeh was a little bit too watery for my taste. Still a good visit and I’ll definitely be back. Parking nearby is horrible unless you ride a bike.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Nice place for a very early hearty breakfast. Surprised to see they open really early and almost all  dishes are ready. Got there at around 640am and its already abuzz, satisfied with the food quality.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Soild and good food but abit pricey depending what you choose. Beef and fish surely $7 plus and above and quene is long during office and no parking place.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: The portion given that day was quite generous, beef rendang and stingray were the two making its way to my favorite list.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Always the place to go to for good quality Malay food. My fave dishes are the curry fish, sayor lodeh, curry chicken, fried chicken, achar and everything else ;)

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: 1 pkt (1 Veg + 1 chicken) and 1 pkt (1 Veg + 1 chicken + 1 Fish) Total: $14.90. Taste ok but not sure this is considered economical...

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
The food is excellent, generous portions and prices are reasonable.

They do catering as well.

The drawback is the lady boss is not patient.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Best Malay food in this area, a bit pricey but worth it for their fried chicken and squid.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Nice Malay food. Pretty pack during lunch time. Go earlier.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Their mutton briyani was great. The place is not too warm even on a sunny afternoon. Generally a long queue during lunch hour.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Delicious nasi padang, very affordable, service good!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: One of the best Muslim food I had in Singapore. They are super generous with the portion and with reasonable price. They beef rendang was superb, soft and tender and super flavourful. All other dishes like even ayam penyet was super good and crispy. They marinate it well. I went during off peak, and I guess it is super crowded when is at peak hour. Definitely will go back to eat again!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
The food is nice Nasi lemak and nasi sambal goreng.
I m from Tampines all the way to  upper Lebar…

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Love the food there. Will always come whenever im nearby.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: I found this place by chance.  But I m very impressed with the tempeh.   It is fried, crunchy and give your taste bud a "yummy,  that's is good".  Tempeh got a caramel taste, just right for the sweetness.  I ate a vegetarian dish that day.  But my 3 other friends took a portion of their mutton dish and said its good too.  Pricing is fair and portion are large.  Sorry I didn't get a photo of our food.  But believe me, if u are in that area, it's worth a try.  Their service is fast and the staff are friendly.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Their ayam penyet and tempeh goreng is a must try. Lots of variety.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Would have given 5 stars but because of the very unfriendly and grumpy lady boss. Having a queue should bring joy rather than frustrations??? Your layout needs to be improved for better customer flow
The food is above average and very affordable.
The staff were surprisingly much more friendly

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: Lots of choices to choose from. Queue move fast. Love their beef rendang.

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content: It sells nice Muslim food. Down side is very limited of park lots. Do not dine in during lunch time, difficult to get seats especially during Covid-19 endemic. Enjoy the good food!!! Matey!!!

restaurant name: Muslim Delights Malay Food and Noodles
content:
Good and delicious food.

Lots of choices for nasi padang and kuih but you have to be early if not you will only get the 'remainders' of whats offered.

Parking is a hassle but SWEET spot if you can get it just outside.

I like the intention of this nasi lemak shop, where they make it affordable for anyone to have some good food. For $1, u get e egg and choose between ikan bilis or ikan kuning. For $1.50 u can get both e ikan bilis & ikan kuning. Then there are all the other addons. I loved the way they fried the chicken. Queue was not that long on a weekday late morning. Ladies at the shop are fast and efficient so it is best you have your order ready in your mind. Taste is not that strong as compared to other nasi lemak shops but my 4 star rating is for their nice intention actually.

Very reasonably priced. Quite a lot of variety such as mee rebus , lontong and mee siam but they get sold out before lunchtime. Very friendly and helpful proprietors. Sometimes they have cockle or kerang sambal which is hard to find . Their sambals are not too spicy and very tasty. Lontong sayur is kept hot unlike other places

$1 nasi lemak plus $0.50 either a fish or ikan billie; so far the cheapest in Singapore.  Other dishes like lontong, mee rebus, mee siam etc are sold from $2.50.  They’ve nasi padang with a good spread of ingredients to choose from as well.  Delicious and will come back for more !

My first visit here. Seems like all the staff at this stall were family members or close relatives... and they were friendly and courteous. This makes for a pleasant experience. +1 for this stall... I will certainly come again. Mi rebus, mi siam & lontong were a little "sweetish" for me... prolly meant for those who couldn't take spicy stuff. The $1 nasi lemak ($1.50 if you want both fish + ikan bilis) was good enough; what do you expect for this price at this day & age..? Well done to the stall owner & staff! 👍
Very good pack of nasi lemak and epok epok. Only $1 each! They open very early so do come down earlier if you want to avoid the crowd.
Delicious nasi lemak with many items and also very cheap and worth it👍👍👍👍...just $1 only. One of the cheapest nasi lemak in Singapore 🇸🇬 👌 😀

There was a queue in front of my favorite mee rebus and Nasi lemak stall.   The owner spotted me and remarked 'your leg hurts right.   Go sit down, I will bring your Bkfast to you...'.  This is my heartland, my Singapore.. my Xmas.

Wow, long queue for nasi lemak. Means must try! I realised quickly, many people were buying many packets to take aways.

Nasi lemak is ok, chicken wings seasoning was very good. I added fired fish, tasted great too.

THE PLACE FOR NASI LEMAK WITH THEIR SAMBAL POWER.. NASI SAMBAL GORENG IS ALSO BEST..
Delicious food, affordable price.. Satisfaction guaranteed.. The least packets of nasi lemsk i bought is 6.. So u guys tell me, how can it not be best..
Cheapest Nasi Lemak @$1/- a packet that comes with ikan bilis & egg. If you want a light breakfast or for tea time, have it & you'll never regret.

I bought lontong and mixed rice. I was so happy the lontong is good. So good. The mixed rice which I have beef rendang, cockles and vegetables taste is outstanding. If u are at Toa Payoh in the morning don't miss this shop for breakfast. Worth the money. Outstanding overall experience
Cheap and nice nasi lemak. Lontong is nice too. Q was long but move fast.

Old school nasi lemak with a kampung homestyle taste that's so hard to find these days. Took me right back to my childhood.

The nasi was lightly fragrant and fluffy, unlike the overly lemak versions you get at most food centres. The simple standard $1 pack with selar kuning, slice of omelette, cucumber and sambal is very good on its own, but there are other dishes from the nasi padang array if you want add ons.

Now curious about their other breakfast standards like mee rebus, mee siam and the soto. Will be back to try!
Got the 4 dollars set. Value for money. Chicken was a bit disappointing though. Fried and hard. Sambal was good. Rice fragrant and soft.
The nasi lemak was soft and the fried chicken was so sedap...not forgetting the sambal...it was not too spicy as my kids could eat it...highly recommended if you're looking for gd old malay food...
Rendang is great, but I kind of hope they would give option for addition of juicy cucumbers into rendang set meal to balance out the dish.
The food are delicious and the price are really low. For example a packet of Nasi lemak only cost $1.00. In the morning store might be pack with workers buying breakfast

Knew the uncle since i was a boy. till today if walk pass his shop pakcik will ask "have you eaten"? When i was a boy pakcik always gave free food to us. Very kind and generous pakcik. Food price is really cheap $1 nasi lemak and $4 for nasi sambal goreng with chicken and lastly the taste of the food never change since the first time i ate it. Its simply delicious!!

Cheapest good nasi lemak Nasi Lemak (S$1) comes with a slice of fried egg, a side of sambal chilli, and a choice of either selar kuning (deep fried mackerel) or ikan billis (deep fried anchovies). If you want both ikan billis and selar kuning, it’s an additional S$0.50.
Rice is fragrant and sambal chili is balanced.
If you are a big eater, get two packets for $2.  They are sold out normally at 1pm

Had the mee rebus, mee siam and nasi lemak with ikan bilis, all in all an average meal which was made value for money as the price for the food is cheap. Rare find in Singapore with prices this cheap!

Obviously not interested in customer getting a good meal. Ordered nasi sambal goreng ayam makan and was given a prepacked pack on a plate. Food is cold and soggy. If I can give zero star, would have given it.  Food is tasteless too

$1 nasi lemak. Can you beat that? Although the serving portion is not huge, it can be a full meal for most people. Not comparable to those nasi lemak with otah, fried chicken wings and sambal tempeh, as you get to choose either fried fish or ikan bilis.

Have it as a snack in between meal, the portion is right size that you can squeeze it in between meal time.

A 5-star for the very affordable food available. They could have charged more but due to their "give back to community", their prices are pegged to the community around them - many elderly who are happy to pay for the small amount of sustenance that they rquire for the day on a day to day basis. The simple $1, YES! ONE SG DOLLAR, nasi lemak with ikan bilis not only fills the stomach but also the heart of the community.
Famous for their $1 nasi lemak which is light on the wallet and a great taste of old-school. Likewise for their mee rebus, mee siam & lontong.
Good and affordable food. Although crowded but service efficiency is great. Does not take long to receive the food. Staff are well-mannered and efficient. Good things must try....🤗🤗
Old school,authentic kampong style Nasi Lemak and other dishes,selling at bygone era prices!! What are you waiting for?!
