6.30am.Nasi lemak.mee siam.lontong.mee rebus.mee soto,is ready for breakfast.Their mee rebus is fantastic when add in tempeh and tahu.
Their lunch is also ready by 1030am.
It's cheap and all their dishes are good and fresh as the Pak Chik gets everything at the nearby market.Never come across any Malay stall compatible to this Stall in terms of good quality food.good pricing for all walk of life.
The Nasi Lemak is cheap and good. Long queue. So come early to beat the queue.
Old school nasi lemak and great value! Not to be missed if you visiting Lor 7 Toa Payoh, do come early.
Taste not bad.Love the small fish most.Although is small,but not over fry.Many stall over fry small fish,taste not good. 是有用❤煮的人。THANK SO MUCH ^^~
Where else can you find a simple and good $1 nasi lemak! Of course you can top up with other food and pay more. The owner and workers are both friendly and food reasonably tasty.
I had mee rebus with begedil, it was tasty. However I noticed it came with half a hard-boiled egg, also for mee siam. IMO for the pricing, I think it should be a full hard-boiled egg.
Excellent hawker foods in coffeeshop very popular right next to wet market with very delicious nasi lemak cheap and good value for money and friendly service.

Tasty. Samabal good. Lemak good. Kuning nice. Selar very nice. Portion too small. 😭

Should have another price for larger portions.
Cheapest nasi lemak $1 freshly packed - tasty. Add-ons like thigh, wings, beef etc tasty. Long Q in morn. Finish by 1pm or earlier.
For $1, you can get a plate of Nasi lemak. I think this is enough to describe the value for money meal you can get at this place!
Friendly staff + Nice food = Happy Customer
Famous Nasi Lemak in Lor 7 Market... Cheap and delicious...
$1.50 for Nasi Lemak?  And pretty good too.. with nice sambal chilli... where to find???
Cheap and fresh nasi lemak, starting at $1! Great place to hangout on a Saturday morning, soaking in the bustle and liveliness of a heartland 😁
All food and beverages are tasty. However to improve on table cleanliness
If you like homed cooked style and simple dishes. Don't expect anything fancy, usually morning half of the day

108 k.m. away from Toa payoh,is a isolated kampong coffee shop,for kampong folk live near by.
When you really hungry, no choice for you, than you have to eat there!.
Visit a friends stay there, exactly like in Singapore, during 1960! More nature and kampongs, is unimproved situation , BUT,PEACEFUL, QUITE, FRESH AIR,HAPPY, SLOW MOTION, ONLY 3% stress, surrounded heavily cheap tropical fruit,and vegetable s,.  NO HOTEL!!!.
Cheapest n tasty nasir lema.Only $1.00
Cheap Nasi Lemak stall found. Nice varieties of food and friendly staff..
My to go place got my Nasi Lemak fix got just $1. Must try!
Market plc…only malay food there.products quality drop…but still acceptable.
Cheap but delicious, $1 dollar nasi lemak is fantastic not only in price but taste as well
Their services are good & courteous. Sometimes long line of customers and orders in bags. Charges are really affordable.
Been here multiple times and behold.... The taste never change! Budget eaters or those who are on a tight budget. Do come over for a full meal.

There was a short queue for weekday lunch. Sambal belacan portion was big but tastes watered down, Sayur lodeh was the worst I've had because it's bland and watery. Sambal goreng was unimpressive as it was quite soggy. I was caught off by how much potato was in it which I felt was a cheap way to disguise as bean curd rather than an improvement to the dish. Beef Rendang was ok but we were hoping for more sauce since it's not the soft and moist kind. It's my first time here and heard good reviews about it but my friend said the macik retired already so quality dropped. Don't think I'll be back for nasi padang of this price. $15 for 2 of us.

Heard many reviews about this nasi Padang stall in blk 128 Toa Payoah lor 1, happened to be nearby and decided to give it a try. There wasnt any queue when i was there. There were only 2 pax infront of me. Selection of dishes was quite limited actually but went ahead to order.

Ordered the rendang, stir fried spinach and a slices of omelette. Bill came up to SGD$7.50. Have to say that it was quite expensive.

Food wise, rendang wasnt too bad. Have to say, portion of the rendang was quite alot. The spinach and omelette was normal. But have to say their lemak chili padi gravy was very different from others.

I have been to this place since as long as I can remember. A native to Toa Payoh, this stall was formerly at the corner of  Block 125 coffeeshop, back in the 80s. Yes I do agree sometime the price can be slightly pricey as to compare to some other stalls calling themselves Nasi Padang when it just a mixed rice stall. Well if you want to eat something good, authentic it's a good price to pay as Che Rose Nasi Padang serves authentic Nasi Padang that is on the same par as those you can find in Padang, Sumatra. Don't just take my words, you have to try it yourself. My personal favorite would be the Squid, Rendang (beef & chicken) also their Gulai Ayam.

If you've grown up in Toa Payoh, you would have eaten or at least known this Nasi Padang. Hailed from 1968, they had been here since forever and moved around Toa Payoh Lorong 1 a few times. Saying I had grown up with this stall is no kidding, and I probably have their Nasi Padang at least once a week back then. Some friends have always said, Nasi Padang stalls love to overcharge Chinese customers, unlike what an out of touch MP said some years ago, $2.50 gets you Nasi Padang with Drumstick. Some would say because Chinese are rich, we charge you more. Others with a more logical approach, they are selling Halal food. While Chinese can feed on non Halal, we are depriving other Muslims of their food when they sold us their servings. In any case, I leave it to your judgement, I did had experiences when the same Malay guy ordered the exact same thing in front of me, and i did got charged at least $2 more compared to his plate of Nasi Padang at Che Rose. But I don't take it against them. There's only so many pieces of their delicious Fried Chicken and they do get sold out usually mid lunch peak. In any case, I am back here today at 1230pm, all I love are in stock (except drumsticks) and I am game to eat. The short queue in front of me are all Chinese diners. Figures. My order $11. All my favourites since I was a kid. Fried chicken, Beef Rendang, Bergedil, fried egg, mixed cabbage on rice topped with their curry chicken sauce and sambal. Some might think $11 for this is horrendous. I think its fair. I knew their Beef and Chicken are delivered daily. How I knew? Cos I used to know a relative whom delivered their beef fresh daily from Tekka Market. He had since retired but vendors he knew took over. Fresh supplies daily is not cheap in a coffeeshop stall quantity. That's quality food. And for the same quality if you eat the same in a restaurant, trust me you will be paying way more than $11. Tender and flavourful rendang, crispy and juicy fried chicken, freshness you can taste. Their Nasi Padang and sambal is of a very local Malay style. A familiar taste we grow up with. Now the pair of sisters took over from Auntie Rose. Still you can see Auntie Rose seating at the stall with a watchful eye. Quality and flavour totally the same from when I first had them 4 decades ago. I will definitely come back for more.

Many have commented their prices are above the norm, why not they just display their prices openly, so patron is able to know what they are expected to pay instead of getting surprises after they calculated the price. I have noticed having the same dishes on two visits but price are calculated differently... alamak 😢

One of very few really good nasi padang stalls in ToaPayoh/Bishan/AMK area. Unfortunately, the beef rendang was not available (cook was on MC or smthng) so I had to settle for the chix rendang. It was tasty, the pachri nenas & sayur lodeh was also good, the sotong dish was good too. I wish they had sambal belacan but they only had sambal blado left (arnd 2pm) 😉. By the time I wanted to take fotos, there was nothing left on my plate 🤣🤣🤣.
side note: I've cooked beef rendang a few times before & the spices my wife prepared made it ohh-so-delicious!... BUT... I was the one who had to c-o-n-t-i-n-u-o-u-s-l-y stir and turn the beef chunks in the wok for THREE WHOLE HOURS! For those who didn't know, this is why beef rendang costs 2-3x more than chix rendang (chix rendang requires about one hour only to stir and turn). 😃

Very nice Nasi Padang famous for their beef rendang. The beef Rendang is not bad but I had better elsewhere. Each individual dish was very very well made. In fact this is a stall that you can eat daily without getting bored of the dishes.Very 'home-cooked' feel. Highly recommended. Must try the beef rendang and see if it's as claimed haha.

Truly homely cooked food with the diversity in selection. Never fails to perk up my weekends with the different combination of dishes to try out here.
It has many must try dishes which can only be experienced with multiple visits

This is our family must have for big or small occasion for past 40yrs. Birthdays, public holidays, festive season - u name it. If anyone is on annual leave on particular day, "anyone" wil volunteer to go pack this for everyone. Sorely missed when out if Sg. This is how good they are. Consistently flavourful. Taste like home, warms our hearts.
Didn't have high expectations as I hadn't heard of it before. Ordered as takeaway and the flavours and quality blew me away!   You can tell it's cooked from the heart. One of my top 2 nasi padang.
Lovely lovely Nasi Padang in Toa Payoh. Great flavour and Chili. The sotong is really fresh and well cooked!

The rendang is exquisite. The rest of the dishes are above average. You won't get the central kitchen type or cook-for-hire type food. All dishes are lovingly cooked by Che' Rose and her family.  However, do expect to pay more than the usual nasi padang stall for similar dishes. Enjoy :)
Truly authentic food served here and simply delicious.. Enjoyed by my mum and myself.. The family is really nice to their customers too. Kudos...

Visited this store as I saw some newspaper cuttings as well as certs plastered on the front.

ordered the rice, beef rendang and vege at the price of $5.

Verdict: didn't live up to expectations. You'd expect a dense and flavourful rendang but what I got was watery and flat. look at the photos and what I got and you'd see what I mean
My favourite lontong place in this world. The gravy is perfectly sweet, spicy, and not too thick. The lontong itself is fragrant, not too soft, not too hard or crumbly. Lontong perfection.

First time trying since I was also nearby. Fan of Nasi Padang. But too expensive @ $6.50 , with only a small drumstick, spinach and a fried egg. Taste, to me, was normal. Some of the staff did not put on face mask or even wear mask properly also.

1st time here when the queue was short. Usually queue was very long. So, give it a try. $8 for chicken redang, 1 tempai, curry vegetables and 1 fried egg. Rather expensive. Taste wise ok. Cannot eat frequently due to the high price. But may come again for the taste
typical malay nasi padang stall. must try the rendang but the price is a bit expensive.

FREAKING EXPENSIVE!!! And not worth it at all.
Food standard so so only.
The nasi padang stall at Blk 28 Hoy Fatt and Whampoa market nasi pandang more worth it. Dun waste time on this.

Che' Rose Nasi Padang has been around for over 40 years.Che Rose Nasi Padang  is renowed for its Padang dishes and best customer service.One of the best stall we can find in Singapore. Its authenticity padang recipe makes many customers comes back again and again.

You won't be dissappointed when you come here to experience what Padang food all about. I don't have to go into details about, but you will find their food up to your  satisfactory.

So if you crave of Nasi Padang come to Che Rose Nasi Padang at Blk 128 Lorong 1 Toa Payoh.
Just ate lunch over there not bad chicken randang but I miss something in it hmmm it's ok anyway nice taste
Tried this after reading good reviews. Their chicken curry and beef rendang is good but overall price is a bit steep for coffeeshop setting. The meal for 3 costs me $33.50. 😭

My fave for the past two decades.
Simply one of the best in sg.
Although the price is simply becoming one of the priciest in sg, easily $6+ for 1 meat 2 veg.
It is now a luxury food, not sustainable to eat it even twice a week.
Food was decent. Beef redang was above average in my opinion but pricing is expensive. 1 piece of beef with 2 portions of brinjal came to $7. Not good enough to warrant a repeat.
Ordered a chicken drumstick and 2 vegetable items and it cost $7.50. Taste was so so, I've had better for less elsewhere.

Tried it due to the many newspaper cuttings adorning stall front. 1 bergedil, 1 pineapple vege & 1 beef rendang for $7 is shockingly expensive. Definitely NOT the best rendang I've tried. Not worth coming back for even if passing by.

Delicious food but pretty pricey.

Beef rendang, ayam goreng rempah and tempeh are great. Their chili is awesome too.

1x meat + 1 tempeh + 1 veg will run you about $6.
Rendang beef is very delicious. The rice is also very fragrant.
nice foods. i wish they have nasi lemak tho.

Truly excellent nasi Padang. The meats and the curries are Super consistent and wonderful. Be sure to try their beef rendang and bergedil. Be sure to say yes when they offer you their chilli on the side!

Only thing that isn’t consistent is the price. I order the same thing at every visit, but hardly ever get charged the same price.

They claim to have the best rendang. I do not think so.. I have tasted better.
The portion of beef given is also little. If you  have a big appetite then it's gonna be expensive.. 2 meat and 1 veg is $8.

Chick was good though
Not a bad nasi padang stall. Affordable and yet tasty.

I decided to check this place out after reading many good reviews on this place. The only saving grace was the chicken rendang, it was delicious. I ordered a vegetable dish (not sure what its called) that had beansprouts and green beans, it was all good until I found 2 long black hairs in it. It's definitely not mine as my hair is blonde. I also ordered assam sotong which was not cleaned properly and there were many "splinters", that wasnt enjoyable. The utensils were also VERY oily and smelled like fish and were poorly washed. Lastly, it was very expensive considering the quality of the food (1 chicken drumstick + assam sotong + vegetables + rice = ~$8). All in all, it was a disappointing experience :(

Poor customer service, they did not wear mask like seriously. I should have taken a photo and send to food safety inspector. Rude staff I said I want lontong then she said I said rice then she argue with me. Seriously lol dont eat there spoiled my morning.
Both the chicken rendang and beef rendang are superb.

Expensiveeeee!!!!! But I'm willing to as this nasi padang is a style of its own and more authentic then most so called nasi padang. My all time favourite as well..the fried chicken is awesome always..consistent as well. Alternatively there is other warung like pariaman, warung makan minang, sabar menanti..also there is one underated warung under hdb block cofeeshop nxt to the beach rd army market.
V nice. Hope they can maintain their standards of yummy good good food.

This is family members business different people have their own way of Charging the food price. I have been there many times same items l have but different prices Either the brothers and sisters charging you. Food l consider good. Beef rendang average ok ok

I am not tried their self proclaimed best rendang in Singapore yet. I have tried the lontong twice. Its good. The gravy was yummy.  Just like most lontong you find elsewhere, it was not hot like I would like. If they could blanch the lontong rice, then I think it would make all the difference. Service was good.

Easy parking space at the back of coffee-shop. Have had better Nasi Padang elsewhere. Rice was clumpy. Vegetable dish, terong (brinjal) sambal balado, was cold. Rendang was good though a tad salty & the kerisik (fried grated coconut) had a bit burnt taste. Taste is subjective thus I urge Google Map users to try this place, at least once! You might like it better than I did. ;-)
the best Muslim stall in Toa Payoh.  Good Beef Rendang.  But, on the expensive side.

Their tagline is "Possibly the best Rendang in Singapore" and I'm strongly inclined to agree.  I've never had better and it's a real treasure.  Bitter gourd is nice too, but the real star is the Beef Rendang.  Lovers of Texas-style BBQ will rejoice at this Rendang.
Just order a plate of rice with one chicken and one vegetable cost $6. Most expensive nasi padang rice in toa payoh

Since 20 over years till now the Beef Rendang still remains authentic! Every pkt bought sure must add additional Rendang. Sambal Balado is one of the best since I don't like too much Sambal Belacan. Nenek still working and clearing the plates, at this age!

packed my nasi padang for lunch...sufficient in variety ..veg ..seafood and meats...good sambal and great rendang .....a balanced pricing ...
can also eat there ..  a coffee shop setting ...👍
The Nasi Padang is overprice and the food is not fantastic. It is going to be my first and last time patronising the stall.
Great Malay rice dishes, must try their fried chicken, ikan bilis, beef rendang....
It's getting more n more pricy .... Ordered beef rendang ... Potato ... N curry vege $7 ...🤪
Good beef rendang and ayam merah. But slightly expensive.
The food is good & tasty. I do patronise it every week. It's a bit pricy, but food  is good.

It’s a decent mee siam
Cost SGD 3 for this
A little bit spicy (even without adding the chilli)

EXCELLENT FOOD, LOVELY OWNERS & EXCELLENT PRICE !

I stumbled upon this coffee shop this morning !

Ordered mee siam for breakfast and packed lontong home for lunch !  Paid $3.50 each !  Excellent price of $7 for 2 meals.  Totally worth it !

The owners did not short-change on their ingredients despite the price.  I did not ask the owners but I believe they made their gravy from ground up and their ingredients are all fresh !  Very favourful and yummy !  No regret !

I will definitely come back and try other food made by owners.  I enjoy and appreciate ethical stall owners like this couple !

Thank you very much !
Uncle Sim moved from Blk 137 Potong Pasir Ave 3. Both the lontong and mee siam are tasty although I like the lontong more.
This hawker stall has ceased operating.

I had previously patronised this place to try their Penang Fried Kway Teow and it didn't taste authentic.

Just 2 weeks ago, my parents returned and were giving praises on the food - tasty and had the charred aroma coming from wok.

Skeptical but didn't mind trying. Truly the food were great, with portions being decent and can be shared by two(not a big eater). My family of 3 visited on Friday at 630pm which was already fairly crowded but managed to get a table. Come any later, you may need to wait around.

We  ordered:
1. Penang Fried Kway Teow ($5.50)
-little moist and spicy level is acceptable

2. Crispy Sheng Mian ($5.50)
-
3. Thai Style Tofu ($6.00~)
- light on the batter, crispy on the outside but soft on the insight.
- appetizing to kick start your meal

4. Sweet & Sour Fish ($9.90 promo)
- nicely fried and fish is quite meaty
The assam laksa is not bad but quite spicy! 🌶 the char kway teow is above average, same as the chendol. Might go again if I’m missing these famous Penang food.

You win liao!

The char Kuey Teow -passed
Ambla  drinks- passed
Laksa -passed
Nutmeg drinks - passed
Water spinach with squid - what happen to the sauce?
Fried pork belly with Red yeast rice fermented beancurd - Fantastic (must try)
The fried fish with Thai sauce and another one with sweet and sour sauce - passed
Pandan leaf chicken - juicy
Chendol - passed

Will come again

Recommended with 2 thumbs up

The food standard had dropped so much that this will be my last visit. From the 2 dishes I ordered today, both are NOT Penang food.

I have nearly mistaken the Char Kway Teow as Thai fried pad thai due to the raw beansprouts.

Next come to the Penang Loh Bak, I have to double confirm the dishes name on the menu at the end of my meals. It taste like the ngoh hiang. It also didn't serve with the dipping chilli and loh.

Bad service experience. Took over 20 mins to fry up the prawn paste chicken and fried otah. Had to chase them, otherwise they kept serving customers that ordered after I ordered and paid. Cashier aunty also very rude. Ignore me after I complained, kept screaming at her staff.

In the end prawn paste chicken is tasteless. No prawn paste flavour at all. They even dare to put it as a signature dish of their restaurant. lol what a joke

First time here. Was attracted by the Penang Assam laksa. Came in for a try as I thought most of the dishes look authentic malaysia-kl style. Ordered laksa. The soup is flavourful, however there isn't much 'liao' in it. There were little slices of sardines and some noodles. At $4.5 a bowl, thought the quantity is insufficient. Glancing across other tables, other customers were having kl noodle, Chinese style fish, fried rice etc, all looks delicious. Think I ordered the wrong item.
Reasonably priced penang food. Tasty and value for money. But don’t expect anything fancy as it is meant for a regular meal.
The dishes were delicious, get the deep fried fish, I crunched and swallowed the backbone. The Nonya and Baba flavours are fresh, tantalising - real authentic and wallet friendly.

Delicious assam laksa ($4.50) that brought be back to Penang for a brief moment at the first spoonful of broth. Generous with the vegetables and mint atop the addictive rice noodles. Could have been more generous with the fish, but still very satisfying overall!

Had Penang Prawn noodle - Broth was yummy and stayed warm throughout my meal (of 30mins)
Service was average but seriously it’s $5 for a very big bowl of delicious food .

The fried fish was too dry.
Kuey Teow and others were okay
But the service was terrible, especially the one cashier lady

I missed Penang prawn mee. Chance upon this stall behind a so-called back alley at Toa Payoh central just next to the bus interchange.

The prawny flavour is just not there. Well at least not enough. It comes with two medium sized prawns, half an egg, pieces of pork slices.

But for $5 it was a pretty big bowl. Hope they will improve the prawn mee soup flavour.

Go there 10 MTH ago , overall the taste quite ok..today take away few dish..the laksa only taste sweet , The salted egg squid very expensive not worth anymore.. won't go again. For those like Penang food can try (Island Penang kitchen)

The food is not bad, pretty tasty but it is still not even 90% close to Penang food. But points must be given for the effort for making it rather close to the actual food. It can be pretty crowded during meal time so go early. The Assam laksa is good but the char kway teow taste pretty normal. Go go and try if you miss penang food, you won't be disappointed.

I don't think the lady's service attitude is very good, I have given her three chances. I think the boss should educate your employees about their service attitude. If her service attitude is like this, I advise her not to do front desk service. - From traditional Penang food.

Ordered Penang char kuey teow and penang laksa, both  are really good. Authentic flavor. Love the kuey teow myself. Would definitely come back for more.
Not sure why the rating is not very high, but will definitely recommend to try out the food here! :)
The Kueh Teaw soup is not so tasty. The asam laksa is lack of sardin. However the Thai style fried tofu is good enough. The service is not bad though. Hope they can improve the food quality.

Had the kuey teow soup, prawn mee and Thai deep fried fish. Kuey teow soup taste so so, no pork lard, Singaporean taste. Prawn mee is big bowl, lot of noodle but not as flavorful as Malaysian Chiak, not enough pork lard, the shrimp is not fresh. The deep fried fish is good and cheap!

Not too bad.  For those who frequent Penang and familiar u will know that it is not fully and truly authentic Penang food. At least it is somewhere convenient when one need a quick fix of a simulation of Penang food.  Just makan makan for fun ok lah.
Their prawn mee and Asam Laksa are the closest flavor to eating in Malaysia! So good and authentic taste.  I always come here if I want to eat those flavors!

I don't stay in this neighborhood but previously I saw constant crowds streaming in so I wanted to try it myself.
But probably due to the fact that it's CNY day 3, most of the items were sold out. Even the chili for the Penang Char Kway Teow was sold out and I had this blend CKT, goes with their signature fried fermented bean curd pork, which doesn't have enough of the fermented bean curd taste and most of the portion was fats instead of meat. Chendol lacks of Gula melaka taste, good for those who don't want their dessert to be sweet.
And one and off you will get shouting from the kitchen staff (and a full 7 letter vulgarity for the CNY day 03)
Overall it was a disappointed meal and I can't get why people will still patronise them. Never again for me.

The place is alright I Guess if you are in the neighbourhood and wants to eat Penang food. It is no difference in hawker centre food. While the fried kway Tiao is not oily, it is also very bland. The Penang laksa tasted better but not as favourful as expected. The prawn noodle I believe it’s a murdering tool, who puts a big pile of chilli in a small bowl of food. The chendol definitely can skip. Take note this is a cash term only shop.

Penang food at afforadable prices. There r aircon seats inside. Staff are friendly. The laksa & char kway teow are not bad. The kangkong is a bit too sweet. The chendol has gula melaka taste & the green strands doesnt taste plasticky.
CKT is quite decent. Laksa is good,  pineapple and cucumber are thinly sliced BUT THE ONIONS ARE SO CHUNCKY and you could cry even by looking at them.

Ordered the Penang Laksa, Penang CKT and Penang Chendol x 2. Total damage $14. Price wise I think its ok. Taste wise I find it not bad. My mum thinks its very nice but we both find the cendol half-cooked (abit hard and powdery). Gula Melaka taste is just right but I prefer an even stronger taste. Otherwise would have given 5 stars.

Not bad the food, definitely not as good as what you can get in Penang. But good enough for me to want to go back when crave for the char kuey teow. The cendol was nice too with gula Melaka. The 南乳炸肉worth a try too

Service is basic. Food pricing is affordable. Order a penang fried kway teow which  taste like any other hawker centre similar food item. Order a deep fried beehoon with seafood gravy which taste nice but the deep fried bee hoon is lump together thus making it hard to chew and swallow.  The penang chendol taste nice but lack the sweetness of gula melaka. The drink I order is nutmeg and kumquat but you can skip it as it is ordinary with a mild taste not like the real drink in Penang.
All good tried tasted not bad- char kway teow, prawn mee and chendol. Staff auntie was quite attentive. Ok to visit again.

We had the Penang laksa and Penang fried kway teow for mains and ngoh hiang for starter. The fried kway teow was moist and fragrant, but the laksa was average. Chendol was good, with generous gula melaka. Would come back again.
Food and service was good. Serving was fast and the cendol was very nice..
I ordered penang laksa, looks more like vegetarian laksa instead. Soup is ok, taste sour and spicy, but the toppings only had lettuce, cucumber and onion. At $4, not really worth the price.

1st visit giving bad experience to me and my wife. ordered the drink doesn’t deliver to us. The staff was told us we ordered 3 food with 1 drink. My order is 2 food and 2 drink. She didn’t check my order and listen wrongly. The kitchen staff giving that kind of eyes contact to us which make us feel like we are wrong at 1st. if possible i will give 0 star to this outlet.

RUDE ATTITUDE, BEWARE!

I went alone for my lunch and wanted to eat Penang food, but upon reaching there. It was packed with lunch crowd, I decided to eat at the china food stall besides it, as there were seats available. After finished, I thought why not have a Cendol, I politely went over to this penang food shop and asked one of the aunties if I can order from them and eat at the shop beside. One of them who looked plump rudely brushed me aside by saying.. "Don't know, you go ask that china shop can eat or not" OK, I went back and asked for permission and they said ok, no problem. I went back to order the Penang Cendol and said I seated at next shop.

The aunties started to gossip among themselves and very grumpy, grouchy about it. I told them the shop already said ok, since you told me to ask them. One of them asked me to pay up first in a rudely tone.. OK, never mind. I paid up and went to my seat. A skinnier with short hair and slightly grey hair bespectacled auntie came over with the Cendol and rudely said to me..."Next time, you come take yourself." By the way, my table is just right next to their table.

Seriously! I paid up as per instructed and now i have to collect Cendol myself? and deserved your rude service? If can I eat at your shop, do you think i need to order from you and seat at other shop? You could have tell me not allowed in the first place and not showing me attitude.

Please use your brain and think.

The owner seriously need to train their staffs, since they are in the servicing line. If there is negative rating, I will give -100.

Bunch of cantankerous menopause aunties! NO MORE NEXT TIME!
Laksa is not bad according to my colleagues but the Penang Kway Teow didn’t meet my expectation. Penang Place Fried Kway Teow is still better.

First up: if you're looking for this place, be sure to be look out for the Chinese signboard. Don't be looking for "Traditional Penang Food" in English now. It'll be a black signboard, with Chinese words in white. See my pic if you want to see what it looks like.

Secondly, note that my review is only for the chendol.

Is this chendol better than the one at Penang? I'd say definitively, no.

Ice: not finely shaved.

Noodles: nice green colour... No comments about colouring though, since I don't know what goes in there. But this is the brightest that I've seen of the chendols today (I reviewed Four Seasons Toa Payoh, and Dove Desserts earlier today). Unflavoured, which is disappointing.

Red beans: ahem if I want Penang chendol, I would be looking for those delightfully soft - and sweet! - kidney beans which I first tasted at Penang (and haven't found anywhere else since). You get a reasonable quantity of beans... But you should expect that, at $2.5, the most expensive of the chendols so far today.

Overall: nothing really strikes me about this chendol. It's middle of the road as far as I'm concerned... Or maybe I've taken too much chendol for today. I don't think so though. The gula melaka isn't generous, but you do get bits of it. The nice thing about it is it seems to come by default with *two* metal spoons, so in case you're sharing, you don't need to ask to one more. And the spoons are metal. An upgrade from the plastic ones that you get at Four Seasons, and Dove Desserts.
Reasonably priced penang food. Only the penang char kway teow and Assam laksa are worth ordering. The taste is average but such penang food not found everywhere.
Prawn mee was tasteless, asam laksa was so so, doesn’t even have pineapple. Not worth the price! Won’t visit again!
The penang Laksa is delicious and generous serving of ingredients.

I ordered grab food just now and there was one missing item not delivered. There is no hotline to contact grab food on this except for submission through a robotic app. I tried calling the stall and the person was apologetic and arranged their own to have it delivered to me. They took the initiative to do a service discovery. Very commendable. Thank you. Will definitely support you!
If u miss Penang Street Food in Singapore, this is a great authentic restaurant. Penang Assam Laksa served with, " Lao Shui Fen". 😜

If I could give no star I wouldn’t want to give 1 star for this restaurant. Extremely poor service not worth your time to pay a visit. Ask the staff if we could sit inside, she rolled her eyes to us. Shout at us when we ask if paywave accepted or not.

Tried the char koay teow and it’s really below expectations for a Penang style dish. Not sure why there’s so many patrons here during lunch time. Perhaps the taste buds for real authentic standard of Penang food has mutated to Singapore local taste style of Penang Char Koay Teow?
First time trying out their Asam Laksa and prawn noodles, pretty alright.
I had the Fragrance Bee Hoon with gravy. It brings back memories of the old school taste. Nostalgic
Good service, able to get some traditional penang food here at Toa Payoh Central.

Food is ok. Basically just Tze Cha food. Unfortunately the service standard needs to be improved. I get the sense that servers here are either highly stress or just unhappy with their work. There was no one in the queue. I was very very polite when I approached them but they were not welcoming, and seems to be rushing me to make my decision.

It was lunch time and I just ordered a one dish meal and again, they don’t seem to be please with my small order.

After seating now, I was asked to shift my seat due to distancing breach with their neighbor stall even though I was sitting in a seat marked “allowed”. After shifting I turned and notice another 2 tables who are very close to each other. Both gentlemen eating (more dishes than me) and they did not ask them to change table or position.

I won’t come back again. It feels like I owe them a living.

Laksa was good, hard to find assam broth and ingredients were plentiful and authentic. Came across pineapple slices, mint leaves and fresh onion slices in the soup which added to the taste. Price is pretty affordable as well. Hope they have an option to add-on more meat in future as I like the well marinated chicken slices within too.

One complaint is that their prices on foodpanda is more expensive than in-store even after the 15% pickup discount. I understand they have to pay app commissions but I don't appreciate the lack of business ethics as a customer.
Good food at a good price in smaller portions so you won't over-eat.

Penang Food - tucked in shops opp Toa Payoh HDB hub is a hidden gem. Excellent staffs working hard to serve us fast delicious food too 😃🙌🏻

Their Assam laksa uses authentic Msia rice noodles. You will never find it anywhere else. Almost like being back in Penang. The gravy is rich and flavourful. Stall is generous with Vege garnish. Very fresh Veges

Thai style fried Sea bass fish is very fresh and appetising too. Crispy on outside, soft tender meat on inside. Highly recommended for sharing 😋

Can try their homemade Ba Long Long juice🧃

For the price, no complains! Best option compared to flying to Penang Msia in this no flying Covid season.
I like their fried kway teow. However, my friend didn't think much of her prawn noodles.

The star of Tonkatsu Special ramen is definitely the broth. 5🏅. Wonderfully rich bursting with meaty flavor but yet not so rich and oily to make it jilak. Ramen noodles perfectly cooked with nice bite and not clumped together. The onsen egg was also done well, soft melt in the mouth ooozze and flavor.!

The ramen is let down by the Cha shu which I personally prefer to be more well seasoned, more tender and more fat.

Overall 4 🏅 considering the price $10.90 which is good value kopitian ramen.

3.5 stars, friendly and fast service at 12:30 pm, no queue. Soup tasted more like our mixed pork organ 猪杂汤 soup than your typical Japanese ramen. The meat has not much fat and is quite hard to bite, overall this will fix your ramen craving.

Hidden in a HDB estate in Ang Mo Kio inside @johnsoneatery332amk
which serves up bowls of ramen at very afforable prices. Arguably one of if not the cheapest ramen you can find anywhere in Singapore as their cheapest bowl of ramen here goes for only $5.90 that come with an entire torched chicken drumstick!! I was in total disbelief. The torched chicken drumstick is also available as add on to other ramen at just $4. Also their broth are made in-house and is boil for 15-hours.

What I tried,

Shinjitsu Ramen’s Tonkotsu Special (S$10.90)
Come with four big pieces of sliced chashu, a giant sheet of nori, and one ajitama egg, which had been cut in half. The tonkotsu broth is smooth, rich, flavourful and not too salty. The ramen noodles soak up well of the glorious richness broth. The chashu has a delectable smokey flavour, my only gripe is that it's slightly dry but that’s just a personal preference.

Shinjitsu Ramen’s Red Spicy Tonkotsu (S$8.90)
Pack with a pile of spicy minced pork and three big pieces of sliced chashu. The little bits of minced meat added a nice contrast to the smooth noodles and rich broth.

(Add on) Torched chicken drumstick (S$4.00)
I choose to add this to my Shinjitsu Ramen’s Tonkotsu Special ramen. This large drumstick has a gorgeous sear on the outside and is fork tender soft succulent. Absolutely delicious.

Pork Gyoza ($6.00).
The gyozas here are handmade fresh. Generously stuffed with minced meat and spring onions, and each bite was springy and juicy with the skin being thin, slightly chewy and a lovely charred bottom. This is a champion.

Grilled Squid ($6.50).
Big chunk of squid. Soft and tender not jaw inducing chewy, and you can just bite through. Is amazing.

Very affordable yet quality not compromise. Is really value for money, delicious for the price paid and generous in portion!

Broth has mild pork broth flavor will sliced char siu gives that porky flavor.

Okay for a ramen fix if you’re eating there and priced reasonably cheap compared to ramen places.

Decent priced ramen for 11.90.

Tonkotsu Special🍜🍥

🍜 Food wise: Egg is good, mouthful, watery and well seasoned. Ramen is quite Q. Cha shu, not too bad. Big Nori sheet. This bowl might not be suitable for me though, might need to give it another go for other flavours! But do give it a try!

✨ Ambience wise: Coffeeshop

🤵🏻 Service wise: Staff friendly

💵 Price wise: $10.90 for this bowl
Quality ramen at affordable prices. Loved their chashu, it is flavourful and has a great texture. The broth is not overly salty as well, would suit people who prefers a lighter broth like me.
Delicious bowl of chicken leg ramen ($6.50)! Meat falls right off the bone. Broth was tasty. Ramen’s taste reminded me of yellow noodle. Will go back again if I’m in the area!

Ordered tonkatsu ramen. The noodle is pretty Q and nice. The soup is bland. The meat is dry and tbh quite tasteless. It’s affordable though. Definitely cannot compare with other cheap ramen that are more flavourful.
Really really rich tonkotsu broth at an affordable price point. Honestly up there with some mainstream ramen chains. Highly recommended!

Tried the ramen before taking vaccination at Braddell Medical Clinic.
Indeed very flavourful and rich with the Tonkatsu aroma. However, in personal taste might find it a bit salty. Reasonably priced at 6.90 for a restaurant-like ramen.

Cheap ramen in a heartland coffeeshop? Where have I heard of that before? Broth was certainly thick with collagen. However, broth didn’t have the “oomph” and char siu was disappointingly dry and tasteless. $10.90 for this is excessive. $6.90 option is probably better value.

📍 @shinjitsuramen 🍜
🧡Tonkotsu ramen
💰 <$10
...
...
...
Kopitam ramen!!! Quality LEGIT ramen at less than $10?!✨ the noodles are similar to Ichiran kind of thin smooth and slurpy💕 with rich Tonkotsu broth filled with collagen for the price it’s definitely worth and delicious 👍 very underrated!
I love this place! Their ramen is very delicious. I wish there is an add noodles option or they would give more soup for takeaway though

Very popular stall. Broth is pretty decent but slightly salty. I like the texture of the noodles but the slice of pork is not the soft type hence a bit dry to me. I like the gyoza but my partner wasn't impressed.

Based on the hardwarezone forum, came across this newly opened ramen outlet located in a coffee shop @ Toa Payoh-Braddell area. Ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen with Special toppings. Soup taste was excellent, with great collagen base in it. Ramen wise, the noodle is kinda thin, but does not lack the Q element in it, in fact it swallows rather smoothly, definitely great addition for kids and elderly. The aijitama (flavoured egg) have excellent colouring in it, which is surprising for non restaurant style ramen shop. The chasyu however is abit salty, but i guess is rather important for the broth. Taste similar to Keisuke Ramen. Overall, price is cheap and the quality is excellent. Definitely, a place to go if you prefer no queue, fast, tasty and a affordable ramen dining experience.

Sets in a nice corner of the coffee shop and charges a reasonable price for the authentic taste of good Tonkotsu broth. The young man is friendly and entertained last minute change of broth. We will definitely support again.
The meat and soup quality is below average. Meat is very rough. With this price, you’d be better off with Takagi Ramen, cheaper and taste better also

Ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen ($6.90). The Ramen is “Q” in texture. The broth is thick and filled with Collagen, simply put: On Point. For the char siew, the size was decent, not too thin. However as with most reviews, the char siew was tasteless. Overall, for the price, the portion and the broth was pretty value for the money.

Reman located in the hawker.
Their Chashu very nice! Big portion.
Also highly recommend for their Gyoza!
A great authentic ramen stall in the heart of Toa Payoh! Run by young and passionate chefs. Check out the other stalls here at 125 as well!
Yes. One of the best and reasonable priced ramen in Singapore. Worthy of a Michelin Star 💫
Good value, but if you’re looking for something serious this might not be it.
Came all the way for the Ramen & Gyoza, nearby Bradell mrt. Awesome food, friendly staff & reasonable price.
Decent bowl of ramen with gyoza. For such standards given its location in a heartland coffee shop, it is highly recommended.

Good quality ramen at affordable prices! The tonkotsu broth is thick and super flavourful with melted pork bits floating around, showing it’s the real deal slow cooked. Noodles done just right which are qq, portion more than generous. Once in awhile the charsiu may be on the drier side, but still tender to the bite, beating many ramen “restaurants”. Chicken clear broth gives you one big fat drumstick and thigh with a flavourful yet light soup base and generous noodle serving.

Did I mention the price? $7 for the charsiu tonkotsu and $6 for the clear chicken broth, it’s super worth it! This place will always have my support for an alternative for ramen Keisuke tonkotsu king which I feel tastes very similar and really good
The ramen is okay considering the price and location. Broth just lacks alittle extra "umami" flavour.

The most value for money ramen in SG! $6.90 bowl was amazing - soup was thick and delicious without being too salty or MSG ish, noodles were QQ and char siew was decent and not too thin.

Didnt have a picture as i gobbled down my bowl haha

Would highly recommend!

Noodle/ingredients felt authentic
However soup was not up to par at all
Great bowl of ramen for the price! However the pork can be a tad bit dry, however the rest of the bowl was pretty much on point!

All the ramens are delicious, broth on point! Love their gyoza and kaarage too!
The chicken meat slides of the bone, simply amazing!

#AffordablePrice
#RestaurantStandards
#HiddenGem
I like that place. Tomyum soup is absolutely yummy...
Though the staff was friendly, the food n ingredients were fresh n well cooked but I personally think has too much MSG. If they can make the aftertaste less salty, it will be great

Maybe it is only me. the broth is salty, not thick and feels like instant japanese ramen. Too pricey for instant ramen standard and the taste is not in par with keisuke imo. The place is also crowded af, all table are chopped by uncle.
Hearty bowl of ramen at a very reasonable price. Definitely worth the trip all the way from the East! Highly recommended! Oh yes, must try their Gyoza too.
Nice, thick n flavourful soup! Recommended to try out!
Affordable price, taste of the food Is what you can expect from the price
A treasure hidden within the HDB estate! Quite nice and balanced taste.
Super value and delicious. Fresh ingredients, thin Al dente ramen with good, non MSG soup :)
Came here at 10.30 but it was closed … 😞 the opening time is misleading!
Nearby stall to quench thirst of ramen. Not on par as the resto. But this is on a different level compares with fishball noodle.
Broth is awesome, noodle is very q, and the portion is just nice for a guy. Highly recommended.
Excellent ramen… just like Tokyo.
Good quality ramen considering the price
Keisuke standard for Tai Hwa BCM price. Hearty broth!
Premium taste at cheap cost ! :)
Basic Japanese noodle.

Ramen - ☆☆☆
Soup - ☆☆☆☆
Meat - ☆☆
Gyoza - ☆☆☆☆
Delicious Ramen on hawker with good price
Ramen is quite nice and the price is reasonable
Good food for the price
Hot and nice.  Back again here after several months.  Sushilicious is in Koufu food court at Toa Payoh Central.

Ordered the teriyaki salmon don at $5.50. Love that they top the salmon with lots of stir-fries onions and also generous amount of lettuce. Comes with miso soup too. Portion is good too. Gave it 3 star as it didn’t taste Japanese even though it was a good meal that I enjoyed.

I ordered oishi beef don. Totally different from picture on the menu. This is thin beef with kim chi 😤😩 felt cheated cos i really want japanese food. Cooking also took long even if I’m the only customer at 4pm.

Cheap and value for money! It can be hard to find something different to eat that is halal in Toa Payoh and this was not bad! A bit far to walk from MRT though and service was a bit slow though there was no crowd. But food was good for the price!

Bought take away tako, only squid as they dont have prawns. The squid is very small in portion. Tako taste is just right but hopefully next time the fillings should be better than now.
Staffs quiete friendly. Will be back again next time.
Had the beef don, ebi and fried tofu. The rice comes with miso soup. It tastes very nice. Decently priced as well!
Last photo is Teriyaki Beef Don. Definitely worth every penny

Good and reasonable priced Halal authentic Japanese food.

Ramen and Udon were well worth the price. Kids love the Udon.

waited 15 minutes for this . gravy about 30% of container, standard chicken cutlet and some plain rice (1 bowl worth) @ $5.30 (due to 30 cents for container) . Sorry to say , this is crazy . Gravy is probably prepared in advance and kept warm ( I m not sure ) . 5.00$ for plain rice , gravy and cutlet with this portion / amount at heartland is steep. Rice is not flavoured rice or Japanese rice. Just plain rice . It didn't taste Japanese.

I don't mind waiting or paying more if quality is better . To be fair , the gravy has a small amount of onion and carrots
Good Food! Serve in large portion. Worth trying.

My go-to heartland good value flavorful japanese donburi place.  Will grab a beef teriyaki or chicken katsu curry bowl.  And if ever i am so lucky to try the missus snacks ( kueh kueh) when available.  The snacks go really fast.  I at times msg them what I will like to have today and when I w be there.  My heartland, my Toa Payoh.
I love their ramen, been eating there since 4 years ago😋 tastes as good as eating at a restaurant
Best halal japanese food at a very heartland price. Fulfilling and very delicious. Will certainly repeat if i at kim keat market area. Try. No regrets
Tried Oishi Beef Udon. Yummy.
Was in the area and came across this halal stall. Although it's not authentic Japanese, but it's delicious, very homely, portions were good and value for money. It was a satisfying meal.

Went to check it out today.
Me and pals order ramen, and donburi. For the portion of food in bowl, is best value for money. At least for my curry ramen its as close to Japan Co-co ichibanya mild. (maybe can consider to offer spicy level customer can choose?)

The maki rolls are big. The takoyaki squid in it is a lil small, but for the sauce and furikake its as what you get in Japan.

They have a tons of bowl selection of ramen udon and donburi. I might missed it, but somehow i didnt see Tempuradon.

Next time i'll check out the udons and the fry Ebi.

Maybe they should consider serving ocha and chawanmushi too

/come here with base line of Japan street/mini restaurant food. Dont compare them to hotel cuisines
100% muslim owned. affordable and sedap! The chicken teriyaki is a must try for u teriyaki lovers out there.

Heard about this outlet during Ramadhan, and my long wait felt so worthwhile. Not only Mr Ramli is so patient and polite in attending to my queries. The food portion is huge and super value for money. Most importantly, its so delicious!! May your business prosper and more rezeki come your way.
Didn't know this place existed so I decided to have a try with my friends on a Monday afternoon. Big portions and value for money 👍🏽 Will come back again to try out the other stuff from the menu.
Beautiful halal Japanese foods. Had a great time, each time. Perfect for families and very affordable.
The best halal japanese food in Singapore by far!
Oiishi bread very expensive as compared to Cedele & Baker & Cook..their sourdough bread too holey
Freshly made delicious food with a nice nod to local palette. Good people with excellent service.
The best Japanese halal so far. Also cheap

I can literally eat from here all days weeks months and years.. The best chicken teriyaki rice and udon.. The best of the best..
(sue spc)
Food is nice! Reasonable price… due to too delicious I forget to take pictures
Love the curry chicken cutlet udon! Reasonable price!
before eat you should say itadakimasu to the owner and they will reply oishii!
Nice halal Korean food cook by professional chef
Superb, highly recommended ,for Halal Japanese cuisine
Chicken katsu curry ramen. Good and reasonable.
The only Japanese stall at this Hawker Centre.
Food was ok.. but service was super slow
Nice place fir makan2 should try. Thumps up.
The takoyaki is delicious 👍with squid filling
Cheap and good halal Japanese food
Good food, good price

Delicious..value for money
Not bad

Awesome food

Ordered food via the food court app and waited  7 minutes before the app said food is ready for collection. When went to collect, the lady had no idea what I ordered and had to tell her and waited another 10 minutes. All these tech is useless if your people are not trained to use them

I ordered Teppan Black Pepper Chicken set.

The chicken came warm and the sizzling plate did not serve its purpose.

The chicken taste was bland and i’m not sure if the curry sauce was meant for this particular dish, i was not expecting it.

I ordered thru Koufu app, the food was ready after 8 mins

(Translated by Google) There is one very fierce! Chinese woman with bad service attitude! Spend money on things like you owe him money! Was a very bad experience! 😡😡

(Original)
有一个很凶！服务态度很不好的中国女人！花钱买东西好像欠他钱这样！是一个很糟糕的体验！😡😡

(Translated by Google) Delicious Japanese set meal, not too expensive

很好吃的日本套餐，价格不会很贵

Food is pretty good, service needs a lot of improvement.

- wait staff don't really care for walk-in customers and were quite reluctant to give us a table despite availability
- smoking customers outdoors not enforced despite non smoking signs
- we ordered via the QR code. After 15 minutes even the drinks weren't served, i went in to ask and the order wasn't even picked up until i told them. so what's the point of the QR code?
- food tends to be served slowly even when restaurant is not busy

Wide selection of sake, nice food and staff is friendly..the BBQ selection for those who is keen... order Edamane- boiled
soy bean, truffle chawanmushi (nicely present and rich serving of ingredients hidden in the egg with a little garnish of truffle)
Temputa moriawase (prawn)
Aspara asparagus with pork belly
Hotate- scallop with bacon
Buta bara- gfilled pork belly
Kawa-chicken skin
Tsukune- homemade chicken meatball
And not forgetting the Supume ika grilled japanese squid, (totally love it)
And a sake to go with it.. yummy....
Chefs are very friendly, you can get some unique dishes here.

Despite being new, the place is full! Their menu seems similar to the one in riverwalk but the prices are cheaper if I recalled correctly. Food is good and tasty. Enjoyed the tempura items (soft shell crab and prawns) the most. Service is good too. We ordered too much for 2 pax.

Extremely slow and poor service. Food was so so not worth the torture. They're not interested to do business. Came in and ordered. One other table who were there before us looked like they had been waiting a long time. Bad sign. The first item that came after around 40 min was a maki roll. The skewers came around the 1 hour mark. The last item garlic rice took soooo long to come after more than 1.5 hours. See photo. How does this pathetic small $10 garlic fried rice with no meat require 1.5 hours to cook? Cook rice from scratch also no need so long. We had to ask for it and the staff said they were already cooking. That was 30 min before it actually came. Even the lady boss could also tell we were upset. The place was rather busy that day they seemed to be hosting friends and family at least 5 tables of them. The lady boss was going around greeting people. Some of these guests are so familer w the place they were helping themselves behind the bar and walking around without mask. Some food items came out to their friends first even though they came after us. If you are not interested to host public then don't do business.

Service is not good, just walked in the restaurant like a self-service place. Weren’t interested in having us as customers. Food takes forever to come. Over an hour wait is unacceptable. The restaurant wasn’t even full. Pricing is also on the high side.

Only good things are the atmosphere and taste was alright, we just hope their service and wait time can be improved soon.

Update: Still waiting over an hour, repeated check-in with staff but nobody gave us an answer.
Good quality of food esp yakitori and gyudon (beef). No extra charge !!

Food is alright. However wait time for food took more than an hour. Had to check in multiple times with staff to get follow up.

Ordering and payment was done through a QR code on the table using our mobile phones. Lots of times sold out on the menu. However, we were later informed that orders sometimes get lost in the system. Felt that if this was a problem, then this should be communicated to us first thing when seating us. Frankly, would have cancelled and left if it weren’t for the fact that we have already paid and it seems like they probably will take an even longer time to process the refund.
Good ambiance and We enjoyed all the dishes we ordered. We ordered a couple of yakitori, truffle chawanmushi, mentai fries and Gyoza, all taste good. We will be back for more.
Food is not cooked. Waited for 2-3hours for the food to come and the food is so cold and disgusting. Food and drinks are all overpriced as well. Please don’t come as it will ruin your day/ night.

@ Jasmine who wrote the review. Is not true. I have been there many times. If you cannot wait is not their fault. Looking at others assuming they waited long and not happy is your own judgement. $10 for a fried rice I would think is reasonable. Even a zhe char stall fried rice now is about $8. So I do not know what do you meant by expensive.

We can rate the food and service but should not judged what others are doing when we dont even know them..I dont see anything wrong with the lady boss going around greeting..this statement is a bit judgmental. Nothing wrong for her to go around even it is true. I think is not fair to judge just for a visit..think must be fair to rate the food but not judged people and put here online to embarrass her. She is just running a business..

The food here was great. Recommended many of my friends, they all love it. Waiting time was reasonable because of the crowd. We were patient and understand that the chef needs time to prepare and is worth waiting. Looking around, I could see there were many still waiting for their food. They all looked cool and enjoying their drinks. None of the customer showed any sign of impatient. Heard them thanking the lady boss for checking on them if they are being served..I could see there were many regular customers. Is a good sign. Good food is worth waiting. The price is reasonable. Will be back
A beer house with Japanese food menu and quite a few selections of draft beer, wine and liquor. Good indoor ambience with a few outdoor tables. Great for couples or small groups.
Great place to chill and have Japanese food 😊
Dined here twice. Subsequently tried to revisit on 2 occasions, but the staff were either missing (smoking outside the condo perimeter) or ignored 2 customers standing by the door.
Hidden gem in the Potong Pasir neighbourhood. Food and drinks are tasty and priced affordably. Service from the owner Kevin is the highlight and will definitely be back regularly.
Hidden gem that offers quality food at reasonable prices. Great service from staff too!
Great food and drink. Some of the best service we’ve ever had in Singapore and our favorite maki rolls yet.
Waiting for 2 hours and food is cold, pls don’t come to this place
Nice place with nice food
Wonderful host.. cosy place

Cheated by them! Ordered salmon belly but got normal salmon - for such a price $21.80 i think theres all grounds for a complaint here so others will know. Ur not a top end restaurant so the basic thing u shd be aware of n respect is trust and integrity and im sorry u failed miserably - and if u cannot uphold this then u shouldnt even be a business entity
This place took 30 minutes to serve a plate of Gyoza. I don’t even need that long to make it from scratch.

Disappointing. Added egg and they fried it with the rice so u cant eat it on its own. The photo is misleading as it shows a sunny side up. And ive eaten from other outlets and they always fry the egg separately.

Very rude service staff,  shouted at me many times. First time shouted at me telling me that my food is ready when I haven't even ordered. Second asking what I wanted to ordered. And lastly he kept shouting a number and while I was checking my receipt number explained very rudely that the number is the food I ordered. Food is decent pepper lunch standard but service is really bad.
Rude and slow cashier, buck up on service
Very delicious would recomend people to eat
Had a satisfying dinner here.

Ordered Little San as takeout lunch. Selection for sushi was reasonable.
Service was quick. It was spacious inside but not too many seats.

Ordered via Grab, just a salad. Not bad, cannot comment much as the main dishes are still maki rolls which I did not ordered.  Salad has many choices of sides to choose from. The only thing is I wish the portion could be bigger.
I ordered a Little San salad from this outlet at 8.45pm. Ingredients are still very fresh and overall taste is very good.
Quality has dropped. Ordered a Mega San but salmon sashimi as thin as a crabstick slice. Feedbacked to the contact us email but lacked response
usually less crowded than other places nearby. if dont want to waste time queue, can come here.

This bowl may look small, but when you pour it out on the plate, the serving was quite huge! I can’t finish the entire serving. Did I mention it was very yummy and fresh? Came back to try their mentaiko salmon. Super good as well!

Presentation full marks! The prettiest bowl of chirashi I have ever eaten! Portions are very generous too, so if you are a small eater, the mini bowl is plenty. Flavour isn’t the traditional kind so come with an open mind. Overall a great meal in a fuss-free residential joint, cosy and friendly staff. Definitely worth a try!

We ordered 4 different donburis (salmon, premium chirashi, bara chirashi and eel) for dinner. Each bowl was nicely presented. The bara chirashi got the most of the attention with its OTT garnishes. A   party in your mouth awaits if you like to mix everything up.

The price point for the bowls were above the average Japanese family restaurant but the quality and quantity of the seafood more than made up for it. I heard from the owner that fresh catch is flown in 2x a week from Japan. Worth a visit.

We initially thought the prices to be on the high side but the portions turned out to be very generous, we had difficultly finishing our food. Fish was very sweet and fresh and the aburi and eel slices were seasoned with yuzu, making them very tasty. I think I won't bother heading to The Sushi Bar anymore as this place is so near my place.

Visited twice when the restaurant newly opened to try out their promo dish. The Hana Bara and the mentaiko salmon don. Both dishes, despite being lunch promos had generous portion of ingredients. The third time, I ordered mini hana bara as takeaway and was so surprised to see the generosity in one bowl (assorted sashimi, unagi, aburi salmon and more)! The sashimi was very fresh and had crispy crunchy bits to give the dish a perfect finish. I hope this place stays open so I can keep coming back for more Chirashi!

checked out Chirashi Sora on a Friday night as we were craving chirashi bowls and it was nearby for us :)

The fish was fresh and the portions were huge!! (Not complaining) only that we ordered one bowl each and none of us could finish - will definitely be back but will share one portion between 2 people in the future!

Felt really bad to leave without finishing their food. Just wanted to say that it wasn't because it was not nice or fresh but because I couldn't get anymore food into my stomach :(

Their green tea was really nice. Many Japanese restaurants serve diluted green tea since it is refillable but each time we got our tea refilled it was rich and full of flavour 😊

Will be back to try their other chirashi bowls!!

Went on a Friday evening. Ordered the Konoha Sanin set. The crispy pork Tonkatsu is perfect. Crisp on the outside and tender inside.

As for the Saba fish, they literally torched the raw saba fish infront of us till it’s cooked. But i personally still find the taste too fishy so I asked them if they could cook it longer. The lady then brought it to the kitchen and microwave it. Which after that I still find the taste fishy, and so I requested them to fried the saba fish instead which they kindly did so.

The highlight from the set is definitely the waygu where you torch each piece of the waygu to your preferred doneness. Since it was thinly sliced, I torched it to rare. I was really expecting the “melt-in-your-mouth” experience but unfortunately not. However I must say the waygu is still flavourful and tender.

I did not enjoyed the edamame though because I was expecting fresh edamame but they used frozen edamame instead.

Overall it was a fun, tasty and pleasant experience. Customer service is good. Price is slightly expensive. Ambience is cosy with anime themed walls. Be sure to make a reservation before going down.

Unexpected gem :) The fish is super fresh and the mini don is good value for money compared to other chirashi places! Look at how much fish each mini don has! Also very instagrammable as each bowl is beautifully decorated with microgreens.

Had an issue with one of the dons (of no fault of the owner) and they were very kind to offer and exchange the don. Been a repeated customer and will definitely bring more people to visit this place! The cosy environment is also good for people who want to have a hearty chat over dinner.

The bistro is a short walk from Potong Pasir station and located at the ground level of The Venue Residences.

No crowd as i was there early.   This is an Japanese anime-themed bistro.  The wall deco and on-going screening of Demon Slayer.  Main character is Naruto.

The Crispy Pork Tonkatsu was super crispy at the outside.  Yummy max.  But the pork was a little tough.  The shredded cabbage wasn't as thin as i like it to be but it was good enough.

Food portion is good and it was neatly presented.

Follow my account and my IG: Joslovesfood for more food adventures!

The potion is very big even for mini bowl. The food is managed like work of art and I can feel the chef must be enjoyed in making the dishes. The sashimi is fresh and indeed a lot !!! A little Jem in my neighborhood and hope it can get more n more popular

Amazing 🤩

We ordered the large Hana Bara Chirashi to share (two person) and were surprised by not only the presentation but also the variety of ingredients in it!

Rice were flavourful (not the usual plain white Japanese rice you would expect) and we LOVE the Unagi inside! Didn’t expect to find it in a Chirashi Don.

Soft Shell Crab were thumbs up to! 🤤

Will be back soon 👍🏻

We order shrimp, puffer fish (is sweet, I think kid probably like it alot) and salmon don . Value for money ☺️ look at the menu you might think it costly  , but the portion is huge(can share as 2pax), as you can see the unagi don 😁

New Chirashi Restaurant, tried it on three different occasions and the standard & quality of the food is quite consistent.

They are very generous with the seafood and the rice has an additional flavour to it.

Tried the mentai salmom cheese don, kinda look like yu sheng (lol), was slightly too complex and heavy for my tastebuds, but my friend really enjoyed it.

The Bara Hana Salmon bowl was good, with pretty edible flowers. Love the freshness of the fish with a slight hint of sweetness from the egg & the pink floss thingie.

Friend had Sakana and we all really enjoy the tuna in the bowl & the huge cuts of sashimi.

Can try their chanwanmushi too, very different & refreshing.

Loved the hana bara chirashi! Portions were super generous and sashimi was fresh! The flowers were a nice touch and tasty too (hana can mean flowers in japanese) 🌸

The ‘normal’ portion was maybe 50% bigger than the mini one. I was stuffed from the mini portion🤰probably would have trouble finishing the ‘normal’ portion myself.

Will be back to try the other chirashis 😋

Edit: Went back for round 2! 👏 Had the hana uni bara (mini), chirashi, and hana bara this time. The uni is sooooooo creamy and fresh!

Chirashi tastes as good as it looks. The chutoro, swordfish, yellowtail, salmon, uni, anago, flounder, ebi… just wow 🤩

Favorite chirashi place 😍

Went there for lunch and ordered that Hana Bara Don S$28.50+ but was not expecting to wait 45mins for the food. Suprisingly the presentation of the don is pretty appealing, with generous portion of assorted raw fish cubes, foie gras, sakura ebis, tamago, cucumber & edamame, etc.  with the wasabi and ginger and they taste fresh. The little negative is too much of foie gras which make the whole bowl very greasy.

The food was so disappointing. As a start, why is there corn in the ramen soup…

Service was extremely slow.

A5 wagyu was good tho…. Cuz it wasn’t cooked by them… beer also…..

Summary : come here if you want Japanese music, anime pictures around and some beer from the tap.

Dinner plans with a couple of friends, and decided to order from different places. So we ordered a Hana Bara (Mini) ($18.80 nett) as a takeaway order, and it took 15 minutes to prepare. Once done, brought over to another place just a couple of minutes away to dine in.

The block of brown in the middle was said to be a sponge cake, from another review, so when we tried...... We were confused, and couldn't really tell. 'Cause there were pieces of tamago with brown tops that looked like the middle piece, that tasted similar but not, you know? But not that big a deal.

Before I go any further, the main reason why this was a 1 star down was just because of the temperature of the sashimi. This is the first time that I have room temperature or un-cold sashimi don, which didn't quite sit well with me. I like my sashimi and sushi cold, you know? It's just the experience and expectation for Japanese cuisine.

Apart from that, everything else was awesome! The portion was huge, totally worth the $18.80, and not just the rice, but the sashimi and ingredients were plentiful! I love the mix of the furikake throughout the don, with the sashimi cubes and mixed into the rice. Everything was flavourful enough that I didn't need to mix the wasabi and soy sauce in.  Definitely can recommend to others!
Pork Shabu Shabu set with fresh meat cuts and vegetables. Good broth and sauces. Friendly and efficient staffs. Cosy, comfortable and quiet environment.

Amazing food!!!

Had the Konoha sannin set:
1) A5 miyazaki wagyu ribcap 120g - the beef was really soft & tender! Also quite fun how we can torch our own meat and add the toppings up our preference!
2) Crispy pork tonkatsu - Super good?! It’s crispy yet not oily and so flavorful! Better than tonkatsu specialty places actually...
3) Torched shime saba - super good too and flavorful! I also like how it’s fillet so it doesn’t have a ton of bones!!
4) Side dishes - the chuka kurage (jellyfish) was fragrant with the sesame oil, and potato salad is always a favourite!
5) Onsen egg rice (add on) & miso soup - I like how the rice has onsen egg and furikake on it

Overall, each dish was great on its own. Really loved the food and will give 5/5!! Also interesting with all the Naruto deco! Recommend!!
Lovely little place. Food is fresh and really yummy. Would surely be back again. Visually a treat for the eyes and for the tummy too. Portions are generous. Staff are friendly and service is good.

Good service. above average food. we ordered tonkatsu ebi set (the pork was well marinated and well fried). aburi saba was boneless and unique. they serve ice/warm water.  fries was pretty small portion for $6.

My ramen noodles still have the alkaline taste. Naruto and Iruka would have destroyed this place if they are real. The tonkatsu is decent tho. Overpriced for the quality of food served overall. Didn't get a chance to sit inside and enjoy the ambience as well.

A Japanese style cafe with 10 tables in the Venue. It is 2 bus stops away from Potong Pasir MRT. Family friendly. It serves A5 Wagyu Beef, Aburi Salmon Don, Ichiraku Ramen, Tori Katsu, Tonkatsu, sake, Sapporo draft beers by tap, and other finger foods.

Restaurant ambience was chilled,

Ordered the Konoha Sannin, it came with their top 3 signature dishes, the Saba, tonkotsu and a5 wagyu slices. All three were really good.. think the Saba is orochimaru.. tonkotsu prolly jiraiya and wagyu gotta be Tsunade.. 🤣

My friend took me here as I had just returned to Singapore for holiday- we each had the Kaisen Chirashi ($25.80+), the torched kingfish with crab roe and the soft shell crab. Price is not cheap for the chirashi, but boy, the portions were huge! Did I mention that the variety of fresh fish on the rice was really generous and beautifully presented too? In the end I couldn’t even finish my own chirashi bowl and felt bad wasting so much food! The torched kingfish appetiser was incredibly tasty and the soft shell crab was nice too. Will definitely be back to try the fois gras and the truffle dishes as that was something I saw on the menu. Place is a bit out of the way though, and seating capacity a bit small.

Very odd chirashi don. Are you one that like everything put Into a bowl? A rojak of flavours, texture and ingredients?And I mean, popped rice, chilli, dried shrimp, pickled ginger, turnips, cucumber, flavour rice mixed in with mushroom, a generous serving of wasabi, topped with generous slices of sashimi and a small piece of cake? Yes, sponge cake.

Personally, I prefer my Donburi taste to be cleaner and that I can taste the freshness and sweetness of the fish. In this experience, we weren’t sure what we were eating. The fish though generous did not taste premium. For $35++ a bowl, a lunch for 2 could send you away $80+ poorer easily. That explain why the restaurant was practically empty.

I don’t think I will be ever going back. Just too weird and a tad too pricey for donburi for me.

Food was great and portions were generous but the service was disappointing. Went there with my family a few weeks ago and was seated outdoors as there were no tables available inside. We requested to be moved inside once a table was available. We waited almost an hour for our food to be served and during that time we saw two groups of walk-in customers being given seats indoors. After mentioning this to the staff, they eventually moved us inside and a waitress rudely passed us their namecard and told us to make a reservation next time before coming. What a disappointing and awful dinner experience.
Food quality is quite good! Please make a reservation 1st as the place is quite small!
Exceptional chirashi. I thought it was a bit pricier when i first looked at the menu. However when the food arrived, i thought the quality and portion justify the price!

Ordered delivery with small little hiccup but was very quickly and efficiently resolved by manager Vincent (hope i remember his name correctly) Food delivered on time and was very nice and fresh. Especially for the pork Tonkatsu although not as crispy but at least is not soggy at all. Salmon is fresh too. All the foodie were delicious and yummy thank you!
Very generous portion! Value for money and great food! Lots of parking available too! Ordering a mini size is more than sufficient.
A bowl of chirashi which clearly had a lot of thoughts put into all the ingredients. Will be back!

Our 3rd time here . A really nice drinking chillout izakaya place that we chanced upon .  We popped in for drinks once and were  surprised that the food  here are really good . Has been a weekly meetup place since that . Highly recommended !

Spoilt for choice and decided to try the Konoha sannin experience/set.
Food is great and very laid back casual dining.
Our server deserves mention.
Michelle is very patient and accommodating. She definitely contributed to the overall pleasant experience
Fresh, beautifully prepared and great variety.
Awesome food Awesome ambience 🔥🔥🔥, Great place to hang out & chill. This is definitely also a must visit for all naruto fans out there! 🙌🏻🙌🏻
Awesome food and ambience! Finally found something decent near my house. Love the tonkatsu and the curry! 5/5 would def come back again.
Tried their food a few times. Their food have been consistently good and price is reasonable. Personal favourite is their crispy pork tonkatsu. Shop with good ambient, highly recommended!
Good quality for food. Can be a bit pricey but definitely value for money.
Their foods are so good and as a big fan of Naruto, I love their ambience 🥰 Just that too bad they don’t have the signature Ichiraku Ramennn :(
Thumbs up on their aburi saba and tonkatsu pork, nice chicken karage and chicken skin to go with alcohol. Cozy Ambience for small group gathering

proper tonkatsu at a decent price , what's more to ask ?

paired with great beer , and a fun environment, will come more often!
Great ambiance and food, delicious tonkatsu and self torched wagyu beef, which you can cook to your own doneness 👍🏼 Gin and tonic was well mixed, definitely a place that I will visit again
Arrived here 9.40pm but was told last order already despite the operating hour states until 10:30.  Wasted the effort to travel all the way here 🥲 will try my luck again next time
This is our first visit. Impressed by the nice food and ambience.
Excellent place to unwind with some grade A5 wagyu beef and sake
Food was great and excellence
Nice food great service

Located on the second floor and it was a tad confusing how to get up using the service lifts. I ordered via Grab and did a self-collection.

Food was delicious and the flavours were balanced. I like the flexibility of the menu. However, like most salad bowls places around the Tai Seng industrial area, I don’t find this particularly value for money if I were to compare it to similar places in the CBD, where I pay similar or lower prices for way more protein. So yes, while the food was good, I’m not sure I might order it again. Especially since macros and nutritional information isn’t listed like the usual CBD haunts I go to, which are way more transparent.

That said, they don’t market themselves as a healthy choice, so something to note for people trying to eat better.
Small eatery on the second level of Tai Seng Centre. Loved their truffle beef rice bowl. Comes with soup and side salad. Great place for lunch but can get get filled quick by the office lunch crowd.

Kind of reluctant to recommend this great little Japanese eatery as it will surely be more crowded than it already is. Friend had the truffle beef and it was juicy and flavourful. I had the spicy salmon bowl which reminsces of spicy salmon gunkan - fresh salmon with a chilli padi kick that is so satisfying. Service was friendly and prompt and the ambience was simple but cosy. Heartwarming and wholesome comfort food!

Ordered chicken katsu but they gave me some frozen chicken drumlets instead. Curry was some powder mixture as well.

A home kitchen at best.

the diy bowls are pretty decent for the ingredients. but i ordered the truffle fries and the fries tasted very weird - its the taste of the overused cooking oil. granted it is during peak lunch hour, i still don’t think it’s fair to the consumers
Food was alright, though there are more value-for-money bowls of a similar standard elsewhere! 🍱

Great pricing and for the quality and freshness well deserves the 5 stars. Located in a well hidden industrial building you will need to be intentional in seeking this place out but rest assured you'll be rewarded with some of the tastiest mentai salmon and pork jowl dishes. They have fresh sashimi too! Well worth a visit or two or three! When u are in the area.
Good Japanese food for a good price. Good for a casual lunch. Kinda tight packed seating. Self service but the staff is very friendly.
I ordered truffle beef rice from foodpanda and it was so nice and flavorful. I will definitely recommend my friends and order again!
Food is horrible especially the Bara Chirashi Sakana Don, the rice  Is very soggy and sticks together like a clump
Great experience here! Delicious and affordable bowls. 😋
Great cozy atmosphere and nice Japanese food.

Enjoyed our lunch here. We will return to try other dishes :) the mentai salmon was aburi even though it wasn’t stated but all’s good, it was still yummy! The place is abit quiet when we were there so no issues finding a seat :)

My favourite hidden gem at Tai Seng! It really is quite hidden at the 2nd floor of an office building. Obviously you can tell I love this place because I have 5 photos of the poké bowl from different occasions (and many more I ate but didn’t take photos of). It’s operated by a group of Thai women and so they offer this sauce called spicy yum, which is the green stuff you see in the photos. I believe it’s the Thai seafood sauce made of basil, mint, chilli and other good stuff. Love!!!
