Salad bowls start at $7.90, poké bowls are $11.90 and $15.90 for one and two salmon/tuna topping respectively. Usually “premium” toppings like tobiko, jellyfish or onsen egg are NOT charged extra.

Also great service and very receptive to BYO, although the salad dressing always comes prepackaged in a small plastic container so I ask them to pour it in directly sometimes.

Great prices and excellent quality of food. The truffle beef don was spectacular and the crispy egg yolk fish skin and aburi salmon sushi was also great. I would definitely be back and recommend it to my friends
Small Japanese Restaurant in Tai Seng.  We ordered a Truffle beef don and a Bara Chirashi.  The beef is great, tender and tasty.  The Chirashi is good as well.

Friendly service. Truffle beef don taste is on point and at a decent price. Looks like it's quite popular during lunch hours so come early unless you are ok with a slight wait.

Pro tip: buy the $50 favepay coupon for $40. Works perfectly and you get 4mpd if you double up and load up crv as payment method in fave.

A underrated place located on Level 2. We went to this place purely from word of mouth. It’s a Japanese place operated by Thais and they also serve Pokè bowls which are affordable and delicious. Definitely recommend heading to this shop for lunch!

A friend ordered for my birthday lunch via Foodpanda. Unfortunately, the tuna was sour, the salmon was acceptable but tasted slightly dodgy. Not a fan of the chosen rice. Also, gave me food poisoning. Not sure if the restaurant did not pack it well or the ingredients were not fresh or the food delivery person screwed up.

But when the food came, it was just in a normal bento box as pictured, no dry ice or anything to keep it cool. Weather wasn't very hot, and food panda only delivers within 3 to 5 km?

Had 4 courses of charcoal to get it out of my system 😭😭.

Ordered Truffle Beef Set and Bara Chiraisi. The fish were fresh and tasted great! The truffle wasn't overpowering. The searing of the beef was great!! Slightly salty but with the rice, the runny egg yolk, the sauce and top it up with a bit of shichimin made it perfect for me! The portion was generous, too! It was a fulfilling meal!

The drink here was ice yuzu lemon. It was refreshing!

What a gem! Surely will come back here soon! Somemore with 10% cashback with Fave!!
Food is really good. The truffle beef was delicious, the beef was full or flavour and tender.  I dont usually like salad but the ones they served were so fresh i ate them all too.
Quaint little place at Tai Seng Centre with awesome food. Each item is prepared freshly from scratch ensuring the taste is just right. Highly recommended for a visit.
A great small little Japanese don place tucked away at Tai Seng Centre! Food was really good and worth it 🙌🏻
Must try the truffle beef don, it's delicious!
Food is good, very fresh. Hope the quality will stay. Like the style to order at counter and collection when buzzed.
Ordered their truffle beef don, it’s really a MUST to try! Very delicious and affordable for the portion!!!

This is my third time here and I feel like home always whenever I eat here. The owner is really such a pleasant person, and always serving such quality food with generous portions! The truffle beef don seals the deal for me, but the salmon 🍣 is just as great. Hope this joint gets the recognition it deserves! 👍👍👍
Great Japanese sashimi bowls! Definitely hidden gem.
Definitely an underrated place. The food is super good and pricing is fair. The spicy salmon udon is a must try!

Best hidden japanese food in Tai Seng area . Open till late , friendly staffs , great service , good food and what else to ask for ! Highly recommended place . Great skilled  chef working on immaculate food .

Friendly staff and good food. Store owner Joob was really friendly and helpful. There was once I left my wallet there and she took care of it and called me to get my wallet.

Recommended food:
Chirashi
Beef truffle bowl (add foie Gras if ure up for it)
Truffle somen

Chicken wings are a good add on

I've tried their mentaiko chicken, truffle beef yakiniku and their teriyaki chicken and I have never been disappointed. Super generous portions, delicious and very value for money. All have been deliveries so i can't speak for service or ambience but 10/10 for food.

The wait for the food was extremely long that is so ridiculous. I ordered a bowl of spicy salmon don, which I believe requires the least effort if you compare to the other dishes on the menu because you don't even need to cook the salmon. I waited 40 mins and when we asked about it, it seems like they forgotten about my order. I also noticed that other customers that ordered their food after us got their food much earlier than us. Seems like they don't prepare the food order by order, and more like just randomly see what order they received and prepare it first. Extremely unorganized. My colleagues ordered cheese fries as well and they only started preparing 1 HOUR after they placed the order. In the end, they had to ask for a refund because the wait is just ridiculous. Don't think I will ever come back again.

Never ever order via food apps. They use their own drivers but delivered my food at 21:30 when i ordered it at 18:30. They never answered the phone despite calling multiple tines. It is clearly an horrible customer experience and the food arrived iced called.

Went here for a quick lunch from office, around 10 of us. Got in early so got food fast, there was quite a waiting when we were leaving.
The food itself was good, I had the teriyaki salmon. The service was very good, I had a special request and they remembered it even with all the rush.

Ordered via Grab Delivery, the menu said the Bara Chirashi had swordfish and salmon roe in it. When I received it there was only half a small cube of swordfish, and no salmon roe at all. That's pretty much lying. Taste wise was ok.

Ordered truffle beef yakiniku Don with foie gras thru delivery service. The food is still warm, the beef is medium rare cooked and tender and flavorsome. There were salad and miso soup in the set too. Never expected such a high quality delivered food. I will definitely come and visit the shop soon.

Had food poisoning after ordering chirashi don from foodpanda last night. Delivery time was alright. Tuna didn’t taste fresh. I hope merchant is more careful on handling the food as this experience is really upsetting!
The poke bowls are amazing! The fish is fresh and the ingredients are so flavorful. Love it!
Ordered from Deliveroo in July: small portions for poke bowl, not filling -> highly overpriced.
Loving the poke bowl I tried today very fresh ingredients are served. 😋 Yummy
Ingredients are fresh and combinations is great for me!!!

Visited JJak for the first time yesterday with my god-daughter and we both love the small but cosy ambience. The food serving is generous and when we sink our teeth into our Mentai and teriyaki salmon, we were immediately drawn to the freshness of the food. The Thai milk tea was excellent as well. We highly recommend JJak to anyone who love good food and we’ll definitely be back for more! 😋😋😋
Very good portions and very healthy! I order via Grabfood so don’t know what the store front is like. The seafood is fresh and tasty, a good option if need a nice and healthy meal
Mentai Chicken.. Nice food
Serving time is a little slow but the food are better than my expectation.
Affordable and tasty food, one of the cheapest Sapporo beers in town. Friendly and warm staff. Definitely a surprise to find this gem in the heart of Tai Seng.
Good quality food and presentation at an affordable price
Food is soooo good! They aren’t stingy with the toppings and you must especially try their cold noodles (it’s the best I’ve had)
I've food poisoning from at least the poke food from the bowl. I'm in pain the whole night, having diarrhoea and vomiting. I'll not recommend this place.

3 star are for the foods only.
ordered bento set with additional add on. foods portion are full filling. salmon sushi are fresh. serving staffs are great  .. but the only downside is that the way they serve the foods. they shall serve the main course with the additional add on together ..
P/S : maybe should send the staffs for some upgrading courses ..

I think this is one of the worst review I’ve given but I still wana give them 2 star to encourage the owner to keep improving. Firstly they have a very wide range of food choices on the menu. And seems like an authentic Japanese restaurant… but very disappointed after you try them. The cha Siew ramen tasted exactly like an instant noodle powder soup base. Noodle are not fresh either. Sushi platter was the worst. Salmon Harumaki came very tiny and badly made. They didn’t give me the tamago maki as checked with the chef and said it was out of stock. Cucumber maki was bitter. Pumpkin croquette was ok as it is deep fried before serving. It’s basically food court standards but restaurant pricing.

Went to enjoy the 1-for-1 kamo (duck) ramen $13.80 promotion. Service was warm and quick. Added on set A for another $4.90 - a drink, chawanmusi, 1 sushi & 1 slice of fruit & $6.90 set B same items as set A just with a tiny salad and 1 mochi. Chawanmusi and sushi were OK, the rest not worth it... kamo ramen was ok.
Tonkatsu $10.80 - crispy and came with nice sauce. Salmon belly 5 slices $11, fresh but the slices were uneven in thickness and sizes...

Most of the item I would like to have was not available. The sashimi was presented like a bento set which I don’t know how to appreciate most important of all not fresh. The chicken was big in portion but not well marinated. The only consolation was the tempura prawn manage to meet the bar. Sake selection was bad very limited . Even the light soya sauce also taste funny and dark in colour . Staff was friendly. Overall dun worth the money.

Ordered set on the menu. It was quite filling for lunch. Quite a big portion for the rice and the meat.
It was delicious 😋🤤

We were seated at outdoor, it wasn't hot but quite windy. But getting/calling the staff from outdoor was difficult.

Lunch hour wasn't that pack for this restaurant.

Quite disappointed with the foods. I won’t called it the Japanese food. Fried rice is oily and bland. Curry tempura, pretty much out from the Japanese curry cubes paste. Teriyaki cod fish, not really fresh.
Don’t think I’ll go back again.

seldom give bad reviews. So it must be really bad for me to do so. Won’t talk about service as it’s subjective. Katsu pork hard as brick. Ramen tasteless. Pork belly was terrible. Salmon look not fresh
Went on a Saturday afternoon, it's a nice cosy and well decorated restaurant. Ordered Ebi Fried Curry and Tonkatsu Curry. Both are okay curry. Service was good.
Tried this restaurant using Burpple Beyond. Got the beef Don which was surprisingly good. However it wasn't the cheapest, would definitely recommend to give it a try if you have Burpple Beyond.

The salmon slice is very thin and doesn’t look fresh. The salmon belly is worse. So tiny, Feedback to the staff and say it’s normal size 5 tiny slices for $11. When I say Tiny it’s really tiny. (Size of abt 2cm x 2cm and 5mm thick?) my customer whom I brought him there is in disbelief of them serving us such standards.

I buy anywhere for $11, it’s definitely going to be bigger.
I won’t go back anymore.

I have attached the photo they show they will serve. Actual per slice is maybe 10% of what you see. They told me picture for illustration only. I was…. I didn’t managed to take a photo as my client finished it himself as it’s too little to share. Order at your own risk.

The unagi set w egg was still acceptable as in 5.5/10. Not fantastic but ok.
Used entertainer 1 for 1 bento/ramen. Very mediocre food. Ramen taste like Maggie mee, egg is hard boiled egg. Salmon sashimi was thinly sliced.

I was prepared to give one star after reading the reviews but man , the hospitality , food , taste it’s all top , truly fantastic Resturant and experience not sure why this place got low stars it’s simply delicious  , hontooooo nii oishi , watashi wa daiski sakana chan
Food seems overpriced with poor presentation... Service was okay but the plates, especially the one for the soya sauce, was dirty with stains.

1. Ordered salmon belly sashimi but only 1 piece out of the 3 pieces is the real salmon belly sashimi (you can see the difference in the photo)
2. Avocado maki was poorly wrapped with the seaweed falling apart (in the photo also)
3. The worst is the char siew ramen!!! 1 taste of the soup and it's exactly the seasoning from myojo chicken instant noodles!! Any decent ramen chef will take pride in their soup base as it's like the soul of the ramen!
Try it at your own risk cos it's definitely not worth your money! This is my first & last time ordering!

We almost ordered everything from the menu! The taste was great and the lady who served us was great. She is attentive and warm when we ordered our food.
A simple yet cosy place to visit if you just need a place to ease your Japanese food bangs. :) Keep up your great work!

Not a high end Japanese restaurant. Taste and price wise well rounded and average if took on promotion meals. Not the freshest ingredients, but makes up for with other items. Service is good. Does seem like a good place to hang out with friends with few beers (around $10 per pint - standard price). Interior also nicely well furnished
Food was okay, portion sizes were okay. Staff was friendly but the ambience was dull. Not very lively place. Only me was there in the restaurant while other nearby places were kinda crowded.

Food was quite mediocre. Most flavourful thing on my table was the rice seasoning. Salmon sashimi was not cut properly. Miso soup and chawanmushi was bland. Even the shoyu wasn't very pleasant. Portion was good but taste needs a lot of improvement.

Sashimi was on the pricier side and the texture and quality isn't worth the price. The sashimi was average and quite small for its price. Out of the 10 salmon sashimi, there was an even smaller piece than the rest. The swordfish was more expensive than the salmon but it wasn't good and the size was small.

Regretted that I didn't check the reviews by others before purchasing from this restaurant. You can get better quality of sashimi from other japanese restaurants or Donki.
Good selection of sushi, rice sets and ramen. They also serve kids meal but the "car" tray was unstable (one wheel missing). Took quite a long time to serve the food but we enjoyed it.

First i need to be remark!! This is my first time for the review..i will nvr put reviews as im a very lazy person!! but this is the worst experience i had at this restuarant..wrong order then insisted the order is correct! I order sword fish but send tuna and tell me this is sword fish. Hello!! Im not first time eating sword fish lo!! Lol! The staff lack of experience and training..and the food is don worth the money..sashimi not fresh.. and the worse age dashi tofu serve in the restaurant!! No taste at all ..im like eating the plain tofu instead!! First time and my last time..thank you for spoiled my lunch!

We are being reminded a few time it's last order at about 8.20pm to 8.30pm. At 8.40pm where most of my family have already finish their dinner and I am really hungry. I was being told they forgotten to cook my dinner. I waited for 50 minutes and they actually forgotten to cook for me. Sadly, there is no crowd at all and this mean they're NOT busy at all. The service crew and the kitchen aren't busy at all. It's not my style to rate a one star unless this really bad service experience.
I think they can be awarded the worse japanese sushi restaurant ever. Food is overpriced with super small portion. Sashimi completely not fresh at all. Order isnt correctly done up too.

Food so so only when I first visit. Thereafter shopback gave loyality reward and went back for the complimentary reward. Reward indicates no min. Spending for the redemption but they insist you need to purchase a main and not able to redeem with purchase of handroll. They say is shopback issue and not their restaurant.

Not going back there again. If you are not agreeable with shopback T&C of the reward, you shld follow up with them and trash it out. You shld honour it while you trash out with shopback the discrepancy.

Not recommended.

Chope voucher brought me here! Voucher for $21.80 - UP $28.80 - 5 kinds of sashimi, 3 pieces each! It was really nice and fresh.

Had a bowl of ramen (not shown which is the kakiage) which was a nice and comforting meal for a rainy day.

Didn’t know of this lovely place but thankful I made a trip here :)

Kudos to the young lady who served us, she was so sweet and patient. Great service!

Will be back here again!

Mediocre food and long wait for food even though the restaurant was not crowded.
The ramen was soggy and starchy. The stock was underwhelming and was almost room temperature.
The chirashi don was worse. The sashimi pieces were very thinly sliced so much so that can't taste the fish. The rice at least was like normal rice.
The gyoza was very oily. There was meant to be 6 pieces of gyoza but we were served 5. Had to ask for missing piece.
Unlikely to go back ever.

Bought the fave deal with the Japanese curry chicken with tonkotsu ramen with just SGD$19.80. Very surprised the food is really nice! The ramen is really Oishi!!! We love this so much. Fully recommend to come and taste.

Used entertainer 1 for 1 here (bento only). We added the sets where $10.90 more gets you some salad, one sushi, one scoop of ice cream, chawanmushi, half pint of Asahi draft (lager/dark). We shared the items in the 2 bento and I enjoyed the salmon the most. With entertainer, full marks. Very value for money

The food was good. The restaurant was cosy. And the portions seemed generous enough for us. Maybe we are small eaters or used to pricey food. But we didnt expect the serving sizes to be what they were for the price we paid. Will go again!
Ramen is average. Sashimi is way below average. There are better Japanese restaurants. Good for quick lunch though.

$18.90 Unagi Set Meal (After Taxes ~$23)
Took ~ 15 mins to Prepare (non-peak hour)
Service (7/10) waitress was friendly

Unagi - (7/10) Acceptable Portion and Standard
Ebi - (5/10) Meh. Like Food Court Japanese store standard
Rice (5/10) just your normal rice or u could add $2 upgrade to “sushi rice”
Miso Soup (5/10) standard not outstanding

Unlikely to come back again as there are better options at this price point.

Came here for dinner. The place is outside the main shopping mall. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. The gyōza was good. Ordered the tempura and it was great too. The tempura was done not to oily but just right. There are also some special ramen set that is value for money. The price was also reasonable.

What you see in this photo is priced at $14++ on their menu. This place is nice and cozy, and the food comes hot. Waitress should have clarified orders because she got one of our orders wrong (Chashu don became Katsu don), and when we informed her about it after it came, she said nothing. I mentioned it again when paying and all she said was that she heard us say Katsu don. Not a single word of apology of sorts. Upon opening (we were there at 11.12am), we were informed that because they had just opened, there was no cold soba available either as the sauce just got put into the fridge. Generally disappointing but thank goodness for Burpple 1-for-1.

Just received my foodpanda order, paid $67 extremely not worth the price tag.
10+ sashimi which is super tiny portion
$9+ salad which is only lettuce with single tiny slice of avocado
$12+ of lousy made Ebi sushi
😓 total ripped off!🤦🏻‍♀️

Decent Japanese food. Ordered tonkotsu & duxk ramen, broth was tasty. Kakiage was not crispy though, it felt too much flour. Curry was also so so. The restaurant only have 1 female staff taking order, serving food & cashier. Kudos to her that despite the hectic, she still maintained her smile & ever helpful.

They should be that I have rated them one of the worst Japanese Izakaya in Singapore. It seems that the chef is not really focus in his cooking and rushing through just to get the food cook and done with any details. Bland taste and poor customer service. BANNED!

Simple setting Japanese’s restaurant at affordable price. Came here for bento lunch set at $19 with sashimi , fried chicken , rice, soup and vegetable. Fresh sashimi and tasty chicken. They served many other Japanese style food and worth a try. Simple and tasty.. will come for dinner too!

Updated with latest visit after 1 year.. jan 2021. Came here for lunch with my loved ones, enjoyable lunch with great deal 1 for 1 using some apps. The tempura curry udon was tasty and no overpowering. Perfect Grilled of hamachi cheek, spider maki were great but the katsudon kind of average as the chicken meat is too dry ! Loved the gyoza with perfect crisp outside and moist inside made perfect !

Food is salty without flavour.

Salt and soy sauce should not be used as substitutes for dashi stock.
Average Japanese food, something that you might find in a food court. The rice was dry and not the short grain type you would expect.
Great dinner here..  service very good. Would come again soon.

Ok Can TRY!!The service was IMPECCABLE! Had a GREAT time and to top it off the FOOD was GREAT!! DESPITE BEING OPPOSITE Michelin- starred Tsuta, this place could stand tall and proud on its own merit!!

I’ve never had such a bad sashimi in my life. Not well chilled, not fresh (tuna sashimi is almost black color) and awfully presented at a high price. You’d better throw your money into the wishing pond than wasting money on these sashimi that can get you poisoned. Living in this area for 3 years without trying this shop and this will be my last time. Crazy that this restaurant is still open, probably because of the 10++ Ashahi beer which is good. Should avoid at all cost if you’re craving for raw fish.
This is what I like. Simple and affordable Japanese food. No need to be exaggerate or fine dining. Dinner set all to myself.
Service was excellent and more than make up for the quality of the food. Food was not too bad but definitely has room for improvement.

This is probably the best Char Siew Ramen I have ever tasted, not your normal circular-shaped Char Siew that is cooked in soup.
The Char Siew is tastefully grilled with the right balance of lean and fat meat, making it juicy and succulent.

Nice decor and service staff earned the 2 stars. Nothing much to comment about the food, we don't feel it is worth to pay for the price. Even takeaway sushi from competitive outlets are better tasting and presented. The rice grain used is not authentic for their Don bowl. Do look into the presentation and ingredients' freshness.

Had the lunch promotion spicy ramen but did not enjoy it. Ramen noodles are quite too soft and vegetables were spinach that didn't felt like they matched. The lunch set came with a drink, salad & oranges. Soup broth was so-so, nothing really "ramen" about it.
Overall, I felt that the taste and presentation is quite comparable to what you can find in food courts - which made my lunch set not worth @ $12.90++.
The pork was quite dry for the curry don, the hotpot was alright and quite a huge portion, can be shared by 2 persons.
Food quality was atrocious. Everything was tasteless and portions were small. Even hawker centre Japanese food tastes better. Prices are far too high for food of this standard.

Delicious Japanese casual dining in Tai seng.
Good location and easy to find it.
Staff was friendly and food was fresh and yummy!!
Will visit again👍

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Most of the sushi tasted decent. Unagi was however, not very fresh. It had a fishy taste. Chocolate cake was also too sweet for my liking. Not for fussy people. Staff was generous with the sauce. Cheap and value for money!

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
It was very good with the right chef, I would give 5/5. Fresh, with sweet flakes. But with the wrong chef, it tasted bland and rancid. Oh yes, the fish stinks my entire room like trash (don't believe, buy it and try)
Now it's way worse. The sushis lack fish eggs and ingredients. Take a look at the photo! it's the most pathetic thing for your money. Doesn't taste good either, lacks ingredients. It been going on for the past 4 purchases.
Sadly I have stopped buying from last week.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: First time trying takeout shop, normally is having at their physical shop dine in, food standard compare to dine in I feel better here at takeout shop. The taste is fresh surprisingly. Price wise is cheaper also for some item, 10 pcs salmon sushi for $5.00. What a steel. Looking for a takeaway meal this shop is Highly recommend to go buy.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Carmen who works as a cashier for the TOA PAYOH outlet was very attentive to my requests. Her professionalism and exemplary service is a shining example for people in the F & B service sector. She was also smiling at the customers even though it was crowded. I hope that the company rewards such employees for their great service. I look forward to patronizing this outlet soon.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: I loved the corn sushi because they make it well and it is hard to find elsewhere and it was very reasonably priced but they stopped selling it for no reason at all. It was one of the best outlets I know but getting worse and worse. Would not go there ever again because no reason to

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Everytime passby this outlet always long queue, happen came early today and buy some of the sushi try try. It was indeed cheaper than other places and salmon fresh too..

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
Claims to close at 11pm based on their google directory.

Went there at 9pm on a Saturday night and their staff already brought the barriers down and chased away customers.

Disappointed and will stop patronising this outlet.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Always return here when I happen to pass by the area. They sell affordable sushi with decently good quality (sushi express quality) and fresh. Bought the salmon don for $6 and it was really filling. Another fav is the salmon duo which is 10pcs of salmon sushi for $5. What a steal!

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
Went out to buying dinner and the queue for the sushi 🍣store is not very long. My wife took 2 of them and didn't put them in the basket they provided and went to pay.
Back at home, I laid out the sushi on the dining table. Opened up the wasabi and soy sauce.Then it was dinner time.
Each pack cost $4.50 and taste was good enough. Reasonably cheap for sushi. No wonder there is usually, a queue there.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Nice and budget friendly Sushi

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: bought a spicy chicken salad from the toa payoh sushi take out. turns out, after almost finishing the salad, found a bloody worm at the corner. almost wanted to vomit out my food. terrible, will never buy from them again

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
12th March 2022 (Saturday) - 3pm

The middle-age lady cashier tilted the sushi box sideway when putting into plastic bag which caused the sushi to toppled and is quite unfriendly over the whole payment duration.

Definitely need more training.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
Firstly, I was really excited when there’s gonna be one outlet opening at Toa Payoh HDB Hub area.I got sushi from them last week and this week. Both visits were during lunch time.

However, on my second visit, the quality of service by the cashier was disappointing compared to the first time I visited.
The cashier during my first visit gave me chopsticks and the cashier for my second visit says it’s $0.20 for chopsticks which is reasonable but I didn’t get it.

The cashier did not finish my transaction before moving on to attend to the grab orders. The transaction took a little long. I think the quality of service could have been improved or they could have better manage their manpower in this outlet.

Above is my experience and I still enjoy their sushi, I just hope  to have a better experience the next time. Thank you.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: I had food poisoning after eating the sushi. The food is not fresh.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: First time i tried this and this is probably the most worth it sushi I’ve ever tried in Singapore. It taste better than normal sushi you buy at convenience store, cheaper price, and has more variety. I will come back for sure to try the bowl.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: saw a boy drop the salmon and ruined it. the cashier immediately came and cleaned it up and wrote it off FOC. 10/10 service.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
Was even contemplating about giving 1 star as the customer service was beyond speechless - horrible. Bought a total of 8 pieces of sushi and asked if I could be given a pair of disposable chopsticks as I was intending to eat it outside and also for hygiene purpose.

However the reply given to me was, “your sushi are all of individual packaging so you do not require any chopsticks.” I was infuriated upon hearing that.

It was ridiculous as it was not as if I did not buy any sushi from them hence I’m not entitled to a pair of disposable chopsticks.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Affordable, fresh and tasty sushi. They provide sauce, wasabi and chopsticks. I wish they have outlet near my workplace.

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: bought here few times before all staff given enough for the soy sauce and wasabi, but this time served by cashier name hoo rae en have limit for the soy sauce even request,unlike

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Please keep the prices affordable!

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: It use to be good but now getting worse and worse….

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Selling sushi without giving chopstick how to eat ?

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content: Cheap and they have cheese masago sushi

restaurant name: Sushi Express Take Out @ Toa Payoh
content:
(Translated by Google) The taste is good...the price is okay...the main reason is convenience, you can buy it back to the office to eat. One-time use chopsticks, very good

(Original)
味道不错…价格还可以…主要是方便，可以买回去办公室吃。有一次使用性筷子，很不错

Happened to walk pass  this small cosy Japanese  casual restaurant.  Decided  to have my lunch with my wife.  Food exceeded my expectation.  The waiting  time  a bit long, seem short handed.
Well,I have a amazing lunch. I be back  to visit  again.
Never seen a udon like this. Very different from the menu. The soup was cloudy because of the beef. Beef was not fresh at all.
Fresh n generous serving. Delicious  n  value  for money. Way exceeded my expectations.  Nice  experience.
Enjoyed the champion floss maki with my friends. Generous serving of floss and roe on the maki! There were a variety of dishes to choose from and staff was friendly :)
Food is average but the soyu is not suitable for sashimi.

This place used to be Nana Curry. Not sure if the same management change their branding since nana curry had a lot of bad reviews the past few months or perhaps just a total change of management.

We ordered the salmon aburi don, unagi don, soft shell crab appetizer and chicken katsu don. All the dishes were delicious and well presented. Staff service was alright nothing fantastic but the waiter was responsive. There's many competitions around for japanese food but I wouldn't mind patronizing them again (fingers crossed their food standards don't drop as they are very new)

We didn't have issues with our food but the next table was giving feedback to the chef that the salmon was raw. Not sure if they ordered Aburi or actual raw salmon but the chef said it is suppose to be raw unless customers want it to be fully cooked. I agree somewhat but I think if customers want it cooked the chef can always offer to take the dish back and cook the salmon aburi style. Cooking sashimi cuts thoroughly is a waste but if the customer wants it more cooked why not compromise and do some changes to make them happy? Just gave me the impression that the chef wasn't willing to go the extra mile to help customers with their request.

never again, the rice is just as bad as described by others and the raw fish wasn't fresh. hope I don't get food poisoning

if the owner/franchisee owner sees this. like seriously send your chef for rice cooking lesson.

your rice is seriously a disgrace and burning all the effort of the rice farmer. literally unedible.

the rice is mushy, sticky and dry at the same time.

waiter responded exactly as described by others with the blur look of huh really ah

This is japanese cuisine (inside poiz center). My favorite is champion floss maki and chuka hotate. Tastes wise is normal, salmon hana maki is fresh, and the sushi is just nice. The wasabi is not fresh i think..Related the price i consider in the middle range. Average price roughly 16sgd(for 8 pcs sushi) and 7-8sgd for 4pcs and similiar price with udon. All menu has small or large portion, and of course the price will be different. Those that really want to have quick grab, you can come into this place and just order don menu ya. FYI, their portion is quite generous as overall..

Small and cosy Japanese restaurant. This place serves value for money Japanese food but on a higher level compared to sushi express restaurants. Was surprised by the quality of food they offered here.

Worst sushi I ever had in my life.. The sushi’s rice is over-cooked and it became like a porridge-liked sticky texture. An obviously untrained waitress (who has no idea what customer service means, even after i filed a complaint and being nice not to be fussy, she has not say a word from her mouth, not even a ‘sorry’ or ‘thank you’). Lastly, an ah Beng chef who speak loudly behind the kitchen saying, it is not my fault by the rice fault....... what an experience and I will not recommend anyone to patronise this shop.

Yum yum.
Ordered salmon aburi don and unagi roll.
The hakotate mentai was nice!!! (not in the picture)

Service is ok but probably because there isn't crowd at all.

Price for a such small establishment is very very steep. Easily matching almost to Sushi Tei.

Food taste is very average at best. Taste frozen. The flour used for the tempura is food court standard. Serving is also very small.

Considering the taste versus the price, wouldn't visit again. I spent $30 alone for the food which i can get at $15 at Sushi Express and taste better.
Surprise that yuba hut serves pretty good sashimi, the aburi don is well torched too!

First and last time here, I don’t usually write reviews but I Ordered teriyaki chicken don cause I saw that it was the chef’s recommendation. For $7.80 plus service charge and GST, you are getting mushy clumped up rice and tasteless chicken. If I am being brutally honest, the food in army cookhouses taste better. Better off patronising the Japanese store in the food court.

Worst restaurant in Poiz. Not fresh and portion extremely small. Chopsticks and spoon dirty yet don’t provide tissue to clean. Only wet tissue and chargeable. See  this picture never see any restaurant put spoon and chop sticks without tissue. Sure the basket is dirty and never wash.

Heard that the Chef David is going to be posted out. I will be very upset and will not visit Yuba Hut in Poiz. Love the way he prepares the food for us. Please do not transfer him out. As we supported since day 1. Tks
Great spot to grab a quick dinner. Food is served very quickly and is pretty decent, considering it’s just a little shop in a linkway. Prices are very reasonable for the portion size.
Love this cosy Japanese  casual restaurant.    Food exceeded my expectation especially the champion floss maki and aburi... affordably priced and great service from staff

Went with my date to there for dinner. I think the portion for the don is a bit small and quite pricey and there was no serviette. The wet tissue was chargeable though. Service was ok.

I gave it 4 stars since the don was actually quite tasty. Hope they can improve for those stated above.
Prices went up is understandable but not food quality. Before $7.80 for katsu don compared to $8.90 now is a lot diff.
There is no updated timing for operating hour, the staff rejected us for dining between 3:30-4:30 when the shop is operating

Poached eggs are cold

Torched Mentai is also cold

Whole place no aircon

Serve customer with burnt fries

Never again!

Worst customer service. The server took my son's drawing paper cos she said no drawing. Even told my son not to draw. For some reason she also didn't want to give us a fork when my wife asked for one. We even have to find a baby chair and set it up on our own even though we asked the server for a baby chair.

$4 service charge is hard to accept given the type of service we got.

Food wise, not bad.

Portions were a little smaller than expected from the pictures. But overall taste was pretty good.

Would recommend to give the soft shell crab a try!
I love the food in this place. Cheap, portion is just nice and really decent quality (btr than sakae sushi imo) for the price.

Service is very slow but I can't blame the cook or the waiter. There are only those 2 around juggling the whole tables and online orders. The management is working them unfairly and as result they got scolded by customers quite a lot.

Had dinner here today. Ordered a teriyaki don. The rice is terrible. Japanese rice cook until texture like porridge. They replaced but rice still the same. Not recommended. How can the chef serve this kind of food to its customer.

Expensive! Even of you decide to pay extra for something good, this is not the place to go. Average food taste with very few bright points.

The Ebi Tempura Don: the tempura was WAY too thick.
Chicken teriyaki Don: there was more skin than actual chicken.
Aburi Salmon Mentai: ridiculously small for the price
Salmon Aburi maki: only thing I ordered that I cannot complain about.

When they open I was so excited to have Japanese food in the neighborhood, but unfortunately this is not what you're looking for.

Ordered the udon with chicken kaarage and katsudon. The udon portion is so small for $6.5 and the chicken kaarage is just too oily. For the katsudon, it's equally terrible. The rice is under cooked and the katsu is so oily.

I give higher than 1 star is just because that there is no queue and waiting time is not too long.

A small little place but has great service. The wait staff on duty was polite and friendly. She was patient in answering my queries about the food and assisted me in filling in the form to order the food.

The food was served fast. The Buta Yaki Don was flavorful and the mekajiri sashimi was fresh. Although there were only three slices of sashimi, it is worthwhile to note that the slices are quite thick.

Price is reasonable for the quantity and quality of the food.

A nice touch was that the wait staff bothered to check with the customers on their opinion of theme food and service during payment.
Service is really bad here. The lady who served used to be good but now they change to a guy and his attitude is really bad.

They told me our orders would take about 20-25 minutes. I waited mine for 45 minutes. I cancelled my order in the end. My 3 fellow diners had their food arrived 10 to 15 minutes one after another. By the time they finished all their food, mine has arrived. In the end I cancelled my order.

Don't listen to the five star review below by the accounts that looks like they were purposely created just to give a single review for this restaurant (two accounts, five star, one review only.. really?). food is inconsistent. prices are downtown japanese restaurant prices. Had the rice bowl , came with HARD BOILED EGG. R u kidding me? Rejected and demanded onsen egg as advertised on the menu. Took them 20 minutes and to my dismay , they served me a SOFT BOILED EGG (a.k.a kopitiam breakfast egg). And for 9.90++, no Miso soup? Service isn't great also (no one speaks English, so good luck if you're a foreigner or Japanese and can't speak mandarin). Why charge service charge then? Been here a couple of times, been disappointed every time. Once, we ordered 3 type sashimi and they substituted maguro with salmon (they ran out of maguro), however the price remains the same. The kitchen staff kept glaring at me today for inconveniencing them by demanding the onsen egg. Hello!!!? Isn't it your job to prepare the dish according to the menu? I'm just amazed a supposedly JAPANESE food stall tried to nonchalantly pass off their rice bowl with a hard boiled egg (and they did it to several customers)! You'd be better off having the rice bowl at kopi&tarts further down the linkway - at least they serve the correct type of egg, and it's cheaper too.

Please educate your staff. He refused us to dine in explaining that only fully vaccinated can dine in. There was two of us who had both recieved our 2nd dose 3 days ago, we had our proofs yet he wont let us dine.

Ordered sashimi platter and Su udon.
Sashimi strong taste of the fridge not the fish which indicates frozen fish not thawed properly.
Texture of sashimi is inconsistent, makes me wonder if this will be my last meal.

Affordable Japanese Food, surprisingly good 👍😋

Shall come back again, hoping for speedier Food wait

Requested for cooked egg instead of osen egg.
This buta don is $8.90. Damn worth it!👍

Nice and fresh,I tried the don here, is delicious.can have a try when pass by poiz centre👍

Like

Answer
Steak don and salmon aburi don are best here. Steak is high quality for affordable price. The only thing is wait time is too long unless you order a takeaway.

Dont listen to the 1star review.
the katsu don is only $7.8 and it is soo good. all the dishes with mentai sauce is extreme good. everything that has mentai in that restaurant is good. extremely recommended
Food is great I will come back

Chicken katsu don very underrated — best I've ever had!!
Mentai sauce is also extremely good! :)
Delicious unagi and salmon protein bowls. Service is fast because not a lot of people.
Seems to be short staffed and as a result, poor attitude and service. First and last time at yuba hut.
Affordable Japanese flair
Overpriced sushi express level food
Ordered unagi don and my mouth is literally soaked with saltiness. Small serving as well.
Katsu Don tasted sour to me and I don’t like it
Don't believe the 5 stars review!
bad and rude service with bad food

Nestled away at the foot of a HDB block, with ample parking. Food was good, fried egg was done really well but a little too oily. Tom yum soup (clear) was good.

Service from the staff was mixed - the lady taking orders was incredibly curt, but the servers were friendly and helpful. It is a good place for simple, fuss free Thai fix.

Authentic thai restaurant, even the staff are mostly Thai.

Taste of food is great and reasonably priced.

The must haves are the fish in lime, prawn cakes and pork collar.

Come early to avoid having to wait too long, though tables turn around quickly due to the yummy taste, which gets wolfed down relatively quickly.

End off the meal with authentic thai dessert - iced red ruby.

Came here for dinner.

Food was not bad.
Tom yum soup was good. Spicy, flavourful and slightly sour.
Salted egg chicken was good. Crispy chicken with sweet creamy salted egg sauce.
Thai basil pork was disappointing. It lacked the taste of basil and could be spicier.
Pad Thai was not bad. It was flavourful.
Papaya salad was super disappointing. Lacked the fish sauce to lift up the salad.
Seabass with Thai lime sauce was not bad. The sauce was flavourful and had acidic notes of tamarind which paired well with the seabass.
Red ruby was ok. The ice was too chunky but the red rubies were chewy and tasty.
Thai milk tea was good. Milky and not too sweet.
Lemongrass could use a stronger flavour.

Overall the meal was not bad just need to choose your dish wisely. Prices are also affordable. Would come back again.

My second time back at the Toa Payoh branch, i was surprised that the waitress recognised and greeted me like an long time customer. Was recommended to try their steam fish with lime sauce. Me and my girlfriend like it very much. Thank you for the friendly gesture
and great recommendation. I will be back to try other dishes. 😄

Very nice and typical Thai food.  I have been here many times and still always my first choice whenever I craving for Thai cuisine.
Its not only nice food,  very cheap some more.  No GST,  no service charge.
Where to find?

2nd table seated, but had waited an hour or more for food to be served. It seemed like they cared more about fulfillment of the Grab food orders since we had to wait so long. Even tables after us gotten some of their food first, this was made even more unpleasant with my hungry children.

What we ordered:
Basil pork with rice - first impression was terrible, serving of pork was also little, egg white was cooked too long as it was rubbery, though the sauce was okay. You can probably get better ones from coffeeshop Thai food stores which I used to get at Ubi.
Phad Thai - serving was small, really small. I also found the fish sauce lacking and this was supposed to be a chef recommendation
Pineapple fried rice - still ok, serving was "average". My kid could finish this, so it's "average" as there is always leftovers at other Thai food stores that we visit.
Fried Kway Teow with Beef - kiddo say ok not bad. Was alright but didn't tried the beef and once again serving was "average".
Tom yum (creamy) soup with seafood - ok, soup was the saviour. But I gotten a piece of squid that was mushy and was disappointed.

Overall, ok to eat but never will patronise this outlet given such waiting time for such food. Several better stores that serve much faster than this. Not hungry children friendly, but instagrammable with their signature neon sign
Best authentic Thai food you can get in Singapore which is cheap. Not service and gst charge. If you love cockles, this is the place to go.

Our 1st visit (09/1/22) as nearby and early enough to get a table. We're pleased with the place and foods, but the music bit too loud for the small space. Hope they turn volume down a notch after reading this and keeping both standards cum prices. Less a star for the loud music.

Found this on google map and decided to give it a go! We ordered Thai Basil Rice, Olive Fried Rice, Kailan with Mushroom, Tomyam Seafood Soup (Creamy) & Red Ruby as dessert. Everything was good especially the Tomyam! Total damage - $26.80, very affordable! We will be back to try the Steam Seabass with Thai Lime Sauce 🤤

I came here with my elderly parents and my wheelchair dependent sister for dinner. The entrance to their dining area is not wheelchair friendly but insisted that they are not opening the adjacent dinning room that has a ramp. So I ask for a chair with a back rest so that I can slowly move my sister to be seated on a chair. Unfortunately, I was told that they don't have any. What restaurant at this time and age not handicap friendly and neither are the staff helpful with our plight. What a disappointment regardless of their acceptably good food.
Absolutely lovely experience. Food was great and the hosts kept our party happy and lively. Omg! Go soi47!

Had the jumbo cockles from Ang Mo Kio branch block 107 coffeeshop. Fresh stock and the chilli sauce came in 4 types. The boss is super nice and friendly, go all the way to accommodate my cravings. Even offer to reserve the table for me. Will definitely go back again.

This is what you get when you wait for 20 mins. They serve grabfood order first before dine in customer. Whoever comes here please be prepared to wait atleast 30 mins for your food even though shop is not packed.

Good decent variety of thai dishes. Steamed fish is excellent if you enjoy fish! Thai fish cake and Kao Pao Gai is good too. Red ruby desert is bad. The shaved ice is coarse, the syrup taste just sweet. Overall food good; desert bad.
Food was nice and price was decent. Only problem is that seatings were quite limited.

Tried the green curry chicken, claypot tang hun with prawn, stuffed chicken wings, and Thai fish cake. All pretty good, best amongst these was the tang hun. Nothing stand out for me but all were pretty good. All these for $35.
Nice affordable Thai meal. Tom yum is a bit sour. Fried seabass is crispy. Liked the fried tofu too. Long bean minced meat was a bit too wet.

There was a queue but there were many empty tables too. I asked if we need to make reservation. Service staff turned me down with a bad attitude and asked me to get back to queue. I was merely asking and wondered why many people have queued when there are so many empty tables. I have not tried the food but certainly have zero tolerance for poor service. Well so what you have good food but that is not an excuse for poor service. Not sure if food is good. Instead I went to Bangkok J N Thai food along Balestier Road. Great food, great service at awesome price.

If there is a zero star, it will be given.

Disappointing as we went based on the good review. Flavors of the food was tasting washed out…we ordered garlic chicken which was the worst as it tasted like chicken had been refried. Food was on the oily side. Fried chicken wings tasted like the pre packed frozen chicken, not the authentic Thai flavour.

We had the steam fish with lemon. Tongan cream seafood soup , kailan with garlic plus red Ruby as dessert: all the dishes were tasty. I wld certainly come back again. Also the price is very very reasonable.
Good affordable Thai food. I would give it a 5 if 7 didn't find it a bit too salty. The Tom yam was slightly more sour than usual.

Find it a really average place. Fish maw soup comes w lil ingredient n soup not thick enough. The fried pork n the pine apple rice so so only too

Only thing it’s not expensive but I won’t come back since food so so

Ate here on Hari Raya Puasa 2pm, did not realize their last order was 230pm! Enjoyed the pork collar (not shown), very yummy not spicy and not too greasy. Tom yum was too salty and spicy for our liking. But the main dishes were great. Ambience was similar to that of Bangkok outdoors, but cleaner (of course in sg).

A decent but small Thai Restaurant. Food wise I think Nakhon is Better. The spicy lemon sauce fish dish didn’t really meet and satisfy my craving. Quite crowded during dinner time. Do make reservation if you would like to try out this neighbourhood Thai restaurant. Lady Boss is friendly though 😌

The dishes we ordered tasted good generally. Similar to other reviews, customers in queue were not seated even though there were empty seats during weekend dinner hours. Service staff without smiles, unlike traditional Thai places.

Good quality Thai food at reasonable (and affordable) prices. Helped to settle my family’s craving for Thai food, without needing to travel to Golden Mile. The parking is very limited for dinner crowd though, as the nearest parking spaces are mostly reserved for season parking after 7pm.

Everything here, from simple pineapple fried rice, fried kang Kong with sambal, basil pork, fish cake, to iced Thai milk tea and dessert red ruby, everything is authentic Thai food and very delicious. I wish I had a bottomless stomach to try all the dishes here! Will definitely come back again for Tomyam Soup, Pad Thai and other stuff!

Authentic Thai taste + value for money price point, makes this place a winner, beating the Thai restaurants found in malls. Queues are common at the usual peak hours and a 30min queue (at least) is expected, no reservations are accepted. The down side is the lack of white regular lots as the car park is 95% red lots 7pm onwards. Check out the pics I took as we had a spread of dishes!

Want compliment 2 servers name sally/Aying  both are really good performance and efficient even shop are busy 👍👍👍 need give extra bonus . Btw foods are delicious.  Me and husband recommend TPY outlets , we will come back to eat 👍

If you wanna eat here, you gotta come early cos queues can get pretty crazy within an hour of opening. Great food at super reasonable prices, in a low fuss setting. Service may take a while when things get busy so be patient! Expect endless chatter from big groups, so forget about intimate conversation. Just go, slurp loudly, eat with gusto, order and order some more, order to bring home for supper and enjoy the experience!

This place is great for affordable thai food. My whole meal cost $49. The steam sea bass with lime sauce is the best. A taste of zesty lime with a punch of hot chilli combination. The stuff chicken wing also taste great. The long bean with mince pork and the red ruby dessert need refinement. Thai ice tea was great too. Service was good and crowd start forming during peak hour even though it is not located at toa payoh central. Remember to bring cash only.

Cosy and authentic Thai food at very reasonable prices! Each dish costs on average $6. The prawn cake was hot and crispy, tomyam soup was spicy and sour enough, green curry super creamy and egg fluffy and stuffed with prawns. This will be our new Thai go to restaurant in SG...
Nice food. Dun forget to try their red rubby dessert..  Authentic thai food. Reasonable price too.. the staff is really attentive. Recommended to try it..

Good Thai Food in Toa Payoh. Good prices. Be prepared to queue and wait for your food. Parking is a limited because it's for season parking. Aside from that, enjoyed the food especially the Green Curry Chicken! 👍👍👍

Omelette was great but abit too oily, tom yum and green curry chicken had the freezer taste, lemongrass drink sometimes very sweet and other times ok mango salad was ok lor olive fried rice was rlly nice tho

Seems typical Thai food .. everything was on the sweet side of usual Thai cuisine .. the vermicelli is pretty decent .. satay pork is nicely done .. tender and nicely seasoned .. ate on a very windy and idyllic day .. overall feel is not bad

Ate the tomyam w chicken, mango salad, olive  fried rice and Thai milk tea. Food not bad taste very authentic the chicken from tomyam taste like my mum's cooking and it has both sourness and spiciness but a bit too spicy for me and mango salad has many small shrimps inside taste very flavourful not like other places where they just dump mango inside but is also a bit too spicy for me.  Next time I will ask for less spicy. The olive fried rice taste alright nothing special just taste like fried rice from a tze char stall

Was surprised this place is quite crowded. Sitting area is limited & my sense is that they are not fully maximising their space, eg 2 person sitting 4 person seat. They can always spit the big table into 2 smaller tables. Food wise, it's normal thai food. Chicken wing & prawn cake were quite oily. Taste wise still ok. Basil chicken is tasty. For pad thai, the portion is very small. No gst nor svc charge. Ice water isnt served. This place is good for residents in the vicinity, personally i wouldnt travel for this.
Authentic Thai cuisine taste! Phad Thai seems to be a bit healthier so it’s on the less flavourful side. Tom Yam was awesome. Portions for veg was larger as well.
The best Thai food in TPY. Not exactly central but very accessible. Can see from main road. The fish is a must try. Opening hours in segments. Do check before heading down.

New experience with Thai food.. Nice taste of each dishes... Suggested the Green Curry very delicious. Pineapple rice is a must into the dinner...
Favolous taste is dessert D1 made with sago and cocco, a taste never try, wonderfull..

I really love this place! Affordable and tasty Thai food. The best dish is the fish. All other dishes are yummy too such as chicken wings, fish cakes, pad Thai etc. But I'm not a big fan of their Tom yum soup... It gets crowded early. They have some seats outside and inside the restaurant.

Deep fried sea bass was overfried, sea bass wasn't the freshest, the gravy was overpowering and not too yummy. Deep fried pork had a faint taste of frozen pork. Stir fried kailan was too salty and too sweet. Not worth a second visit.

Surprised to try delicious Thai food hidden between HDB blocks in the heartlands. Recommend to try their green curry and their salted egg chicken! The food came quite quickly and the portions were just nice for a family of 4. Place was packed so we had alfresco dining and realised there was another space they had a few stalls down. Don’t expect good or friendly service for a place like this but come for the food! Decent price for quality taste :)
Miserable Thai food. Served grab food orders first rather then in house guest. Simple dishes failed big time.

My family just ate at this restaurant today for a late lunch.  No complaints from the family, however my pad Thai was “ interesting”, no Chili powder served with the dish…. And the “chicken” looked more like something that should have been trashed.  I pulled most of the skin and gristle out and let them “throw it out for good”!!!!

rly affordable and delicious thai food!! pad thai was amazing as well as the whole fish! green curry and tom kha were good as well with lots of sauce!! highly recommend you order those with rice :-)

only thing is that the curry and soups are typically quite thin and doesn’t have lots of ingredients in them. i think that’s alright because the price is already so affordable anyway but just to keep in mind when deciding on portions!!

pick up was smooth and rly quick as well :-) thank u for the good meal

Good food, feeling satisfied after meal. Worth 15-20 mins wait during peak for the price (I would give a miss if longer). Sufficient staff and fast service. Variety of cashless payments available, use promo codes for some small discounts compared to cash (dependent on the app). Only bad thing is the steamed fish was not descaled properly, have to spit the skin. Parking at night is not convenient in the evening as nearby all red lots. (Reserved for season holders)

Tucked in a corner of a HDB estate and came across quaint. The whole steamed fish with lime sauce was excellent and the rest of the food were not too bad. What made the dining experience unpleasant was being barked at by the waitress to put the empty gong shells back on our plates if we were done when 1) she could have asked nicely 2) provided an empty plate for the shells. Also it was excruciatingly painful to ask for a second serving of white rice which never arrived. I’ve never been in such a hurry to leave a food establishment. The steamed fish could never make up for the appalling attitude of that waitress.

Used to really love the thai food here like about a year ago(?) but things have changed right now and this place is really not worth a visit anymore! Would totally give it a 0 stars if I could. Recently visited the restaurant and all I can say is bad service and bad quality food. Standards have really dropped like no tommorow. So focused on delivery that they literally neglect the dine in customers, food took over an hour to come(and its not even all the food we ordered coming at once), literally had to cancel order half way because the waiting time was just getting way too long and the staffs were not even apologetic at all. (terrible balance between deliveries and dine in customers if cannot balance just off your deliveries gosh) Adding on restaurant definitely has some hygiene issues, place where food comes out is also place for return plates also saw staff touching some of the vegetable with their hands while placing the sauce. Terrible!!!! would not recommend at all if you want authentic thai food.

Quesadilla felt empty unlike other outlets. Ingredients were unevenly spread too. The others were okay. Speed was fast tho, received my food in less than 10mins even though there were other customer(s) before me.

I love Guzman Gomez's burrito bowl! Filling and tasty. Will try to request for more onions😍 in future as we used to be able to scoop the amount we want, but due to Covid they now prepack them (garnishes and sauces) in separate small containers. Love my burrito bowl with plenty of 🌰

food quality and ambience is similar to other branches.

tried mexican cola for the first time, the sweetness is so distinct, it’s not my favorite 🤗
For the price and quality of food, you’ll find nothing else that compares in Singapore. They even have Jarritos. The staff is also great and make for a very positive experience.
First time trying here. Good food. Love the burrito bowl and soft tacos.

I dine here at least 3 times a week. I love the food. However, the staff aren't consistent with their serving. There are days the rice will be so much more and hardly any meat. Another time, their burrito can be pretty light.

I just had this for lunch with my family and it was not bad. It’s basically classic Mexican food and it’s good, just that we don’t particularly enjoy eating Mexican food so it was okay. The fries was good, crisp on the outside and soft in the inside. Taco was excellent, and nachos were good. Just note this, if you are thinking of getting a Burrito regular sized, know that it has a ton of beans and rice inside; portion overall very big! Service is efficient.

My daughter vomited and suffered all night after eating the burrito bowl delivered in the evening. I couldn't complain because I was in a hurry to go to the hospital, but it is a very angry experience. I enjoyed it as a delivery food for a long time, but recently, the taste differs every time I order, so I tried not to eat it, but it became the last burrito bowl. Pay attention to the quality of your food.

minis promo for burrito seems smaller than usual 🤔
limited seats for dining in
staff didn't know table numbers during serving
but at least there's table service 😆
Nice burrito bowl but wish there were more tomatoes.

Presentation can be better improved. The beef portion size (which requires top up) was even smaller than the chicken (which requires no top up).. the taste wise is okay but can do with much more meat as only vegetables can be seen in the tacos.

I think I was discriminated against here. I am a regular of Guzman y gomez outlet in Yishun North Point. I always received good service and food from there and expected same from here. I went in at around 11.50, much before lunch rush. There was only one other dine-in customer. Even after 25 mins I didn't receive my order, while customers who came in after me kept getting their orders. When I finally complained, they gave me my order without cutlery or tissue. Will not visit this outlet again.

Horrible experience from fhis outlet! Staff are disorganised, they actually forgot about my orders! Apparently I am not the only frustrated customer that's waiting incessantly long. You guys need to put in a system of checking order fulfillment to have a basic level of customer service.
Very average food, it's slightly pricey. The burrito was very bland, the rice in it was bland. The only thing good on the entire menu is nacho fries

I placed my order via Deliveroo. I realized i had the wrong item order immediately after i pressed the sent button. I then immediately asked Deliveroo to help cancel my order via live chat. But the Deliveroo chat told me the order could not be canceled as the delivery was already on the way. How can the delivery be on the way 1-2 minutes after the order was sent in?

I tried to call the restaurant five times, but nobody answered the call. This will be the last time i order from this restaurant.

First time trying this mexican food chain and I must say Im pleasantly surprised! Ordered from foodpanda but the food was still fresh! Got the mild nachos with grilled chicken. For $16, the price was quite expensive but it was really filling which was unexpected!! The guac was delicious too :) Will definitely try their tacos and burritos next!!

Default Order: Burrito Bowl (different variants)
Times ordered ready: 40+
Food Quality: Great
Timeliness: Excellent, never delayed
Taste: Excellent

Recommendation: Spicy Chicken Burrito Bowl with additional pico de gallo

Good place for an introduction to Mexican food. A little pricey but flavours are strong and good. Nachos and fries are great. Unfortunately they do not have salsa here so the strong acidity and spice is missing

Best Mexican food in Singapore!

To be sure, there aren't many options for Mexican food on the island. Nevertheless, Guzman y Gomez food is generally high quality and eminently edible ... Though it may not compare to taco truck food in LA!

I stick to the spicy beef option for most dishes with the burrito or burrito bowl being my preferred choice. The quesadillas are also decent.

If in Singapore and craving Mexican food then GYG is your only choice. Thankfully, they have multiple outlets across the city to satisfy your craving.
First time here. Nice place and crowded on a weekend lunch period. Ordered the Burrito chicken wrap and bowl chicken. Recommended to have with spice. Nice overall!

Staff were very professional and service was top notch even if it's a more fast food style place. Love the fries, especially the chipotle seasoning and soft chicken taco :)) I don't normally eat tomatoes but it's really delish as they take out the tomato seeds and its so nice together as a whole taco
Used to quite like the food at GYG but the standard at this outlet has just fell off the cliff. Had the burrito bowl which had a pathetically small portion. Food was rather cold. Disappointing.
Not much to say about it except it is just super tasty. Love their soft taco with grilled chicken or steak!

On the GYG website it says the sauces are "free at every GYG". However, when asked, staff said its chargeable.

This outlet used to have great service but i think they got a new manager/supervisor somewhat recently and its just been downhill from there.
Always good. Value, clean tasting lunches. Chicken burrito bowl ftw
Can't go wrong with a good ol burrito bowl :-) Food's great, and thank you Kelvin and team for the warm welcome always!

A little "expensive" for the portion you're getting. Food tastes okay. Quesadilla had very little cheese which was quite disappointing. The fries were fresh though (which I really liked). The Churros were quite good but nothing special about it.

The best compliment I can give this chain is that it's the Jamie Oliver of Mexican food. Proudly underwhelming, uninspired, overpriced yet somehow, you'll find one everywhere. While i can see how they might appeal to the undemanding and uninitiated, there is definitely much, much better Mexican food out there (and yes even in SG).
Tasty food. The salad was nicely done. The burritos was delicious too.

First time trying with the wife as the reviews sounded promising. Ordered a spicy beef burrito set and a spicy pulled pork bowl set. Both were very disappointing... Very little meat in both, just lots of tasteless rice and beans... Miserable amount of salsa given. Food was barely even warm considering we were dining in... Chips were obviously stale. Not sure if they forgot to put the spice but both the orders were not spicy at all... "Chipotle" Fries, while cooked well, crunchy outside soft inside, tasted completely plain and devoid of any seasoning... Not sure if the outlet ran out of salt or what... The only thing that we both managed to finish was the lemon tea... Have tasted real Mexican food and this is not even close sorry. Went to McDonald's after...

Hi there,

I love your food and there's no doubt on the quality. But recent my 2 delivery orders missed one item each. Last time set menu fries was not packed and today chipotle mayo was not packed. While understanding busy delivery orders, it is important to ensure customers to receive what they have ordered. Would appreciate more attention to pack better next time. Thanks.

My takeaway order had been missed and I needed to wait for a long time until staff noticed. Then, they forgot to provide utensils for burrito bowls.Not sure if it is due to staff shortage, but unless you dont remind them, they dont seem to bother tracking the things in order. Food is not bad but service is lacking.

Food is fine. One staff was very rude and mocked my accent to other employees as I was ordering. I guess she thought I couldn’t hear her. If the owner of this restaurant sees this, pls get to the bottom of who this is (appeared to me a manager as she was holding paper, female, in her 20s?). Looks like some re-training and disciplinary action are needed. Very bad experience.
Great food for the price. Hard to find food Mexican fast food in Singapore so this place never fails to satiate that craving

It's a classic mexican fast food place, just that it's quite conveniently located right next to Novena MRT station. We had the burrito bowl, and the nachos fries, both of which were pretty good. It's the kind of food that I'll have for a quick lunch, but I'm not sure if I'll enjoy a proper sit down meal here necessarily.

Food via delivery was always good, but somehow dining in turned out to be a horrible experience. Didn't take long for them to come up with our food but it came in cold for my friend and I with much lesser meat than usual.
Best to avoid dining in I guess.
Always manage to get the place to sit. However the pricing has stayed flat but the quantity has reduced.

First time eating here and I was not disappointed at all the food was delicious especially the burrito bowl. Staff was very friendly. The place was clean. It was an amazing place to dine in. I would recommend this place!
My first experience  trying mexican food was at vatos urban tacos & was utterly disgusted by them.  hence was a little decisive on coming here. Glad i came ,the quesadillas & food here are delicious!

Whenever I am homesick for some solid 'great quality' tex mex - I look no further than Sydney stalwart GyG.

The staff at the Novena branch are courteous, happy to take dumb questions, and exceedingly speedy with their order fulfilment.

Eating in, also a great experience (now that we can)

Overall, great outlet, great staff, five stars!

My to go order was missed and I ended up waiting for 20 mins. The person packing the food was right in front of me and didn't bother to enquire about my order number but instead avoided looking up at all. Only when I asked then they realized the miss but tried to avoid acknowledging it by saying they will start preparing it...which took 2 mins to be ready.
Good, staff are helpful, would recommend, tho needs more seats
A bit overpriced for the food... Fast and efficient for some Mexican themed food.
delicious food and great service from staff , definitely will come back again 👍🏻👍🏻
Food is good. Service is fast.

I ordered 2 veggie burritos for takeaway today - 1 was alright but unfortunately the other was a soggy, deconstructed mess. The filling was falling out as I was unwrapping the burrito and the tortilla wrap was soggy, broken and very unpleasant to eat.

Rating 2 stars for inconsistency.

Sometimes I want to be induced into a food coma. When I need that, this is where I come. Pork burrito does the trick. Eat one and a nap is sure to follow. Puts me to sleep faster than my wife chatting in bed.
Service was prompt. Food is as expected, delicious and fresh. Limited seating due to distancing requirements so go early to avoid crowds.

This rating is rounded up from 3.5. The food is fresh and fast and the sauces to add to the dishes are delicious, but there was hardly any chicken in my burrito, it was mostly (plain) rice. Disappointing for Mexican, but OK if you have a craving in Singapore.
Just had the burrito bowl with pulled pork for lunch. Really good and the pork was so tender! A tad on the salty side but the corn chips helped!!

Nestled away at the foot of a HDB block, with ample parking. Food was good, fried egg was done really well but a little too oily. Tom yum soup (clear) was good.

Service from the staff was mixed - the lady taking orders was incredibly curt, but the servers were friendly and helpful. It is a good place for simple, fuss free Thai fix.

Authentic thai restaurant, even the staff are mostly Thai.

Taste of food is great and reasonably priced.

The must haves are the fish in lime, prawn cakes and pork collar.

Come early to avoid having to wait too long, though tables turn around quickly due to the yummy taste, which gets wolfed down relatively quickly.

End off the meal with authentic thai dessert - iced red ruby.

Came here for dinner.

Food was not bad.
Tom yum soup was good. Spicy, flavourful and slightly sour.
Salted egg chicken was good. Crispy chicken with sweet creamy salted egg sauce.
Thai basil pork was disappointing. It lacked the taste of basil and could be spicier.
Pad Thai was not bad. It was flavourful.
Papaya salad was super disappointing. Lacked the fish sauce to lift up the salad.
Seabass with Thai lime sauce was not bad. The sauce was flavourful and had acidic notes of tamarind which paired well with the seabass.
Red ruby was ok. The ice was too chunky but the red rubies were chewy and tasty.
Thai milk tea was good. Milky and not too sweet.
Lemongrass could use a stronger flavour.

Overall the meal was not bad just need to choose your dish wisely. Prices are also affordable. Would come back again.

My second time back at the Toa Payoh branch, i was surprised that the waitress recognised and greeted me like an long time customer. Was recommended to try their steam fish with lime sauce. Me and my girlfriend like it very much. Thank you for the friendly gesture
and great recommendation. I will be back to try other dishes. 😄

Very nice and typical Thai food.  I have been here many times and still always my first choice whenever I craving for Thai cuisine.
Its not only nice food,  very cheap some more.  No GST,  no service charge.
Where to find?

2nd table seated, but had waited an hour or more for food to be served. It seemed like they cared more about fulfillment of the Grab food orders since we had to wait so long. Even tables after us gotten some of their food first, this was made even more unpleasant with my hungry children.

What we ordered:
Basil pork with rice - first impression was terrible, serving of pork was also little, egg white was cooked too long as it was rubbery, though the sauce was okay. You can probably get better ones from coffeeshop Thai food stores which I used to get at Ubi.
Phad Thai - serving was small, really small. I also found the fish sauce lacking and this was supposed to be a chef recommendation
Pineapple fried rice - still ok, serving was "average". My kid could finish this, so it's "average" as there is always leftovers at other Thai food stores that we visit.
Fried Kway Teow with Beef - kiddo say ok not bad. Was alright but didn't tried the beef and once again serving was "average".
Tom yum (creamy) soup with seafood - ok, soup was the saviour. But I gotten a piece of squid that was mushy and was disappointed.

Overall, ok to eat but never will patronise this outlet given such waiting time for such food. Several better stores that serve much faster than this. Not hungry children friendly, but instagrammable with their signature neon sign
Best authentic Thai food you can get in Singapore which is cheap. Not service and gst charge. If you love cockles, this is the place to go.

Our 1st visit (09/1/22) as nearby and early enough to get a table. We're pleased with the place and foods, but the music bit too loud for the small space. Hope they turn volume down a notch after reading this and keeping both standards cum prices. Less a star for the loud music.

Found this on google map and decided to give it a go! We ordered Thai Basil Rice, Olive Fried Rice, Kailan with Mushroom, Tomyam Seafood Soup (Creamy) & Red Ruby as dessert. Everything was good especially the Tomyam! Total damage - $26.80, very affordable! We will be back to try the Steam Seabass with Thai Lime Sauce 🤤

I came here with my elderly parents and my wheelchair dependent sister for dinner. The entrance to their dining area is not wheelchair friendly but insisted that they are not opening the adjacent dinning room that has a ramp. So I ask for a chair with a back rest so that I can slowly move my sister to be seated on a chair. Unfortunately, I was told that they don't have any. What restaurant at this time and age not handicap friendly and neither are the staff helpful with our plight. What a disappointment regardless of their acceptably good food.
Absolutely lovely experience. Food was great and the hosts kept our party happy and lively. Omg! Go soi47!

Had the jumbo cockles from Ang Mo Kio branch block 107 coffeeshop. Fresh stock and the chilli sauce came in 4 types. The boss is super nice and friendly, go all the way to accommodate my cravings. Even offer to reserve the table for me. Will definitely go back again.

This is what you get when you wait for 20 mins. They serve grabfood order first before dine in customer. Whoever comes here please be prepared to wait atleast 30 mins for your food even though shop is not packed.

Good decent variety of thai dishes. Steamed fish is excellent if you enjoy fish! Thai fish cake and Kao Pao Gai is good too. Red ruby desert is bad. The shaved ice is coarse, the syrup taste just sweet. Overall food good; desert bad.
Food was nice and price was decent. Only problem is that seatings were quite limited.

Tried the green curry chicken, claypot tang hun with prawn, stuffed chicken wings, and Thai fish cake. All pretty good, best amongst these was the tang hun. Nothing stand out for me but all were pretty good. All these for $35.
Nice affordable Thai meal. Tom yum is a bit sour. Fried seabass is crispy. Liked the fried tofu too. Long bean minced meat was a bit too wet.

There was a queue but there were many empty tables too. I asked if we need to make reservation. Service staff turned me down with a bad attitude and asked me to get back to queue. I was merely asking and wondered why many people have queued when there are so many empty tables. I have not tried the food but certainly have zero tolerance for poor service. Well so what you have good food but that is not an excuse for poor service. Not sure if food is good. Instead I went to Bangkok J N Thai food along Balestier Road. Great food, great service at awesome price.

If there is a zero star, it will be given.

Disappointing as we went based on the good review. Flavors of the food was tasting washed out…we ordered garlic chicken which was the worst as it tasted like chicken had been refried. Food was on the oily side. Fried chicken wings tasted like the pre packed frozen chicken, not the authentic Thai flavour.

We had the steam fish with lemon. Tongan cream seafood soup , kailan with garlic plus red Ruby as dessert: all the dishes were tasty. I wld certainly come back again. Also the price is very very reasonable.
