Good affordable Thai food. I would give it a 5 if 7 didn't find it a bit too salty. The Tom yam was slightly more sour than usual.

Find it a really average place. Fish maw soup comes w lil ingredient n soup not thick enough. The fried pork n the pine apple rice so so only too

Only thing it’s not expensive but I won’t come back since food so so

Ate here on Hari Raya Puasa 2pm, did not realize their last order was 230pm! Enjoyed the pork collar (not shown), very yummy not spicy and not too greasy. Tom yum was too salty and spicy for our liking. But the main dishes were great. Ambience was similar to that of Bangkok outdoors, but cleaner (of course in sg).

A decent but small Thai Restaurant. Food wise I think Nakhon is Better. The spicy lemon sauce fish dish didn’t really meet and satisfy my craving. Quite crowded during dinner time. Do make reservation if you would like to try out this neighbourhood Thai restaurant. Lady Boss is friendly though 😌

The dishes we ordered tasted good generally. Similar to other reviews, customers in queue were not seated even though there were empty seats during weekend dinner hours. Service staff without smiles, unlike traditional Thai places.

Good quality Thai food at reasonable (and affordable) prices. Helped to settle my family’s craving for Thai food, without needing to travel to Golden Mile. The parking is very limited for dinner crowd though, as the nearest parking spaces are mostly reserved for season parking after 7pm.

Everything here, from simple pineapple fried rice, fried kang Kong with sambal, basil pork, fish cake, to iced Thai milk tea and dessert red ruby, everything is authentic Thai food and very delicious. I wish I had a bottomless stomach to try all the dishes here! Will definitely come back again for Tomyam Soup, Pad Thai and other stuff!

Authentic Thai taste + value for money price point, makes this place a winner, beating the Thai restaurants found in malls. Queues are common at the usual peak hours and a 30min queue (at least) is expected, no reservations are accepted. The down side is the lack of white regular lots as the car park is 95% red lots 7pm onwards. Check out the pics I took as we had a spread of dishes!

Want compliment 2 servers name sally/Aying  both are really good performance and efficient even shop are busy 👍👍👍 need give extra bonus . Btw foods are delicious.  Me and husband recommend TPY outlets , we will come back to eat 👍

If you wanna eat here, you gotta come early cos queues can get pretty crazy within an hour of opening. Great food at super reasonable prices, in a low fuss setting. Service may take a while when things get busy so be patient! Expect endless chatter from big groups, so forget about intimate conversation. Just go, slurp loudly, eat with gusto, order and order some more, order to bring home for supper and enjoy the experience!

This place is great for affordable thai food. My whole meal cost $49. The steam sea bass with lime sauce is the best. A taste of zesty lime with a punch of hot chilli combination. The stuff chicken wing also taste great. The long bean with mince pork and the red ruby dessert need refinement. Thai ice tea was great too. Service was good and crowd start forming during peak hour even though it is not located at toa payoh central. Remember to bring cash only.

Cosy and authentic Thai food at very reasonable prices! Each dish costs on average $6. The prawn cake was hot and crispy, tomyam soup was spicy and sour enough, green curry super creamy and egg fluffy and stuffed with prawns. This will be our new Thai go to restaurant in SG...
Nice food. Dun forget to try their red rubby dessert..  Authentic thai food. Reasonable price too.. the staff is really attentive. Recommended to try it..

Good Thai Food in Toa Payoh. Good prices. Be prepared to queue and wait for your food. Parking is a limited because it's for season parking. Aside from that, enjoyed the food especially the Green Curry Chicken! 👍👍👍

Omelette was great but abit too oily, tom yum and green curry chicken had the freezer taste, lemongrass drink sometimes very sweet and other times ok mango salad was ok lor olive fried rice was rlly nice tho

Seems typical Thai food .. everything was on the sweet side of usual Thai cuisine .. the vermicelli is pretty decent .. satay pork is nicely done .. tender and nicely seasoned .. ate on a very windy and idyllic day .. overall feel is not bad

Ate the tomyam w chicken, mango salad, olive  fried rice and Thai milk tea. Food not bad taste very authentic the chicken from tomyam taste like my mum's cooking and it has both sourness and spiciness but a bit too spicy for me and mango salad has many small shrimps inside taste very flavourful not like other places where they just dump mango inside but is also a bit too spicy for me.  Next time I will ask for less spicy. The olive fried rice taste alright nothing special just taste like fried rice from a tze char stall

Was surprised this place is quite crowded. Sitting area is limited & my sense is that they are not fully maximising their space, eg 2 person sitting 4 person seat. They can always spit the big table into 2 smaller tables. Food wise, it's normal thai food. Chicken wing & prawn cake were quite oily. Taste wise still ok. Basil chicken is tasty. For pad thai, the portion is very small. No gst nor svc charge. Ice water isnt served. This place is good for residents in the vicinity, personally i wouldnt travel for this.
Authentic Thai cuisine taste! Phad Thai seems to be a bit healthier so it’s on the less flavourful side. Tom Yam was awesome. Portions for veg was larger as well.
The best Thai food in TPY. Not exactly central but very accessible. Can see from main road. The fish is a must try. Opening hours in segments. Do check before heading down.

New experience with Thai food.. Nice taste of each dishes... Suggested the Green Curry very delicious. Pineapple rice is a must into the dinner...
Favolous taste is dessert D1 made with sago and cocco, a taste never try, wonderfull..

I really love this place! Affordable and tasty Thai food. The best dish is the fish. All other dishes are yummy too such as chicken wings, fish cakes, pad Thai etc. But I'm not a big fan of their Tom yum soup... It gets crowded early. They have some seats outside and inside the restaurant.

Deep fried sea bass was overfried, sea bass wasn't the freshest, the gravy was overpowering and not too yummy. Deep fried pork had a faint taste of frozen pork. Stir fried kailan was too salty and too sweet. Not worth a second visit.

Surprised to try delicious Thai food hidden between HDB blocks in the heartlands. Recommend to try their green curry and their salted egg chicken! The food came quite quickly and the portions were just nice for a family of 4. Place was packed so we had alfresco dining and realised there was another space they had a few stalls down. Don’t expect good or friendly service for a place like this but come for the food! Decent price for quality taste :)
Miserable Thai food. Served grab food orders first rather then in house guest. Simple dishes failed big time.

My family just ate at this restaurant today for a late lunch.  No complaints from the family, however my pad Thai was “ interesting”, no Chili powder served with the dish…. And the “chicken” looked more like something that should have been trashed.  I pulled most of the skin and gristle out and let them “throw it out for good”!!!!

rly affordable and delicious thai food!! pad thai was amazing as well as the whole fish! green curry and tom kha were good as well with lots of sauce!! highly recommend you order those with rice :-)

only thing is that the curry and soups are typically quite thin and doesn’t have lots of ingredients in them. i think that’s alright because the price is already so affordable anyway but just to keep in mind when deciding on portions!!

pick up was smooth and rly quick as well :-) thank u for the good meal

Good food, feeling satisfied after meal. Worth 15-20 mins wait during peak for the price (I would give a miss if longer). Sufficient staff and fast service. Variety of cashless payments available, use promo codes for some small discounts compared to cash (dependent on the app). Only bad thing is the steamed fish was not descaled properly, have to spit the skin. Parking at night is not convenient in the evening as nearby all red lots. (Reserved for season holders)

Tucked in a corner of a HDB estate and came across quaint. The whole steamed fish with lime sauce was excellent and the rest of the food were not too bad. What made the dining experience unpleasant was being barked at by the waitress to put the empty gong shells back on our plates if we were done when 1) she could have asked nicely 2) provided an empty plate for the shells. Also it was excruciatingly painful to ask for a second serving of white rice which never arrived. I’ve never been in such a hurry to leave a food establishment. The steamed fish could never make up for the appalling attitude of that waitress.

Used to really love the thai food here like about a year ago(?) but things have changed right now and this place is really not worth a visit anymore! Would totally give it a 0 stars if I could. Recently visited the restaurant and all I can say is bad service and bad quality food. Standards have really dropped like no tommorow. So focused on delivery that they literally neglect the dine in customers, food took over an hour to come(and its not even all the food we ordered coming at once), literally had to cancel order half way because the waiting time was just getting way too long and the staffs were not even apologetic at all. (terrible balance between deliveries and dine in customers if cannot balance just off your deliveries gosh) Adding on restaurant definitely has some hygiene issues, place where food comes out is also place for return plates also saw staff touching some of the vegetable with their hands while placing the sauce. Terrible!!!! would not recommend at all if you want authentic thai food.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Passby here so went in to check it out n surprisingly the pineapple rice was really delicious! I definitely would go back for their pineapple rice again. One dish I wont order again is the soup, we find the soup tastes too plain. For these dishes plus 2 drinks total was $50. ☺️

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Decor was interesting so gave it a try but food was average. Tom yum soup, Kang Kong n pork basil rice were passable. Can skip the vermicelli salad n oyster omelette.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: An amazing discovery of good food in a hidden niche. Thoroughly enjoyable lunch at a reasonable price.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Neighbourhood Thai cuisine at average price. Food is proportionate average with no surprise.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Wang Thai Kitchen. Blk 92, TPY Lor 4. We came here 2 years ago in  2020. The food was very good and we eat there regularly. However when we ate there recently we were disappointed. The TH milk tea that we usually order tasted diluted. Our favorite garlic pork dish is no longer what it looks and taste. Now it looks like it is not well cooked. No more golden brown and crispness no more. Dont taste good. Dry chicken curry  standard has dropped a lot.  The creaminess and flavour is very flat. The uncle waiter used to be happy and friendly. Now he don't smile at all just Stern face all the time. We highly suspect they have changed the chef. It is just no longer the tasty food that we were used to having. I don't think we will ever come back here again.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Cozy place for some well cooked and great tasting Thai food. The Chef is Thai.which makes the difference. Its not air con but is airy with good ventilation and fans. Make sure you also get a bottle of iced water!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: One of the best Thai food in Sg. Ordered the Tom yum seafood, sea bass, crabmeat omelette, pork belly shrimp paste and none of them disappoint us! Will definitely come back again! Service staff was very helpful too.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Did a double take when I walked past this shop coz of the super garden decor hanging from the walls and ceiling! Ordered some items to share and here's what I think:

1)Tom Yum soup is super spicy!!! Not for the faint hearted. Tastes great, but next time I will ask them not to put the cut chili padi inside.

2) Olive fried rice was salty (as it should be) but fried until fragrant too. Nice touch to add the thinly sliced mango.

3) Red Ruby with jackfruit to cool down my mouth after the Tom Yum fire.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
The food might be good, I would never know because we couldn’t even pay for the food. Ok sure, they are old fashion, no paylah, no paynow, no contactless payment, in short only cash or nets, even with a paylah sticker there below the countertop ( which is misleading) The staff generated some QR code for my wife to scan but this turned out to be a dead end as my wife’s money got deducted but payment was declined. While this is common in many restaurants, we are not faulting the restaurant for that but it’s the attitude of the cashier that suddenly became very rude. First he threw the receipt at us saying “look, payment didn’t go thru, I also dunno coz it never goes thru” (then why generate it in the first place) .So my wife asked him for help and what can we do now?, is there any other way, coz the payment went thru on our side. He replied, “then you all just wait, I also dunno what to do, payment didn’t go thru”. His tone was quite loud and not acceptable for me. There are multiple ways this situation can be handled but raising tone and being rude to customers is definitely not the way.  So we went away and tried to call the bank while the staff just ignored us and went to serve other. I got seriously annoyed by this lack of professionalism and manners, and once we managed to get the money back, we left. Once again, they might have the best tasting Thai food in the world, but with that kind of attitude, I would not step in that place again. If you want to go, bring cash/nets, then probably the staff will be nice to you.

Might be a blessing in disguise. Went to the toilet, and on the way, you can see how poorly maintained the kitchen is, not to mention filthy. Might have saved us on a case of stomach pain/ diarrhoea. My advice for your management : 1. we are in the freaking 21st century Singapore, not some ulu kampungs , update your methods of payment for more variety. 2. Talk properly to your customers. Who do you think you are to be rude? 3. Clean your kitchen or at least put a curtain to hide all your mess from your customers eyes.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
2nd visit there. Surprising find. Very nice Thai food. 1st visit we had their abacus seed, roast pork kway chap and lala bee hoon. All very good. Way above average and the abacus seed had an interesting twist to the non Thai ones.

This visit  as the sambal fried kway teow came out first it overpowered everything else. Highly recommended!! But if you are eating other dishes, taste the others first!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Very expensive.  Sour pumpkin in green curry but not replaced. Small portion. Paid more than $50 and still hungry. Won't go again. Bad customer service. First time and disappointed. Did not order any meat.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Very nice Thai restaurant. Lavishly decorated with flowers. Friendly service and some very nice food. I always come here for lunch if work brings me to the neighborhood.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: The basil chicken with egg rice is nice and generous in portion. My friends love the crab omelette very much. I personally feel that it’s tasted better hot. So do eat it hot if you order it.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: The number of seats/tables are limited. But not crowded even on Sat night. Food were ok, taste just suit us.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: I’ve ordered a normal Phad Thai, which co gains fish and prawn. Considering the ingredient used, it’s very generous to its price of $6. By comparison, it’s far value for money and tasting to other Thai chain outlet present in Singapore. It would continue visiting.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Never been to this part of Toa Payoh, was surprised to find this authentic Thai Food restaurant here.
Had dinner here with my family, service was good, service staff very friendly and food was delicious.
Bon Appetit!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
I'm a frequent diner here with colleagues and the taste never disappointed. They have affordable lunch specials such as basil pork rice set at $6.80 and salted egg fried rice at $5.50. The portion is big and we usually share the fried rice among 3 girls.

Their homemade tofu and garlic chicken are amazing, must order for group lunches.

The owners are very friendly too! :)

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Very nice and fresh food, with good price.
No beer or any kind of alcohol allowed though.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: I like the sambal fried kway teow, the taste is good... But the taste for rest of the dishes not as good as expected...

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Very nice thai food. Tomyum soup was abit too spicy. But v nicr overall. Better than Nakhon Kitchen imo. Overheard their Dry Kway Chup is a must try!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Descent thai dishes, fresh ! Lemongrass drink is good !

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Food is nice and delicious, staffs are friendly.
But they took my orders wrong :(

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: A true thai homely experience, generous servings and good food at affordable prices! my mom loves their steamed fish and pork knuckles especially and we come from the southern western region!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
A hidden Thai food gem in a HDB heartland. Atmosphere is quite realistic.

Food portions on the small side, but enables a group to order more variety.

Taste wise is not too bad, can visit again.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Good place to go💕 can really enjoy the food and environment.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Last year food was 5 star quality.
Seems like they had a change of chef..food is subpar now

Garlic Pork was tough
Curry was bland
Ice teh diluted

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Authentic taste! Good ambience and great value. Well recommended. Especially enjoyed the soup and fried rice, but everything is good also.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
A surprise find. Decided to give them a try while walking past the shops at Toa Payoh. Wasn't disappointed, in fact I was quite blown away by their dishes.

This is also one of the few places I know that serve abacus seeds, which are quite hard to find; they did a fantastic job of it too.

Will definitely go back, even if it's just for the abacus seeds

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Its actually very Under rated.. I love it. The sambal kway teow is very nice! I wanna try the kway chap one day!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Cosy & relax restaurant Thai Kway Chap since 2014 highly recommended served in claypot top it up with a cup of Thai milk tea to sweeten your day

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Authentic thai food with fresh ingredients imported from thailand. Friendly staff that always serve with a smile despite busy period. Highly recommended

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Very nice pineapple rice and vege dish

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Value for money. Love the crayfish hor fun!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Average food, terrible service. There weren't many customers at the time my family went, but the guy behind the cashier seemed too busy to want to take our orders/queries. The guy clearing up the table was also inconsiderate as he wanted to clear my half-finished food TWICE. Absolutely grumpy staff.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: The Thai. Food is very delicious. You'll can go for a try.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Great ambience and affordable food!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Nice ambient but I won't be back for the food..

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Always great food served. Love their Food - and now they serve Abacus seeds as well 😊Delicious food!! 💕

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Seriously good thai food here. Of all the thai kitchens in Toa Payoh, this is my favourite. Always satisfying to have a meal here.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Food is good and reasonably priced. Try their crab meat fried rice and clear seafood tomyum soup...it is good!

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: The food is quite nice, especially the Thai milk tea

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Nice Thai food. But I feel maybe can adjust prices for HDB based Thai resto.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: nice food must try👍👍👍

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: The seabass, glass noodle salad, pineapple fried rice is very nice.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Always order food from here, best Thai food I've tried. 👍🏾

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: D fish cakes n fish r outstanding.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Nice food with reasonable price.

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: Very delicious food . Very friendly boss

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content:
Food is delicious and
Staff is friendly

restaurant name: WANG THAI KITCHEN 泰国美食
content: had good food there so i will recommend this place

This is our fourth times here.  Their Thai food are nice and delicious. Menu has alot more variety than previous owner.  Price are reasonable and they serve quite fast. Will sure patronise often and highly recommend for all to come. The fried chicken skin is crispy and nice. Tried their red ruby today, if the ice is crushed ice will taste better.
Love their authentic Thai food by the Thai chef. Nice and neat place. Conveniently situated near TPY MRT. 1 minute walk
The food are nice especially the fish. Very authentic Thai food taste. Serving is fast and waiters are polite. Recommended.

The food is authentic and value for money. Used to travel all the way to the west for their food but this outlet is much more central. Standards remained high and service staff was warm. Certainly a hidden gem.
Good food. Very reasonably priced. Definitely will return for more.

The Service is fantastic, the food is awesome 🙏🏼👍
Will come again 😉
Great food, good service, reasonably priced! Will be back
Food quality and value dont match , wont recommend to eat here. Go for Nagarathai instead!
Solid Thai food - couldn’t travel but got my fix here. Highly recommend!
Good thai food at TPY central , Comfortable place to dine in. Strongly recommended their steam fish with chili lime and grilled pork cheek.
Good food, good place and good service and friendly staff.

We were there last monday during lunch. Ordered and waited for close to 30mins. I had to enquire before they realise that they forgot to key in our orders (drinks were served btw). It was not a great experience as throughout the time we waited, nobody checked on us even though the place was not busy. We had to takeaway in the end as we were already late.

Best Thai food outside of Thailand. Ever. Soi Thai has outdone itself again. Food is authentic, staff incredible, and the owner so friendly. Today we ordered pad Thai, Tom Kha soup, seabass with Thai Chilli sauce, mango sticky rice, pineapple rice, and Thai iced teas for everyone. Menu feels like a dream team of Thai cuisine - any combi is guaranteed to impress. Kopkhunkrap Soi Thai Kitchen!
Nice food and good environmental. Must try it guys
Very underwhelming tbh. Ordered chicken basil with egg rice and it was so blend and dry. Probably my last time ordering the same dish here. Might try other dishes the next time though.
Good food and excellent service
Very authentic! Reasonable price!

Expensive like HELL.
Terrible experience.
The plates for all dishes are ladies' palm size. So you can imagine that how small is their portion for every dishes.

Radish Omelette $9 - So basically it's just 2 eggs (maybe it's rooster egg that's why $4 each) + few onions + very few radish. Radish omelette without radish taste.

Thai Kang Kong $9 - Imagine that you request 2 portions from mixed rice stall equal the portion this shop served to us. (maybe the Kang Kong import from Thailand lah)

Belacan Pork $9 - The portion same as you order 2 portions from mixed rice stall.

If the portion match with the price won't feel so dunlan.
Green iced tea is super sweet, basil chicken not good, garlic pork just ok. I won’t come back. For the price there are much better tasting options.

(Translated by Google) The food is delicious, affordable, and the service is attentive, suitable for a large or small Thai restaurant.

(Original)
食物非常美味，价格实惠，服务态度周到，适合一家大小光顾的泰国餐馆。

Tried the Thai Claypot Hotpot (jim jum). Not a lot of places in Singapore has this jim jum. $28 per set, more than enough for 2 person. The ingredients should be similar to the Mookata. The jim jum soup is good. The dipping sauce (nam jim jaew) is very nice and match very well with the jim jum. Value for the money. Good to eat especially during cold weather.

I tried the $18 set meal which was promoted as for one person (set comes with 1 rice). Expensive considering this is just a stall in coffeeshop and that one of the three dishes was just deep fried omelette. The other 2 were tom yam soup and stirred fried mixed vegetables. Dishes were rather salty as they were not light on using fish sauce.  Perhaps it is just my preference. Fish (1 pc) and prawns (2 pcs) tasted not fresh. 3 stars given because of low score in value for money, seafood in tom yam soup lacking freshness, ok taste only and long wait.
Very nice Thai food!! Cheap and affordable. Tried the basil pork and Tom yam fried rice. Both is dam good!
The seafood in the Tom yum soup was not fresh and tasted so bad, that I had to give up eating. Worst thing is I was down with stomach flu right after that meal.

Tried their green curry, grilled pork stick and basil pork. The food is authentically thai and priced reasonably.

Will definitely come again to try other food in the menu.

Update: standards seem to have declined due to a change in management. The phad thai was sorely lacking in intense wok hei flavours and wasn't as moist as before. Even the addition of sugar and spice could not save the dish.

One of the better Thai food stores at Toa Payoh Central. Dishes are priced competitively, portions are sufficient and food quality is consistent with the multiple patronage.

The stall owners are also receptive to customers' requests. Favourite dishes include the plethora of fried rices (particularly the pineapple fried rice), phad thai (which they cook extremely well, it wasn't too dry, sufficiently moist and packed with ingredients) and their mango salad. Cashless payment is accepted here.

Do patron this new place as they serve very affordable and delicious food! We tried a couple of their dishes over 2 consecutive days: basil pork, tom yum (both red and clear), green curry chicken, olive fried rice, pineapple fried rice, pandan chicken, claypot prawn vermicelli, deep fried pork with garlic, seafood MAMA salad, stir-fry kai lan with crispy pork and stir-fry kangkong - they were all tasty! Definitely one of the better and value-for-money Thai food in TPY central.
Food was mediocre. The women taking orders was rude and disrespectful talking like we are begging for food. Better change her attitude if she want her shop to excel.
Nice and delicious Mango Salad that i eat ever
love love love! So good food and I’m so happy I found this place to get a quick thai fix anytime
Great thai food and excellent service. I'll be back often enough I'm sure.
I tried the mama fried basil noodles, it's like Thai version of Maggi goreng. Portions are pretty good.
Price reasonable lots of choice for u to dine alone or with family. Will patronise more if i happen to be around the area.

(Translated by Google) The price is a bit expensive, the tom yam fried rice is $6, the amount of fried rice is very small, but the fried rice only has a few small shrimps...

(Original)
价格有点貴，东炎炒饭$6，炒饭份量非常少，而已炒饭只有几只小小虾………

(Translated by Google) Mother's Aroi

(Original)
Aroi mak mak

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Came here for a late lunch.

Ordered Basil Pork Rice, Clear Tom Yum Soup and their Omelette.

Basil Pork Rice was not bad. Flavour is more towards Thai taste buds.
Tom yum soup was good. Spicy and flavourful  with fish, prawn, tomatoes, onion, shimeji mushroom.
The omelette was not bad. Oily but could be crispier.

Overall a decent meal at a good price

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Toa Payoh residents are blessed with this well known authentic Thai food stall  situated in the Lorong 7 hawker center.

Im a regular of this Hom Aroy brand in Sin Ming but it was unfortunately closed for a few months since early January. This is the next closest Home Aroy you can find in the central area.

This stall is extremely busy during meal times especially in the evening. Be sure to visit early or be prepared to wait for a bit.

You won't go wrong with the standard dishes like Thai Pork Basil Rice, Fried Omelette Rice and Tom Yum Soup. Enjoy!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Best so far and they have not shut down but relocated a few units away within the food centre; from 01-10 to 01-32.

01-10 now sells Chinese Food

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Taste downgraded from 1-2 years ago. The Basil Pork looked really bland and tasted like economic rice standard. Lastly is this woman stationed at the counter who always seem hesitant to serve customers

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Food: 10/10! All that we have tried so far were delicious and veggies had good wokhei flavor. Haven't had a disappointing dish so far.

Service: 10/10 as well!
Ordered via Deliveroo last month but the stall was sold out on many items already. One of their staff called me and asked if it's possible to replace my orders with those available. When the food came, my green curry chicken was missing. Deliveroo didn't do anything, told me to Contact the stall so I tried to call their number online but it goes to their boss's number who was not at outlet. Their boss was apologetic and offered to give additional item on next order. Next order came around and indeed I was given extra fishcake on top of my orders. Had a small chat with the boss and definitely very friendly and keen on providing good food. Good service.

Sadly, my curry was still not refunded via Deliveroo, but not their fault... Was deliveroo slow processing.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Went to the one in China town. It was so yummy! Pad Thai is great! Green curry is spicy and very flavoursome. Tom yum was delicious too. Great value. Will definitely visit again soon

edit; 2nd visit was good, third visit average. I won't be making the effort to go again but happy to try if passing. My opinion now is that it is not consistent and sometimes great sometimes ok.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Stand there wanting to order and yet the female staff just stand there use her phone and do her own stuffs despite seeing me. Another uncle came and she just took his order.. what kind of service is it. Waited 5 mins and staff just can't be bothered.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
I’m not usually a fan of Thai food but this stall converted me. Ordered the green curry chicken, kai lan and clear tom yum soup. Super worth it.

2021 update: felt that the standard wasn’t consistent as of late. But still a good option considering the price to quality.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: I always order delivery by Grab. And always same items Mango Salad, Basil Pork Rice and Pad Thai. Food delivered hot and my favourite is Pad Thai. Comes with 3 prawns n egg fried inside the dish. Mango salad well cut and I like the half spicy n tangy taste!! Yummy always!!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Basil Pork would have taste better if freahly cooked.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: If you love spicy pad kaprao (thai basil pork with rice), ask for extra spicy from Hom Aroy - super yums!!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Don't try to eat after usual eating time
arrived at2.30 told me that they open at 4, only later i realize that opening time on the wall
I suppose they don't wanna open fire juz for 1 customer?

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: A tasty value meal. There is always people lining up for this Hawker stall.  The seafood Tom Yum is medium spicy, would prefer a it more spicy. Very good Thai noodle.  Fast service but some items are not available such as we wanted the mango salad.  This is recommended to us by a local friend and our opinion is: worth a try.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Coronation Plaza outlet at level 3 food court ... excellent value and service. Deservedly popular, attracts lots of students from nearby tutorial centres. Very competitive prices. I particularly like the fish cakes, and mixed fried veg with prawns. Mango salad always fresh, and they will omit the chili for sensitive western palates like mine 😉.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Delivery:

Taste is good and very reasonable for the price with the serving size.

Tom yum soup is not bad but can tell got high msg and makes you thirsty - good for drinking in small doses.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: The serving size is just nice and the pricing is reasonable. Taste is fantastic with good hygiene observed too. One of my go to place for Thai food from now onwards. 👍🏻

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: One of the best Thai Food tailored to Singaporean taste hands down. Portion can be more but still value for money and good good taste 👍🏻 will support again 👏🏻

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Food is tasty, price is reasonable (range from $4). I like the Tom Yam soup ($5), pineapple fried rice ($4). Patthai ($4)is good, a little on the sweet side. Authentic Thai food at hawker price. Definitely going back for more.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Went a few times. Didnt like the feeling of being ignored. Store wasn't that busy but lady basically just left me standing there while slowly counting money etc. Only managed yo try once tom yum soup average.not coming back.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: An alright taste of Thai food available in this small food center. The tom yum kung clear soup bowl is good for a try. Costs 5 SGD, a bit more than other nearby stalls.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Photo is misleading. I ordered on Foodpanda the thai basil pork with rice. The photo shows a fried egg but it came without. Taste is not bad though.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Food is good. But waiting time is really long. Waited 25 mins for a bowl of tom yum soup! In my opinion worth trying but they need to work on their time to serve too. 👍

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: I just ordered basil pork with egg through grab  but it come without egg. Zzzz.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Mediocre food, pad thai tasted like soy sauce. Not worth the long wait and putting up with the unfriendly service.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Nice Thai food but price abit expensive and small portion or else it be a 5 stars

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
I am a local staying near the toapayoh store. Ordered 2 items at 6.30pm and only got my food at 7.10pm. 40minutes wait
Bad attitude no apology, still can stare at me

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
Super Authentic Thai food prepped by Thai chefs.
I am glad to find this here in Singapore.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: This place serves very good food. Affordable, good  authentic Thai food.

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Cheap and authentic taste. Can't find any place cheaper than this!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Authentic Thai food at affordable prices

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: right amount of spicyness. feels like im in BKK streets

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Very bad service. Not heeding to customers’ needs

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Authentic conomical thai food

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Very nice

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content: Cheap and good!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
(Translated by Google) Basil Pork with Rice - absolutely awesome. Super tasty & spicy! i love it!!!

(Original)
Basil Pork with Rice - absolut geil . Superlecker & scharf ! I love it !!!

restaurant name: Hom Aroy Thai Food Express (TOA PAYOH LORONG 7)
content:
(Translated by Google) The taste can also be cheap

(Original)
味道还可以价格便宜

Had this a few times couple of years back and the food was so good. Ordered again and the standard really drop so much.

Prawn cake : mushy, tasteless, feel undercooked.
Tom yum : picture shown is already after scooping ALOT of the oil out.
Basil chicken :  isnt it supposed to be minced? This can in big chunks of chicken and the taste was totally off. Don't remember it was like this previously.

Only edible food was the fried garlic pork and green curry.

Will never order again from this shop.
Fish and soup is nice. But... The papaya salad really can not make it. Lack of so many ingredients and the taste is very salty.

During weekday lunchtime, table of 4 ordered a few dishes with rice. The plates of rice were served first served while we waited for more than 5 minutes for them to bring out the dishes while the rice turned cold. After we ate everything, it seemed that they forgot about our soup until we reminded the cashier. IMO, there must be customers who cancelled orders and left because of long wait. That was why they served rice to give us no reason to cancel orders while they take their time to cook the dishes.

Affordable and good Thai food served here. The price stated on the menu is the final price. Staff there are average. If u want to get the coconut drink, bear in mind that a majority of them are young coconut, hence the flesh doesn't come off so easily.

Some recommendations:
- Lemon fish (Currently having promo at $12.9 per fish nett)
- Tom yum soup
- Omelette

Enjoy! :)
Thai restaurant with  foods cooked & place run by Mainland Chinese.  Service mediocre & we're  not going back again.

O....This Thai restaurant foods is marvellous...Price also very reasonable...Must try...
Felt $$ n foods are better than Nakhon or Ah Loy Thai .
Cockroach in the beef glass noodle that I ordered last night. Totally gross and threw away all other food that I have ordered. No hygiene at all. Avoid at all cost!

Awesome experience! The clear Tom Yum seafood soup was just the right amount of hot and sour, they have one of the best Pad Thai ever!

Also, their fish is 50% off (fried and steamed choices available), so grab it while you can.

Sadly their pandan chicken wasn't that good.

First time to visit this thai eatery located in Toa Payoh North. Many google reviewers warned about their portion size, I agree quite big, for 4 pax no problem.

Ordered Thai steamed fish with lime, promo price of $12.90. We also ordered plain omelette ($7, some cabbage in it), basil stir fry pork, fishcake ($9 soft inside, like otah filling), kai lan with slated fish ($7) and 4 plates of white rice, total bill $46.90.

A hearty dinner in the neighborhood that is wallet friendly.

I’m a huge Thai cuisine lover and usually as long as the taste meets the minimal bench mark I’m pretty much satisfied. This one is horrible! Pls don’t waste your money and time to try this place out. Will definitely not be back again

Bought take away - 2 x clear tom yum seafood with 2 rice. It Used to be above average hence it’s once of my options buy dinner or once a while dine in.

When I reached home, I was shocked that the seafood portion in it was so little, just 3 small prawns and a few sotong (used to have fish), used to have mushrooms and tomatoes but this time round 2 tiny mushrooms and small slices of tomato. And then lots of soup and then that’s it…

$9 for this amount is clearly unacceptable.

I doubt i will be returning to eat here again. Standards drop and really felt shortchanged 😤

Walked in, went to the counter to see the menu. This PRC waitress brings out a customer's order of basil chicken rice with a friend  egg.

The egg falls onto the counter as it was on the edge of the plate.

She picks it up with her long finger nailed hands and puts it back on the plate and proceeds to hold the egg down on the plate with her thumb as she proceeds to ask me if I'm eating here or takeaway. (In mandarin)

I can kinda understand picking the egg back from the counter and putting it back. But holding it down with her thumb on the customers plate with dirty long fingernails as she talks to me....

Not going back tho this place has the potential to be a nice family run Thai food place if it takes care of details like this.

Reasonably price Thai food, large portion with slightly above average flavours. I ordered Tom yum fried rice, Kai Lan with salted fish and pork fried with basil. I find the Tom Yum fried rice lacks tom yum flavour instead it tasted more like tomatoes fried rice. The kan lan with salted fish seem to have stir-fry both ingredients separately and mix them together at the final stage. Best is the pork with basil, a bit spicy but it was good.

Comforting Thai-inspired fare within Toa Payoh’s neighbourhood. My favourite was the pork slices ($10), which my friend and I swallowed down before we could take a picture. That, along with green curry chicken, broccoli, Tom yum soup, fish, red ruby, and mango sticky rice, cost us only $30 each! The fish was on promotion though ($12.90 instead of the U.P $22.90). Staff were pretty friendly too!
Price reasonable.  Food taste good and service was fast. Minus point was the place is a bit small so its like a eat and go concept.

Portions were way too huge and there was a lot of food wastage :( I wish I had knew beforehand so I could order to share and not waste so much food. Perhaps the place could let people select portion sizes?

Taste wise, not bad - pineapple rice was fragrant, pad Thai had wok hey. The only odd thing was that the Tom Yam soup tasted a little jasmine-y and metallic, which I thought was odd. Sad because I was looking forward to a bowl of nice comforting Tom Yam soup this coooool season.

sharing this info from my mum and my aunt , they went to eat at tpy branch on the 4th of aug 2022, they had mango sticky rice, my mum told me that she complain to the waitress that the rice is hard, like its from the fridge or freezer then heat up in the microwave., as my mum ask the waitress, when was this made,  was it fresh? the waitress replied and said this : it was made like 2days ago, the current chef who made it wasn't there that day 4 th Aug. . so made it in advance and store in the freezer or fridge, and heat it up in the microwave. *CLAPS MY HANDS*

can i ask u , thai Lily, is that how u made all ur food in advance and store it in the freezer, or fridge and reheat it up in the microwave? i tell u, if i was there with my mum , i confirm have have diarrhea immediately, Well,, if u wanna up keep ur restaurant, and to maintain good reviews, please do something about ur food being freshness. if u cant do or cook that certain food, pls 86 it.

oh btw the way the timestamp would be around 12 to 1pm.
thanks.

Ordered their pad thai, tom yum soup and Thai iced milk tea for my dinner on a weekday evening. The servings were very generous and value for money. My total bill was at $20 only. My favourite dish was the pad thai, the tom yum was little too sour for my taste buds and there was lots of meat inside of it. The Thai iced milk tea tasted a little weird than the usual ones at Thai eateries.
Overall, a good and very filling dinner 😁

Affordable Thai food in Braddell area. Ordered the lunch set basil pork rice with green curry. The green curry is rather creamy, basil pork rice comes with a fried egg and is decent without being too spicy. Overall good value for money if you are around the area.

Crave for Thai cuisine? You don't have to fly to Bangkok to fix your cravings anymore. Just visit ThaiLily at 107 Lorong 1 Toa Payoh and you will find a good selections of authentic Thai food that will satisfy your appetite.
Don't miss out their fish dish promotion. My favourite is the steam fish with thai lime sauce.. currently going at $12.90 instead of the usual $22.
I didn't have time to cook last night so decided to pack the  dinner for my family. And as usual, they enjoyed the food  so much.  Thanks to ThaiLily for the sumptuous dinner!
Nice neighborhood thai restaurant. Decent green curry chicken and minced pork basil. Payaya salad was terrible - overdosed on fish sauce.
Standard dropped... different from the old thailkly at novena.
The service was superb.  The dajie always serve us with a great smile. Very friendly, make our every visit very happy

[Promotion] Love their steamed Thai fish promo! Entire fish (both sides!!!!!) for only $12.90. Cant get a better than this. Also, you get to choose from a list of flavours like Thai style, clear tomyum, red tomyum, lemongrass.... great value for money!
Restaurant show accept CDC voucher. When I want to redeem my CDC voucher this evening 6.25pm 18/9/2022 it was not busy. The china lady told me  $2 cannot redeem.
Steamed fish with lemon sauce was overly sweet. Pork belly was soaked in oil and over sweet! It's like eating sugared pork skin. Bad experience and will never come back again.
Order was quick when you shared with them that you are in a hurry. The serving auntie was super nice today.

Today's 2 Nov 2020 and they are still serving the fish for $12.90. We ordered the tomyam fish as in our picture and loved it. Its like having 2 dishes in one LOL.

The green curry has pineapples in it that gives it a sweet taste, unlike the other Thai places. We like.

The pork kailan had very few pieces of roast pork though. Wished there were more.

Total for the 3 of us was $31.90 with no drinks.

Wanted to give it more stars. But as the dishes come, it got even more disappointing.
1. Tang Hoon is completely tasteless. Please skip it.
2. Red Ruby desserts came with ice cubes and not iced shavings.
3. Worst Thai milk tea drink I ever had. It is completely diluted.
See photos.

Ordered on deliveroo. Missing rice and metal scrap from dish scrubber found. Tried to contact restaurant to remediate but was put on hold without informing and waited very long with no response. Will proceed to submit case to SFA
Ambience old school. Staff friendly food is good .. they have this sea bass only $12.80
Non authentic Thai food. It’s the worst Phad Thai Chicken I have tasted in my life. Lack flavour, bland. The Noodle was under cooked before it was fried. Will not be here again for sure.
I like the taste of the Thai food here. However, I won't recommend takeaways as I find that the taste of the food changes when I got the food home.

I had fried basil seafood rice with egg. Not authentic but good enough for a quick lunch fix.
Flavour is not authentic but decent.
Good portion

Milk tea made from sugar.. damn sweet... diluted sweet. Like a syrup drinks. no Thai tea fragrance. I order phai tai, is like eating dessert.. so sweet... all noodle Lump up together.. 😓 food are very salty.

Is the worst phai tai I ever ate. If is not because of convenience, I won’t come, never again. Not worth the $.

By far the worst mookata I've eaten in my life. no marinate for the meat and the soup is basically hot water. Really damn sad. Please, if you want to include mookata please at least have a minimal standard to upkeep.

First time trying. Only 2 staffs serving and cashier but they were quite efficient.  We ordered the $12.9 seabass steam with clear tomyum, curious how would it be with the price.  It was big, fresh and tasty. 4 thumbs up. We also ordered $6 chicken basil fried rice (big portion and yummy) and $6 fried kailan with crispy pork (somehow they served us just fried kailan without pork but we decided to accept,  it's a bit salty but ok). Will come back to try other dishes
The steamed sea bream is sweet and tender. The Kai lan was also pretty good. Wouldn’t recommend the desserts here though tasted kinda weird. The red ruby was poorly executed.
The food is good and the price is just OK. The place is clean and not fancy. Good waiters and quick.

This place was recommended by my friend because of their Sea Bass (fish) promotion at $12.90. Good price for its taste and I was really satisfied. Initially wanted to order the steamed kind but unfortunately, it’s already out of stock. Guess it’s already good. Will definitely come back for the steamed style. Of course, Thai meal won’t be complete without Tom Yum soup. I opted for their Tom Yum seafood soup and it was a bomb! Can’t wait to come back soon.
Fast service despite a busy Friday evening. Staff very friendly, good place for a no frills dinner.

Awesome service by cute cute plum boy wearing a spec. He is an asset of the restaurant.
Very tasty food with reasonable price. Will come back again
Tasty pork belly. Let's support these small businesses, don't keep going Malls or the international restaurant chains.
I had Oder food from deliveroo. And the noodles got something I have no idea what this but look like dead ant. And the Red Ruby look ugly I disappointed.
food delicious n nice service

Ordered seabass with tomyam coconut milk, basil leaf minced pork, pineapple fried rice and mango salad.

Pineapple Fried Rice: Extreme Failure.
Serving was huge, but the rice was extremely soggy. Absolutely not fragrant nor tasty.

Fish: Fail.
Even with the fire below, the entire dish was luke warm at most. Fish was very bland and coconut milk tomyam was just looking it's part without tasting like it at all.

Mango Salad: Fail.
Was sour as expected but totally lacking the spicy touch.

Minced Pork: Pass.
The ONLY dish which saved the day.for them.

Won't return.
The waiter forgot to serve me my chicken n time but he came smiling sending me the dish, with apology. So, I didn't mind. Kindness matters.

⭐⭐⭐

I am impressed by ThaiLily Restaurant and will visit them more often.

Yesterday they forgot to pack my honey ribs. I message them in FB and they were responsive and responsible.

Just now, I went down and order dinner at Thai Lily again. Told the staff about the missing honey ribs. He okayed and I went for a smoke. Came back to restaurant and he packed an extra mango sticky rice. Said complimentary from his boss. So nice of them.

In term of food quality, they are above-average Thai food. The sea bass dishes are attractively priced at $12.90 and come in 5 styles, and my family love them.

They are located at Block 107 Lorong 1 Toa Payoh #01-268. Beside Phoon Huat/Redman Braddell MRT.

Aftermath;
Food- superb 🤩🤩
Service- above average (considering it’s late night 11:12pm)
Ambiance- average (just 3mins walk away from mrt station)

Overall- great for everyone who’s looking for values for money food to stuff your big belly 😁

supper lovers.. this is the place where you can go..! it closes at 1am..
food is bad...! $12.90 for a whole steam fish.. Cheap! But it is on promo.. not sure when it will end..

why 4 stars? cos i got bitten by mozzy while dinning there..

April 2022
Price increase to $9.80 for oyster omelette. Oysters are smaller too.

Ordered olive fried rice. Didn’t really like it as I prefer savoury taste more than sweet (some floss on top. Sweet taste there) and the rice seem sweet too.

—————-
Green curry with rice (don’t remember price) and oyster omelette $9. Good taste.
Now new Chicken Satay. Same price as Moo Ping (Pork Satay) Highly Recommend. The rest are my favourite.

Ordered steam sea bass , kangkong, prawn cake and tomyun with 3 rices.
Cost $50
Fresh and tasty. One of the thai stall that I will patronize often.

This Thai food standard has drop after the Circuit Breaker period. Their Tom Yam Soup and Thai style fried Seafood Tong Hoon used to be very delicious now is just average. Fried seafood tong Hoon the noodle is bit soggy but at least the flavor still here, must stir in the chilli sauce which is a perfect match for this dish. Tom Yam Soup is now too milky and less spicy, lacks the herbs and lemon grass flavor in the soup.
Best Thai Food in SG. Better than many we have tried! Full 5 stars for this fantastic restaurant. Right smack in a coffee shop! Price reasonably at 10 per pax or less.

Great and affordable Thai food. My favourites are the tomyum soup, basil chicken, tod man pla, tang hoon and pad thai. Highly recommended. You can call in to order as well and they will tell you what time to go to pick up the food. The belacan is out of this world and goes well with seafood.
Pretty authentic Thai food that is very scrumptious! Would definitely come back again.

Had meals here on numerous occasions. Friendly and great Thai hospitality. Some of the local food stalls need to learn from them. Have a meal is more than just good food, it means a total experience and that include service.

Friendly owners from Thailand.
Authentic and affordable Thai food. Always my 1st choice.

Circuit breaker period
- hours as usual
- call to pre-order to reduce waiting time
- self collection only. (Updated on 16 April 2020)
Delicious authentic thai foods by native thai chef. The price is inexpensive and service is good.
Great Authentic Thai food. Fantastic friendly service. Best price in Singapore.

Nice, affordable thai food in Bradell neighbourhood area.
Ordered the set menu for 5 pax only $40!
Warm service as well!

Yucks! Fried w yellow curry powder.
Took a long time to get the food after chasing !!!
They cannot cope with large volumes.
Never again.
Very unsatisfying.

The padthai is too sweet n in Singapore the bean sprouts is expensive so they use the small n thin unlike in Thai padthai use fresh big n raw bean sprouts is readily available. I never like dish that come with prawn in Singapore . The prawn is small white. 5 dollar not worth to try the same dish.
satay pork very tender juicy, but their tomyam clear soup too sour. Deep fry pork abit hard.
Literally living in this block, have been going to here almost every night for dinner. A29 Crispy Basil Chicken is just the PERFECT dish to go for 🔥💯

One of the more popular Kopitiam shops in Toa Payoh. Even on a weekday night you’d have to wait 15 minutes. But the food was worth it. 😋 #letsguide #burpple #foreverhungry #singaporeeats #instagood #chope #hungryeatwhat #hungryeatwhere #foodie #foodiesg #hungrygowhere #chope #entertainerapp #sgfood
Delicious, just that the spiciness is greatly reduced to suit to the local customers.

Reasonably good Thai zhichar!

Their olive fried rice and pineapple fried rice are fragrant and tasty

Third time here and it just gets better with each visit.
You have to order the grilled pork. One of the few and best I've had in sg.

The food here tastes really good and authentic. The Pad Thai is really delicious. The Basil Pork is moist and has a lot of flavour. The Grilled Pork has a ton of flavour and when you dip in the chili fish sauce that you can ask for, it is absolutely fabulous. I have went there at least 5 times and it never gets worse.
Tasty Seafood Pad Thai served by friendly staff. A more wet version compared to other places.
awesome food awesome price awesome service. just need to wait a little while during peak hour

Authentic and extremely delicious Thai food cooked by Thai chefs.

The Thai auntie taking orders is also extremely friendly and helpful.

Tried their Basil Leaf Chicken with Rice and Crispy Chicken Basil Leaf with Rice.

Will be back to try their green curry and pork dishes. Highly recommended!

Pad Thai here didn't resemble pad Thai at all, they used the ipoh hor fun kind of kuey teow and ended up in a mushy mess. Pork satay here was nicely marinated and barbecued but have very fatty layers, price is also on the steep side considering that it is located in a coffee shop. The stalls here are inaccessible for wheelchair user because of the huge step and narrow pathways, only seats at the outer part of the coffee shop are accessible.

Humble stall selling authentic thai food in a neighbourhood coffee shop. Possibly the most popular stall in the coffee shop. Service is quick and good. Food is also great with appropriate portion sizes recommended based on the number of diners you have.
Despite its popularity, food was served up pretty quickly.

Perhaps I am not over-exaggerated to say that this place, by far, serves the best Thai food in Singapore! Authentic home-cooked Thai food prepared by awesome chefs and the staffs are never lack of smiles (now you know why they call Thailand the "Land of Smiles").

Always friendly and courteous to compliment their great food. Price is very reasonable for such quality. Must try includes the tom yam soup and spicy basil chicken.

Has been to many Thai eateries throughout the island, but none came near D.K. In fact, the standard here may be better than what you would find in Bangkok!

If you're looking for some comforting Thai food, you know where to go.

Totally don’t recommend! The Korean store owner who take orders really very rude and impatient he only got 5 secs for you , if you ask him more questions he will ignored u and went to take next order . The fried chicken are overrated honestly

Patronize this eatery very often. They serves authentic Thai Food at reasonable prices. I personally love their pineapple rice, chicken carshew rice, basil meat rice, etc...the list goes on. Try them and you know what I mean. Come earlier to avoid the dinner crowd.

enjoyed the fried basil chicken rice. spicy and crispy enough for dinner for one. there was a bit of waiting involved as the chef cooked each dish individually but fortunately they have a buzzer system.

will return!
Overall their food is excellent the only part is they use Low quality rice instead of Thai rice which I feel they should as it’s Thai food. I hope they can improve on their rice quality
seriously the best thai food in singapore. so satisfying and affordable! better than anything ive tried in singapore. the lady is extremely friendly too. have been coming here for over 6 years!
Really good Thai food by Thai people with good service. Only problem is expect to wait cause very long queues!

I eat here every week, always with a smile on my face.
PadThai and seafood TomYam are delicious. A serious must-try.
Also very Friendly staff.
My favorite Thai in SG!

Good food. I think it's better than Nakhon Thai.

$26.50 for Cashew chicken + Mixed Vege + Tom Yum Soup + Tomyum Fried Rice.
Good place for thai korean foods...
Deep fried pork was really good, don't forget to use the sauce. Prices were around the standard. Would recommend! 👍🏼
Excellent reasonably priced Thai cuisine. We love the lemon grass steam fish.
One of my fav go to Thai food! Friendly prices but sometimes the wait can be long but totally worth it
Love their pineapple rice. Decent pricing. Good selection of food on their menu. Food is very homely. Recommended.
Love it for the really authentic Thai food served at a very affordable neighborhood hawker price . The staffs are very friendly.
Reasonably priced.  Oyster fried eggs are good.  Pineapple fried rice too wet.
Authentic n Economical Thai Food. Passionate n Friendly Hawker
Authentic flavors and friendly service all at a great price. I will return to try more dishes.
really authentic Thai food. The basil meat rice is very nice
Seriously one of the best Thai food in TOA Payoh lor2. Value for money the owner very friendly and helpful and staff
One of the better Thai food so far. Reasonable price for a Coffeeshop.
Food stall run by a Thai couple. Food was good. Not too expensive. Recommended.
tasty and reasonably priced thai food, worth trying if youre nearby
Good enough for me.

Place order using online menu QR. fast service. Some items on physical menu may not be available on the online order because physical menu is less updated. Have to separately order fresh coconut in person but service staff is helpful & prompt. Found lemongrass tea quite seeet even though there was option for less sweet, less ice. Tomato snapper fish (no picture) was good.

surprisingly quite flavorful Stir-fried Beef Hor Fun. The beef cooked just nice , broth is richly aromatic. The “Wok Hei”, heavenly. I believe they prepare the stock well, I am trying to figure out the ingredients though. Lol…. Fresh juicy crunch on the vege, cook just right, retaining the texture and moisture. Snow Pea could used a bit of prep work to remove the thin fiber string on both sides. Portion wise versus taste and price, I would say this is worth it. Would recommend sharing for smaller portion eater.

Red Tom Yum Soup with Seafood, less spicy. I would say the spicy, sour and sweet balance would suite most. I’ll should take the original  spicy level though. A bit too sweet for me. Anyway, Shimeiji mushroom are yummy and have the fresh juicy texture. Squid and prawn wise prep & cook well, tender and juicy to enjoy. Can see the good knife works and skill prepping the ingredients. The chef really have some standards, I would say. The squid could have a smaller bite size cut though. Less chewing and bite with smaller pieces.

Overall, a delicious well balance flavored meal. Which is pretty rare. Yummy meal. I am surprised, in a good way.

Would recommend to try, while their food/chef/quality still in the season. 🤔😄…

(written on 8 Mar 2022)
Green curry with chicken is nice. Sweet and slightly spicy with a strong basil flavour. The coconut slushie is also good.

The standard of the food was rather disappointing. I would not really classify their style as thai. Flavor and authenticity was poor. Portioning is small and price is rather expensive qith that portion. Service was rather sloppy. Ordering app did not have the history of the orders for us to keep track. only enjoyable dish was the fried seafood kway teow.
Foods were good. Service was good too. Love the spicy clam dish.

A couple of Sundays ago, after playing mahjong at the inlaws place and losing close to $40, it was time for dinner.
We decided to try the Thai restaurant, Siam Kitchen, which we had not eaten at before.
Placed our order for an appetiser platter and a seabass set. We got the glass of Thai milk tea that came with the set but was told we don't get SAFRA member discount with that set meal and so no discount for the meal. Disapppointing. 😟 Just as well that we didn't order dessert which looks to me was overpriced. Ended up spending about the same amount I lost at mahjong earlier.
The soup with meatball was served with the baked potato. The baked potato still tasted OK but the soup was too salty for me so I didn't like it.
The appetiser platter had a lot of food. I guessed it can be filling enough for a full meal for some people.
The seabass was last to serve. The taste was OK but not something I'd missed enough to come back for more.
The place wasn't crowded throughout. Diners came and left while we were there and the number of groups was more or the less the same before and after our meal.
Better option for dessert was McDonald's which was less than 50m away.

Went for Sunday dinner. Definitely not busy which is good. However, for some reasons the staffs are difficult to find. There were only several tables occupied, the fact that the staff are not around is a bit frustrating. Food was not at best, not bad either.

Cozy place, less crowded during dinner.

Lots of choices on the menu.
Love the Grilled Beef and Beef noodle soup
Hearty meal.

Food is expensive and tables are super dirty - they are so sticky that the paper napkins are ripped apart when u try to use them after dinning. Also, plse note you cannot use both SAFRA card and SAFRA vouchers together - which the other F&B outlets in SAFRA allow.
Long waiting time for pad thai lunch set meal on Monday. Order the rice dishes instead if you don’t want to wait up to 30mins.
Food taste great, service by Theva and the team are fantastic even they are very busy. They fulfilled all our requests!
Theva and team provided excellent service with their pleasant approach! :) kuddos to the team in Safra Toa Payoh! You guys deserve recognition for all your hard work.

Really great food! Service was great! Would like to commend the staff, especially Shidah and Ali who really provided great service and were very patient with my queries. Didn't get the name of the other staff on duty, but she was also really helpful with my queries. Loved the food, especialy the Pad Thai, and green curry. The omelette was excellent, and their mango sticky rice was  really tasty! Will definitely return, and strongly recommended to others.

the food is quite mediocre imo
the tomyum soup not spicy, not very tasty
the steamed fish like abit mushy
The service by Theva and team are great. We are pleased to have a dinner here.
Lousy service. Told to pack my takeaway bento before 1pm. At 1pm it was not prepare at all.

Ordered family set online and the food tasted terrible. Red Tom Yum seafood soup was so salty like a full jar of salt was added in. The salted fish fried rice was also too salty. Waste of money as the other dishes like pandan leaf chicken and honey chicken were also not well cooked as lacked flavour. A total waste of money as not palatable at all. If can give no star, I would want to do that. Please check your chef's cooking skill before serving the food to your customer.

Ordered via Bungkus. All food is horrible! Except for Tom Yum! Blackpepper beef too oily! Crab fried rice failed! Just plain rice mix with soy sauce and add crab meat on the top. Fork & spoon crab fried rice more nice. Kailan also can't accept! Basil just a spoonful and throw in a bin. Not worth it. Gonna be my 1st & the last. All food gone to the waste except for tom yum. Waste money!
Service was great! Very friendly staff, food was really tasty and the lunch deals are really worth it! Particularly enjoyed the Omelette and Mango Sticky Rice! Definitely a must try!
Great authentic Thai food . Great service also . Highly recommend

Tom yam soup was horribly salty.  Totally Inedible. Chicken in green curry not fresh too. We have to drive all the way back to the toa payoh outlet with the food n ask for a refund. Disappointed. Not recommended
The foods and service was awesome will reccomend to my friends 👍
The mango sticky rice is nice.  In general, the food is quite good but too expensive. there are many Thai eateries which charge less and without ++.

Would like to give commendation on your staff called hockseng and Xavier Seah on a Saturday night dinner, 3rd April 2021. They recommended us with good suggestions and all were good and delicious. Food also came on time and staff were really courteous and friendly always checking on us whether the food is good and whether all food has arrived. Definitely looking forward to have dinner with my family here again. :)

The service staff tried their best but this outlet is obviously understaffed. An hour in the queue and a long wait for food.

If you plan to come during dinner time, you may need to buffer 1.5hours waiting time.

Poor Service

The staff was unfriendly and difficult to attend to my needs when only my group of friends were the only customer there at that time.
We went lunch on Sunday. Order tom yam soup and few dishes. Realize the soup was served with few pieces of mushroom and 2 pcs of slice squid.. Very pathetic seafood soup. This is my 3rd visit h
Went here twice and good thing that it was not crowded. Environment is cozy and food tastes ok and decently priced. Convenient place for dining after doing some exercise at SAFRA.

Had the shrimp omelette and seafood pad thai with thai milk tea. Although I would have liked the pad thai more spicy, it was very delicious. The mango sticky rice was really good also. The staff, Shidah and Ali, were very attentive and helpful as well :D
Such a nice service and happy joy of food 🥰🥰🥰

Food are terrible.
Not authentic at all
Service was great, by the team.
Under staff. Only 1 hard working staff at the dining area.. food okay only.

In December i visited 2 Times.
Ty for cooking vegetarian food for us.
Had a lunch at siam kitchen few days back. The staff are nice
Foods good and not a lot of people which I like
Tried Tom Yum clear soup. Doesn't taste very impressive and can be rather expensive~
Superb
Food is good!
Nice variety of tasty choices
Very satisfied!!!Highly recommend ☺️
Authentic thai food with excellent service!

(Translated by Google) The food is very delicious. It's like eating in Thailand.

(Original)
อาหารอร่อยมากค่ะ เหมือนกินอยู่ที่ไทยเลยค่ะ

We were stuck at Toa Payoh Industrial Park due to sudden heavy rain so decided to have dinner at nearby coffeeshop. Surprised by the many stalls still open at this hour in this area; we decided to have mookata since perfect weather to eat something hot. Wow!!! No regrets! Not only the seafood was fresh, everything was tasty. More importantly, I don't feel thirsty. Best experience was the stall owner cook and guide us when I asked him how and what I should cook first as I've never tried mookata. Despite the heavy rain, it was a perfect evening with great discovery, yummy Mookata Lor!!! I will definitely be back again. 😋
Soup is yummy. Meat is well marinated. Prawn is fresh, scallop is big and delicious. Overall is good. Worth the try. Will definitely come back again.

Ordered the set for 4 which is about $40+
The meats are well marinated but I find the greens are lacking but add a veg set ard $4+.
The condiments are standard.
The setup is in coffeeshop in the light industrial area vicinity. There are many stalls to add on to mookata. I liked the vibes due to the music and the young crowd.
However not all the fans are working so try to find near it or else you find yourself perspiring while eating mookata

Nice food with good dipping sauces but setting in an industrial park canteen or food centre is not very condusive as it gets pretty hot & sweaty which is actually how it should be but may not be very well received by people here.

The meat here is AMAZING!!! So well marinated and tender. The mookata here is so affordable and came to about $10/pax and I ate till I was so full. In terms of value for money, taste and service speed, its a full 5 stars. In fact, the only reason why I dont have a photo is because the food was so delicious everything was gone in my tummy alr haha

This is almost the best mookata I have ever had!
Food is fresh, marination is awesome, service is great and most important thing is chilli 一级棒!
Their boss only serve the best quality of food!
And I have to say their staff super friendly!
What’s most important?
The bill is super pocket friendly also.
This is a must try and to die for mookata!
👍👍👍

Was cycling casually with buddies till we were so hungry, we decided to stop for food at this industrial coffee shop. After reckying all the fancies big signboard, we decided to settle with this Smallest signboard that says “Mookata Lor” since we havnt had Mookata for quite awhile. And also like their “Singlish Thai” signboard name.

And tell you what.. Their ingredients had caught me by surprise.

- Their Prawns & Scallops were so fresh, so fresh like it’s straight from the sea. Giant Scallop were bigger than our old sg 50 cents coin.

- I personally do not like pork alot due to the pork smell but trust me, I had so much pork than I could imagine here.

- Chicken were well marinated & savory. Tender & Juicy.

- Beef is Goooood. I cant have enough of it. OMG I’m hungry again writing this review.

- Soup base was FANTASTIC. Well broth with tint of sweetness. Unlike many stalls we went, starts with plain water.

- Mookata cant go without condiments. They provides 3 different type of dips or you could create your own.
Thai dip is good, goes well with everything. Traditional mince garlic chilli padi with parsley, my favourite. Another was abit sweet, mild spicy perfect for non spicy takers. Gosh, spoilt for choices.

- Last thing I would like to emphasis is the price. All 3 of us had satisfied tummies at just less than 50 dollars.

We had a GREAT time GREAT meal at Mookata Lor yesterday evening. I had it pinned and will DEFINITELY visit again. A GEM we accidentally found.

Dont wait. Bring your whole family there now.

Great place to eat at, owners are extremely friendly and would constant check on you and engage in some light hearted conversation with you!,  food are budget friendly with a 1KG Meat platter and add on of several other ala carte dishes came to a cost of 45 for a group of 4, definitely worth it! Food was fresh and marinated deliciously, been coming back every month to support them. Can't wait to go back again ahah.
They kindly friendly, the food very nice….the most is garlic pork belly slice, that is the most nice and delicious. I will provide bring a lot friend come to eat…try support them
Great value and price for 2kg of meat. Super nice and chill industrial ambience with great service and chilli. Even have reward card. Worth every penny! Will come again soon!

Definitely a worth a visit to Mookata Lor! The ingredients especially the meat were of good quality and really well seasoned. And can i say, the soup was amazing, its the first time that I did not add the maggi seasoning into the soup as the soup base on its own tasted so good I did not want to ruin it. Furthermore, everything is very affordable and I do seeing myself making frequent trips to my new mookata hideout!
wonderful meal. first time enjoying mookata. The season meat plus d premium beef is superb. Chili is spicy enough. thumbs up
Great portion of ingredients at affordable prices. I will definitely go back again!! They have fish skin on their menu which was sooo good!! The service was excellent as well 👍

This is really the best mookata I have ever had!
Great food great service!
Marination is awesome!!!

We had a hearty dinner. The sweetcorn soup is nice. The meat and seafood is fresh and well marinated. There is chilli sauce and sweet sauce to go with. Price wise - value for money. Will definitely go back again.
Went there as recommended by a friend, chicken and beef are very well marinated, soup was good and scallops were huge. Yum!!!!
Making reservation but was told that they are closed for renovation till Dec22. Its best to call before go down to avoid disappointment.
Food was really good and value for money. Owner is friendly and helpful
Fresh ingredient at a reasonable and affordable price. Well marinated meat! Definitely will come back again.
Good food, music, and vibe for a mookata at Toa Payoh. 👍🏻
Very fresh food, good portions and reasonable price. Totally worth it!
lovely place with great music and great vibes!!!! nice service too!!
friendly boss and staff, food really good!!
Great food and good services ~~
Great service and affordable prices

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: A no-frills but delicious and fresh meat Mookata place in a Toa Payoh kopitiam.  We realised that the meats were really fresh as they were not heavily marinated (to cover up using old meat) like some other places.  Loved the pork belly slices, the garlic pork collar and the streaky pork bacon.  However, the star of the show was their signature chilli sauce!  Would be great if this place could open until later as sometimes we love a good late night Mookata meal.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
-The food was fresh, and atmosphere was nice after dark. Handmade red chili, garlic sauce was excellent, in harmony with every other food.
-The staffs were not so kind. Long queue but you can make reservation. They have a time limit of 90minutes eating.
>>It’s located in hawker center where you can enjoy your saturday night at one place. How about eating Mookata as the first round and then moving to Tiger beer stall that is close to by for the second round?😂

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Personally felt this place was great, food and staff were amazing. But the killer was the extremely tight spacing between guests, led to space issues and particular group beside me kept looking over when their space felt threatened. Generally just bad environment and experience but food saved it.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Very crowded, we did the right thing to book in advance forces Sunday. It was full house.
The marinate meat were nice. Service staffs were attentive and fast. Good and spicy chilli with choice of non spicy dip too.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Excellent packages, food is very tasty also!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: This mookata is quite obscure unless you're familiar with the neighbourhood. Once I was there, it was not obvious that there was a waiting line unless you ask the staff and the wait was quite long almost an hour. The wait was worth it as the food was really flavourful. There is a hawker beside which you can fuel up a little while waiting too. There were 5 of us and each of us paid about $10 excluding the drinks which was a really good deal. Not a lot of drinks selection though.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Authentic Mookata meal in Toa Payoh. The price is pretty cheap for the volume we get. The ingredients are fresh and served really fast.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
