content: We were served pretty quickly despite the place being crowded. The food variety is ok. Lotsa meat and my children love the garlic chicken. We ordered at least 20 plates of meats, Vegs and instant noodle for 4 of us and the bill came to only $38. We were very full by then. Will definitely go back again.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: 1 of my fav place with BBQ & beer beer

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: This place is very crowded on weekends, especially at night. Expect to wait for 30min before finding a seat. Bookings can only be made for groups more than 10 people. The garlic chicken was our favorite dish and the beef was surprisingly tender. Paid about $13 per person.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Good place to eat mookata. Very airy and ample wind that makes you not feel hot. Come early as it gets pack very fast. Price is decent too.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: have been to three of their outlets, I prefer this outlet more as the environment is more spacious, feel less claustrophobic. food is good and affordable. well ventilated!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
They stand out for their tasty marinated pork. Go for both the marinated and garlic, won’t go wrong!

Only issue is the queue at dinner times and the smell that accompanies you after the meal.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: for hawker/coffeeshop is ok. value not that bad. but I feel seating slightly cramped as the tables and benches are fixed.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
A casual, friendly and cosy place for Thai steamboat aka Mookata. It gives a true blue heartlander experience within a coffee shop yet keeping up with the trends. Very affordable at $22 nett for a set for 2 pax excluding drinks. Ala carte option available.

Love the al fresco ambience even when it's bustling with people enjoying the food with family and friends. A perfect get-together spot.

Mookata is essentially a hot plate BBQ plus a ring of boiling chicken soup stock around it so you get to enjoy the best of both worlds. Grill your meat with the pork fat given, and boil your vegetables in the tasty soup that has no MSG. Then, dip your grilled meat into their homemade spicy chilli-and-garlic sauce. Heavenly! I could eat this all night.

If you need more food, simply add on other dishes at only $1.90 to $2.40 nett. The boss goes around chatting with patrons, and he does seem like he loves what he is doing.

Icing on the cake would be the quality draft German beers the coffee shop owner sells right beside. It complements the mookata perfectly.

Will definitely be back!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
The best mookata in town .Meat and seafood amd vegetables is fresh.Highly recommend the marinated pork belly and garlic pork/chicken, its tasty .The spicy chilli sauce the best!!👍🏻
Reasonable price and friendly staff. Always crowded and quite long wait but its worth it!! Recommended !!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
It was my first time to try mookata.
It satisfied me and ingredients were fresh.
Tastes so good
Recommended

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: super good & affordable, fast service too.. very convenient venue as well, always return 😁😁

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Staff had the audacity to chase me off because he wanted to go home. We still had a pan full of chicken meat and he walked up to us with his hand gesturing he is keeping the pan right now. Was utterly disgusted by this service provided by them. Thank you for the unpleasant evening. To the people out there, there are many other mookata places with fantastic services compared to them.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Had to wait for around 45 mins for seats as we came during the peak hour but the staff timely called us when our seats were ready.

The meats were marinated well and the vegetables tasted very fresh. Their pork collar and garlic chicken were by far the best tasting ones out of those that we ordered. It was also fairly affordable and ended up costing around $10 - 15 per pax.

Throughout our experience, the service staff there were very attentive and quick. They kept our tables clear from finished dishes and even offered to change our hot plate when he saw it was very used. Generally felt that they were rather warm and genuine as well.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Well, it's a mixed rating. Food was good and super cheap!!! 6 of us full grown adults, all the meat and seafood etc it only cost us $118.80!! Amazing! I think cheaper than supermarket and cooking at home!! I downside, this branch has no Aircon. Some people like it but i do prefer if they have AC and a super strong suction ventilator. Overall happy.. HAPPY CAMPER!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Great place to hang at the right time. Peak hours could get you to wait for 3 hours..
Good service, good food

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Delicious. May have to wait a while before getting seats. Very popular. Cheap.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Meat is good, would recommend going coffeeshop serves beer on tap too
Ordered the 2 person platter for 22

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Fresh ingredient at a reasonable and affordable price. Definitely will come back again.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: I love this Mookataaaa! Would say this is the most wallet friendly mookata store in Singapore. Meat were well seasoned and its so tasty. Can't stop craving for their galic chicken/pork. 10 pax is only about $150 when we ate so much! However if you go there without reservation, please be prepared to queue for quite sometime. Will strongly recommend this store! 10/10

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Very nice food the chill is the charm. Must try. Price is really affordable 😉 if know what I mean

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Affordable, great service. Now taking groups of 5. However, no reservations are allowed. You can have beer at the same coffeeshop while waiting.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Food are not fresh but if you just want to eat and gather cheaply, this is the place. I stopped going after the manager is cheapo and refuse to change a plate for me. Yes sure, you need to count the washing plates to earn more.   You lose your customers who visits you every other day within the week.  But it’s ok, many people still will eat at your place, you won’t close shop.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Would have given a 5 star but some of the staff were quite rude. Inexpensive and the meat was well marinated.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
mookata now opens at 12pm on all days
the food is super cheap really worth the money

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Love the food! Great staff as well. Usually crowded speacially weekends, but it's worth the wait!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Love to be here to enjoy a meal with family and friends! Place is kinda hot and price is reasonable!

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Crowded on a Friday evening as usual. Lots of diners who did not make reservations had to wait.

Prices were reasonable. Food items were as fresh as can be. Service was good with empty plates cleared regularly.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: My favorite place for Mookata. The place is getting packed recently and I had to queue for more than an hour to get a table. No reservations allowed.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Money worth it. Can add on more side with reasonable price. 5-11pm so better make a reservation if not long waiting list Esp weekend. 2 choices of sauces are match with soup and BBQ. Must try if you are the Mookata lovers.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Good pricing and tasty food...👍👍

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Management was bad we waited for 2hrs plus and they told us there were no seats but we saw them giving the seats to other people 😡Also before we when there we called and asked if we could book in advance they say it wasn’t allow rly bad management😡

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Mookata usually not my go to food but this place serve good quality ingredients for mookata with choice of a nice spicy or a sweet dipping sauce. Best of all, you won't break the bank even if you order the whole menu.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Didn’t took photo as waited too long And very hungry...
Maybe because I have tried other stall that suit my taste more.. a bit disappointed.
Soup is ok. The pan doesn’t stick at all, price very cheap compare to other place.
So that all for the 2 star.
Marinated meat don’t suit my taste.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Food nice & cheap high recommend

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: It was really value for money. For $22 a set for 2, you get 2 medium size prawns, some squid, pork belly, chicken, pork, 4 scallops, enoki mushrooms, cabbages, xiao bai chai, corn, wong pok and an egg. We did not order rice or noodles because the amount is perfect. The thai dip is superb and spicy too. Our first time there but definitely will make many return trips there. We call in advance but was told no more reservations were alot. Staff told us we can do a walk in. We went there at 9.45pm and got a table immediately. Best to avoid dinner time. Last order is at 11.30pm.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Great place for Thai mookata (bbq). Inexpensive and meat are well marinated. If local Thais choose to satisfy their mookata craving here rather than golden mile, you can be assured of the quality. Just be warned that long queues are expected on Fridays and weekends.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Pretty positive experience, staff were friendly and food quantity was fair and sufficient in my opinion. Pricing is reasonable too. Overall it is recommended, but not 5 stars because there was nothing special about it; other than it being a place for mookata. Also, take note that they only except cash.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: It's great. Had a perfect time there with delicious food. Although, it is located in a Kopitiam or Coffee Shop so it is not some fancy air conditioned restaurant.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Nice ambiance to enjoy mookata.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Loved the outdoor atmosphere! Very friendly husband wife owners. Taught us how to cook Mukata well. Thank you very much. Will definitely come back.

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: 2nd time coming here. The customer service is superb but their food marination standard has dropped alittle. Will definitely be back due to their friendly approach. Keep it up! 👍🏻

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content:
Bangkok Street mookata is probably one of the better places to eat mookata, the prices are quite cheap with less than $15 to $20 per person. The place is quite packed, I suggest coming earlier to book a seat as it can take anywhere between 30 mins to 1 hour for a seat depending on group size.

The portion for food is generous and good and for the large eaters, don't worry, you will be full. I have gone several times and it is always filling

restaurant name: Bangkok Street Mookata - Lor 8 Toa Payoh
content: Affordable and yummy! Remember to make reservation before hand

If you're a Thai food lover then I urge you to not missed out this authentic Thai food stall that is hidden right in the heart of toa payoh central. I have seen this stall around recently as it was opened not long ago after covid period. I think around May if I'm not wrong? The main chef is from Thailand so please be assured you're getting real authentic Thai food! This stall is located right in J99 coffeeshop together my favourite chicken rice stall... I have been eating chicken rice all along and haven't been able to try this Thai stall until today.

Their menu is very extensive and it all the usual Thai favourites can be found right in their menu. Their price are also super affordable and most of all, it is very very valuable for money. Basil pork goes for 5.50 and it comes with egg. You can also try out their basil prawn which is super good as well. Their prawns are not those small little shrimps as they used medium prawns which are fresh and crunchy.

The aunties here are also super friendly and courteous so don't be afraid to ask for their recommendations if you're a first timer like me. I will be back again to try their other dishes such as phad Thai and Tom yum soup. Hope they will survive in the long run as this stall is quite small and if you don't look around carefully, you might missed their stall as there are quite a nunber of stall in this coffeeshop.

Decent portion for $5.50 basil pork rice with egg.

Saw others ordering garlic pork which looks good with the fried garlic bits too. May try it next time!

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Went on a sat afternoon and it was quite busy but had many empty seats due to the rather large area. Feels like they might be a little short on staff with only 1-2 waiters that are always tending to someone, but still gets the job done rather quickly. Overall a rather satisfying meal, though the food is a little on the saltier side. Nice air conditioned cosy environment

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Air-condition restaurant. Place is clean and new, floor abit slippery but okay. The waiter are kinda attentive, even though they are very busy. If you having a la cart meal, do check if the servings are correct, they might missed one or two. Overall experience is good.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
This is my first time to try Toa payoh branch. Food are unexpectedly yummy!! Especially pork meat 三層肉 was well marinated 👍
You can choose to go Ala-cart or buffet, but I advise can go for ala- cart, unless you are super big eater😅
They serve ice cream too! You can just take by urself, that was so generous, but for ala cart can just go for one cup and $2 from 2nd cup onwards. Buffet is unlimited!
6 of us was just spent $101.81 in total! So cheap! Definitely will visit again ☺️

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
1st time here, on a Sunday evening.
Pretty big place but still got filled up.
They have buffet and ala carte and we went for buffet.

They do missed out an item or 2 of our orders. But not an issue, just reorder it anyway they serve the foods very promptly.

Don't forget the smooth texture ice cream before u leave; must-have items. Hahaha

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
We are here as it was raining and it felt like a perfect time for thai hotpot hahaha. Reminds me of the good old days at marina south Zhengfa.

Not much to gush about, normal fare. Good crowd for a rainy day ☺️

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Food is good as always. Must pick thai sausage, fake abalone slice, and seaweed for the soup. Would be so much better and comfortable if the cleanliness can be done better. Will still come back again for the food.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: This is the toa payoh central outlet. Clean, cooling environment, food is well marinated, fresh and tasty, and the service by the Thai waiting staff were warm and awesome. I would recommend that you guy provide tongs to bbq the meat. One can expect to spend around $70++ for 2 pax if you opt for the canned oolong drinks as well. Oh and they use gas instead of charcoal…which tastes slightly different from traditional charcoal mookata but still very good!

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Had been here a few times before deciding to drop a review for them.
The place is clean and well ventilated !

Most of the time we are here on weekend afternoon, slightly less crowded compare to night timing. There's aircon, so no issue even if you crave for mooks during lunch ~ Be sure to drink more water mannnnnn~

Staffs are friendly, but tends to get a little busy. So do give them more time for the preparation of your orders, or additional orders.

There's two type of choice for this mooks i believe. Buffet Style or Ala-Carte.

Most of the time, we will opt for Ala-Carte. Each plate range starting from $2.00 , if i didnt remember wrongly. On the pricey side, but for the location & air-con , acceptable la.

Love their minced pork & bacon cheese ~ The rest are good too, but personally skip black pepper, too heavy for me. But teriyaki pork belly is great !

There's also FOC ice cream for you, just help yourself to it.
Great fix for midnight cravings, open till 2am .

One pointers for all customers, do take note yourself on what you have ordered and no. of orders. Although as the usual practice, at most mooks, they will combine your no. of quantity into the same plate/bowl, sometimes there's still a few missed/overlooked orders. So if in any doubts do ask them, they are nice people so dont worry. At times, it happens to be a missed for our favourite meat, so we tend to realise.. Hahah, else i think its easy to overlook for everyone, too much selections too much orders. Just whack all the meat ! Hahah.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Decent mookata in the neighbourhood, price is affordable, $70+ for 4pax for ala carte. The cheese dip is a must get and the smoked duck too! Free flow ice cream too, the sauces are decent too. A nice place to satisfy ur cravings

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: First time visit here on weekday, food was tasty especially the sauces, if u like spicy, this is the best place to try it, price is affordable.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Tasty soup, affordable price, nice ambiance, meat are well marinated and it's flavorful... It's a nice place to connect with friends and families with sumptuous food.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Many choice of food to select. Love their teriyaki pork belly n chicken. Only that sometimes miss out order and need to ask again. Usually I pay using favepay n get rebate for my nxt visit but this month I came no more favepay.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Went there with family on 15 Sept for mookata. Food is not bad as usual though the ventilation there is slightly poor. I would recommend you to wear your most unpopular clothes there.
Special shout out to cheese bacon wraps, smoke duck , pork belly and basically all e meat haha.

The ice cream will be a good ending after dinner. Self service and you can grab a huge portion for urself. Additional to mention that the service stuff is amazing. Friendly and helpful. Feels like you are dining in Bangkok.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Came here more than 5 times but every single time, there will be extra 2-3 items added to our bill. It’s hard for us to remember every single item we ordered but we always order 10 items but somehow the receipt shows 13 items. At this point, it’s hard to believe that it is an honest mistake. Food is great but doubt I’ll continue to support. Service wasn’t great today; all male staffs and it is obvious that the they all seemed pretty confused. Still prefer the usual female staffs who are fast and efficient and always get the orders right.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Went in at around 5pm, there were not many people so maybe there is no time limit for the mookata. I was allowed to eat the buffet until 7+pm with my family. Even though there were only 2 or 3 waiters, we were serviced really promptly and kindly. Overall a pleasant experience. The food is slightly savoury and salty and has a very large variety of meat to choose from ( ranging from pork belly/slices/neck to lamb and fish)

However, the seats and space in the restaurant is slightly too narrow and squeezy, especially during busy hours at around 6pm onwards.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: First time visited this restaurant. Affordable price and spacious. Fast service and good for enjoying good time with friends.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Horrible Midnight experience whereby the Indian staffs are just bad at communication with customers and plainly just interested in sitting down with their mobiles than working. Management also didn’t give two hoots about running the place properly and just sitting around.

Ordered twice on the menu with several items and no updates on item that are unavailable. Had to take 3 staff to update me on closing timing

Staff constantly crowding over table when it’s near closing to pressure us to finish up quickly when no proper handover on what time they’re really closing. Everything was estimated.

Billing was horrible where items are just listed on how many quantities of the price tag we took which we can’t tally if the item is there on the table or just added randomly. Bill is not shocking but could use more work to let customers understand what is charged

Been to different outlets and also this outlet in other timing but never had this horrible experience even when it’s super shorthanded. Makes me think twice on whether I’m gonna patronise there as a fellow F&B server

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Not wanting to give a one star rating due to its facility being well ventilated and clean but the service must improve in order to prevent a future incident happening.

1) burner cooks slow that my table was seated for 3 hours in there.

2) we ordered buffet set but because we sat for 3 hours we could not order any more than we wanted.

3) we asked for another set of burner but was declined to unknown reasons.

4) we asked if we could change the buffet set to ala-carte but was also rejected as it was too late to do so?

5) we had 3 people sharing 1 burner but we spent 3 hours in there but did not even finish cooking our one and only order of meat.

6) if the Thomson outlet could change my ala-carte order to buffet because of their technical issues im sure the toa payoh outlet could do so too.

7) i spent $104 for 3 people ordering only $50+ worth of meat.

This is unfair as we could not order anything more due to the time and also the burner not being able to cook fast nor being able to open a new burner due to the manager saying so.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Pretty decent food and prices. Very good and quick service. Highball tower was a bit diluted,they added too much ice. If ordering ala-carte, please check cause they may miss out on some items/ give the wrong serving.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Prices are cheap. Food quality is mediocre. The amount of ice in the drink tower is amazing, basically you are drinking very diluted stuff. Go if only you are looking at cheap Mookata.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Food is good, the place abit too noisy for a proper conversation with friends. Please check your receipt. Went there 3 times, and coincidentally there’s extra dishes added to the bill every time , don’t pay extra for nothing

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Good choice for mookata due to...
Environment: Inside with aircond so won't hot and the smoke exhaust did the job. But definitely you clothes still smell smoky after that.
Food: minimum order of 10plate (exclude rice/noodles), most of the meat we order is tasty, soup refillable. Just nice for 2pax as we are small eater.
Sauce must try: go for special with add on garlic, chili, and lime juice.
Service: Fast, waiter are attentive.
Price: ~$30 for the one shown in photo (10plate+1rice). Depends what you order, range start from $1.80 (vege), $2 (Meat)~$4(special/seafood).

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
food was not bad a little bit pricey? but i think its the normal price?
has quite a wide variety and includes a drink bar and their in store washrooms
its a pretty good place to feel the restaurant vibe

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: First time visiting this neighbourhood mookata. Food is tasty, it's air-conditioned, prices are reasonable. But to be expected, it was massively overcrowded when we visited on a Saturday night--staff was running around all over the place trying to handle orders, customers were getting impatient, etc. We also ended up with stomach aches the day after, so can't say much about food hygiene. First and last visit.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
First and the last time dining here, service is awfully bad, staffs are not attentive although not much diners at that point of time.

Staffs are having lunch together and talking happily disregarding the customers in the vicinity. Nothing wrong to have lunch but I suggest having lunch at different timing rather than having lunch altogether.

Rice also tasted sour, almost feels like mayonnaise with rice.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
the worst mkt in sg. (only this outlet)
stuff was throwing ice at each other and making the floor wet while customers were just bedside eating. took forever just to get our order. VERY BAD HYGIENE.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Food is nice and portion is good, price is reasonable and the staff there are quite friendly but sometimes slow in attending to us

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Reasonable pricing. Food is rather delish. Really too few staff around.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Attentive staff, good food, spacious and air conditioned. Better than Golden Mile outlet!

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Horrible service, especially the chinese auntie, took my order and missed out a few items. Told the chinese auntie and missed item didn't come and had to prompt again. Bill didn't tally with my order, with extra items charged in it which I believe the auntie thought I was ordering more items instead of the item being missed out on their end? Ice cream is not free flow either. Definitely not coming back, unpleasant experience.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Latest venue .... not fully renovated as air con wasn't up though.. food wise.. is solid... In charge was kind enuff to explain that air con will be up in a weeks time due to renovation and apologised for any short comings during payment...

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Almost perfect Mookata experience 😁

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Supported them from last time 3 years ago in pasir ris all the way till I moved to toa payoh.

This time round unfortunately have to give a 1 star review as they decided to change their free flow ice cream to chargeable. Went there most of the time for free flow ice cream. Now no more so have to look for other mookata place.........

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Soup is almost tasteless. Meat normal, marinate not well enough. Spicy chicken cannot make it. A bit shock at d amount had to pay at cashier. No order list to verify.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Marinated meat is shiok! Air con environment! Get ready to smell like bbq!

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Ambience: 9/10
Food: 7/10
Service: 7/10
Price: 9/10

Previously frequent the branch at Bishan which located at a coffeehouse. It was very very humid and hot. But now they've shifted to TPY and its air-conditioned! The food is mediocre but the portion is quite big for the cheap price. Perfect fix of a meal on a rainy day!

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Best Mookata in tpy area! 👍🏻friendly staff and service is really good too. Initially my fiance and I ordered ala-carte.

Upon serving all of the food, one of the male staff (a little big size) came over and told us if we would like to change to buffet instead as it would be much more worth it. We're glad that the staff was kind enough to inform us.

Would definitely go back again.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Friendly and attentive staff. It was my husband and my first visit to this outlet at Toa Payoh. They really deserve a 4 stars (cleaniless, attentiveness, friendliness etc). We will definitely go back there for our next mookata session :)

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Environment not bad but food abit pricey..
I ordered ala carte instead of buffer style.. cashier should attach the order form with the receipt together so that we can tally with what we ordered..

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Fast service and yummy food

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Horrible service given, I usually don’t post reviews but this is the worst branch ever. To make reservations as well, they just left you seen on blue tick without confirming if your reservation is made. When you reach there, they said they didn’t get the reservation 😅 truly poor service

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Been here twice, service is always very good.
Food is also quite good, very lively environment to dine in

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Staffs are not attentive, was queueing at the wrong door for like 20mins and no one warned us about it  .. moreover, table was not  well prepared , soup only came in after 20min which only when we asked for it...

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Not that pricey and like eating mookata under air conditioning environment more important is they had exhaust over the table that help to minimise the smoky smell.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Portion was just nice. Price was OK to me.

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content:
Food quantity is good, sauces are nice and friendly staff

Staffs are prompted and courteous

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: abit ex even if prices seem cheap usually mookata i spend about 12 but spent 20 here per pax and their drinks are wayy to overpriced

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Nice Food service good and manager very friendly

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Nice food, friendly staff. Portion also more then you can eat

restaurant name: Siam Square Mookata - Best Mookata Restaurant in Singapore
content: Food was great and portion are quite big. Worth the money

Had the premium set dinner for 2 pax. The crispy papaya salad was nice, and crispy of course.
The steam fish was fresh, and a big slice of fish! Tom Yam Creamy soup was great too.
And choose 1 meat dish. We chose basil pork. Was nice, but I was too full to eat. Had it takeaway instead.

I ordered Thai milk tea but decided to add pearl. Staff gladly changed for me. Very good service. The drinks are served in takeaway containers and sealed with the machine to avoid spillage.

Overall nice restaurant, would come back again for sure!

I visited this eatery for dinner on a weekend and I must say that it was crowded. So I would advise that you make a reservation first before heading down or you will spend some time waiting. Overall customer service is good, the staff that attended to us was polite and gave good recommendations for the dishes and beverages. Ambiance wise, it was okay, comfortable enough to enjoy your meals. I ordered fresh oysters and they were awesome! A little salty but thick. You have to try it, words cannot tell how good that is. Their meat platter is another. Succulent and grilled to the right texture. Again you have to try it yourself, I really cannot find any words to describe it. Price, is rather affordable in opinion but worth the money.

Very high quality food yet friendly on the wallet. We ordered the 4 pax meal and have no more space for the oysters. Will come back again to try the Japanese oysters. Happy hour rate at only $2 per oyster. Staff are very friendly and willing to accommodate. Kudos to Jeremy for the good hosting!

First visit as recommended by a friend. Atmosphere was very cozy and comfortable. Ordered few dishes, fried sea bass and clay pot glass noodle is a must try. Even the Thai milk tea was almost identical to Thailand standard, make me feel like I’m in Bangkok.
Service was excellent as if you are in the land of Smiles.
Overall this place is strongly recommended.

Didn't managed to capture all the dishes that were ordered. the crab omelette is really good! A must try! Overall most of the dishes were pretty yummy and portion was good for 5! We ordered 3 rice/noodles, a meat and a side. Big eaters might want to order a little more! The ambience was nice and we saw that the menu has sashimi and oysters as well hence it's more a fusion restaurant. Friendly staff and service!

Very satisfying meal. Not disappointed after multiple visits. Always up to expectation. Very good to satisfy cravings for Thai food in the neighbourhood.

Highly recommend crispy papaya salad which elevates the usual papaya salad into something fun and indulgent, not usually found on menus. Great as a starter and adds a lot of crunch texture to your meal. Also recommend Tofu hot plate which comes with egg tofu, egg and some meat and seafood with comes sizzling hot. Great with rice.
Standard basil pork/chicken always consistent. Tom Saap hits all the spot for spicy Tom yum craving. Great balance or sourness and savouriness.

Love to end with my favourite red Ruby dessert. They usually serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for added creaminess.

Upon arrival at the restaurant, we were warmly welcomed by a staff, Thai. She was very smiley and friendly. The ambience was very soothing with Thai songs playing in the background. After looking at the wide variety of dishes on the menu, we decided to order the set menu for 4. The food was really good and well presented on the plates. I especially like the Thai milk tea and would bring my family and friends to try their food again.

great food! So flavorful and tasty~ staff are so nice as well! Will come again ~
second time here！even better!! Shout out to the sweetest girl here ICE! So kind and pretty and beautiful and thoughtful! Oyster here is so fresh and lightly sweet, good match with the sparkling wine! Cannot go south with the price, only 2SGD each! We ordered a dozen! Happy with our full stomach! Definitely will come third time!

Super Thai is indeed a hidden gem. It was my first visit and was impressed with what they got to offer. Food and drinks prices were reasonable and I will certainly be back! The staffs and crew were entirely Thai; dining there is as if you were in Thailand! Warm friendly and meticulous. Will certainty not be my first!

Recommended casual Thai restaurant in Aljunied area! The restaurant is clean and cozy with friendly staff. They also have quite an extensive menu, so it’s best if you come in a group so you can try more dishes ☺️

𝑭𝒆𝒂𝒕𝒖𝒓𝒆𝒅:
🦐 𝐏𝐚𝐝 𝐓𝐡𝐚𝐢 𝐰/ 𝐏𝐫𝐚𝐰𝐧𝐬 ($𝟏𝟎)
🌶 𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐓𝐨𝐦 𝐘𝐮𝐦 𝐆𝐮𝐧𝐠 ($𝟏𝟑)
🥢 𝐂𝐥𝐚𝐲𝐩𝐨𝐭 𝐆𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐬 𝐍𝐨𝐨𝐝𝐥𝐞𝐬 𝐰/ 𝐊𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐏𝐫𝐚𝐰𝐧𝐬 ($𝟏𝟒)
✨ 𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐏𝐚𝐩𝐚𝐲𝐚 𝐒𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐝 ($𝟏𝟏)
🦀 𝐂𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐩𝐲 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩-𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐝 𝐎𝐦𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐂𝐫𝐚𝐛 𝐌𝐞𝐚𝐭 ($𝟏𝟕)
🔥 𝐒𝐨𝐢 𝐀𝐫𝐨𝐲 𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐌𝐢𝐱𝐞𝐝 𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫 ($𝟏𝟔)

𝘛𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘥 𝘢 𝘵𝘰𝘵𝘢𝘭 𝘰𝘧 6 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘩𝘦𝘴, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘺 𝘵𝘰𝘱 𝘧𝘢𝘷𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘸𝘰𝘶𝘭𝘥 𝘣𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘛𝘰𝘮 𝘠𝘶𝘮 𝘎𝘶𝘯𝘨, 𝘊𝘳𝘪𝘴𝘱𝘺 𝘗𝘢𝘱𝘢𝘺𝘢 𝘚𝘢𝘭𝘢𝘥, 𝘔𝘪𝘹𝘦𝘥 𝘗𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 & 𝘊𝘳𝘢𝘣 𝘖𝘮𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦!

Don’t forget to get their Red Ruby too!! 💓

Chanced upon this thai food restaurant and decided to give it a try, the food tastes so authentic and the time that took the food to be served is almost immediate! The staffs there were super nice and pay great attention to our needs! I will come back to try more food on the menu! 👍🏻

Great Thai food. All the flavors are spot on. Fairly priced, delicious, and such friendly and accommodating staff. Highly recommend. Try the papaya salad, pork cheek, tom yum, heck - everything is great. Love the oyster and Prosecco for $11 on Friday. Super promo.

Had the premium set for 2 for lunch. Food was amazing, with the signature crispy papaya salad as the greatest highlight for lunch! Will definitely come back and try their crispy papaya salad with soft shell crab. Amazing service as well, as our needs/well-being/quality of food was checked on by the service crew.

First of all, the staff is very friendly. It was full house when I visit during dinner time as I didn’t make reservation but the staff still service me well to sit outside and introduce me their menu.
I ordered the premium dinner set for 2pax, food is good and appetizing and I think can serve up to 3 pax for the portion so it is totally worth with $39.90. I take away the papaya salad which doesn’t show in my picture as we can’t finish and it taste good too.
Will definitely visit again to try something else in the menu.
Is a nice neighborhood Thai restaurant worth visit!

An excellent Thai restaurant with an equally efficient staff.
Real authentic Thai food at a reasonable price.
Food quality was fresh & great .
Montark service was prompt & she would explain the menu to the uninitiated explaining how the dish is cooked.
I would highly recommend this place 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Wide varieties of Thai food selections. Nice ambience with aircon. They sell liquor too.
Mixed meat platter is mooping, lemongrass chicken and grilled pork neck.
Seabass with garlic is not tough.
Fried papaya salad with soft shell crab is special.
Fried omelette with crab meat is very flavourful.
We should have order some non fried dishes to balance the meal.
A place worth visiting. They have points accumulation system so make sure you order through qr code to have the points accumulation. We wasn't told and order taken down by waitress but boss Jeremy is good to offer he will settle it backend for us.

One of the BEST Thai Food in SG. Good and reasonable price premium set meal. Their ala cart menu is also good too. They serve Fried Papaya Salad - pretty special. The Seafood Chilli sauce is also very nice. Their staff is friendly especially Ice is very friendly and open for conversation. We will definitely return to try more of their Thai delicacies.

Affordable, delicious and very authentic tasting thai food. Restaurant was clean and well air-conditioned. Great place to grab a bite and chill. Loved their recommended drunken noodle which was spicy. Fortunately, me and my wife love spicy food. Their pineapple fried rice was bursting with flavour too. I'll definitely come back for more.

most of the dishes are good 👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾😋😋😋👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾
my personal must order dishes are deep fried seabass fillet, pork in spur sauce, pork cheek, deep fried pork w garlic, stir fried chicken w garlic, tomyam creamy, brinjal and lime juice.
Authentic Thai food. Good atmosphere. Spice kick is good. Thai ice tea is one of the best I've tried.
Reasonable prices great food. Pleasant environment for a Thai food. Dinner time could be quite crowded.

Thai food is known for being one of the popular food in Singapore. There are a bunch of Thai restaurants in here, but if you want to have some of the best Thai food available in Singapore, then you should go to Super Thai By Soi Aroy. The food is great and the price is reasonable. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try out some authentic Thai food!

👍🏽 Grilled Pork Cheeks - must order! Nicely torched and tenderness of the meat.

👍🏽 Premium Tom Yum Soup

👍🏽 Red Ruby - must order! Sweetness is just nice and the awesome taste of the milk. Most delicious red ruby dessert ever!

👍🏽Aurora Cooler - must order! Very special nice drink. Butterfly pea flower tea with lime juice. The pea flower gives a very fragrant taste to the drink unlike normal lime juice.

Follow reviewikr on Facebook and Instagram for more reviews.

If without Get Great Promotion will not know that nice THAI food hidden in such area.
Prices are reasonable and portion are huge too.
Must try the Papaya Salad and Pork Cheeks.
Wonderful Thai food and very friendly staff and service! The oysters were fresh and yummy. We also ordered grilled pork, steamed sea bass and pork trotters. All were good.

We came near closing and were welcome in.

Tonight dinning is fantastic, great service and delicious food but wondering if msg was a little over as We felt really thirsty after the meal

Parking
You can park inside Macpherson mall n walk over.

Will we be back?
Yes!  Food is nicer,  we just have to drink more water!

Recently visit and I must say if you want authentic Thai food to satisfy Thai food craving, here is the place! I highly recommend here and I love their quality dishes are all at affordable price plus the staffs are very friendly.

What I have,

Soi Aroy Signature Mixed Platter.
Comes with Moo Ping (pork skewers), Lemongrass Chicken and Grilled Pork Cheeks that are marinated for 24 hours. Once served the staff will torch the pork cheek on the spot to give that smokiness and melt in mouth goodness once you bite on while the lemongrass chicken and mooping are grilled to tender perfection.

Crispy Papaya Salad with deep fried soft shell crab!! This dish was probably the most unique out of all the dishes tried. A unique rendition of the familiar papaya salad that been battered and deep fried till crispy and atop deep fried soft shell crab. Have it together with the tangy and nutty dipping sauce, I'm in heaven.

Crispy Omelette With Crab Meat.
This is another of the stand-out dishes to me.
The fried egg is not only airy and fluffy, but very crispy and not being in any way greasy as well. The added crab meat atop, adds a distinct note of crustacean sweetness to the omelette and the crab meat itself is fresh.

Thai Steamed Seabass with Lime & Chilli.
Ocean fresh Seabass steamed in special lime and chilli sauce topped with SuperThai special sauce. I like you can opt for fish fillet or the entire seabass. Fresh, tender meat paired with the spicy sauce that keeps me eating non stop.

Seafood Tom Yum Soup.
It blew me away with its depth and bold flavours. Sour and spicy which goes perfectly with rice and the seafood is really fresh here.

Claypot Vermicelli with Prawns.
The prawns are fresh and succulent and the vermicelli is bursting with flavour from having absorbed the sauce. Pack a flavourful punch.

Fresh Oyster.
I'm very lucky that I went day they have fresh oyster and is so fresh when you dip with their sauce, you in ocean heaven!

Mango Sticky Rice.
Hard to give this Thai dessert amiss. I love this as it has the perfect firmness and sweetness of the Thai Mango thay went perfectly well with the perfect texture of the glutinous rice and coconut milk. This dessert is highly commendable.

Red Ruby with Coconut Icecream.
Coconut Icecream on top shaved ice, drizzled with sweet red syrup and fresh coconut milk. Topped with red rubies that gives a chewy crunch.

The Thai Iced Tea here is a must DRINK. Not too sweet yet strong enough taste of the tea aroma.

A place worth keep coming back to.

Ig: @zoey_belle_

We ordered the prosperity set menu for our reunion dinner.
Food is prepared rather fast and ingredients are fresh.
We have a satisfactory meal as all the dishes are palatable and tasty.
We definitely be back for more meals in the near future.

Overall it was a happy & very pleasant experience dining here!

Good job on the attentive & personable service by the team.

Enjoyed mooping, pork belly, mixed vegetables, pineapple rice, olive rice and mango sticky rice. My family members love the spicy lala, tom yum soup etc. I don’t take any spice so will have to take their words for it.

Ordered many dishes, too hungry to capture all snaps:)

Ordered the Tom yam glass noodle soup. The soup is rich and nice but too bad they only have glass noodles.

Find the Thai ice tea so so only so can skip.

The price is not too expensive so recommend to try. Not much parking so need to park at nearby hdb instead.

Delicious food .  Large portion of rice being served  , so you dont have to ask for  extra rice . Friendly lady staff asked - whether we need  extra soup or not ?  I Said ,”No”at the beginning but end up  finishing  all and have to  request again . Fish soup was full of Flavour 👌👌.

Good foods. Authentic Thai food. I enjoyed the food here and friendly staffs recommending the options and food serving as well.

Not so crowded for the store. The parking was quite full in the front on the store.

Price wise was ok.

Came again second time, ordered different dishes from the first one. They were delicious. The staff, same thing, was friendly. Green curry with the Thai omelet were good combination. Prawn was good as well,  easy to peel even with cutlery.
Authentic, affrodable and memorable Thai food worth coming back for. Many book reserve a table in advance. Had the two person set which includes Kang Kong, Fish Cake and Squid.
Service by Miss Tai is super friendly and welcoming. Food is excellent, even better than some famous Thai restaurant here and Bangkok. Must try the Prawn Vermicelli, Pork Platter and Fried Fish.
We decided to try this restaurant and was overwhelmed by the wonderful Thai experience. It brings back wonderful memories of BKK. 😍 I  will definitely recommend friends to drop by and try.
Super delicious food! Must try the Leng Sap, Steam fish and prawn glass noodle. Great service from Tai too! Must try the grilled squid too
3rd visit to Super Thai. Excellent dishes, at reasonable price. Servers are friendly too! Will try the oysters next time.
Yummy Thai food. Added extra dishes on top of the premium value set. Total bill about 130 for 5 pax.

Impressive menu with authentic taste. Service crew is overwhelmed but kudos to floor manager Vincent who will make it enjoyable. Tom yum going is super fresh, soup emphases the fresh seafood on its broth. Fried fish comes with killer chilli sauce mixed with fresh veg

Top fab and fav: unanimously the prawns tang Hoon. Takes in the wok Hei flavour from the claypot . Prawns are of large size and till just right. Crunchy and not overcooked.

Had some good oysters paired with Prosecco. Overall great experience . Just a tad too loud and noisy. Probably all patrons too excited about the food fed to them

U Should give it a try. Moo Ping ( pork chop skewers are a must.

Great place, excellent food! I was quite surprise that with such delicious Thai food, there wasn’t a crowd!

This is my second time visiting this place. They have different level of spiciness; local, Thai and super Thai. I went with the local version. Unlike many Thai food restaurants, their flavour will change with the spice level but this one maintains the flavour irregardless of the spice level.

The only downside is the fish. Tried twice based on different cooking style I guess they have still some rooms for improvement. Mind you, the fish is fresh and soft but I prefer it abit more crispy (deep fried fish fillet) and prefer a stronger flavour for chilli and lime fillet. Oh yes, you can choose either to order whole fish or fillet which many stalls doesn’t give this option.

I would still go back and try many of their other dishes because price for the food quality is a steal. Plus don’t have to queue to get a seat :)
Great food great ambience. The food are tasty and delicious that we foresee we will visit here again! Service was excellent also. Highly recommend!

Let me just quickly state that parking is going to be a pain. We had to park at the nearby HDB estate and walk over.

We had the prawn claypot with glass noodles which was slightly disappointing as there was no burnt taste that you would normally associate with a claypot dish. The prawns and noodles were cooked fine.

The grilled pork cheeks were quite nice although it was 99% fats.

The prawn cakes were perfectly done, light and fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Easily the best dish.

Personally I prefer the outlet at sim lim but this place was quite decent.

Have not tried other dishes but pad Thai with prawns was a great disappointment. Prawns are very tiny and the texture and taste of pad Thai is not the usual flavoured ones. For the price, it is not worth it.
Excellent food and a very friendly and cheerful host that gave good recommendations. Very unique take on Thai food as well.

Officially a fan of this place! 2nd time here and very impressed by the authentic flavours of the Thai food! One of the owners,Uncle Vincent, was really accommodating and friendly and takes the time to answer our questions and talk to us and check if everything is ok, even though the restaurant was pretty busy! Will definitely patronise again!

I live in the neighborhood near this restaurant and there are many thai places near by. Out of all, i think this one is the best one in terms of the authenticity of food, quality of service. The staffs here are so attentive and explain to you about menu very kindly.  Super Thai is a really nice place to dine in as well as to quickly pick up (they prepare it very fast) and bring home to eat.

They also have a super value lunch sets on the weekdays,  which makes my wfh lunch time very satisfying. Their chicken wings are to die for lol.

When i have home gathering, this food never went wrong.

Super authentic really delicious Thai food. Under-followed and with it’s jam packed flavors, we are definitely coming back here to try other dishes! Had the yellow curry seafood and the petai with prawns cooked in a unique style. Coming back! Thank you for the kind hospitality Jeremy and the team!

Came here for lunch, on a Sat afternoon. Very friendly staff. Loved the ambivence, mordern Thai themed decor with contemporary thai songs in the background made our lunch very enjoyable. We will be back!
Excellent Thai food, great service and great prices too. Will definitely be back!
Superb aroy food gave the authentic Thai taste yum! Staffs was friendly and the bistro was cosy 💯
We enjoyed the Olive Fried Rice, Steamed Lime Fish, Kailan with Pork, and Basil with Century Egg. Staff were friendly too!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Food was great and price performance ratio was good. Thoroughly enjoyed my meal:) Hotpot base was nice and also was something unique. Highly recommended and definitely will return

A shout out to new service staff Aiman for being kind, prompt and friendly when serving our table. We were really appreciative of him attending to us.

Meanwhile, appreciate if the management of Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot can look into the performance and conduct of service staff, Margaret. Throughout our 1.5 hour session dining at your restaurant, Margaret was bossing and instructing all your service crew around to clean tables, serve other tables while she herself practically contributing nothing at all for the entire duration.

When making payment, we feedbacked the above to the manager on duty. He mentioned the following
1) Prior complaints have been received against Margaret by both service crew themselves and customers.
2) Margaret is a service crew, similar to everyone else, and not a manager etc. Hence, logically, she should be taking a fair share of the workload

Hence, hope that management is able to look into the above, please.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
The deal was $35 NETT hotpot buffet with free flow drinks for 2 all day everyday! (OK, so the third of us paid ala carte lo 🤷‍♀️)
⁣⁣
Great service never goes out of style, thank you Shidah for keeping us as happy as our tummies! Our meal won't be the same without your friendly chatters and recommendations! Red Tom yum broth is a must-order! Love their Thai milk tea to accompany the meal, and we highly recommend the fresh fish paste! I'm hooked on the chicken cheese balls too and lost count how many I ate😝⁣
⁣
⁣Shidah's cheery disposition really rubbed off us and kept us happy throughout the meal! Thanks Shidah!
⁣

⁣⁣
⁣⁣

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Totally worth my time and pocket . Enjoy every moment , just one thing , plan what you want to eat to avoids too much leftover . Appreciate your food . Staff are very helpful and fantastic service by the staff . Thank you so much , i would love to repeat my visit .

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Food was delicious.
Staff were helpful and friendly.

I give it 3 ⭐️ because of the following ordering system issues:

Waited 30 mins before knowing that our order was not received.

Cannot amend number of items we ordered in the webpage

Received the wrong order.

Can encounter delay during peak hours.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: First hotpot experience and it was great! The soups were flavourful and the service was good. Location isn’t the most convenient but I would still recommend!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Not worth paying $25.90++ and another weekend dinner surcharge of $3++ per pax and another $10.90++ for premium items but the restaurant is short handed.

You have its staff doubling between Suki-Suki Thai and Siam Kitchen and honestly, you can get something comparable somewhere else at a more affordable price.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Friendly and nice staff.
Staff is supportive and quickly serving
Recommended for friends.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Our first visit was fine, but there are limited food choices and staff issue.

However we still decided to come again, only for the Sukiyaki soup base, but we were informed that it is only a promotional item.

Please bring it back. It is so difficult to find a halal hotpot restaurant which serves Sukiyaki soup base ( because it mainly uses wine ).

Thank you

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Nice place and nice food. Everything (soup, marinade, sauces) was the right combination of spicy, sweet, sour, salty. Can tell that they are a little short handed but it didn’t affect the food or service in any way. 👍🏻

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Had a family dinner here for 10 pax. Entering the restaurant was painless after reservations made earlier.
Service - I was disappointed with the lack of attention to our table and the very slow drip of replenishment food which we had ordered through the website. Initial round of meats and other condiments served barely covered the amount of people we had in our table which resulted in each person only having a piece of meat before running out. We had to order again through the website ordering system and waited more than 20 mins for them to actually give us more food. Regrettably this only happened after I had to literally chase down a staff at the other end of the place and complain.By the way I don't blame the staff for the restaurant being clearly short handed.
Foodwise the quality given was average at best which did not match the asking price for a buffet . For reference per head we were charged SGD 35++ per adult not inclusive of an additional optional charge of SGD4.90 ++ for free flow drinks / desserts. For that price in comparison would have expected prawns to be available but this was only available if you add a further charge for premium meat/seafood. which would have brought the price up per head to SGD 50++.You could get a buffet with oysters / prawn at a hotel at that price.
In conclusion I would not recommend the restaurant at this moment due to food quality versus price asked.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Not worth the price you pay. Very little choices. The price you pay for buffert does not include drinks or dessert which is not interesting at all (pay seperately). Will not come again.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Very bad experience at this outlet on a sunday night, nearly empty. Food was decent but service by this older chinese? auntie waitress, Jov was hideous. Jov was very rude and constantly staring down at us close to us from the corner. The restaurant was empty, Jov. We can see you.
When we flagged her down asking for refill or utensils, she repeatedly exclaimed shes busy. The restaurant was almost empty, about 20% full.
My previous review was longer and got removed, but my experience stands. This waitress Jov has a bad attitude.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Same style as suki ya but with thai flavours. The service was a bit slow at first, but after that it was excellent and attentive. The food is great for the price. Best place to be for cheap buffet. You can't beat this restaurant based buffet at these prices.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Service staff was great on 25may's dinnertime, everyone was very friendly and efficient as well. Food not amazing, couple of items not replenished since we stepped in and taste wise also just mediocre, but soup base actually quite authentic....

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Great service. The grilled meats were delicious. At a good price point. Service staff were wonderful and friendly!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The food there was delicious. The manager there , Mr Theva was very kind and attentive. My friend and i had a good time dining at suki thai !

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Place just converted to Thai Hot Pot recently.  Price is reasonable only if you have Safra member 20% discount. Soup base is better compared to previous Suki-Ya but limited choices of ingredients. Believed its Halal certified so no pork served. Service average due to insufficient manpower.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Not worth it all.
Food were meh, same as their sukiya outlet.
Only can order max 3 condiments out of the 5 they have.
Service really terrible from one of the female service staff. We asked for chopsticks but she says she’s busy. So we took from another table without anyone. Then she came over to scold us and said “you cannot take from here, we already lay out properly, if you want ask from me”. But we already did ask…? And she said she was busy…??? Confused by her service and action. Really not needed. She could have just replenish the chopsticks on the empty table without saying anything.

They don’t provide serviettes/tissue as well. Spoons were super dirty, didn’t dare to ask for another one cause they so fierce, I scared.

Paid ~$75 for 2 person weekend dinner. Super not worth it!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Its not what I expect to have here , its a wonderful moment my stomach could have with fresh Wagyu and delicious choice of seafood . If youre grill and steamboat lover , this is the place you want to try . Oh ya , thanks me later , lot of offer&promo going on . Watch em out .

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Very good service. Staff were efficient and kind when serving. Food was delicious too

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Don't even deserve a star, can't even be bother even to take a photo. Standard , service as well as quality is pretty bad for an big restaurant. Soup base tasted like boiling water vegetables is as big as those that are selling in the market. Would love to comment more on facts however it doesn't worth my time to do that so friends all I can say Is visit at your own risk.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The staff by the name Shidah, very friendly and excellent customer service. All the other team members are very welcoming and efficient!! Thank you suki thai toa payoh!!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Pros:
1. Had a great dining experience. Staff are attentive, foods are fresh, taste good.
2. Love the basil chicken and tom yum clear soup base.
Will come back again for sure.

Cons:
1. Limited selections but definitely worth it with the on-going promotions.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The staff are friendly and helpful. Overall experience was good.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Theva portrayed a very good service. Went the extra mile to assist us. Good job knowledge and very friendly.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The staffs were attentive and topped up the food regularly. The meat were tasty too!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Had a wonderful family anniversary celebration last weekend. The working staffs were nice and helpful.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
The staff there were very kind and helpful, especially Jov! She was super friendly and made our experience there great. She's the kind of staff that would help secure loyal customers to your restaurant. Hope she gets rewarded accordingly :)

The food here is really q good for the price you're paying, definitely worth a try if you're around the area

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Always delightful experience! Service staff is so friendly and food is always on point!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Not too busy. The soup was nice. Staff was friendly & helpful. A nice place to have dinner with friends or family.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Nice and spacious, suitable for family.
Went with a toddler and the food was suited my toddler’s palate.

Good choices of variety of meat/ veg/ fish cakes/ mushroom.

Love the Thai soup base, had the sweet Basil chicken and Khao Soi as recommended by the staff, and it was really good.

Best service staff! Was attended by this staff Hock Seng, very attentive and he personally reccommend the soup bases to our family.

Would come back again.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
I would got to say this place is really a value for money if you are into eating loads and is tight on budget. They are running a promo at $35 for 2 person (Eat-all-you-can).

Try it!

The downside is that the place is severely understaffed. But the people did their best to help you as much as possible. So kudos to them! :)

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Service was good, staff explained on the menu in details.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
This Thai hotpot located in SAFRA, currently offers 1for1 thus the price is very friendly but still can only beffet-ala ka while they have only 2 waiter/waiteress helping at the dinning area... So, from order to be served, it takes.quite some time and usually the meat plates and short to serve, order the 2nd round needs to wait for 15.mins more. However 1for1.only dine in for 9ne hour... Which makes us very uncomfortable during lunch time.
The food themselves, all the those we can buy in the supermarket, the fish paste is too moistured so after cooking, the taste is very weird...

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Good food, for the price extemely worth it.
Service was fantastic... we were kinda late yet the Jov crew maintain professional service level to serve us instead of rushing us.. I really like the different sauces that they made for us.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Shidah and Shariff have been wonderful while we are at Suki Suki Thai Safra Toa Payoh.
Food is fresh and tasty. Soup base was super refreshing especially Red Tom Yum. Thank you so much for the great service.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Suki Hotpot had reasonable variety and quite authentic. Atmosphere was great with attentive staff, especially Shidah, who made us feel very warm, welcomed and very attentive to us. 😁

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Me and my group of friends were having dinner at suki suki Thai @ Toa Payoh on 26th March 2021. It was a Friday night and the restaurant seems pretty crowded. The staffs are especially short handed due to covid measures. Hock seng was very patience with us. He was very friendly throughout and guide us on how to order through the QR code. His service was very prompt too when we ordered the drinks. We had a very special night celebrating my friend birthday. He made the celebration even more memorable. Thanks hock seng for your service! Stay cheerful!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Good food, great Staffs...
We have this "table captain" Hock something...  Who is attentive...  My friend drop a chopsticks and bowl loudly one the floor and voila!!! He rush to us and hand up another one set and rush off to another task..

Thumbs up this the service!!!

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: All staff with excellent service especially a guy named Shariff! I requested Thai milk tea with less ice and everytime I want to refill water, he will make sure the ice not fall into my drink.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Queuing system sucks. Call and ask but we aren't allowed to make reservation. Waiting outside the store for more than 45 mins. They should have a queuing system to get a queue number. No air con no chair at the waiting area. A waste of time.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: A good place to chill and enjoy your food. A good ambience. The staff hock seng is very polite and courteous. Keep it up! Things to improve more choices of food would be good :))

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Conveniently located inside TPY Safra. Staff are extremely friendly and polite, able to notice any needs you have before you even ask for it. Drinks are refilled proactively before they are empty. Food tastes really good, Sweet Basil Chicken and Red Tomyum are really worth trying, highly recommended place.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Soup base tasted like instant soup paste. Menu pricing too complicated to understand. Don't be too deceived by their advertising photos.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Dined here with friends and was really impressed with the service. The food was decent - but the services of the waitresses - atie- was top notch. Very helpful and attentive to our request.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Good experience at suki-suki Thai serve by Staff Shidah. She's very friendly and attentive. Thank you for the great service.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
System is not very friendly, but staff is nice to guide us. It's very nice to see a group of cheerful group helping us not so up to technology batch..

Seems abit under Staffs as they are moving up and down very quickly...

Overall, experience is great.. Jus not very good with thr phone ordering.

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The food was delicious and the ambience was great! The staffs, especially Hock Seng, served us well and was friendly too! It was overall a nice experience 😄👍🏻

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Gd customer service by Ms Jov and her team. The food was excellence, gd value for money. Highly recommended and will come back again. Thumbs up 👍👍👍

restaurant name: Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: I want to respond to hock seng on the 27th. He serves very well and is very enthusiastic. This is my first visit here. Thank you for introducing the soup and food. I will come back next time. 🥰

I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was, given that the store front looked rather assuming and there wasn't a snaking queue.

We ordered the set meal for 2 as we didn't want the hassle of deciding which dishes to order. The set meal came with 2 large bowls of rice, chicken, crab/fish (can't remember which) cakes and Tom yum soup. The portions were generous and is suited for a dining party of 3.

I loved the tom yum soup went very well with the rice and there was so much flavour. There were squid, fish and vegetables in the soup. The crab/fish cakes were not too oily and they went very well with the dipping sauces provided.

All in all, the meal was value for money and we'd definitely return again if we are in the area.

Ordered the pineapple fried rice, basil pork rice, tomyum soup. All dishes were flavourful and good! Staff is also very friendly when taking our orders, and also helped to bring the food to our table. A hidden gem in the area.

Was recommended by a friend and I cannot stop going back.

It’s definitely a hidden gem and the thai food is bloody legit. The broth for the steamed fish was so refreshing filled with lemongrass, mushrooms and it was invigorating with every sip!

Tom yam soup is definitely one of the better ones here, it’s thick and not watery just as how it should be.

They’re generous with the size of the omelette too and to top it off, the owner is such a sweet lady.
Run by a Thai couple, business seems good. Ordered the pad Thai for $5.50, and it has ketchup sauce instead of usual soy sauce. Will try others next time.
Omelette is delicious with chicken meat and preserved radish (i think). Tom yum soup is not too spicy but still flavourful. Will come back and try other dishes next time.
Fried dishes such add Kuay Teow and Sambal Kang Kong full of Wok Hei and robust aroma.  Reasonable priced with generous serving.
Great food at very reasonable prices. Just happened to stop by and try. Recommended ! Friendly service too~

Delicious and value for $!

Recommended if ya looking for affordable Thai food

Good food value prices. The steam fish was fresh and tasty. Grill squid is out of this world good. (To note, it doesn’t taste as good when you tarpow). And the tom yum soup packs a punch too.

Nice hardworking and friendly couple. Please support.

This is the first time im taking photo of my delivered food.

Ordered via foopanda for lunch. I could smell the food as soon as I opened my door. Food was still very hot and very well packed. Tom yum was wrapped and no spillage.

Food was tasty and perfectly spicy as I asked for extra chili. They also gave chili at the side. 2 large prawns in the soup. Perfectly frid egg. It is worth it for delivery of hawker food. Thank you for cooking.
Came here to try something else but it was closed. This was surprisingly good and value-for-money, although the egg was overcooked. Also suggest giving less rice to minimise food wastage.

Found out about this hidden gem from a Straits Times review. Ordered their BBQ pork collar (was recommended their pork neck), Tom Yum soup with prawns looked great & tasted great. And added their Thai omelette rice $5.50.

Highly recommended & way superior to anything you can find at Thai enclave at Golden Mile. So authentic, cook is Thai. Legit!

Tried this after seeing good Google reviews and boy was it spot on. Operated by a Thai couple in a modest Balestier road coffeeshop stall, there’s a wide variety of food on the menu. We had to do takeaway during this period but it didn’t affect the quality of the food. We particularly loved how flavourful the Tom Yum was, and it was packed full of ingredients such as fish slices and squid. The basil chicken wasn’t too spicy but it managed to pack a nice punch, especially when I had it with the Tom Yum. The pandan chicken was succulent. Unassuming Thai comfort food. Overall a great experience and we will be back for more.

The pictures don’t do justice to the food as they were taken from a video we shot via screen grab (forgot to take photos).

Go for their Steamed Fish with Lime. Really pack a punch! We also had the omelette with rice which was yum too. Easy and affordable menu, but delivers in terms of taste, service and quality. Plenty of seating space and a drink store where you can order something to put out the Thai spicy sour fire 🔥 Highly recommended.

We first patronised their stall back when they were at Katong Student Hostel. Visited them again when they moved to Clementi. Now they have moved to Balestier and it's the third time we have looked for them. Now this says something about their food. My absolute favourite dish is the honey chicken, you can ask for the rice version too. Their Phad Thai, mostly different from others with their signature wet style with tomato based sauce is worth mentioning too. This is unusual from most Thai food places.

Disappointing food standards and overpriced.  Oyster Omelette is just fried egg and canned oysters placed on top of it, definitely not the way it is cooked in Thailand.  Basil Leaves Pork with rice and egg, another dish that is not cooked Thai style i.e. has carrots and other veg mixed into it that ruined the taste, and very overpriced. Fried Kai Lan using kai lan that is many days old, not fresh, tasteless and overpriced dish.  Not recommended at all.

My expectations are high because of the reviews and is unfortunately unmet. Though it is not that bad but it's hype around here are not all that.

The Tom Yam is unlike other thai restos that are all just chili. The broth is tasty and rich. Overall, it's s ok. I'll give a higher score for the Beef Kailan due to its serving size and taste.
Steam fish was very good, ok for others such as tang hoon salad (too spicy, suggest to deliberately say low low spice if you wish), 'deep fried pork with rice' is ok, rice was rather hard.
Second time here - food is amazing, large portion and cheap. Seating at coffee shop is also easily available and clean.
Super value for money and authentic Thai food. Had tomyum soup and mango salad. Even though we ordered the smallest sizes, the serving is generous. They are friendly and have great service too.
Good taste like eating in Thailand, cheep price but big portion... highly recommend.
Great place, nice food!! Will definitely come back again!!
Best Thai food outside of Thailand and better than much of the Thai food in Thailand too. Great price, lots of food. The green curry is fantastic.

This food stall serves the most authentic Thai cuisine by far.
The food is always fresh and tasty, whether it is takeaway set meal or dine-in ala carte dishes.
Was pleasantly surprised that the Thai lady boss cling wrapped the plastic container of green curry that I takeaway and eliminated the common problem of spillage. Strange that other hawkers don't do the same.
Loved it! Authentic Thai flavours and reasonable prices.
Of the four Thai food stalls in the area, this one is the best and most affordable.

I have been eating their Thai food since they were at Clementi! So glad that they have received the recognition that they deserved! Value for money, good portion, delicious, authentic Thai food! Service is good too :) my go to place for good Thai food for sure!

My favourite Thai food. Found it a month ago and I think has been eating there at least 3x a week! Loved the steamed fish with lime, basil minced chicken rice, tom yam, seafood tanghoon, green curry chicken, tanghoon salad... go try!

You can tell the food is authentic by the Thai couple running the stall. It's not a restaurant but a self-service stall in a relatively large coffee shop. The food is like that served at road side stalls in Bangkok, which is to say that it's delicious. Prices are very reasonable too. However, be prepared to wait a while for the food, as there's only one cook and business is brisk.

Taste good, price good.
Thai green chilly source excellent

We have found this place by chance while strolling around Blaestier Road. Since then we never stopped going back. The food is delicious and the owners are a lovely couple that make you feel at home. Cannot recommend this place enough!! 😍
Best steamed fish ever. Been patroning this joint at least once every two weeks. 👍🏻

The Couple is friendly and nice. The food is average in comparison as they are many good Thai food in Singapore. The portion is not big as stated. The portion is just right. I don't consider cheap there are restaurants in Singapore who serve cheaper and equal quality Thaifood Nahkron, Nangfa, Soi 47, Just Thai with better environment . But still will support as I stayed around that area.
Good quality, generous servings, affordable prices. What more can you ask for
What can I say? Food even better than shops in Golden Mile. That is the ultimate compliment! Great service too!
Food is really tasty, very authentic thai food. Ladyboss is also very friendly.
Very authentic Thai Food. For someone who eat Thai every other week, I rank it amongst one of the better ones in this area. Won’t be disappointed, noticed that the crowd are getting larger.
The couple chef is very cute and the food is priced even cheaper than normal zi char. Everything is around 5-7 for staples and less than 25 for fish. Tasty, good service and cosy
Fantastic food and fantastically priced. Authentic Thai food cooked by Thais. Highly recommended!!
