Very authentic Thai food. Must order lemon steam seabass. Fresh n soft. Price reasonable.cuttlefish also tasty. 👍👍👍
Staff came to order for us but he was so slow working and then, curry and nam bread, chicken were not hot. It was feel disappointed.
Yummy and generous portion too!
Great customer service, average Thai food pricing! It's a must try, it's so fresh and authentic!
Love this place. Super well cooked food and super sweet couple. Love the pad thai!
Hw fried tang Hoon NOT oily!!!I don't understand 😳🤔😝🤪
The dishes are very delicious and rich in variety, which is suitable for children to eat. The price is also very cheap, fair and very good.
Food taste great, portion is big and affordable. Waiting time is quite long during peak hours. Will definitely go again.
Fresh, tasty, authentic, down-to-earth thai food. Highly recommended! Especially the tom yum and steamed seabass :)
Decent taste thai food
Having moved from Clementi, my housemates and I chased the storeowners to Balestier. The food prices stayed the same (i.e. very reasonable for the quality). We'll make it a monthly haunt!

Authentic Thai eatery hidden along a stretch of shops. I did not realize it was a Thai eatery until recently I chanced upon it on Google and went to find it. I ate there with my colleague and we find it good and authentic. The portion is quite decent also.
I came back in the evening to take away pad Thai, pineapple fried rice and fried garlic pork for dinner. Generous portions and tasty. Slightly disappointed with the fried pork as it was soggy - might have been due to the take away journey.

Overall recommended and I will come back to try other dishes

The design of the stall is amazing. Food taste is superb and plenty of variety. They even have set meal for couples. Which I personally think is a good deal and good idea for those who not sure what to have. Thumb up for this place. Parking is also convenient and they also accept non cash transactions. Which is a good thing.

Lunch crowd filled this small eatery. Food is good but as its crowded, service would need some improvement
Quite authentic Thai food. It’s also affordable.
But at this industrial area, go if you are around the corner

An authentic Thai restaurant: 🇹🇭
- Thai servers: checked
- Thai songs in the background: checked
- Photo of the old Thai King on the wall: checked

I ordered their Pad Thai ($6.50) and it was flavourful - the serving was generous. I did a walk in slightly before 12 on a weekday but the place was soon fully occupied with the lunch crowds.

This is without a doubt an authentic Thai food place by Thai folks. Even the simple looking hor fun already tastes better than many zhi char, and the Pad Thai is damn shiok. Fried rice also shiok. Will return to try everything else.

Came on a weekday night. Not much queue and food came quite fast. Big portions for each order. One portion definitely enough for two small eaters. Pad Thai was flavourful and pineapple rice come with lots of pineapple. 👍

Great quiet corner for Thai food! Introduced by a food friend to come here for affordable Thai cuisine. We got many dishes ( close to 6) and paid only about $25 - definitely overate.

You must try their Omelette wrap With seafood in tomato sauce. Fillings comprised seafood and mushroom chunks that are really tasty!

Dry sukiyaki glass noodles is also cooked pretty well, and you get a good mix of vegetables, chicken and prawns/springs.

Will definitely be back if I’m in the area!
Super economical and delicious. It is just small and abit noisy during lunch time.

Food was average. Had the tom yum soup, basil chicken and glass noodles with prawn. Nothing memorable and lemongrass drink doesnt even have the lemongrass taste. Though price is relatively affordable but there are several other affordable places with better tasting thai food. The staff, this local girl was friendly and nice but thai lad( shld b the boss) was quite arrogant and rude. We wanted to take away 2 dishes as we couldnt finish, staff was kind to suggest she will pack separately but charge us 30c, but eventually the boss insisted that we shld be charged 60c. We r fine to pay cos it wss the staff that made the suggestion in the first place, but eventually 1 of the boxes wasnt even a proper box but a more flimsy plastic. If u wanna charge have thr decency to give a proper box. boxes need to be paid for in cash as well.
Very nice wohei taste of the omelette. Blew me away! Very authentic thai taste and thai ambience! Will visit again

Delicious food and the portion is generous. The fried prawn tasted fresh and well crisped and that’s  a  clear testimonial of the good cooking skill.   The rest of the seafood in our Tom Yum soup were fresh too. Well visit again!

I hope the boss will read this. It will be my first & last visit for my family. Young Chinese lady service staff with black frame spectacle was extremely rude & impatient while taking our orders. No welcome greeting but remark like “I ALREADY SAID there is no other dessert except….”. She looked agitated. How can one hear clearly if she mumbled behind her mask and standing a distance away?  Only repeat once and she can be so curt & rude. A polite crew would reply “sorry our desserts are not available today.” When making payment, she didn’t smile nor say something nice, eg thank you, please come again. Pure transactional like a robot. You have lost a customer who is staying nearby & is a food panda regular. If you are not happy, you quit. Please don’t vent your frustration on your customer, who is supporting your business. The only choice for dessert was tapioca which tasted so hard. Worst I have ever eaten.

Tried the glass noodles, mango salad, stir fried kang kong & clear tom yum soup with prawns. All was wonderfully cooked except the soup was not really to my liking as compared to Soi Thai. Price was reasonable and serving portions were generous.

Great for value Thai food!
Nearest MRT is Taiseng, a short 100m walk and you’ll see a stretch of food stalls.
Place is cozy, and has very Thai ambience. Food is 5/5, but space is limited. Service can be better. Overall, food is good! Great cost performance value.
The food is authentically Thai but some dishes are overly spicy or sweet. Perhaps this is how it's done just not too suitable for my liking.

Authentic, delicious Thai food

Pad thai
Egg wrap with seafood in tomato sauce
Kai lan
Basil chicken
Clear tom yum soup

All are good 👍

Good selection of Tai food. We tried Hor fun, basil rise and some fried eggs. The taste is good and close to authentic tai cuisine. The price is also low for the food and table service. Also to surprise dishes came with high portions. Staff is also nice and friendly, did not hesitate to help on the menu. Can become crowded during lunch hours and have to wait to get a table. Can recommend this place

I was a regular here, Food is good but as time flies by my favourite orders are always(!) out of stock (Mango sticky rice, fried prawn cake) and today coke was out of stock too. Service is tremendously bad :) singaporean lady with black specs was absolutely rude, banging the fridge door, raising her voice telling us to take a smaller table, almost shouting at us to speak louder as she says she cant hear us:) the way she spoke to us was literally telling us that she’s unhappy having us here, totally fed up. Came in with a good mood but everything deteriorated after experiencing their worst service. Pretty sure the owners here dont really care about their work attitude as i have heard my friends saying it gets worse as time flies by.
Good and authentic Thais food at a reasonable price. Had the Phad Thai and Tom yum soup. Both are good. Will go back again.
Chanced upon this restaurant when visiting this area for a course. Restaurant serves authentic thai food at a really affordable price. Omelette was amazing!
food taste It very like Thai food in Thailand sell, but waitress services are bad
Great food, great service. Tom yum seafood noodle is really...good!
The food is really good and reasonably priced. The place is very popular with the office crowd so expect a wait during peak lunch time.
Authentic thai food - enjoy the thai basil pork rice

Servers were not friendly and one of them was in particular, arrogant and haughty.  We ordered green curry which was soupy and bland, chicken pieces tough - one of the worst i ever had in Sg or anywhere in the world. Tom yum soup was also bland but seafood was quite fresh. Only the kangkong was decent.  Maybe should have ordered pad thai which seems to be getting rave reviews.
reasonable prices and fast service! food is delicious too.

Been a regular there as food is good at the place. But, there are important things to improve on (especially lately).

Have been there since pre-covid, it’s a simple cozy place. Food is affordable, tastes authentic and very delicious, always enjoyed going there. But recently, it has been disappointing on more than 1 occasion.

On all of these occasions, it’s the same problem - service. Somehow they hired someone new (note: the last time we went, she’s not new anymore. She should have been working there for close to half a year already). This specific staff always got our order wrongly, either forgetting one of the dishes that we ordered, serving dishes first to those that came in later or once even, serving our dish to the wrong table. The people from the table were unaware and touched our bowl. When we pointed that out to the respective staff, she took the bowl from them and passed it directly to us.

In a situation like this (especially when it’s covid period), shouldn’t she change the bowl to a new one before serving it to us? It’s basic hygiene standards. And when we pointed out that we were not comfortable with eating from the bowl that other people have touched it already, she and the kitchen staff started shouting back and forth in Thai language in front of us. And the kitchen staff even banged the table at the counter more than once while shouting or complaining. At certain point, even glaring at us. As if it’s our mistake.

Ever since then, I have never felt comfortable going back again. I really hope they improve on this staff issue. It’s such a waste when their food is really good.

Just a note, I have tried giving chances and returned to patronise the store after I noticed the drop in their service. But it just gets worse every time. We also patronise around near 8pm when crowd is slower. This didn’t happen when it was busy.

And no, I do not expect very good or impressive service. But just simple service like getting our food right, proper hygiene and proper manners.
Food was indeed authentic and service was great :) Had a really good experience here
That egg. Crisp ring of skin and runny yolk. Every dish came over well cooked with balanced seasoning.
affordable authentic thai food. i would prefer this over Tok Lae Dee in Tai Seng area

Friendly Thai staff, quite busy , good food
Order their garlic fried pork and fried chicken wings
Tasty and affordable priced Thai food. The portions are generous too.

Ordered their basil pork, tasty and good portion. Good tomyum soup with quality ingredients in it. Overall worth going back and recommendable!

Only downside is long waiting time - Waited for almost 40mins for my takeaway during lunch.
Affordable and authentic thai food

Ordered the glass noodle prawns and squid in lime broth. Both are so good! The price is a bit steep for the noodle prawns, as there are only 3 prawns of medium size but the portion is a lot. The squid broth is amazing and is one of their signature dishes.
Not bad, but taste not heavy compare to malaysia thai

The food and ambience was pretty good. I really liked the sukiyaki glass noodles. The green curry was slightly underwhelming as there was too much coconut milk in my opinion. But on a whole price was worth the meal!
Staff here are very nice and patient. Food was delicious.
I order their rice and noodle dishes from here regularly. Food is delicious and portion sizes are generous. Price is very value for money. Highly recommended.

Tried during lunch hour. Pad Thai served hot and tasty. Fresh prawns. $6 for a big plate of Pad Thai and $1.80 for hot thai milk tea.  Prices are Nett. They are generous with the portion. Looking forward to bring family along to patronise again.

Let's see... How much would you have been charged to eat such street food in Bangkok. I was under the influence that if you had ordered a fish, a meat, a veg and an egg... You will be looking at 50 bucks in bkk. Well, I was filled at 45ish and 4 pax. What else is there to complain?  The portions are decent, the taste is authentic. I don't know what others are looking at for their Thai food. But I tasted Thailand the moment I entered the place.
Really good Thai food at reasonable prices (all nett, which is great). They’ve got some decent lunch set menus too. Quite a small space so a little hard to get a table with the weekday lunch crowd.

small place. one side nobody but made everyone sit on other side. some patrons even sat back to back but don’t seem to mind. cashier takes off or pull down mask whenever she wants. when i ordered she wasn’t even wearing. the cooks don’t wear too. saw his head popped out for rice. also saw him putting mask on when he was going outside for a break. hope they don’t talk while cooking. but then again if cooks perspire and they go into foods, same same. thermometer for show only but also ineffective in singling carriers of viruses anyway.

outside says cash only but accepts grabpay.

food was quite nice. authentic as they all look and sound thai. basil pork rice was like a simple home cooked meal. makes me want to get my own minced meat and make.

This place is not for couple. Well that's becos it serves up so many varieties of Thai food that i feel a couple will never truly be able to enjoy it's offering on the first visit..always enjoy the dishes while it's hot.
Authentic Thai food with no service charge and GST.

Ordered on grabfood. Was a very delightful meal. Had the tomyum soup which did not leave me thirsty and was a good balance of spicy and sour and the seafood was not mushy either. The vegetable had a sauce tht went well with the rice.

Ordered a Tom yam noodle soup, non spicy clear pork (ball) soup, mango salad, cold Thai milk tea and fresh coconut, between the two of us and the bill only came up to $27.80. The salad was crunchy, and had the right bland of spiciness and soreness. The Tom yang noodle soup was lovely as well. The clear pork soup. . I like my soup spicy so between two soup I much prefer the tom. Yang, however th epotk balls were very moist and tasty and I'm sure kids would that. I'm going back again for  sure.
My wife is a Thai food lover. We tried a number of Thai restaurants before and this is one of her favourites. So it's good enough for me. And more importantly, it's affordable and nice.
I visit frequently to order the lime steamed fish
This place is run by Thai folks. Quite authentic. For the price, the food is reasonable. Be prepared to wait abt 15mins for your food during lunch peak hour.

Chicken Cutlet

🍜 Food wise: Fries were hot and quite well salted. The cutlet was tender, well marinated and well fried. The lemon was interesting as it gives the cutlet a more refreshing taste.

This is surely one of the comfort food.

Side note, their steak smells really good!

✨ Ambience wise: Coffee shop ambience

🤵🏻 Service wise: Uncle was friendly!

💵 Price wise: $7.50 for this plate of goodness.

Coffee Shop pricing and good old school style western food.

Love the potato ball and their coleslaw. The fries are the thick cut type and is nice too (although I love string fries).

The fried rice is very tasty and not overcook.

Love this place.

We had the sirloin and chicken chop fried rice. Both were yummy!  Medium rare was more medium than rare but the flavour was great.  The giant potato hall was a nice change from the usual fries/baked potato.  Chicken chop was grilled really well, almost crispy skin.  Be ready to wait during peak lunch hour

Mmmmmmmmmh. This was my first time here and thumbs up for one of the better steaks that I've tasted in awhile. Tender juicy medium rare ribeye steak that is made to perfection.

I must say the black pepper sauce is indeed unique, not too peppery and just generally great to enjoy it with the steak.

The complement fried potato side dish is very unique and tasty as well. Will come back and try the other menu items next!

This place is another great find in Singapore! It’s a Singapore “Western” food stall, so you will find steak, fried chicken, and various dishes for the “western” palates. Now you m not a fan of “Western” hawker stalls and have tried a few, but this place blew me away! Their fried chicken wings were delicious! The batter was nice and crispy with the flavor that outshines KFC. I wish they had spicy!!! Their steaks were nice and tender. Great deal for the price I paid! Be sure to order it rare because when it’s served on a hot plate, the steak will become medium. Also, nice touch in the mashed potatoes. They are served in the form of deep fried balls. Overall, I will definitely come here again!

Steak lover approved! Ordered the $20 black pepper tenderloin steak in medium rare (actually like medium), thoroughly enjoyed the piece of juicy and soft steak! Pepper sauce was mild, and the steak was delicious for coffee shop standard.  Highly recommended.

We waited for about 45mins. But the staff did warn us before we order. Friendly staff took order at the cashier. Note they do not serve ice with soft drinks.

Overall food is nice.
Spaghetti serving was huge! Forgot to take a pic though.

Hearty main course. Sides are great too.
But one would need to endure 1 hour of waiting during the usual dinner hour.
See many customers ordering the fried rice combo. Will try on the next visit.
Mixed grill for $13 - waiting time was about 20 min. Pork and chicken was tender, but portion could be a bit more for the price paid in my opinion. Potato ball was interesting

Been eating at Uno for years. They were previously at a different location and I thought they closed down but nope, they reopened near CHIJ Toa Payoh!

Everything is delicious on their menu!
Old school kind of western food. The price is reasonable and tasty of course! Had their chicken cutlet, fish and chips, chicken chop and chicken wings.

Didn’t order the beef. The pork too tasteless and hard. Fish abit soggy not crispy. Chicken chop still ok. Overall will not come back here again. Tried their food 3yrs ago and I rem it’s much nicer. So I would say their standard has dropped quite abit.
Nice steak. Ordered as the stall open at 5pm, then get my order at 5:30pm. Luckily the food worth the waiting time

Ordered ribeye (medium rare) for $16 & chicken cutlet for $7.

Sauce for the ribeye was pretty tasty and meat done-ness was done just right. As for the chicken cutlet, quite average. Coleslaw was nice!

Affordable, old-school taste western food. The mashed potato balls are a must have!

UPDATE (19 Sep): they have now moved to Block 168 Toa Payoh Lor 1 - Maxim Coffeeshop.

Same good old school flavour and affordable prices.

The ribeye is pretty good
They serve with hot plate like in higher class restaurant
Overall pretty worth

One of the best neighborhood western food stall. Followed them from three locations in Toa Payoh. Son of the owner is now running the show and very customer oriented. I loves their butter whipped potatoes besides their lovely main courses.

Visited twice in a week, skip the pork chop (also included in mix grill), too hard. Chicken cutlet ($7) and sirloin steak ($12) were good value for money. Fried chicken wings had nice crunch, worth a try at $1.50 per piece.

Ordered the Ribeye (med rare). Done-ness  was quite spot on.

Beef quality better than some western stalls in other coffee shops.
Would like the pepper sauce to be more prominent in terms of flavor.

Price wise is on the high side but still worth a try.

Sad to said it’s just a normal steakhouse in a coffee shop.

45mins of waiting time is way too long for a small portion of steak on a hot plate which cost $16 dollars.

The side dish only offer less then 1/4 of tomato, 1 fried mash potato and small portion of baked bean. If they change it to the bake potatoes with toppings + some carrots and broccoli. That will be better.

The only good point is that the beef is soft and tender.
Mix Grill. A coffeeshop style western food stall that is almost the anchor stall of the whole coffeeshop, their cuts are decent and you feel like you get the bang of your buck.

Tabao their ribeye steak. It’s tender and not gamey. Sauce is lightly peppered and not salty. I’m impressed with their fried potato ball. It’s crust is thin not oily and packed with flavour. Hope to have some garden veggies option than coleslaw.
Awesome place. One of my fave western at TPY.
Sirloin Steak and Chicken cutlet are good and highly recommended. Chicken Chop is average but lamb chop too dry. Overall is good but repare to wait if reach after 6pm in weekend.

My first visit! We didn’t want to shell out a lot for some western food and came across this value-for-money, old-school joint. The chicken cutlet is one of the best I’ve had recently, tender on the inside with a crust that is crisp and not bready. The coleslaw, baked beans and fries were fresh and tasty. The tenderloin steak was juicy; medium rare finished perfectly to a pink centre on the nostalgic steakhouse style hot plate . Will be back! Note that they’re moving to TPY Lor 1!

Relocated from 51 Lorong 6 Toa Payoh.

Here you get to enjoy one of the most authentic western food.

Famous for its Sirloin Steak, this is the real deal!

Must try.

UNO BEEF HOUSE is located in Toa Payoh along Lorong 5 Toa Payoh, at a coffeeshop under a HDB. Carpark is just beside the coffeeshop.

Beef Spaghetti ($6.00)
It was a spaghetti that was full of unpleasant surprises. The spaghetti tasted too soggy while the tomato sauce did not stand out. The real surprise was the mined beef as they felt like normal bolognaise. The beef was not unpleasant tasting but was just not outstanding from recommendation. Just a plate of tomato based sauce pasta with a touch of minced beef.

Mixed Platter ($12.00)
I went for the Mixed Platter which includes chicken chop, pork chop, bacon, ham, egg, fries, baked beans and a garlic bread. The pork chop was the only disappointment as the meat was dry, tough and was not well seasoned. On the other hand, the bacon was very flavorful and was crispy with a slightly charred side. The sunny side up egg had a really runny yolk which we gladly mopped up with the crispy garlic bread.

Bacon & Egg ($5.50)
Another friend went for the bacon as he could not resist, when the point was for him to try the pasta. Bacon was rather salt to have too many in my honest opinion but it was to his liking. It comes with two eggs, baked beans, garlic bread, coleslaw & fries. Nothing really fanciful about the dish. Probably something that would shine better for breakfast rather than lunch/dinner for the usual patrons.

You can’t really complain for the price and quality you get. Tenderloin on a hot plate for $18 is a steal. Meat was tender and substantial. Not like those thin slices you often get from hawker centres they charge you $10 for. Probably one of the best old school steak places you can find anywhere.
The food is uniquely done! Items to take note are the steaks, mashpotato that are fried into ball shape but soft on the inside and the fried chicken wing that is a must eat!
tried it 3 times. their pork chop ($7) was quite hard. chicken chop taste better. i dun eat beef but ppl who ordered beef makes mi drool. it smells heavenly.

Ordered Rib Eyes steak - texture is very good. Chicken chop fried rice was different from Pic and rice has very good aroma.

Value for money

Excellent beef steak for coffeeshop western food. The black pepper sauce is not hot but just actually sweet bring out the sweetness of the beef. The mash potatoes fried ball is butter yummy. The fried rice is actually above average and surprise to find shrimp in there. However do note that the steak is not cheapt starting at 13 for sirloin and 15 for ribeye and 18 for tenderloin if I am not wrong. However one of the much better western food stall out there.

Reached at 8.50pm and the owner had stopped taking orders although they were still clearly plenty more orders to cook.

They prioritise online orders over dining in so just beware.
The food is very good but the price is a little high. I know it’s because they use top quality ingredients. In a restaurant you’d pay that price. We go there once a month.

UNO beef house a long standing brand in the heartlands of Toa Payoh. There’s a reason why they can survive the test of time - the steaks are reasonably priced and food is good. THE MUST HAVE SIDE IS THE FRIED MASHPOTATO’ non beef eaters you can opt for chicken/lamb/pork
Decent steak in a cozy coffee shop. Good location with ample parking space and a friendly boss who always seems so happy and positive.

A good place for a decent steak at decent prices. Ordered a medium rare steak n actually got medium rare. The black pepper sauce here is out of this world. It is thick, meaty, savoury, peppery and salty in a good way. Makes anything dip or slathered in it so yummy. Also like the light n fluffy round ping pong ball shaped thing served with the steak. Texture like a cake but goes well with the black pepper sauce

Food: 4/10
Cost: $
Recommended food: Ribeye Beef Steak

Drove all the way to Toa Payoh to check out what's the hype with this neighbourhood western food that was featured in quite a few news articles and food reviews. Sad to say it is not really worth the hype. The ribeye cost 15 dollars which is quite reasonablely price, however in terms of taste it just tasted like most neighbourhood western food, of course those good ones. The pork chop is medicore, nothing special. In conclusion, the western food here is very average in terms of taste, and it serve well as a neighbourhood western food, but definitely not worth to specially travel down for food tasting.
Ordered the mixed grill and chicken cutlet.  Chicken got one kind of smell though.

This hainanese western food is something close to my hearts. Had it since early 90s and the shop probably shifted a few times but within the same area. If you like affordable western food, this is good.
Waited for about 30 mins. Taste not bad.

Ordered the black pepper ribeye. I think they treated the piece of beef well and I enjoyed a proper medium rare steak which reflected the cut. A rare gem of a steak house in the heartlands of Toa Payoh at heartland prices.

A long time player in the western food circle, that I finally chanced upon. My hotplate steak was rather forgettable in my opinion, just ordinary. I was completely underwhelmed. It wasn't a good value to boot.
Black Pepper Beef Tendonloir $20
great beef! Really good tasting coffeeshop hot plate steak. I'd come here over Jack's Place! Recommend the rib-eye!

Fish & Chips @ uno beef

sounds ironic? so yeah, ratings base on their fish & chips, have yet tried theur other dishes.... one can only eat so much at a time, a pity

their fish are those standard frozen sutchi fillets, quite well done and pretty tasty.

i suspect that the batter they used for their fish are likely to be the same used for their chicken wings and cutlet, not complaining as it taste kinda good

the coleslaw taste great, btw. can't say the same for the garlic bread which is definitely stale

would come back and try other items on their menu
Price increased $1 per steak 5 July 2021

It serves mainly western food at an affordable price. Previously the steaks came in big portions, but shrunk over the years... more like kids meal nowadays! updated*09/18 price went up again... Chicken cutlet($7.50) portion getting smaller... haiz...
Very decently price steak and food is amazing. Decent potion. Wings and steak is a must try!
Food delicious and price reasonable.new location now accessable by mrt.coffee shop also has lots of fans very airy.

Quite a special menu with jumbo frankfurter, bacon carbonara, aglio olio and mix n match options.
Thumbs up for the chef's meticulousness to every last detail... During Sat peak dinner every pork chop that came off the grill was lightly dabbed with a fresh kitchen paper towel to absorb the excess oil before serving
Great relaxing dinner with a refreshing glass of Dunkel from Otto Berlin Haus... One glass wasn't quite enough. Btw this is a drinks stall with quite a history.
Note, try not to sit directly in front of the mala stall. The fumes from the frying nearly killed everyone nearby but thank goodness he keeps his frying short... Gonna try that mala sometime.
My new favourite hawker western food. Pork cutlet is amazingly tasty and juicy !
Tabao their Fried rice with pork chop @ $6.80. Good and not expensive.

Worst western I have ever have. The chicken chop and fish fried rice is totally cannot make it. Totally tasteless is it Bec price went up so put lesser ingredients. Don't waste a dollar here there's other western around at toa payoh and also taste better and the price is lower.
Great food at affordable prices. If you're looking for cheap western food, this is it!
Terrible wait time. Waited more than 1 hour for my food when they told me it will take 20-30 mins. Some more food so so
Food is not bad, cheap but be prepared to wait...gets crowded and also does a lot of deliveries.

Just realised I have been patronising this stall for 15 years ever since I was in secondary school and I think it really deserves a review. The food has been consistently good throughout the years and you get a good sense that the owners really take pride in their ingredients and quality.

I've also never had a dish here that disappointed me and when I visited today, the pork chop $7 was excellent, very tender and the portion generous. They also make their own coleslaw and this might be one of the best coleslaws I've tasted in Singapore (so none of that KFC garbage-tasting coleslaw). If you are looking for an affordable and filling meal, you can also pair their fried rice with a protein like chicken chop or fish.

So show some support for this little joint if you are in the area, you won't be disappointed!
The pork chop used to be my favourite and had been visiting over the past 10 years, however recent visit was disappointing as the standard had dropped

Food are good, but the old lady serving is really rude and uneducated. She said something like, if u can wait wait, with unpolite tone. I know she's busy, but can she be considerate. Hope she sees theis.

Good old school Western food, waiting time can be easily 30 mins or more during peak hour, but the lady boss will always inform you about the estimated timing, if u can't wait, you can always try others food and somewhere else. Dine-in, they still serve the food to you instead of self service.
Childhood nostalgia taste. Ate in Primary - Secondary school. After many years taste the same. Same standard , great and friendly service. Never ever disappointed with the food!😍🥰🥰💕💕💕
food is decent, but the service is super horrible. despite a standard western food taste, will never return again. the ill service really affected the experience negatively. will not recommend.

Is this some slow western food stall?? waited over half an hour to beyond fifty minutes just to take away a packet of fish & chips. Slow service indeed, gave up and went home empty-handed without paying them.
Amazingly delicious food. I recommend the Carbonara. Personally, i add an extra grilled fish to go with it too. Thumbs up!
Well seasoned chicken, tasty black pepper sauce and always freshly fried fries. Very underrated store
Reasonable price & finger licking good. Friendly boss
Rude owners, portion is miserable, pricey. Take your money somewhere else.
Very bad service. Rude owners, bad attitude
super nice lamb chops
Thanks for the good food!

Homely restaurant that’s a family favorite. Mushroom soup @$5.80 was served with warm garlic butter bread. Kid’s meal was fish and chips @$8, enough for a small eater. It comes with a cup of apple juice and end off with a scoop of ice cream! Always a crowd pleaser. Chicken steak came sizzling on a hot plate and potato topped with yummy sour cream, bacon bits and green onions! The service was prompt and polite. Overall, a place we enjoy good food and service with family.

A no frills restaurant in Toa Payoh. Situated just below OrangeTee building makes it very convenient for people to access. A nice place for a meal especially for the lunch crowd.

Food was ok. Good value as we often go for the set lunches. Option to upgrade to lobster bisque should really be considered as the lobster bisque is nice. Baked potato with kits of onions and sour cream is great too.

Give 4 star for service...
Not the food..
Their service crew are older folks.. so they tend to be more attentive to kids and old folks......
You go in... With kids..
They will get the baby chairs first....
And once awhile will come ask if anything u need.

But the food is plain so so....

The 1 for 1...
From 2.30 pm to 5pm.. is enticing..

But twice we went....
The beef seems very soft and both times my wife says that the beef has a smell..
I tried... It is like... The meat has been defrosted.. in And out of the chiller too many times.....
Not sure. . Maybe some experts can give their views...

Their coke... And coke light ...
Coke light is by the Can.. so they sell $4.
But the coke is $3. Pour by the bottle....
So be prepared the drink doesn't have gas...

As a chain western outlet...
Just plain...
Normal western.

Inflation has taken a hit on the price and portion size and the shortage of workers is visible with only half the seating capacity opened. We waited only five minutes for our turn 😊

The cutlery is not so clean and we had to wash it ourselves.

The dessert of the cake was panna cotta which is fine. It used to be cake and we remember the cake we used to have was really good and we complimented the restaurant for it when we visited back in March.

The soup of the day was chicken soup with vegetables. Still value for money.

order a triple meat grill. and seafoods marinara with ice cream and ice lemon tea
triple meat grill - beef cut is quite bad with thick layer of inedible. chicken not grilled enough .  sausage is very basic . i would say it is a decent dish that shall be priced at 15-18 instead of 20+
the food not hot as it was serve together with the pasta .
seafood marinara - the ingredients is fresh and generous. only issue is the sauce too watery.
ice lemon tea - very normal concentrate taste
ice cream- is call gelato but taste like normal marigold ice cream

be prepared to spend some time for waiting food . is not as fast as usual western cuisine.
The steak was great. Soup was so so. Dessert was one scoop of ice cream. $7 add on for soup and dessert not very worth it. Service was not bad. Not crowded, so quite comfortable.
Had the rib-eye steak and the signature. Loved the sour cream baked potato. Beef was hot and not too bad for medium well. Expect to wait a little during peak hour.

Queued 45mins to get in during lunch hours on frid. Lack of staff. Food came quite fast after ordering so ok. Missed out the water i ordered... But Bolognase Cheese Fries quite nice. Fish is very plain but crispy. Have to eat w the sauce. Soup of the day was cauliflower soup which comes w the garlic bread. My friend like the chicken alfredo. Not so much the chicken but the pasta was nice. (forgot to take photo). Wont be back again sorry.

11 Sep 2022, just visited this restaurant for dinner. Firstly, place not so crowded during my visit around 5.30pm. Maybe this restaurant need some upgrade to its carpet. It seems very old and wear out. The little icon outside the restaurant look so dirty and old. I am not too sure if this is "Feng Shui". Haha... I think the restaurant manager need to look into it and give a New Life to this icon statue. Food wise, I would say ok. Comparable to Aston. However, Aston prices are slightly cheaper. Sad to say that this is one of the restaurant in Singapore that does not serve you free drinking or tap water. They charge 50 cents per customer.
Quiet and Cosy Cafe. Signature woody decor. Great place to meet friends.  Service is quick.  Prices are reasonable.
Lovely meal but the branch is severely understaffed!! Management should amp up their hiring because the staff there are clearly doing their best, very dedicated and polite but struggling.

I'm... so... shockingly sad. :( Ordered a Medium Rare Fillet Mignon, it came presentable but when I tried to cut it, the meat was so tough. Took forever to chew as well. The picture below speaks for itself. I forced myself to finish it as it cost $30+. Really felt like crying as it was the worst beef I've eaten and I'm not even a "steak expert". Just want to warn future diners what they're in for - Very tough meat and microwaved vegetables.
(also, iced water is served with one ice cube lol)
This review is made on September 2021.

Went here my father-in-law's birthday party and asked for a mango mousse but they ran out of stock.

Gladly they're offering an onde-onde cake as a replacement despite the price is more expensive.

waited for almost 40mins for my meal to be served correctly, my family ate finish already then i can start eating…i ordered lobster with rice but at first they served me seafood spaghetti then followed by lobster with spaghetti??2 wrong orders served consecutively, manager wasn’t sincere and apologetic too , and lastly the rice was hard.., lobster was cold

Standard of the place has dropped overall.
1. First they did not serve (or even ask, for that matter) water. It was only after about 20 mins after we asked for water that it was served.
2. Then they forgot to serve us the soup that came with the set meal. After we asked they took awhile to verify with each other whether anyone did serve the soup. Eventually arrived after the main course did.
3. One of us ordered the steak well done, and it was so tough that he had difficulties cutting it with the steak knife.
4. For some reason they were reluctant to clear the table. Many service staff walked past and looked to see if we were done eating, but despite the obvious empty dishes, no one bothered to clear. When they served the coffee and ice cream there was not enough space on the table but yet the staff still tried to put the cups and bowls down without clearing, until we had to ask them to do so. Seriously?
5. The steak was supposed to come with slices of King mushroom. The plural only meant there were two pieces instead of one. And superbly thinly sliced too, at that. Have to admire the skill of the chef.

Will seriously reconsider whether to come back here ever again.
Cosy western food restaurant with great food. However some grilled cuisine requires chilli sauce or pepper to enhance the favour. The platter and apple pie is good. Overall not bad.

Only one staff saved this place with his great service. Other than that service was HORRIBLY slow as they are terribly understaffed. Waited for nearly 1hr for my food in total and the food quality is not worth it all. Definitely will avoid this place.

Had one of the most disappointing experience at Jack's Place. I grew up eating JP and I will always remember its great service and food, but today's experience tainted the image of JP.

We ordered their triple meat grill and the meat(doneness was great) but the pasta was way undercooked. The manager on the ground was quick to resolve my unhappiness but in return, I still received undercooked pasta with some mushroom sauce(not sure if their pasta was microwaved).

Understanding that drink and dessert will be served after your main course. Only our dessert arrived and we did not receive our drink at all (suspect that they forgot about it). When we rectified at the counter, they apologized and offered us can drink instead which we declined.

I can empathise with it lack of manpower(as I used to work in an F&B outlet), but at least remember your customer's order and delivered it on time when requested.

Kudos to the manager who hears my feedback, but I'm still taken a back by today's experience.

The family restaurant feeling is waning. Gone are the set meals. Everything is alacarte. Food portion has shrunk, fish and chips only 1pcs instead of 2pcs. Service has deteriorated, starting top down from the restaurant manager , even when the restaurant is half filled...We would have walked out if not because we have ordered. Maybe last visit

Very bad. Had the three meat grilled spaghetti dish. The waiting time was the horrid - we had two gelato and we told three different staff (including the manager) that they can serve but we waited for 20 minutes and we just left cos we couldn't wait longer ...

Jack’s Place has been around for a long, long while. But it seems food quality has dropped slightly over the years, albeit the food is still good and value for money.

The garlic bread wasn’t as crisp as usual, ie it was sagging a bit under its own weight. But it still tasted okay.

The lobster bisque and the soup of the day (minestrone) were both nice.

The steaks weren’t that juicy, to be honest. But they were still well cooked and seasoned, so they were still great.

The baked potatoes were extremely filling, but still tasted good.

The dessert was a cherry and mango pie, which was pretty nice.

All in all, the food was pretty average, the main draw being the value for money it allows.

However, the service was top notch, being extremely prompt and friendly to boot. (This may have been because I arrived at 11am, before peak lunch time).

Overall, the food is just like any other Jack’s Place, but the service is prompt, genuine and doesn’t leave you with a bad taste in your mouth.

Good attention, variety of dishes. Amazing curly fries. Big menu.
A lot of sugar in the cold tea, like a heavy syrup, not recommended.

The food came quickly and the quality of food was satisfactory. Service was extraordinary,  staff were attentive. Staff Suman upon seeing my pregnant wife provided a pillow to support her back. 👍 Positive experience

Favourite food from Jack’s Place is its potato jacket with cream and bacon bits. Cheese fries were not too bad, chunky fries were crispy. Other than that, Salted Egg Chicken Cutlet was oily and not the most delicious salted egg sauce around. Buffalo wings had a strange taste. Panna Cotta dessert looked more like a mousse cake.

13/05/18
Local chain restaurant offering western food. This old time restaurant has been around more than 25 years ago. Their food has evolved from selling steak to pasta. Overall their food is average and the price is reasonable.

Jack's Place is a restaurant that many locals would be familiar with. It provides good value for money lunch sets which has me returning every now and then. Especially like the potato with sour cream, chives and bacon bits. Service at this outlet is friendly and prompt. Will be returning here to get my fix
the Set Lunch is not bad. Portion of food is alright. Value for money. Quite a good choice to select from.
This was my worst experience with Jack's Place tpy. Food presentation was bad. Cake is in mini size & so dry.
Great 1-for-1 lunch time deal! Food was really nice and value for money, food also came quite fast. Overall, love this place 🤩
Service crew was good, the food was so-so but could pass. Ordered a sirloin steak and a chicken steak. We ordered one set too. Overall it is a nice place, not too crowded.

Service could be better for a weekday lunch. Food is alright. Waitress forgotten to serve the coffee. Asking for bill is also a slow process. Assistant manager was apologetic and quick to make up for it. 5 stars for the Assistant manager.
Decent restaurant for western food. We like their fish & chips and lobster bisque soup. This store also has an Udders ice-cream store inside. Usually not crowded and located next to Toa Payoh MRT.
Family friendly restaurant. Food is nice and hot even when it's crowded. Affordable glasses of wine to pair with steaks.
Order the daily set meal. It Wass served real fast. Not totally full house even at lunch time.

Ordered a sirloin steak. Nicely done. Baked potatoes was nicely done not overly dry - which happen the last time i was here - moist and tender to soak in the sour cream, bacon bits and spring onions (miss the chives).

Ordered a rare steak which they served as per my order. Just the way i like it.

Was very well satisfied with my dinner tonight.
Awesome service crew. Was busy working on my laptop. A waitress came by and reminded me to drink my soup first before it turns cold. Like a mum. Thumbs up

One of the best set lunches I had in Jack Place. Many outlets quality of food was not good and felt presurized to clear the table fast but this outlet in Toa Payoh has excellent service, food quality and ambience.
Service ok. Food wise cant make it. Garlic bread not crispy. Seafood not fresh and tasteless. Chicken chop tasteless. Brocoli over cooked.
Very nice steak! Reasonable price and service is good.

Dined at 3 different Jack's Place over the past month, ordering their signature Fish & Chips. Toa Payoh branch's is most dissapointing, neither the fish nor chips is crispy. Fried potato that is soft is not my cup of tea. Guess the staff in charged of fried food doesnt know the right temperature required.... Fish is fresh though, no fishy smell.
not the first time online orders get cancelled. quality  of food found wanting compared to other branches

The only thing i can say about the restaurant
That can be improved is the seating,because it was somewhat cramped for me and my family, other than that food was good and portion size..., well the photos explain it😊

Pasta, steak and veggie are quite nice.

Service not so friendly. The Auntie is quite too strict. 😅 I don’t feel like a client.

Pricing is quite okay. I just wish can be a bit bigger serving. 😊👍🏻

Missed out my order, so I cancelled it and ordered fries instead so that they can prepare fast. No hard feelings. Then suddenly the manager Rick came to apologise to me for forgetting my order, which I wasn’t even bothered, and gave us a box of cakes! Lol so nice of him. Food is good, environment is clean. Good service

It was the worst dining experience ever. I had a complimentary meal there. Upon arrival, I had to seek out the asst Mgr at the reception counter to be seated. I was not even decently greeted by the AM. Not only did I have to wait for my table, I also had to summon the AMs attn that I was ready to order. I was abrubtly served n waited patiently for my steak which arrived 20mins later.  I had strip steak w standard sides. I was not given the rundown but had to ask. Midway, the AM sauntered to the table behind me to enquire about their steak. Not a peep to me on how I was doing w mine free meal. Having managed restaurants overseas as an area Mgr. I'm appalled at the lack of care and  professionalism at this Jack's Place. It seemed that the staff has adopted the scruff manegerial behavior!!!  Nevertheless, i sincerely ask that the owners of this place look into the operation. Fyi I visited restaurant at the tailend of lunch rush. I used to visit the very first restaurant at killineyw w my parents n service then was much more pleasant.
Affordable western food in Toa Payoh MRT station, not very crowded even Friday evening
Nice family style restaurant. Great lunch deal and beef is from NZ! Portion size is good.

Rabak bro. Must pay for tap water, soup of the day served in a tiny bowl. I ordered steak, the veggies they served with the steak were slightly burnt. Ordered medium rare steak, came almost well done. Ice cream for dessert was lousy also. Service also not that good.

In a nutshell, mediocre food at premium prices. Steak was pricey and literally tough to swallow. Stuffed mushrooms tasted as if fabricated from the worn out carpet that covers the place. Apple pie ala mode was soggy and more reminiscent of apple pie soaked in commode. Save yourself some money and disappointment. Go somewhere else.
Always missed the food here, love the taste and favour. There is a 1 for 1 on weekday from 2.30 to 5.30pm . Quite worth it
Chicken Chop. I asked for lesser fries more caslaw. Nice portion cheap and good. Be prepared to queue for at least half an hour for your food.

Food portion consider big for me, didn’t took down photos. I ordered black pepper chicken chop on sizzling plate, full plate of chicken as the sides was put on another plate for me instead.
Price @$6.50
Waiting time about 15~20min @6.50pm

This is probably one of the best western food I’ve had! I ordered a chicken chop that comes with fries, baked beans and coleslaw. The chicken chop is thin, tender and flavorful and the fries are crispy. I hate coleslaws but the coleslaw here is actually good! Will come back again.
Should be one of the cheapest Western food around the area, grilled items tasted better than the fried one. Expect long waiting time during peak hours.

Good environment. I have been to Nepal before and can vouch that the Momo served here tasted authentic. The other Nepali dishes I tried was great as well. The staff was kind enough to wipe the baby chair clean before handing it to us. Great service. Would definitely re-visit again!
Not bad, gives you a good feel of what food in Nepal is like. Most interesting to me was the dumpling. Eating it like Chinese style with Indian curry.
Visited on 16 Jul 2022, enjoyed the suculent NZ sirloin steak and nepalese chicken.. the dishes were done well and delicious

I enjoyed the chicken momo, especially with the sauce (not sure what it is). I wish they can create the Bhutanese version with cheese ;) I miss that chilli cheese momo in Bhutan. The meat in both main dish 'Chicken Tash With Pulau' and 'Nepali Lamb Choila' are very tasty 😋 Hub said he went there with too high an expectation (he had actual nepalese food on himalayan mount before) so he wasn't too satisfied but I enjoyed the food 😄 I think I will return 😋 Anyway it seems like western food is more popular here. The western food serving looks generous and great plating.

Pros: nett price
Cons:
We went there Sunday night, 19th September 2021, and there wasn't a lot of people but it was very chaotic. The staff were arguing (guy in yellow shirt at counter was screaming to the staff to "open their eyes") and there was a lot of banging of plates. It's a small indoor seating area so the noise was very hard to ignore.
We ordered a set meal with one mushroom soup(top up $1, the soup of the day was chicken soup) and one chicken soup and chocolate cake.
My friend is a vegetarian so ordered veggie chow mien and the mushroom soup. The older lady taking our order didn't write down any of our orders.
We were served two chicken soup and when we informed them, they didn't even realise that we ordered mushroom soup (keyed in wrong order, maybe can write down the order next time?)
The mushroom soup took about 10 minutes to serve.
Then the Chinese waitress served my friend "chicken chow mien" and when my friend asked if its veggie chow mien instead, she was like "oh ya, that"
For dessert, the Chinese waitress served us yellow sponge cake and said it was prune cake and then said it was cheesecake? She didn't even know the menu... It was a regular pound cake (the type you can buy at giant supermarket) and we asked what about the chocolate cake the older lady told us about? And she said they ran out.... They didn't even inform us about it.
Food is edible. But the portion is questionable. Do Not order the pizza. Its $12 for a pan sized, those you can get for better quality for $5 at pizza hut. The dough was also RAW. Also asked for extra sauce because chicken was dry but was told have to add $1 for any sauce lol. This is the first place I've been to where I heard such thing. Other places like Aston don't have?
Overall, horrible service and bad atmosphere. Been here before where we were served by I think it was the owner, older guy with glasses, who was very polite. Unfortunately, this time, was a bust.
Nice cozy restaurant in the hood. Great for dining out with friends. Food is top quality and service is great. Price is reasonable too.

I move around in Singapore a lot and had a chance to try out this restaurant due to a friend's suggestion. They mentioned they serve Nepalese cuisine and it's rare to find such a cuisine that's located in an old heartland estate like Toa Payoh. The restaurant is spacious and the service staff is friendly. Most importantly, they really do have Nepalese cuisine as stated, alongside a variety of Western fare, which many old folks who dine there go for. (Maybe because they have a senior citizen discount special which was really nice!). We had 2 appetizers and a main course and the serving size for the appetizers were family size but we stillanaged to finish it. It's my first time trying Nepalese cuisine and it's actually quite interesting - worth a try really! I would love to try out the Western fare next if I can! And they currently have 20% discount on ala-carte.

A hidden restaurant for tasty and value for money food.. The Nepali chicken Tash, Gumbo Soup, chicken momos, brownie with ice cream and house pour red wine was amazing. Genuinely reccomend this place..I think it’s underrated and deserves 10 stars.. service was great and warm too . I am coming back for sure ☺️

A surprise gem right in the middle of housing estates. Tims Restaurant & Cafe is great for family and small group gathering. A wide variety of western and Napalese food at affordable prices with korean beer and wine to complete your fine dining in the heartlands.

Food standard & prices same as before. Only thing is staff service & attitude must improve. Need to go for basic service quality course if possible. Young guy at cashier counter with attitude, need to improve his service & manners. Miss the warm feeling of last time when the male boss at dinning hall talking to customers. Don’t expect much of service quality but at least the basic from them but that also don’t have. Ts is my honest opinion.
I love Nepalis food. I love the herbs taste

Tabaoed this for dinner on our way to our friend’s house nearby. Ordered the Nepalese chicken with rice and 2 different types of salmon. Price isn’t the cheapest but food is good enough. Like the chicken very much due to its seasoning. Rice, vegetables and mashed potatoes are all good too. Service is as good as what I remembered it to be. The teriyaki salmon can be softer though. Otherwise all good.

Very accommodating people work here. I like that they do try their best to Ensure we have a good time even in this trying period. The food is quite well prepared and I am surprised at the speed. Pizza size is smaller than outside so do order 2 if you are planning to share. Lamb shank is very well done - loved it. The Beef tenderloin is okay for the price that I am paying but the black pepper sauce is too over powering. Chicken with pork ribs is disappointing but chicken is well marinated.

Tims Restaurant & Cafe is a cafe me and my family will frequent as they have 50% pricing for senior citizens for selected menu. They are one of the rare cafe that focuses on Nepal food. Most of the choices are western food.

Their western dishes are value for money. The portion is also generous. Set meals of $4.50 includes a drink (coffee, tea or milo), soup of the day and a dessert. It did not take too long for the food to be served upon order. For the coffee and dessert, you would need to let them know when to be served after you finish your main meal.

The ambience is also rather homely and is suitable for family with kids to dine in at.

#ILoveTimsRestaurantAndCafe

Favorite fusion restaurant in the hood. Oysters could have been fresher but for the rest of the dishes - from steaks to fish&chips, no complaints. Come here every year for Christmas Eve / NYE dinner and they never disappoint. If you visit during the non-festive periods, they have senior citizen discounts too!

Tried the Nepali food again this 2nd time that I went. The last time I was there was about 7-8 years ago and I had the sherpa noodles. It's no longer on the menu but this time, I shared 2 of the Nepali dishes - the lamb and chicken with rice - with 2 friends and the pakora (?). They were all delicious. Pakora was piping hot and crispy when it arrived, and all snapped up by our table of 5 immediately. The lamb was so flavourful that I can't wait to have it again the next time I go. The chicken was good, too, but I prefer the lamb. Only downer was the yuzu drink that tasted like it had too little yuzu.

The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Went there on a crowded Friday evening, but food still came fairly fast. Hope to be back again soon with my family.

The lobster with steak were amazing. The Nepalese chicken has a special and unique taste on its own. The fries was really good. We went there on an eatigo app discount of 30%. Please remember to make reservations prior to arrival to enjoy the eatigo discount. It's a pretty neighbourhood and quiet place. The price is around $10 - 20 depends on the mains u ordered. But with the eatigo discount, we only paid 30 bucks for the amazing food that we ordered. Definitely will recommend this.

A hidden gem in the neighbourhood with a wide selection of western/nepalese food. It has been around for more than a decade, and the owner is very friendly. Food quality was way better than Jack's Place and prices were very reasonable!

Some bad stuff tho:

1. The pizza we ordered was a bit too small and tasted like it came from Cold Storage.

2. Mashed potato tasted like it came from a powdered packet

3. Service was very very slow on a crowded Sunday and we had to set aside more than an hour for lunch.

I think service might be much better on quieter weekdays.

Brought my dad here for dinner on a Saturday night.

Waitress was a chinese auntie (possibly lady boss) gave us one menu and stood beside us right away, expecting us to quick fire our orders to her. Asked for some time to look thru the menu as it was my first time visiting. She literally walked one round the restaurant (30 secs), and came back standing beside my table again.

While I was translating the English menu to my dad, she kept interrupting and suggested us to order the dishes she recommended. My dad got pretty annoyed and said to dine at another place instead. I returned the menu to her and apologized for the trouble, but she just rolled her eyes and did not even acknowledge me. Dodged a bullet and definitely not dining here ever.

Friendly service. First time dining in a Nepalese restaurant.

The fish and chips was a huge serving. The Nepali pork belly was extremely tender and flavourful, comes with pulau rice and Nepali salad.

We had the moumou for the first time. Nice sized and tasty. Are they suppose to taste like xiaolongbao with curry seasoning? :) Will find another moumou to compare.

After 10 years of being his customer, food is still good and delicious. Never fail to impress me. For a successful place he has, the boss Tom is still a very humble man, still hands-on at his own place and provides great service. Not overly priced western and Nepalese food. Definitely a good place for a good cravings fix.

Frills-free restaurant cum cafe that sells western and Nepalese food. The food is not too bad but the service is commendable, the staff were eager to serve and friendly. There are set meals to choose from; daily ones, student and even for senior citizens (60 and above). I enjoyed the butternut squash soup, their signature ribs (fall-off-the-rack, hickory sauce?), Sausage (juicy!) lemon tea and colesaw. Apart from that, the sides of fries was normal and mashed potato a little too dry, the steak could be more seasoned and the mushroom sauce was just ok (maybe the other sauces are better). Other than baramundi, the fish used (such as in the grilled fish and fish and chips) was mushy but i guess you get what you pay for? The tiramisu was tasty and more of a well-set cake. If I do visit again, would want to try the Nepalese food here. If you want coffee, perhaps should try Shrove Tuesday among the opposite row of shops which sells waffles and coffee.

Interesting cafe with cosy setting, serving both Nepalese and Western. Rice is very fragrant, meat is herby but rather dry. Western dishes are average, portion is quite large though. Good when you want to try something different.

Good food, quite affordable but the service can be overwhelmed when there is a crowd. So you must constantly chase abit.

Overall ok, would go back and try their ox tail.

Delivers by grab and accepts grab pay

Tims Restaurant & Café is one of the nicest neighborhood eatery to dine at. With a wide variety of unique menu items, ranging from Western to Nepalese cuisine, it's never a dull moment when eating here.
Their Christmas Special menu is extremely delicious and well prepared, early orders are a must! One of the very few affordable places that serves their turkey succulent enough to wipe away your fear of dry turkey. (Not yet released but you can pre-order takeaway for Christmas dining in the comfort of your home.)

Value for money lunch sets

Paid 12.80 nett for a 3 course meal with a choice of drink. There was no service charge nor gst which is awesome!

The food was generally fair. I very much like the chicken stragonoff with rice as it warms my soul. Service was fast and good.

Will recommend!

It was a Public Holiday, and we headed out to Toa Payoh for something different. Chanced upon Tim's Restaurant not too far from our favourite chicken rice, and what a gem it turned out to be. This simple Nepalese joint serves up very decent western fare. Besides they have excellent staff with immense patience with the customers! Is recommended this once to anyone, but don't take MY word for it; go try for yourself!

Cozy place in a lay back area.  Enjoyed both the food and service.

Spoilt by the choices we have, therefore took us quite a while before we can decide.
Ordering your food with as set is definitely a better deal ($4.50 c/w soup, cake, coffee/tea/soft drink).

I like the Friday’s tomato soup with basil.
Lamb rack was nicely done, the brown sauce was not over powering so that with pinch of salt it brought out the goodness of it. $23

Ribeye steak was good enough for me, reminds me of Jack’s place. 220g (I think) of goodness at $22.80 as a set I feel is quite a good deal.

The MoMo was an experience. Mine mind was kinda confused as it looks like Xiao long Bao but of course taste different.

Will try the Oxtail stew on my next visit.

A nice restaurant around Toa Payoh. They serve Nepalese cuisine and western dish. Overall the food was okay, nothing fantastic but I gave 4 stars because the service was good and they are senior-friendly with a lot of discount.

Tried the western food. But will return to try Nepalese food.
Throwback into the 70s. Friendly staff.

Good prices for set lunch on a Sunday. German beer $20 for a bucket of 4.
Oysters available as well.

The oysters were big and fresh, as with the lobster, very sweet!

Wagyu was a gigantic portion too!

Currently having a promotion till 3Feb, don't miss it!!

The place is conducive, something different from normal western foods, portion is big at a reasonable price. They have wines and other foods from Nepal for light meals and also cakes . Coffee is also nice.

This restaurant offers several value for money set meals. Due to  the profile of most residents in this neoghbourhood the restaurant also offers set menu for senior citizens. We tried the pork knuckle and found it tasty. Portion is huge even for 2 to share that we had to pack it home.
Neighborhood restaurant that offers Ala Carte and several good value set options. There are sets for elderly $6.90 and students $7.90. High tea sets at $5.90.

Good food and reasonable price , big portion .
Value for money. They don’t charge service charge . Free plain water . Their ice coffee is nice I like it . Will definitely visit again , a lot of parking lot availability as well at HDB carpark , easy to acess location . Seniors citizen have $6.80 meals set , and was told the portion is same as normal price.forgotten to took others food picture , next time update again .
(This was the portion that I had taken up few pcs )😋
Nice, cosy and casual neighbourhood restaurant. Like their lamb shank and oxtail. They also have some nice Nepalese dishes.

Had the New Year special meal... pork ribs and roasted chicken.. with lots of vegetables, n my favourite corn on cob... it's a platter for 2 pax.. pork ribs is so succulent, chicken grilled with Nepalese spices... 😋😋😋... enjoyable meal ... good food, good company.
Thanks Tom for this special menu ...

All is nice, the staffs are friendly.. they greeted my fam 'Happy New Year', told us what is nice and etc. But, when it came to the set meals, the price stated on the menu is clearly $4.5 and we werent told that there is an increase in price on PH(new year day).. we were only told about it after we finished our soup and bread. And the price is increased by 80cent to a dollar?!? Ok to many the price does not matter but this is actually an issue.. it is like we are 'scammed'? If my fam knew about the increased in price, we would have reconsidered the set meal.
Good price point! Food is yummy. Love the mushroom sauce and minestrone soup is tasty! Recommend the soursop drink. Lunch set is available.
Delicious food, quick and friendly service, value for money.
Love this restaurant.  Went 3 times in Dec with different group of friends.  Tried a few different dishes and all taste good.

Tims is a very cozy little restaurant serving nice western food. The staff here is nice and friendly. Food is always consistently good. Generous portions for what we refer to as neighbourhood price. I recommend their chicken cutlet - crunch on the outside but juicy on the inside. Their steak and seafood on specials are often good too.

Good food at affordable price. Decided to try this place after my treatment at the TCM next door. Overall the food is good and the service staff is friendly and efficient.  20% off meal course from 3 to 5pm
Elaborate Menu , good service. Food tastes good. Pocket friendly restaurant, No GST, No Service Tax. For sure, will go again. Will recommend everyone to try at least once 🙂🙂🙂
Great food although at a slightly higher price point. Servers were helpful and accommodating to our requests.
Best oxtail stew ever! & the veggies taste so good (I don't like veggies) & the soups are not salty! My favourite dining place now. Bringing my grand-kids there for a treat.

Aside from the delicious food, the staff are nice and approachable with smiles.
Sirloin Set is good and the Cheese Chicken with Sausage Set is hefty in quantity

Food was delectable with reasonable prices. Have a good number of choices on the menu for families and friends!

A great homely atmosphere with friendly service staff for a pleasant evening out!

Not the usual heartland western food. Serves (entry/mid level) restaurant quality meats and seafood (western style) for lower than restaurant prices. Heartland ambience. Definitely recommend the lobster and beef steak combo and the bottled Belgian white beer bucket.
Nice food. Portion for set meal is way too big though..

<MUST TRY>

Ordered their Chicken Chop. Their portion size is generous. The chicken chop is tender and juicy. You can taste the fragrance of the black pepper when chewing in your mouth. The coleslaw is mild in taste and has a slight sour tinge to it. It is refreshing to have and does not overpower the main dish unlike most processed versions.

I was lucky and had the chance to speak to the owners. I understand that most of the side dish are made in-house (including the coleslaw that I had). I think it is quite rare for an eatery to make the side dish themselves. The coleslaw is thinly cut by hand and selectively chosen to ensure that only suitable parts are included. Had a great experience and will definitely visit again!

Newly opened Little hidden gem here. Owners are very kind and humble and funny person. Mashed potato and coleslaw is a superb, fresh and own hand cut daily. Salmon is crispy at the skin but soft and juicy in the inner part. You can still feel the juice bursting in your mouth. The only wasted is the gravy, they put it on part of my favourite crispy salmon skin. The pork chop is very soft and tender, not oily and the portion is huge at only $8.90. But the homemade pepper sauce, I really wish I can take away only the gravy. I can already smell it once I collected. My eyes turned very big when I smelled. The fragrant is really addictive. Can feel they put a lot of effort in making it! Gonna try other dishes !

I first tried the pork chop from Ling Maison and thought the meat was tender. Sauce was a bit sweet for my liking but overall still nice. Took away the chicken chop for my mum who loved it as well. Look at that beautifully roasted skin! The following week, my parents went back for the salmon and chicken chop with pineapple. They absolutely loved it. I guess apart from the mains, what made ling maison stand out from other Western stalls in coffeeshop is their sides. They even have sous vide egg and red potato salad!

This stall is newly opened. I only managed to try the Homemade Coleslaw and Cheese Tofu Fritters. I quite like the coleslaw.

=======

I came back two days after last visit, and ordered:
- sirloin steak
- salmon hollandaise
- sotongyaki

I changed the sides to coleslaw and potato salad. Coleslaw's standard is as good as last visit, and potato salad is nice too. For the steak, quite good for hawker standard.

Chicken chop at $7.90 comes with two sides (I swopped fries for coleslaw). Very generous portion, meat was the perfect thickness, well seared and piping hot (I've had enough of lukewarm chicken chop precooked in bulk). Top that off with a cheery and friendly server and that gives you every reason for supporting this stall.

My picture doesn't do it justice (took in hurry as I was hungry) but I'd recommend those who are in the area to give it a try. Extensive menu choices and I'm sure you'll find something that catches your eye.

Finally get to try the food after seeing so many good reviews. Tried the chicken chop and salmon oglio olio pasta. Indeed, the food taste great and especially the salmon pasta. Great customer service as well. Not crowded during dinner time and perfect for unwinding after a day's work.

Had the chicken chop. Being a chicken lover, this is one of the best I have had. Generous portion for less than $8, came with fries or mashed and garden salad or coleslaw. The meat was very tender and the black pepper sauce not oily or too salty. Must try, don’t come to Jackson Square just for noodle😊

The mash potato is to-die-for.

The Salmon is fresh and the hollandaise sauce compliments it perfectly!

The Pork Chop marinate is NICE! Not the usual black pepper or mushroom. The salad was fresh and crunchy, nice sauce with sesame. Plus a generous portion of french fries. They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
Fish & Chips was superb too! The fish fillet was good, it did not have the ugly fishy taste! Haha.
The staff were enthusiastic and smiley. They were extremely happy when we went up to them at the end of our meal to complement the food.
If they serve soup, it would have been PERFECT!
I will definitely come back to try other items, and bring friend when more can dine out.
Do check them out. It is good food at reasonable prices.

Tried signature chicken chop. Rich taste of sweet and sour with a bit of peppery sauce. Chicken thigh meat was juicy and tender. Old school coleslaw and fries. For the portion, you got the value for money.

Hidden at one corner in the cafeteria of Jackson Square, this is a rare gem and one which you want to keep for life (I'm not exaggerating). Try it and you will know the definition of value-for-money, which is somewhat an understatement. A more apt description might just be optimal consumer satisfaction for every cent incurred. Putting the heavenly food quality and generous portion aside, service standards by the cashier may likely put some restaurants out there to shame. If you are down to your last 10 bucks in life, you've gotta save it for this.
Awesome food. Great serving. Must try Aglio Olio Pasta and their homemade coleslaw!
My favourite chicken cutlet with french fries + rice!!!!! the highlight of my day whenever i come to school. Thank you for the friendly service
Ingredients are fresh and value for money. Tastes good too!

I ordered chicken cutlet and requested to replace the side dish which was egg and coleslaw with fries. My another request was to add abit more tartar sauce. One of their staff called me and said that if I want extra tartar sauce he have to remove my fries for it and replace my fries with the tartar sauce! Never seen a restaurant so stingy with a condiment and wants to replace my side dish with a condiment.  I just received the food and there is no tartar sauce at all and the potatoes salad is horrible! Definitely won't be buying from here again
Friendly staff,nice food 😋,big portion,recommended to all 👍👍👍👍👍
Photo show got veggie. But dish came without. Ordered fish n chips

Ordered 2xchicken wing rice sets and 2xhalf chicken rice sets. All chicken were very dried and tough.
Please look into refund. Thanks.

This is the only store that still standing and not changed (except moved stall next to it)
price is ok and service is friendly
Food nice
Consistent standard for fried chicken.. try the buffalo wings

(Translated by Google) Garlic Oil Chicken Cutlet 👍

(Original)
Aglio olio chicken cutlet 👍

Tried the Mushroom sauce chicken chop.
The sauce is actually pretty rich in flavor.
Chicken is tender, portions of main and sides are good.
Disappointed in the mac and cheese however.
Was expecting cold dish but somehow it’s warm and can’t taste the cheese.
Overall satisfied anyway. $7.90
I had the Sirloin steak for 9.90 anniversary promotion, very tender and juicy beef.

I stumbled unto this joint while walking past. Price was reasonable considering that the rib eye was quite substantial. It didn’t taste very different from the others modern style no frills western food stalls like Aston’s, chargrill etc. Doneness was quite uneven though.

Affordable restaurant standard Steak $11.90 in large portions at TPY coffee shop. Good deal! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Super bright coffee shop, with modern reno. Seatings limited thou.

Went back in 2018, standard dropped.
Food was not too bad.  Thought fried garlic topped on spaghetti was a bit overwhelming for me,  bitter taste.  For S$7.90, I guess the portion is slight small for most.

I would have love to have given 2 stars but the beef burger did not fail my taste buds.

Number of onion rings 4!!!!!! Disgusting . Vs amount of fries.

Will I eat another burger here? No.
Nice local western food place. Had the burger. Not bad.

Good range of mains with sides options. Huge servings of fries and coleslaw - but only 4 onion rings... 🤔 chicken chop quite large but "monster burger" isn't really monstrous lah. Tasty enough though.

Need to wait 10-20mins for the buzzer to ring after making order. Always many people order from here. Good business. Somehow the plate is bigger than whats being served. Anyway i like their grilled fish, so give them 4 stars.
Guys, just to update u 8.50 for chicken cutlet ya. So yup, not going back lol. Also cheapo auntie give 2 package chilli some more tell me i put the chilli inside alr ah haha. GL.

Affordable and good western food. This place is a bang for your buck. Highly recommended.

<EDIT> 20220520 - have dropped my rating of JWS Grille factory. standard has dropped. ordered a ribeye, but they served a sirloin. very disappointed.

Affordable and delicious sirloin steak at a coffee shop in Toa Payoh.
Will try their fried chicken the next time.

Underrated stall, they deserve more stars. The pork loin was great, both my kids love it. The portion was juz nice for small eaters like my family. Steak was nicely grilled, char grilled chicken is still tender and juicy. Not forgetting to mention I had to walk a distance home and food still taste excellent. Don't take my words, go try it and review yourself.
Our favourite "Western food" place right now.   Well priced menu and appropriate expectations.   Big fan of the Pineapple or Hawaiian Chicken Chop carbonised like Han Solo, but in cheese.
Overall not bad. Fries so so.
Love the chicken chop here. It has the grilled flavor that you don't get in other coffeeshop western stalls
Fries and Onion rings were soggy and cold. Tried toasting in the oven and unable to turn crispy. Onion rings tasted weird like plastic. Chicken chop thick coated by bread crumbs
So tasty! Plenty of seats too. Good choice very nice service
Affordable food and decently sized portions.
Very well priced western food with promo deals.. Liked the quality of food for that price.
Nice food in shop house with no aircon. Price good because no additon GST and service charge. 😔

Customer service could be better, however food-wise, I'd give it a 7/10. Decent western food for a coffeshop under the HDB.

Be sure to try their Sweet Potato Fries, its one of my favorites from there.
Good mince meat noodle, haha Yong tow hu

I give this place a 1 star because the food is really depressing , the fish and chicken are so small that it does not fill your stomach.Missing side dishes  like the onion rings which was supposed to be 4 per person actually was only 2! And the fries , alot but missing 1 packet , also found a piece of fries that was fried with some strings in it  which was gross. With the price of the fish costing 7.90 and getting such a small portion of it , i will rather eat burger king or macdonalds which is more worth it. I reco not to buy in bulk as they may give missing side dishes.

Rude middle aged woman manning the store. Prepared the order for eat-in even though she asked twice and I’ve confirmed both times that it’s for takeaway. When I received my order and told her it’s for takeaway, she started scolding me, and told the kitchen folks that I “changed my mind again”.

She said, “if it’s really for takeaway, why did you accept my order pager?”

It was my first time at that store. Who would know that a pager is only meant for eat in?

Food wasn’t even good. Not recommended.

Horrible service. I understand that the server doesn’t understand English. At least staff should have basic training to learn stall’s dish names. Nvm, so happen that a lady before me orders fish and chips, so I told the staff “same dish” in Chinese. After 15 mins of good wait, I was being served a chicken cutlet instead of fish. And the staff still insisted it is fish, despite it’s definitely chicken just by one look.

Ordered rib eye steak medium rare from this restaurant today. Got a seared steak with completely raw meat!!!! Could not eat the rest of the meal as I am not sure how fresh is the meat. Everything was horrible.

Food average, abit pricy. The staff who is taking order is super unfriendly. I wanted to change my order, the staff stare at me, show me black face and said cannot change because they have prepared my order already but i waited for 30 minutes still have not get my food. Dont even deserve 1 star.
