No fries came with the fish and chips that I ordered. The mashed potatoes were quite good, but everything else was adequate at best.
Steak is good for their price range but sides can improve standard.
Nice western food and options
Chicken chop with brown sauce is nice.
You pay hawker centre prices for restaurant sized steaks. Highly recommend
Beef burger with 2 sides
Long queue. I dont like the sweet corn side dishes.
It's ok
Super affordable western food with almost always long q. But they are so efficient that the wait is never arduously long.
blk 73 curry fish head good mac 4pax fot 12$ cheap and good. other 8 to 12$. try try...
Good food and reasonable price.
Yet to try heard that their rating was good.
Nice! Had THE LAVA Cheese Burger!
Lovely steak on offer and affordably price food.
I like the chicken chop. They deserve more stars..
mac & cheese sides are really good
Budget steak for quick bite.
Nice burger
Overall its good for a normal western stall
Apparently they have quite a spread of mains and sides. Lookout for their promotion.
Love the promotional items. Value for money
Quite nice, especially when they got promotion

Food was really good! Much better than expected! Beef patty of the burger very fragrant, and chicken cutlet very well marinated! And the fried mushroom, super yummy! Definitely prefer this place over Astons! 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼 and very cute robot waiter 🤩

Good:
- Axsolutely amazing service. Staffs are helpful and helped us to communicate with the bowling staffs. There were some miscomm but the staffs were sincere in apologizing and even compensated us with free soup, drinks and 10% discount even though it was not entirely their fault.

- Food portion is just nice! Prices are reasonable and 25% off for SAFRA members!

- Very nice outdoor seatings with great view of the night sky.

- Great choice of sides for the mains including aglio Olio!

Bad:
- Aglio oilio is abit salty.

Like the atmosphere and ambiance as its inside of temhr bowling centre.
Service crews were quite nice and polite.
Food wise, not bad. Beverage on quite high side.

Brought my mum here for lunch few hours ago. The 2 gentleman that served us were very friendly and helpful. We had the 1 for 1 main meals promotion which was very worth it. Taste of the food was not bad actually so we are keen to return to try the rest of the food.

An excellent restaurant for the genre - located in a bowling alley, aimed at families, the food selection is fair, the portiin size very nice, the price is reasonable. Good for people who need baby chairs, too, which is a plus.
My family enjoyed the experience. The waiter took time to explain about the food. Service was good enough especially Gary, Jason and Raj. I love the food.
Pizza is 5/10. Taste like those frozen one in the supermarket. If you are looking for a quiet place, look elsewhere. It is next to a bowl place so noise is inevitable.
Nice outdoor chill out area. Food was reasonably priced (especially with SAFRA discount), albeit rather salty.

We decided to dine-in after picking the kids up from classes (adhering to 2 per table restrictions due to Covid restrictions). The Aglio Olio is very flavorful with a hint of lemon which makes it refreshing and not overly rich.
We also tried the Barramundi Fish & Chips and I loved it. The batter was very crispy and tasty. The fries were normal, but the best Barramundi fish I’ve had, I feel that they’re way better than some of the restaurants I’ve tried before.
Nice and cosy place to chill out. Food was great, reasonably priced and better than expected. Gary and team provided excellent service.

Great vibes for great value meals.
Grab the promotion items!

First time here and am really satisfied with their service and taste.

Hawaiian and chicken grilled pizza - 👍👍👍👍👍

Grilled chicken burger 👍👍👍👍👍
Onion rings 👍👍👍👍👍
Golden dust chicken cutlet 👍👍👍👍 (juiciness was missing)

If your a safra member, there's promotion and discounts. Worth it 👍👍👍👍👍
Nice vibe,good vibe to chill and relax..food was not bad..environment was good..very relax here..price also affordable.HENG,ONG,HUAT to the boss
The food was good and staff are really helpful! Food is also VERY reasonably priced especially with the Safra discount! Will come here again with friends & family.
Great value food, especially the 1 for 1 lunch.
Good and tasty food.... And the promo is quite reasonable
Good food, good environment, good prices, friendly staff, won a truffle fries on lucky draw!
I ate here after my game today. Food and service were great! They even accept PayNow!
Friendly service!
Notbad

(Translated by Google) Food portions are big and taste good. The price is reasonable, and the discounts of eatigo or their own are very attractive.
Food portions are big and taste good. The price is reasonable, and the discounts of eatigo or their own are very attractive.

(Original)
Food portions are big and taste good.  The price is reasonable, and the discounts of eatigo or their own are very attractive.
食物分量很大，味道好。 价钱合宜，搭配eatigo的折扣或者自己本身的折扣都很吸引人。

friendly stall owner, gives great vibes! ordered the fried fish with mashed potato and onion rings as sides. also ordered an ala carte side of chicken nuggets. portion was quite generous, really worth the $13 i paid for the meal :) thanks for the meal!!
had chicken chop with pasta. overall taste not bad, gd portion too. price was $8.50 er which i felt slightly ex cos dis was a stall in non-aircon coffeeshop.
Great western grill at toa payoh central. The shroom oglio aglio and cheese wedges must try when you are here. Coffeeshop is clean and well maintained too.

02/03/22
Chicken garlic pasta is good. The large calamari rings are crispy and nice as well.

One of the best ribeye steaks from a local western coffee shop stall one can find, grilled to your preferred doneness. Mine came medium, succulent and moist, and at $16.80, that’s pretty good value. Staff is friendly too.

Chicken chop aglio olio:
Chicken was well seasoned and tasty. It was also grilled to perfection with just the right amount of charring. The aglio olio looked pale and unassuming, but it was packed with garlicky taste and was seasoned enough, without being  overly oily like a lot of coffee shop aglio olios. However, personally would have liked it to be spicier.
A pleasant find at Toa Payoh. Juicy, succulent and well seasoned chicken chop. The charred garlic bits gave crunch and punch to the aglio olio. Excellent value for the quality.

Really Good Western Food! Had the Ribeye 250gms at $16.80 inclusive of 2 side dishes. Good Quality Beef! Charred on the outside, juicy inside. Try Medium done. I had it Medium well which was a bit overdone but still a pretty good piece of Steak. Try it.
Chicken cutlet with aglio olio
The steak is done well and grilled over fire. Very worth the dollar.
The guys at the stall at absolute Chads. Awesome food for a good price. Every other western stall in the area is average compared to this. Astons eat your heart out 💯

Good quality NZ ribeye steak at good price!
Appreciated the thoughtful service when the chef re-plated a half eaten steak when we needed the raw parts more seared.  Good service 👍
Food is good, would be perfect if they are more generous with the onion rings
First time tried this stall. Ordered lamb chop and was pleasantly surprised by the well marinated meat with rosemary herbs and cooked over fire grill. Best lamb chops so far!
Chicken chop was awesome. Generous portions!
Highly recommend the 250grams NZ Ribeye. Ordered 2 times and each time was cooked perfectly. The side dishes are good too.
We had chicken cutlet and fish&chips, each at $7.50 includes 2 sides and bake beans. Really affordable. There's no need to go to a restaurant unless you're looking for air-con.
Nice western food. Will come again.
Food is tasty as it not salty,  seasoning well balance.. 👍💰 Value for money.. Try yourself

Above average western food stall at a coffeeshop.
Ordered Pan fried Dory fish $7.50.
Not oily. Very well presented
Ask for pepper sauce to be on the side, Broccoli is well cooked. Coleslaw is made by themselves.

Exceed my expectation for a coffeeshop.
Tasty meal
Fabulous food. Nice selection of sides
Best $16 Ribeye steak, good qyality value
Portion was generous and decent for the price, pretty high standard for Coffeeshop Western food. Will come back again
Succulent chicken cutlet
So so food n price high
Good western food.
Good and affordable
All side dishes are cold
Nice 👍chicken chop & chicken cuttle
Good food good time

Ordered wild mushroom pasta in cream sauce. Mushroom was ok. Pasta texture was ok. But too much cheese added n it was crazy salty. Maybe I'll try something else next time or ask them to put less salt or not put cheese.

Recently ordered their fish and chip and grilled fish to try. Well I am quite impressed and it was quite good especially the grill fish that it was cooked well and has flavor with the brown sauce. Fish and chip is typical but both portion size may be small doe most people.

Ordered chicken spaghetti with cream sauce and spring chicken whole to try. The spaghetti noodle was well cook not too soft, chicken is bland like poach in water and throw into the spaghetti to cook. The cream sauce lacks flavor and not rich, a bit running. However the chicken was good, loved their crispy skin that is packed with flavours and not oily. Worth trying their fried spring chicken!

Portion became smaller. Ordered chix cutlet rice. Few pieces of chicken on white rice.

Ordered 3 chicken wings. Overcooked with black patches.

I ordered before another lady. End up lady got the order before me.

Went to ask the cashier a male, how come take so long. Give me theory lesson that fried chicken wings takes longer to cook than fried fish.

Wow. Lor wonder my 3 pieces chicken wings was overcooked n had random black patches

Thanks not coming back. Service sucks like the food.

Those ordering from grab, its the same male chef cooking your sometimes under or overcooked fish/chicken. If a chef cant be consistent what he puts out, wonder how he survive so long.

Ordered two chicken chop sets, one with fries, the other with spaghetti, the one with spaghetti was supposed to come without sauce on the chicken chop. They managed to screw up BOTH ORDERS. Unfortunately only discovered the mistake after I arrived home.

Super slow yet food nothing special. Cook was packing precooked spaghetti (horrible, they should be cooked fresh) into about 50 small bags for later use instead of spending time to preparing my order.

Lot of varieties of western foods n Japanese like foods with a reasonable price... All rice come with a small bowl of a little diluted taste but overall it ok... Tried their pan fried fish with Japanese rice @ $4.80... fish is soft and well pan fried... Don't mind to come back again...
Beef steak and chicken chop are delicious and the price surprisingly very affordable 😍🔥❤️ Yummmmmyy !! Best
Chicken Chop + 1 x sausage for $7.50. Portion is small and don't taste that good. Not worth my moneu
Tried the pan fried fish (R3) with mushroom sauce. For the price of 4.8, this is really good with pearl/Japanese rice.

Ordered from them on Grabfood and the food was not packed properly and the sauce spilled all over the bag. Not only so, I’ve topped up $3.80 for popcorn chicken and I received a pathetic little bag of it, on top of the the paper bag that contained the chicken was soaked in oil. I hope the restaurant would consider better packaging and to reconsider their portion sizes for some of their items.

Tried the ribeye, chicken chop and half spring chicken. Reminds me of old-school tuckshop Western food. Spring chicken is crispy and juicy yet not oily. Haven't tried the other items but these are good!

I have been ordering through Grabfood many times. Can say their food is not consistent at all. Overall, their grilled fish is still passable, but both their mushroom soup and mash potato taste bad (really sour) and the garlic bread lacks flavour. Gotta improve on their side dishes.

Just for 14Jun's order. We made an order today and found the batter for the fried fish n spaghetti too salty. Not sure if the spaghetti was boiled too long in salt water or the sauce over salted. Had to remove the batter from the dory fish for consumption. No issues with previous orders. Perhaps the cook could be more mindful. Thank you.

I have been ordering from them via grab food multiple times. I always order the Ribeye Steak Set. Tbh for food court western, this really tastes delicious and the portions are sufficient. I don't know about the rest of the items on the menu cause I've never tried it  but their ribeye steak has never disappointed me.

All time fav for their pasta! (Aglio olio), cheap and affordable!

They also allowed to upsize your pasta portion which is great!

Reading some of the reviews here are quite entertaining, as though like the prices were hidden and you got a culture shock when the price came up 🤣 #facepalm

Great black pepper chicken chop, must try it.
The chicken is well done and black pepper sauce is awesome.
The plate bigger than the food. This one hawker or restaurant? $5 rather spend my money for donation. Scam 😡
Been eating that stall since it was open a few years ago. Never had a better western in a hawker settings.
Customer service is terrible. They won’t listen to ur order properly. Their food is mediocre but a little overpriced.
Spring Chicken Set and Fish n Chips are good.
Food was good.

The worst western food I ate so far. Nothing is nice.. Salad is sweet. Chicken is hard. Fries is bad. Rice got a weird taste. Black pepper sauce is with water n corn starch.  Hope you can do better, do something above average. I m really sorry to comment like this but I m not enjoying it at all.

Ordered the popcorn chicken with rice. Requested to remove coleslaw and the stall owner gave even more popcorn chicken! Wow.

The chicken is crunchy and spicy. Extremely satisfying.

Rice is flavourful too. Goes quite well with the chicken.

Very generous serving.

Ordered chicken chop with butter rice through food panda. Requested for more sauce and fries. To my very pleasant surprise the boss was very generous to my request. Of cos the food is delicious as well. Pricing is affordable too. Will recommend anyone who craves for western food to visit them.
Ps:the butter rice is super delicious

LOUSY  is an understatement.  Steak made super well done despite ordering medium rare. Ask for a change, told by the stall guy, there is no difference between medium well & medium rare. What??? Do you even qualify to do steak when all wellness means the same???
Nice, friendly and pretty Chef. Their western is so good. Among the best in the area. The portions are big. Fries and salad are old school. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Ordered ribeye, tasted like black pepper chicken breast. Never coming back.

Came here because of the good reviews. Ordered a sirloin steak. Worst steak I ever had. Cooked by a Chinese man. I asked for medium rare. He gave me well done. When i tried to return the steak, he told me medium rare and medium well are the same. Steak was terribly tough. Black pepper sauce absolutely tasteless. The only saving grace was crispy fries and good portion of coleslaw. It was a nightmare. I ended up throwing half the steak and just eating fries and coleslaw for dinner.
Tried the whole spring chicken ($9) and chicken chop ($6). Pretty good portion size and tasted OK. Spring chicken could have been fried a bit less

Just tried the outlet at 31 Kelantan lane
Beef is overcooked and taste like rubber.
Egg is also overcooked.
Don't deserve a $11 pricing.
Sad.
To add on
Potato is extremely Satish.
Total failure.
Thanks God.
It seems it will be last I order again.
Boss.
Please do something
31 kelantan lane outlet. WORST western food ever. Portion was so small and dry.

[17/11/21 13:09] order food thus Panda (Mix grill)at stall, being very rude treated an service by ur VN cook..
Was told, I cannot placed order in such manner, of changing meat option.
Ask me to cancel this order. Well, in the 1st place, on ur platform, u shld stated no meat option changing is allowed..
Or else additional top is required
In such cases, ur end as the food stall vendor shld cancel this order. Hw would customer would be able to known
While waiting time to cook n wait to pick up, made an feedback to the boss Ms Ann (Vietnamese)
Male staff cook come in front n confronted me. Saying, I shouldn't say his bad attitude.
Seem like looking for fight, it is very simple,  either u cook or don't cook.
Don't yells at me the customer. Upon picking of food. When ready. Don't even bother to call customer. Just throw there. Expected u known. Post such review, hope bring awareness of this stall staff serving crew attitude. Never an retuning customer despite how cheap n big portion of the food serving.

I have ordered from this restaurant for the past 2 weeks through food panda. The food was quite tasty even though for some reason they always change my order due to having not enough stock on hand... especially the baked beans... Apparently no baked beans for the past week but its still listed in foodpanda...

Today i ordered again and the coleslaw tasted awful, very sour and presumably expired... I took the first bite and threw it away. The few times i ordered coleslaw from them, it tasted normal... but not today.

I hope that the restaurant does not keep food overnight and serve them to customers the next day... this poses a health risk.

I will probably still order from them again... but never the coleslaw after this event.
Had chicken chop! The black pepper sauce and chicken is decent. The mash potato is quite horrible tho. But value for money! Old school western food.

I ordered the striploin steak through food panda, i usually dont write reviews but i was cery happy with my meal. It came with a nice portion of rice, steak was pretty food and fries wont too bad. Overall it cost me $11 and that is pretty affordable. Highly reccomend trying it out

This is a horrible shop. Waited for more than 30 mins still haven’t got my food…wanted to rate zero star, but there is not such option. :) I asked when the food will be ready, they answered “since you’ve already waited for so long, what’s the big deal with waiting for additional 5 mins”, amazing attitude :)
Sirloin steak sucks, chicken cutlet, and fish and chips ok. Mediocre!
Excellent western food. Portion is good and very good customer service.
Good portion of chicken cutlet, fries and coleslaw. Worth the $6.
Fish and chips $6. Big portion.
Ordered Fish & Chip and Chicken Chop both were great!
Fish and chips batter is very good and big portion
Amazing old school western food, portion was generous and food very delicious.
Cheesy Chicken Chop is top notch.
The fish & chips very average

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
I give it a 5 star rating as I found 2 stalls were exceptional out of my expectation, although the other 2 with fairly ok taste after my own trial. The soybeam milk and the You Tiao Man are awesome, it's the best I've tried since came to Singapore. The You Tiao Man has no butter flavor, and it's not like the others that it too much stuff, it tastes crisp out side but also light feel inside with a little salty. The boss said there's not so many people make You Tiao in the old way like him, I totally believe.
Astonishingly, the 88 congee was a little disappointed though a lot of people were in the queue. The congee is too thick, rice was not totally melted. Maybe I've tasted too much Cantonese style of congee, I would only give 3 star for this. The Teochew Handmade Pau was ok, I'll give it a 4 star, as it's just doing ok and the same as I tried in a Pau stall in Tiong Bahru. I didn't try the other famous ones like carrot cake, fried fish soap that day as they were not open. But all in all, a place worth to go again!

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Known for the fried carrot cake (chey suay) that you have to queue for at least 30mins: tip is to place order first, have a cup of coffee, the collect.

Hawker centre is usually busy in the day, and few stalls open for dinner.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Nice n adorable madeleines and big crossiants at this stall. Madeleines were fresh out of oven when I visited at 9 plus in e morning. Run by a young hawker and they sell waffles, ice cream n pasta too.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
1st Visit To This Food Centre... Alot Of e Stalls Are Not Open On A Wednesday Weekday Around 11+ 12pm. However, There's A Number Of Stalls w Queues For Lunch Crowd Still... 😊
A Nostalgic Taste Of Kway Chap!! Can Try If You Are A Kway Chap Lover... I Don't Really Take Intestines, But Theirs Are Indeed Well Served I Would Say~

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Love the food here, must go hawker center for local delicacy esp Hokkien mee (best of the best) many snacks and desserts
Yet to try the muffin and you tiao

Minus 2* for the tables and hygiene
People could be ignorant and forget to wipe down tables after eating especially on busy period like weekends *sigh*

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Fairly empty at time of visit (10am Friday).
Stores with constant queue were the roast meat store, main tauhuey store, hokkien mee store.

Ordered the famous carrot cake large size $4, took about 40mins. Not as nice as I recall and frankly even too salty, and this was after I had my other dishes. Wouldn’t have it again.

Had the large size $3.50 mee Siam, it was really good and I would be happy to have it again. Auntie squeezes the lime juice for you so you don’t have to do it yourself.

The tauhuey $1 was good but I didn’t prefer it. Though silky somehow I felt there was no more soybean taste. It felt like I was eating agarAgar or pudding…

Hokkien mee smallest size $5, was really good. It was flavorful, umami, good taste of lard without the porky taste. Chilli was not my fav but the base noodles itself was way too good already. Would have it again but it is a big portion for the smallest size.

Toapayoh HC is not bad. Was wondering why it was quite empty today but realised must have been because of the current covid cluster here . Lol…

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Breakfast here, small hawker center but the Laksa sooo good and perfect match with calamansi juice 😍😍 the price also cheap. Stall in the middle dont know the name bcos thats chinese character

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Coffee stall lasts forever, nearly 30 years Qing Qing.
Pretty plenty of choices for youngsters in bean curb, jelly, Teck Hwa. Market and hawker are modernised with bright lit stall.
Found little old style fried prawn here, 记得来吃。
Food center is well lit and ventilated.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: It’s a nice hawker centre in Toa Payoh, tried the lei cha and the soya milk, really worth the price.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Very well maintained market and food center upstairs. Regular evening cleaning by the town council. Great food in the food center upstairs such as the Joon Heng Noodle stall selling chicken feet noodle, 88 congee, duck rice, Hup Lee Fried Mee Hoon selling economy bee hoon and come daily hokkien mee which is my favorite. There is a snack stall on the ground level and this uncle sells really fresh snacks, his opening hours is in regular and do have plenty of patience to purchase your snack...

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: I like to go there. Wet market, level 2 hawker stalls. Today I was there for breakfast, and did my marketing. At level 2 the wanton noodle stall still has long Q, I missed it because I do not want to Q. I found 天天来Hokkien fries noodle. I was very delighted. Unfortunately I did not get to eat. I will be back again to eat 天天来Hokkien Noodle🥰 a must to eat food.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Great market, with lots of good food options. Highlights include the "thunder tea rice" (vegetarian, very healthy, super tasty), "88 congee" (very close to Hong Kong style thick congee with lots of options/varieties), "ugly cupcakes" and the "fish ball and fish dumpling" stall. Highly recommend a visit to this place.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Lots of good food options within the hawker and around the area too. Food are all on the second floor with the wet Market downstairs. Home to many famous food like hokkien mee (come daiky- my go to alternative to geylang), fishball noodle, chicken rice and more.  Tried a new peanut pancake here today (stall is located in the middle area) and was cheap and good ! Pieces were also quite big.

There's a good hakka ytf at the nearby coffee shop and a couple of cafes near the old creamier  area.

My go to place if I'm around the tpy area for a relaxing fuss free meal. Lots of parking options around too.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Teochew hand-made tim-sum, White carrot cake, Hokkien noodles, White chicken rice and Uggli muffins. Must try at each respective food stall serving only a single menu. Cannot miss them when you are at the food centre.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Support hawker food👍There’s so many good food at this market! Briyani from $2.90! I tried the plain Dosai today $1.50, simply good! Owner is friendly!

Xiang Yuan Cafe, the tea is so good! $0.80 for small cup.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: The Lei Cha #02-39 is phenomenal and only $4 for a big main bowl and the cha!!! So delicious!! I would say the handmade teochew pau & 88 congee is a 4/5, pretty standard.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Lots of food options. Popular for carrot cake, hokkien mee and soya bean drinks. They have new store like chee Cheong fan and Korea food.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: On a second floor of a wet market... The food section is divided into 4 parts with lot of local good "recommend" foods... Nostalgic feeling to an old town... But just don't go during night time, almost all are closed...

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Good place for hawker food.... Run by generation of local. Must try this old fashioned wanton noodle. 2nd dish to try is the fish soup. Freshness is ok. Special feature is the seaweed piece in it.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Blk 127, 128 n 124 form a triangle of good food n activity.

At 127 is the popular local mkt,
the fresh fish stalls looked clean n lively, plenty of vegetables n a row of friendly clothes stalls too.  Food Centre on upper level (has Teochew handmade pau stall).  Plant for sale grd level corner is gd value.
At 128 is Niche Cafe, hair salon n sundry shops for housewares n cute hair accessories.  Far corner of this block is coffeeshop with very good Roast Meat rice stall.

At 124 is good value Hakka Yong Tau hu n a seafood restaurant in airy coffeeshop. For amusement, there's Japan Home store.  Blk facing 124 has good reflexology at Healing Hands.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: An affordable hawker center with a wide selection of food, but my personal favourites are the porridge and hokkien mee stall. You can have a meal here for $5 but it can get quite crowded during lunch time. Also be careful of hungry birds!

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: A lovely mix of food stalls on the top floor (second storey) and a wet market that has traditional stalls like alteration shops and coffee beans, plus a wide selection of stalls selling vegetables, meat, seafood - all fresh!! One can even find unique vegetables typically not found at a local wet market such as kale, organic mini carrots, romanesco brocoli, and even fennel!

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
It was a great place indeed. I honestly went to the market however most of the outlets are closed. Really love to cook fish today.lol.I just enjoy strolling with the windy and warm weather,bought a watermelon juice and just seat here for a while.

Look at the view,it’s a breath of fresh air,really relaxing.

Let’s stroll again next time pips.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Newly reopened after a renovation. Not a big hawker centre, but has a few good and popular stalls with a constant line of customers. The food pricing range from cheap to reasonable. The quality is decent, authentic, and sometimes nostalgic. Crowded during lunch hour, and most stalls closes after lunch.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
One of more spaceious and clean hawkers in Sg. Few key personal fav stalls to try..
1) qing qing kopi shop
2) shredded chicken fishball noodle
3) teowchew dimsum
4) uggly muffins
5) hk roast
6) chee chong fun

Enjoy !

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: “Look for Mee” good food and friendly service. Authentic home cooked flavours.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Prawn Mee with Clams ($6.50). Was surprised that a halal prawn mee could still be good even though no pork was used in the broth. Lots of chicken bones were used instead of pork bone, together with anchovies, dried shrimps and prawn shells.

Those who like their prawn noodles dry should also like that the noodles were savoury and fragrant with lots of fried shallots in the mix.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Beancurd here is good! Gula Melaka was an interesting flavour to try but I preferred the original flavoured one. Hawker centre is clean, no birds flying in, toilets clean as well. Many food options here

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
This hawker centre is one of the best hawkers in Singapore. Many awarded & featured hawker stores from various online platform as well as newspaper outlets.

Some of the famous stores here include this white carrot cake store ( for $4 theres a generous portion of egg. The texture on the outside is crispy & soft on the inside chilli sauce is slightly on the sweeter side & not too spicy for those who can't stand the heat)

Hokkien mee ($8 portion in the picture. Get 5 small prawns which are peeled for you & no fishy smell for the sotong n prawn. This will be the wetter version of hokkien mee. It's a good plate but only thing lacking is more char flavour or wokhei.)

Many other food here not in the picture but are delicious !!!!

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Interesting and new concoction to bean curd toppings. Not only from usual chin chow or tau sar, you get Kellogg's cereal too

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
A limited number of stalls selling food.
The nice ones are the fried hokkien mee stall( tien tien lai) which is definitely a must try. There is also a stall selling teochew pau(teochew hand made pau), not too bad also. Not forgetting the famous fried carrot cake stall(chey sua), if you like your carrot cake that is crispy on the outside and soft in the inside, then you must try.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Good cheap lunches at L1, but most sold out by 1pm.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Well ventilated food centre and toilets are finally free (used to have surcharge for use).

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Majority of the food are good but price is getting high. I believe should be across all hawker centres. The fried hokkien prawn noodle is good 👍

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: This stall’s carrot cake (white+spicy)’s great!! Not too dry/wet 🤤❤️

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Had breakfast at the market on level 2. I tried the Hakka "thunder tea" rice and really liked it. Loads of veg and nuts mixed into brown rice with soup. All for $4. 👍🏼

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Today I was at this place Q 1 hour just for this yummy UGGLI muffins. I started to Q @ 11.50am and finally my turn ut was 12.52pm. Now 1 person is allowed to buy 1 box of 12 muffins👍👍. Do drop by to buy these tummy muffins but do remember u must have the patient to wait. Yummy 😋😋🧁

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
Great fish soup and soya beancurd and soya milk drink. The fish soup costs $4 and rice is $0.50. The soup doesn’t contain MSG (as stated at stall front). You do have the option of adding evaporated milk. The chef looks stern but he’s a very nice.
The soya bean stall is run by some young chaps. Very friendly looking.
If you’re looking to try other food here, don’t come on Monday. Most of the stalls are closed.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Very nice carrot cake. It have a nice tempura texture to it. The chilli is like those Thai Sweet chilli. Super enjoyable however watch those calories. The hawker mix a lot of oil into the carrot cake and egg mixture before frying. Hence the carrot cake is very fragrant.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Great place of a good and affordable meal.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: The stall that sells economy beehoon and nasi lemak always has long queues as the food is very tasty and price very reasonable

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
The Damage: S$10-15 for two

Medium sized hawker area on the second floor of a market complex. Popular with residents around the area with hits including the Bib Gourmand Carrot Cake and Hokkien Mee stall

~~TRY😍:
// Come Daily #02-27 ~ Hokkien Mee

Follow us at IG: eatsmorefun

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Quite convenient to get sundry goods. But the items in this surronding environment are a bit higher than other markets nearby. Not a bad place to hang around if free.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: had my fav fishball noodle in the morning.. plenty of good food for breakfast to start the day.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
About 11 minutes walk from Caldecott MRT.
Not the busiest hawker centre but with the usual food and items you are looking for.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content:
1 of other stall within the hawker centre offering same dishes of 🦞 🦐🦀 white bee hoon.

Not as good as other stall.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Alot of tasty foods available

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Many good food like teo Chew pao, lei char, mee siam, muffins......

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Wet market and a food court in level 2. Renovated one. Gets crowded during lunch hours. More options to eat.

restaurant name: Toa Payoh West Market & Food Centre (Lorong 1)
content: Sooo good well worth the trip after a hefty hike at macritchie! We had prawn noodle yum yum!

2nd visit. The pork Cutlet is very nice, thick cut and the meat still quite juicy. Change the rating to 4 star instead.

Average tasting Western food stall. Less crowded compare to the other western food stall in the same market, so it an alternate if you prefer shorter waiting time.

Auntie handling the order is very rude and has very bad attitude , speak like we owe her money. Got my order wrong and still insist I order wrongly. The pork chop is abit dry but the sirloin steak is bad. Stopped eating and ordered other food instead. Order at your own risk

Delicious Western food within the Kim Keat Palm Food Centre. Pork Chop came with fries, coleslaw and baked beans. Pork chop itself was tender and tasty. Chicken wings were well marinated and fried to perfection with golden crispy skin. Staff was bubbly and friendly. Fast and efficient services rendered.
Nice chicken chop set. The chicken is cooked nicely with juicy meat and crispy skin.

Affordable local style western food that's value for money. Great taste, reasonable pricing, super friendly and pretty lady boss. Recently they also adopted contactless payment via SGQR so you don't have to fumble with cash (and more hygienic during this covid season)
Love the chicken chop here! Come try it yourself.
Visited once. A very average Western food stall. Dislike the coleslaw, tastes very watery, the sauce not coated on the vegetable. Meat is small piece and taste very normal...
This Western Food used to be very nice. But after the owner employ helper to do the cooking, the chicken wing sometimes is not fully cook. 👎👎👎
Chicken Chop with Fries and Coslaw with brown sauce. The chicken is well done and juicy inside.
Extremely rude staff who are very inpatient at customer, waited for a good 2 minute at the cashier only to receive a lashing by them asking me to wait when i tried to order
Nice Western food but waiting time always very long
The guys is very rude  in taking order.. wearing red shirt i order on 27/11/20.
Old.school western food. Love the pork chop especially
Acceptable. Nothing great to shout about
Nice tender pork chops..
Yummy chicken  chop

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Tried this outlet yesterday. It was almost empty during lunch time, very spacious.

The service staff who took our orders at the cashier had quite an attitude. She seemed irritated/ annoyed and was rude towards my friends even when they were very polite towards her.  She was impatient and got angry at one of my friends when he did not understand what she was saying (none of us could because she was not pronouncing the words properly/speaking up). She displayed an attitude when my friend went directly to select his choice of sides when he was ordering the double up chicken as did not know that he was allowed to choose the chicken. Oh btw there wasnt anyone behind us. This conduct is extremely turned off and uncalled for. As much as we try to understand why she is behaving this way, it is unfair for us customers to have to deal with her personal problems.

The food was affordable and tasted not bad. Chicken was tender, baked potatoes was not too hard unlike other outlets, quite nice.

The ambience would be very chill if its not for the two different songs playing in the background. One of it was probably playing from the speaker and the other one sounded like it came from the kitchen. Felt a bit uncomfortable.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Always love Aston’s for their affordable prices n good food. Will always order the steak with a glass of red wine. Now that it has become a halal establishment, no more alcohol is served. Nevertheless, the food is still great at that price.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The queue is really long at dinner time because there's only one service staff taking order before you can get seated. The ribeye was overcooked and dry and some parts were fully burnt. Their sides were at least edible. Astons used to be known for being value for money, but their standard has dropped drastically. Not an exaggeration that I've had steak at coffee shops nicer than this, and a third of Astons price.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Food is good but sad they took out Snapple now. Side can be better. Side dish standard drop compare to last time.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The latte which looks like long kept lemon tea. And the char grill chicken, is over burnt chicken. The standard really drop a lot. Beside the steak and fish. Please to order the char grilled here.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Had chargrilled chicken and 2 sides for lunch and it was an enjoyable meal. Chicken was tender and juicy while the baked potato was done right. Quiet place during weekdays for some me-time. No service charge and SAFRA members get 10% off.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: They are short handed and staff stretched to the max but they still open up the entire place. End result is they have to rush like mad compromising customer service and food. I been to this outlet many times,  all I can say is they are on a slippery road down in terms of service.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Located in SAFRA Toa Payoh.
Astons is the only other entity together with Superbowl bowling centre and Mcdonalds that have survived from day one it opened.
The premises is much bigger, compared to most other Astons restaurants and can seat at least 50.
Dishes here are of same standard as other Astons branches.
But somehow, they run out of FRIES on MONDAYS a lot of times.
Staff explained to me that their fries supply sell out over weekends and they are unable to get replenishment by Monday mornings.
Do take note of this and prepare to have other sides if you are coming on mondays!

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: There is only 1 pathetic female staff manning a long queue of crowd at the cashier counter, taking orders, collecting payments and assigning/bringing customers to the table. It doesn't help that she is also very slow. The rest of the staffs and manager are either walking around, chatting and idling behind the beverage counter. It's very frustrating. There should be an extra staff helping to take the orders at the cashier during peak hours. Food is good and value for money but the staffs really need to be more efficient!

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Great place to bring family for lunch or dinner fixed. Less crowded than the other outlets. The manager was very friendly and helpful enough to bring back to the kitchen to recook the steak that received raw initially.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Aston’s/Andes has always been a go-to place for good food at decent prices. However during my latest visit, I was made to queue for over 45 mins despite the restaurant being less than half full. Already quite annoyed, when I was finally seated at a table, I noticed that people who were at the front of the queue when I reached the place were already leaving, that’s how long the wait was. Food didn’t come for another 20-30 mins and when it did, the portion of food was disgustingly small and the wellness of the steak was nowhere close to the requested. Overall an overwhelmingly disappointing experience and very frustrating in terms of service.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
services:  i was regular at here but yesterday was first time that i and my family received very good services from the staff here her name was Hanah, she wearing tudung. Excellent.

Food: Excellent, thank to the chief for the excellent food that you offered.
i will come back again

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Standard dropped a lot since the last time I visited. Ordered chicken cutlet and felt the meat tasted slightly weird. The inside was alittle pinkish. Informed the manager and he told me their chicken is supposed to be slightly pinkish on the inside due to the marinate they use. Gave him the benefit of a doubt and continued with my meal.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
I had difficulty logging in to my Safra App however the waiter still provided me the discount.

Food portion was good and taste ok.

Newly renovated and it is brighter now.

Air conditioning was a bit cold for me though.

Overall was a good experience.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Service not that great. When asked for a glass of plain water, the first thing the waitress said is chargeable. We paid so much for the meal. It doesn't make sense if we can't afford for a glass of water. Need to train the staff how to communicate to customers.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Went to eat nearing the closing time. The staff were still rather pleasant and courteous despite that.

The Chargrill and lemon chicken were good. The wedges and onion rings weren't fresh but expected since it was almost closing time.

Overall great experience.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: I was in awe when Hui Ping, your full time staff at the counter told to write the product codes for the food in bigger letters next time, otherwise she is going to key in the wrong items for us. Basically, i am here at the counter with the chit paper, to confirm my orders before making payment. Next, she asked me to read out the drinks product codes to her since she could not read our order. Telling her the code name and she asked, what is CF2?? Isn't this the product code your restaurant decided upon for the beverages that you serve? You must be joking with me right? You do not even know or bother to check what code goes to what drinks as someone who is already a full timer? The way you speak to me makes me feel you are commanding your customer. What marvelous customer service you have..

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: It was quite disappointing as the sides I ordered, the mash potatoes isn’t seasoned with butter or even salt, it just plain potatoes, the Mac and cheese has close to no salt either, likewise for the unseasoned chicken which they barely pass it off with a hickory bbq sauce. I didn’t remember Aston standards to be this low as it was a place that I would go to in my younger years. The standard of their food has certainly deteriorate over the years. Would not visit again, as western food from coffee shops would be better than this.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Place is alright, unfortunately service is really poor. Tried to get the waiter’s attention but they ignored me despite making eye contact with me. Also, not sure why such establishments do not offer tap water? Wouldn’t recommend and wouldn’t return in the future

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: ASTONS in Singapore is awesome! I always love the value for money. Their food is delicious, generous. Especially love their pasta salad! Yummy max. It's usually packed with people especially during weekend evenings.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Long queue despite restaurant being half full; queued more than an hour to be seated. Then waited another 40 mins for food to arrive. Standard of food has dropped. I have been a supporter of Aston's but not anymore after this experience.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Restaurant was only half full on a Friday Lunch hour. Orders took 45 mins to arrive. Kitchen was extremely slow compared to other outlets. If you want to eat ASTONS suggest to patronise their other outlets.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: A reasonable cut for the price you pay. It is probably not going to be the best steak you ever tasted but most likely not the worst too. Don’t get scared off the queue outside. They are just waiting to order before being seated. A good place to go for a family weekend dinner if you have always enjoyed the western food in hawker centre.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
The place was packed.

Wedges tasted fresh, the steak and incrediburger were good.

The mac and cheese was so-so.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Decent steaks at affordable prices. I went with the ribeye extra cut which came with 2 sides (quite good value). Comparable with some of the steaks I've eaten in Australia. Plenty of seating available but you just order and pay before getting a seat. Good for groups and credit cards accepted.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Was there with my 44th years primary school classmate. Love the ambience and the food was fabulous yet very affordable . Definitely highly recommended

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Decent western fare at economical prices. Most meals include 2 side dishes for you to choose. For an extra $5 they will throw in a large bottle of SNAPP juice and a soup with garlic bread. This outlet is always crowded at peak hours so it's good to come a little early. I enjoyed the thick lucious black pepper sauce slathered over the chicken chop which was peppery and appetising.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Consider cheap for western restaurant.
Average 1 plate about 10 dollar. Food is tasty. Service quite fast. Portion size is quite good.  Recommended to try.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Another visit: another one of those promo dish.. Fried duck a la orange... Absolutely scrumptious. 😊

Revisit: The lamb ribs isn't so good anymore... Sad😭
The meat tasted dry n leathery.. Rkn consistency is an issue.

Previous review: Typically I'm not a big fan of Aston. I eat at this location because it's convenient and I can get Safra discount. Generally the grill meats and pasta are so so, with the grilled seafood somewhat better.

Occasionally Aston do deliver some special promo dishes that's a bit more appetitising than normal, and this is what caught my eye... Moroccan lamb short ribs. It was pleasantly surprise for me as usually they tend to overdo on the meats but this lamb ribs is really worthy to command 4 stars. Nicely  charred, with a thick layer of yummilicious fats over laying tender and juicy pink meat. Grilled to medium doneness, the taste of the pinkish meat is simply delectable with natural sweetness and a subtle tinge of Moroccan spices (could be heavier with the spices if I was the cook). Leave the pepper sauce alone. It's too heavy and will overwhelm the natural taste of the spiced lamb. I must have had my month's fill of charred lamb's fats at 1 sitting but heck, it's just melts in your mouth. Too tempting to resist..Yolo😁, will take a couple of motilum when I get home.  😆

As a purchase with purchase, I opted for the escargot baked in garlic/olive oil. That's brilliant too. Aston shd seriously consider make this lamb ribs a permanent part on their menu. I'll definitely patronise more frequently. At $19.90 a pop, this lamb ribs is great deal! 👍👍👍

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Taste ok. Fried chicken taste quite good. Lamb chop was a bit disappointing.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Menu (halal) is quite limited. Set lunch or dinner reasonably priced. Service is good though slow. Cosy ambience. Good for small gathering, family. Those without own transport may find it quite inconvenient.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
• SLOW: Using a pre-pay system where one very slow server took the orders of the entire queue outside. The restaurant was empty but they were just that slow to seat people.
• Kitchen was also very slow getting food out even though the number of customers weren’t that many.
• NEW CHANGES: Ever since the revamp, food portions have gotten smaller but more expensive.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: I'm disappointed with my lunch at Aston in tao payoh safra. Is cold when they serve the steak. Is so hard. After hv the food there came home hv diarrhoea. This is going to be my last time going there.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Reasonable priced and value for money. Yummy food too. But the cleanliness is a bit...... ? Went to get our own utensils and realised that the forks and spoons were all very dirty looking and stained. We asked for disposable forks and spoons instead.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Service attitude was poor, after waiting for more than 30 minutes order has not arrive. Asked their staff about our order and was ignored.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
A tad bit dark - but in line with the theme of its American linkage. Food portions are smaller than I used to remember but prices are reasonable. If you are a SAFRA member, 10% discount awaits.
Quite a decent place to enjoy a Western meal but I wish restaurants like this don't charge for water. :(

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Food is nice and usual Aston's relatively high and consistent quality. However restaurant ambient is really dark and gloomy. Nice for dinner but not good for lunch....as it makes you wonder if its lunch or dinner due to the extremely dark environment with dim lightings.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Ordered fiery chicken with garden veggies(boiled) and fries.
Restaurant is barely half filled but orders took 30mins to arrive and everything is cold.  Not worth to even take a pic

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Always a great deal and the food quality is consistent across the chain in Singapore.  What's even better is SAFRA members get a 7% discount at this outlet.  Sub SGD10 for a decent main (with the discount) is a good deal.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: It's the decent steak house in Singapore. Nothing spectacular but the char grill chicken is always good and steak often get done a bit too much. The sides are good for kids with Mac and cheese, onion rings and pasta salad. The tasty rice is surprisingly flavorful so try that if you want some rice. One thing bad is that you need to pay for water.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: I didn't get the name of the lady who was fronting customers at cashier. But I wanted give kudos for her patient and customer-oriented service. Other than Fiery Chicken, there were no other chickens available. Also no fish no that. I wonder how Astons Toa Payoh do business. But the lady kept running in and out, in to take order, while out to inform customers in queue the unavailable items. I would give all my 5 stars to the lady but none to the branch manager.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Good food and nice environment

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Charbroiled chicken came at room temperature while seafood marinara sauce was abit to the watery and bland side.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Not one the better outlet. The menu has much less items than their other outlet. Disappointing

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: The little old lady serving us is such a sweetheart!! Decent food. Took a long time to have our orders taken and seated though.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Reasonable price but lacks the freshness I used to love about the place. Seems like a lot of pre-prepared food & sauces. Very automated customer service. Potato salad was bad, bit into raw pieces. Mac & cheese was not good. I had lemon-lime grilled chicken that lacked flavor. All I tasted was the sauce poured over it.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: Bad food, fries were reheated without the normal seasoning, ordered the fried chicken and the flour covering the chicken was burnt. Oil was dripping from the chicken. Wouldn't recommend.

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content: A decent places for cin chat during lunch time! Not crowded

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
The staff were very helpful and friendly!
Food were of good standard too!

restaurant name: ANDES by ASTONS @ SAFRA Toa Payoh
content:
Very clean and very good service. Food is up to the standard you expect from Astons.

There is a long queue when I went there so maybe that's something you would want to keep in mind but the queue was quite short.

10% discount for HomeTeamNS members but if you are Singaporean, I'm sure you know that 🤣
Really nice food! And the staff was super accommodating and understanding as well. Really enjoyed purchasing from them. Will come back again!

Female staff forgot to place order with kitchen, wasted 30mins waiting. Also busy on handphone all the time. Kitchen staff also didnt expedite order and unapologetic.
Fortunately food was good, otherwise a total disaster...
Big portion ,nice

Definitely consistent of deep fried crispy chicken cutlet.
Indeed a good idea to order with pasta.
Western food options - good to have for a change. But no fight against the deep fried chicken wings in the same food court

“One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.”
This review was made possible by my HEX Crypto stakes. Hex.com

Not an honest hawker. Ordered 2 packets of Fish & Chips. 1 order was remnants of the whole fish fillet (3 little small fillet fish) instead of one whole piece of fillet fish. Felt very cheated. Side dishes was a little coleslaw and baked beans and some skinny looking fries. Pathetic!
Placed order via Deliveroo for delivery from 6.45 - 7.15 pm. Waited for ONE HOUR until 7.45 pm to be told order cancelled. One star already too many.
4 stars for the nuggets and fried chicken wings.
Delicious and filling!

(Translated by Google) really sucks!
I ordered a takeaway at grab!
Fried chicken ~ a brood ~ rice ~ and eggs!
Only chickens and broilers are delivered to home! And it's already paid!
There is no contact information at all!
The person who called grab said it was none of her business~🙄️

Are you doing this business?

(Original)
真的烂！
我在grab订一份外卖！
炸鸡～一只童子鸡～饭～和鸡蛋！
送货到家才有鸡和童子鸡而已！而且已经收钱了！
单和网上根本找不到联系方式！
打给grab 的人说不关她事～🙄️

你们是这样做生意的吗！

(Translated by Google) Just passed the grabfood order for your Half Chicken with rice&fries*value* set meal. Halfway through the meal, I saw wire in the rice? ? Shouldn’t the food be very hygienic? What about hygiene? What happens if a pregnant woman fails to notice when eating? ! !

(Original)
刚刚通过grabfood order了你们家的Half Chicken with rice&fries*value*的套餐。吃到一半，竟然看见饭里有铁丝？？做吃的不是应该很讲究卫生吗？卫生呢？万一孕妇吃时没有注意到，后果会如何？！！

Great variety of main courses, side dishes, and lots of dessert to choose from.

The creamy chicken pasta was great value. Definitely wished that the pork-steak portion was bigger because it was very yummy. Sandwich and truffle fries was ok. Spinach soup was so so, served hot so that’s good.

Waffles is crispy on outside, light and fluffy on inside. Please safe some space for the waffles :)

First try and love the food n ambiance. Away from the crowd, reservations recommended to avoid disappointment! Tried the chicken burger and pork Ribs, simple meal yet delicious! Too bad no waffles today, will try next visit! Please get spare waffle machine as a backup can 😜

Called in to reserve and true enough the place was packed up very soon. The pull pork burger is tasty and flavorful. The duck confit is made just nice. Loved it. Draft beer was having a promo - buy 2 get 1 free. Overall great service, ambience and best, no service charges.

Cozy cafe for dinner, served mostly western food. Teriyaki chicken pizza was surprisingly yummy and crispy! Loaded with sauce and mayo. The pan seared barramundi was fresh, paired with mashed potatoes and salad. Kids Mac and cheese was a small portion and comes with a drink. Service was excellent and attentive. The lights was dim yet warm. It was crowded for a Thursday night! Overall, the food is good, will come back for waffles and ice cream next time!

Have Been Wanting To Visit For Times... So It's Like Finally~
Is Definitely Worth To Visit Cafe...
Nice Ambience, Nice Food!!
Baked Escargots 4/5 👍 (It'll Be Perfect If More Garlic Are Added)
Mushroom Truffle Melts 3/5 (Was A Little Disappointed w Their Crust Though)
Pork Ribeye Steak 4/5 👍
Grilled Salmon 4/5 👍
*WAFFLES* 4/5 👍

I enjoy the variety of food choices and the service. Salmon was abit dry but still good. Only down side is we had to pay via the app before our order comes. So if you need to add any other order you need to separately pay again...

19 May: The cafe is easily located in Toa Payoh, quite near to MRT station. Probably 5 to 7 mins walk from station. There is a promotion during lunch time by topping up $4.80 for soup and drink when ordering a main.

The soup is really awesome!! 👍🏾👍🏾 Foods are great. I will definitely go back to try out other foods especially their desserts with my family! Price is reasonable, value for money!

21 May: I came back again with my family. We tried out more foods. The Black Mama Pork Burger is really nice! The pork is very tendered and juicy. It is really worth trying!! This round we ordered Carbonara Spaghetti, Creamy Chicken Penne, Kids Tomato Pasta, Kids Fish and Chips, Soup of the day, Waffles with 2 scoops of classic ice cream (Mint Chocolate and Caramel with nuts) and scoops of Bubble Gum flavor for kids. The waffles is crispy and milky taste~

There's no service and GST. What you see is what you pay for!

Nice place for affordable brunch and good place to chill!

Went there during their weekday brunch so it was $9.90 for the mains and you can add on for the soup of the day and drinks. Food tasted quite ok given the price, though the pasta could be a bit more seasoned or flavourful at it tasted just like cream. The chicken in the pasta was instead quite salty. The sauce for the dory was quite similar to the cream pasta but i goes well and i enjoyed that.

Thumbs up for their desserts as their waffles were so good!!  The ice cream was good too and generous serving. All that for $12!

They use an online order system so you will have to order and pay online.

Overall a pleasant experience and will be back for their waffles again!!

It was a busy Saturday night but we could still get a table. Ordering and payment through QR code which saved the staff some time and energy. Food was served quite promptly. Was pleasantly surprised by the quality of my food. Delicious. Price is reasonable.

Nice ambience after the lunch crowd has passed.

Loved the vibes.

Food is dismal though. The chicken pasta is very tasteless and the pumpkin soup is very watery and tasteless.

Coffee was fine.

Cozy place with friendly staff. Quickly seated on a weekday dinner. Back a couple of times to try out different dishes.

My son likes the ribs. Nicely done for a wallet friendly price. Fish was yummy too.

Today, we tried butter chicken burger and seafood aglio olio. Will be back again!

Waffle is freshly made, nice and crunchy

Pork ribs portion is huge and the meat came off the bones easily. Chicken chop portion is small taste very average.

decent cafe
Price slightly on the high side but still ok
Food is good but salmon set, portion slightly too small
Recommendation: Double Chocolate Brownie, Big Breakfast n the tea series
One of our favourite joints. The lamb shank just falls off the bone, I didn't even need to use my knife! We must have the emperor's fingers side every time. Wife got her usual salmon.

Ordered the Pan Seared Barramundi, sweet potato fries, truffle fries, chicken meatballs.

My main was pretty well prepared, side dishes are alright in my opinion. Meatballs were quite salty but this is subjective.

Staff were friendly and efficient!

Service :4 stars
Food: 3.5 stars
- the sausage veggie was too oily. You can see from the plate the abdundunt oil left.
-the kids beef burger is quite good though.
Value for money :4 stars
Nice neighborhood cafe with a wide variety. The cafe is quite spacious. The food were good and the staff efficient and polite
Came here twice. Price is good and food is nice. Came once for lunch and once just for coffee. Found my favourite fresh milk with coffee ice cubes here. Will definitely return to eat again.
Nice ambience cafe. Staff service is good. Ordered the creamy chicken spaghetti. Chicken is salty, noodle creamy yet a bit plain. Maybe will try other food next time.

5 stars for the friendly service. Like the cosy environment too. tried the duck confit tender meat but overall its too salty for me. The pork redeye on the other hand is delicious though.
It is a place you don't mind to say ' I'll be back'
😊
Nice cafe concept eatery place in a hdb shophouse. Friendly and helpful service crew. Prices on the ex side though.
Not bad their sweet potato fries was good. Spinach soup reminded me of Jack's Place.

Below expectations. Food was very oily and portion was little. Sausage Aglio - 5/10, oily, salty, unimpressive.

Creamy chicken pasta - extremely creamy, overwhelming, bad @ 2/10.

Price - your usual neighbourhood café price but high for food quality

Café was noisy, not for chilling  people!

Nice variety of food menu at an acceptable pricing. Place Is medium. Got inside and outside seats. Service was okay.
Aircon is okay.
Got deserts and ice cream.

Carbonara was decent but could be better.
Teriyaki chicken thin crust pizza was tasty.
Iced cubes espresso latte was alright.

Price is alright, food is average.
Tried their truffle chicken and pork ribs, both are quite dry.

Nice little restaurant at Toa Payoh. They seem to have a good crowd during dinner time. There wasn’t any queue when I got there around 7pm and there was a table available soon. The food is tasty but the portion is too small for a main. Service is excellent and the stuffs are all polite to the customers.

Found this cafe through Google search and it was the 1st one that came up for "best eats near Toa Payoh mrt".. Cafe was located on the other side of Toa Payoh mall, so might need to walk abit to find it if you are not familiar with the area. Cafe was almost full on a Sunday afternoon at about 1pm and more people came after us. Indoor and outdoor seatings available. Food ordering and payment was through online, quick and efficient. Waiting time for the food was surprisingly quick, less than 10mins. Wide variety of western cuisine and desserts & beverages. Food was good and service was good too, staff were all friendly. No gst or service charge. Nice place to visit if you are in Toa Payoh area.
The food was so good.. Forgot to take photos 😂. Reasonably priced good food and desserts!

Ordered (as pickup) from food panda many times

Today (29 april 2022)
i ordered truffle fries and the fries were re-fried so many times, the inside is hard. Never ordering again.
————————————
2nd time in here, first time was when they’ve just opened(bought a dry cake), so giving them a chance since a lot of reviews say food is nice. Coffee wasn’t bitter, just had a slight tinge of sourness (I don’t add sugar to my flat white), food tasted good. Lunch for 2 mains with one soup and drink was $30 (rounded up)
Really nice surprise to stumble upon this place. Foods yummy and reasonably price

Decided to try this place because of its reviews. Although the food is pretty decent, I found a total of 3 stands of hair inside my husband and my food. Needless to say I didn't finish my food. The waiter took away our food and acted dumbfounded. No apologies, no service recovery. Nothing. Not that all these matters... but sigh. Simply disappointed.

This place is absolute trash. Waste of money for what they provide. 3 tiny slices of toast for a dish meant for 2? I'm supposed to split the 3rd one down the middle? $28 for an anemic excuse of a steak?
Sausage platter is straight off the frozen meats section at NUTC. Quick pop in the air fryer and on to your table. Bland and boring.
Amazingly, its crowded, proving once again that us Singaporeans will support absolutely any terrible place, so long as it's accessible. I mean, that's why I came down.

Save your money and go to a better place.
Nice place to have a good meal.  The price is ok.  There have some nice meals there.

Quite recommendable place for lunch or dinner. Overall food is good but there,s improvement to be made on the food taste. Especially for the pork rib eye abit too salty. Anyway great job on food presentation. Will come back again to see any improvement on the taste 😄😄

Hidden away from the main alley of Toa Payoh Central, this cafe served quite a wide range of western dishes, pasta, pizza, steak, lamb, dessert, ice cream and even beers! Tried their lamb shank, the meat is really tender and fall of the bone but it still have the gamey taste of the lamb. Thought it would have more spice mask it. The mash potatoe lack flavour and not smooth. The sweet potato fries is a bit too thin but it is crispy. The service is fast even for the lamb dish!

110321 Impromptu TGIT dinner with ❤️ @ The Larder Cafe, had baked escargots, grilled buttermilk chicken and Black Mama Pork Burger (What a name for a Charcoal Bun burger!)

Osmanthus Latte was somehow a bit of a disappointment with a hint of the flavoured taste, but promptly covered by the heavy coffee flavour, despite being a milk-based latte drink.

Still a good dining place to try out overall !

Tucked away at a corner of Toa Payoh central Larder Cafe offers nice juicy burgers for meat lovers. Good size dining space with approx 12 tables catering to different group sizes. Online Menu, Food Order & payment online, great for tech savvy people, and food was delivered promptly. Overall nice place to have a quick bite and fast service. Thumbs up!
Cons: Wafer ice cream dessert took quite awhile to be serve though. No free water.
Good place for gathering n enjoying delicious food
The most interested one is Waffles Ice Cream and Pizza.

Ambience is alright, has a tacky industrial look. Menu is really quite extensive and includes a whole range of ice cream flavors but I only tried the coffee.

Got a long black and a flat white and when the drinks came, I could not tell them apart because there was that little foam in the flat white. Their coffees do not come with latte art, just milk dumped into the espresso shot. Taste is not too bad but the there is a lot of room for improvement wrt the texturing of milk.

Cannot comment on the service as we ordered through the phone app instead of at the cashier.

Their duck confit had perfectly crispy skin and mouth watering meat below, accompanied with fresh rocket and tomatoes.

The mushroom truffle gratin was also amazing from the first bite to the last, filled with creamy yumminess.

I'll back to try their pizza, burgers, and other mains!

Sorry ate too fast before I could take photos :P

Visited during lunch time on Saturday, restaurant was about half filled, staff were warm and friendly. Food were good but nothing spectacular, price was reasonable for most of the menu. Great place for gathering as their table can be easily rearrange for more seatings of 10 pax easily and wasn't too noisy for chatting.

Has both indoor and outdoor seating. Reservations recommended if you want indoor seating.
Pork ribs were tender and well marinated. Sweet potato fries not bad; has a abit of a crisp.
Arrabbiata Linguine is pretty spicy (fair warning)

Very nice pork ribs and pork burger! Pork ribs are tender and flavourful! Love the fries too! Crispy and crunchy!

Lavender honey ice cream is very nice! Lavender smell very strong and not too sweet. Charcoal Waffle is crispy too!

Good service too!

When you crave for something and it’s just around the corner.😋🌸Have you ever visited The Larder? If not yet, then it’s time for you to explore..3-5 minutes walk from Toa Payoh Mrt,you gonna love the place,the food are amazing,the ambiance is cozy. I really love to come here and bring my friends to try every dish they have. Just so love to spend time with friends here and having a brunch. The price are affordable with easy access of their menu. Btw they are using QR menu as well,it is fast and easy to order. Highly Recommended.

Waited for 30min for a table of 2 on wed night. Some food already out of stock. Had mushroom aglio and buttermilk chicken.
Mushroom aglio is real bad. Tasteless and funghi taste is too heavy. Told the staff about it, she nicely replaced a new one. But it still taste worse than home cook. It’s $14+ for. Small plate.
Chicken was salty and falling out by bits and pieces. Don’t wan even need to use knife.
Left. Hungry.
Yummy food! Recommend the charcoal waffles and their triple chocolate ice cream!

Food was a hit or miss depending on the dish you order. My table ordered pork ribs (was quite decent), mushroom truffle pasta (good), teriyaki chicken pizza (meh - the mayonnaise overwhelmed the entire pizza), caesar salad (so-so).

What was not great was the service. One of the waitstaff who is clearly a butch has a really poor attitude and for some reason was just rude to me simply because I was a guy. Could not greet customers properly, and talk decently. My entire dinner was ruined simply because of the way she behaved and spoke. Could tell she was biased because she treated her other butch customers with such kindness and courtesy, but not to others sadly.

NOT RECOMMENDED!

I like the Truffle Mushroom Melt and the salad is very fresh. I recommend the sweet potatoe fries. Many place couldn't achieve the crispy or it will become soggy very fast. But here the fries is nicely done, no fancy seasonibg just true skill & true taste of the sweet potato.

Osmanthus latte is too sweet for me. Has ordered for less sweet but myself still find it sweet. Seem to me like Osmanthus honey in latte. Personal opinion.

Cafe located in toa Payoh central. Decent selection of food, taste is not bad but a little pricey. Food takes quite long to be served. Interesting ice cream flavours available here. Cash, nets or grab pay payment only. Unique decorations.

Tucked away on the 2nd floor, this place offers a wide variety of cuisines from Indian to Western and Korean.

This place also has a cloud kitchen that allows you to order and pickup certain food easily via their lockers but is however strictly for takeaways.

It's good that they are starting to get more footfall in this quiet food court. They have also expanded into a central kitchen that houses various brands like king of fried rice & Texas chicken. Will also recommend the Korean don at gogiyo. Their teriyaki salmon don is really fresh and the serving is huge!
Unique foodcourt with lotsa beer options, great tze char and western (Fatty Bom Bom) food!

Place has gone thru some reno, and signs of more reno being done, with the addition of some new shops. Today ordered food from Ya Long. Not disappointed. The white beehoon, veg dishes were all so good. Definitely will visit again to check out the new stores

Nicely decorated in an industrial theme aptly because this is located in an industrial building. Huge variety of beer and drinks at an affordable price. Great for large gatherings and family dinners. Good array of other eateries in the same food court. Parking could be challenging though. Advice to come outside of peak period to avoid the massive crowd during lunch.

Select Group Cloud Kitchen opened within Grains & Hops on 29 May 2021, at #02-01. Basically they took up 4 stall space and offer delivery/takeaway for 7 brands (see pictures for brands available).

Ordering can be done through the 2 kiosks available, payment only by Nets. For customers who may need help, there is a counter where you can place order with staff but payment also by Nets only.

Once order is ready (you can order from any combination of stalls), you will get a receipt with a number, look out for your number on display and then collect from the numbered locker.

How to get there: bus stop after mosque along Braddell Road, just in front of Blk 978 Toa Payoh North building. Grain & Hop is on level 2, access by escalator (see picture).

If driving, you can park at the MSCP within blk 978, as open air car park mainly for season (but on Sunday quite empty). Alternative is to park at Blk 199 Toa Payoh North open air carpark just behind the industrial estate, short 5 min walk.

Enjoy!

Located at level 2, and you can only access it via 1 escalator, nowhere else.
Not very accessible, though there is a nearby bus stop.
Well decorated place with many food stalls. It's a food court with aircon selling food from many cuisines and the place is huge!
Tze char, western, korean cuisine, army stew/mookata, drinks.
At the back of the place, the drinks stall sells snacks and many beers! They seem affordable!
Came here for Gogiyo, but might come again for other stalls
Generous portions from Fatty Bom Bom. Ordered the chicken cutlet and chicken chop. Find it a bit greesy but generally decent Western food.

Tl;dr: Peaceful oasis for lunch, good food selection, good cooking! 😋👍

Review: Went for a slightly early lunch, Comfortable place, food was good.  Lunch crowd started coming in when we finished, but generally still quite peaceful compared to other lunch spots.

Super upset and angry with the drink stall chinese lady. Paid $34.80 for my drinks but the actual bill was $22.60 because they forgotten about there was a discount for the beer. Just because i use OCBC paynow, the chinese lady said they cannot refund me in cash of the differences but ask me to buy drinks from the stall instead. I insisted for the difference and she keep refusing until the guy from the zi char stall came by to help and told the chinese lady to refund me in cash. And i told the zi char guy that’s what i ask for and the chinese lady suddenly came to me and change her story and say (in chinese) “ is not that i don’t want to give you back the difference, but i was just trying to explain to you.” This chinese lady super good at twisting her story! Was really fuming 😤

Amazing cloud concept chicken so you can get food from various estabs all in one place! There’s Lerk Thai, Pho Street, newly opened King of Fried Rice, Niigata, Hill Street Coffee Shop and Hong Kong Sheng Kee Dessert. Air conditioned waiting area makes the long wait bearable in the tropical summer heat. You also collect your orders in a contactless manner. Great concept and great first encounter with a cloud kitchen!
Nice modern bistro with variety of stalls to select and share among friends or family. There are rounds tables suitable for gatherings and chill over wide selection of beers.
Food was good. Ambience was ok. Accessible as there is a bustop just outside the place. Must try the chicken cutlet rice. My fav in the menu so far.

The selection and quality of this place is decent. But the service is horrendous. They sell a variety of beers but the drink stall helper has no idea what the beers are and blames it on the customer that they should communicate in Mandarin whereas all the menu items are in English. Even when taking orders for coffee and tea, the person in charge could not apprehend just 2 simple orders. It is okay to have the lack of knowledge, but the attitude to put her lack of on the customer is unacceptable.
good beer promo and delicious food at Yalong Bay. have to order their specialty fire chicken
Love the beers... Loads of options
Nice and cosy. Limited choices for food.
Ate spicy chicken Japchae. Not spicy at all. A bit salty to my taste bud.
