Fatty boom boom have consistently great taste, fried rice king offer great fried rice you can ask for .. superb
Nice place for a small gathering but food wise is average only.
Ate there for dinner, lovely tables and air conditioning

Enjoyed the zhi char stall especially their fishhead curry, salted egg chicken and claypot brinjal. The place is air-conditioned with high ceiling. For beer lovers, there's great selection there at reasonable price.

Was at their woodlands outlet. The can drinks are not chilled and they only provide a cup of ice per can. And on a hot day, if the ice has melted before you can finish the drink, the drinks stall will not give you more ice nor sell you ice. Probably the first time encountering such incident. So best is don’t drink or be prepared for drinks not chilled.

It's a nice place to have lunch or dinner, only because it is air conditioned, parking is super convenient, and not many people truly know of this place yet. It's very cool how they have so many different types of craft beers on display, and how the prices are much more reasonable compared to the bars and pubs we know. The food here is also very well curated, whether it is the tse char stall, the western food, or the malay Muslim food stall. Quite impressed.
Nice Zhi char food. Good for big group
Air conditioned food court with mookata and beer options. Beer is cash only, so bring some along. Social distancing is minimal, plus some people working there don't really put on their masks.
Pretty busy place on a weekend night. Good variety of local favourite foods like zi char, Indian Muslim, Western grill and Korean Army Stew, supported by a well-stocked beer fridge.

Air-conditioned and have a big variety of beer selections.  Food selection is good. Indian booth is popular choice, while most Chinese sample the flaming duck. Western booth is ok but takes forever to cook.

The so called famous chicken is average tasting to me. I guess the wow factor for most pple was the flames. The zichar stall serves decent food.

Beer bundle deals are good. Great place to gather with friends.

Service of Yalong Bay is good and staff are approachable and friendly as well. Reservation is also allowed. However, the food is not as tasty. The lala Hor fun supposed to be popular tasted starchy. The prawn paste chicken wings and deer meat with onion were also not tasty as those we took in other coffee shops. The burning chicken, we didn’t get to try as needs to call for reservation one day in advance. Other shops, the western food took 40 mins to serve our orders but didn’t taste good either. Either over fried or oily. Kids couldn’t finish it at all. On TOP of that, the place is very hot although the aircon is on. Only attention is the beer pricing.. 5 of bottles for $30 - $35
Cosy place but pricing can be cheaper for such a place....
Lovely place to dine in. Great selection of Asian cuisines at affordable prices. Cooling place but gets a little stuff though bearable.

Haha thought this was a bistro but turned out to be a seafood foodcourt with zhi cha stalls and a row of kebab and western food. Went on a Saturday evening and place had a big turned out of customer. Ended a bit disappointed as was hoping to have a quiet place to dine. Food also took >30mins to serve.

This is one of those hipster coffee shops, located in the middle of nowhere, selling good food and providing good ambience. The tse char stall here Yalong Bay is pretty decent, and the coffeeshop has a very impressive collection of craft beers that are very well priced, especially in bulk. Imported San Miguel will go for 35 for 10 bottles - that's how attractive it can go.
Not many stalls are opened. Price are consider high as this is only canteen to foodcourt environment. Not really worth.

Food at Yalong Zhicar is nice. Good to go in group of 4 - 6 pax to share their La la Hor Fun. Those who like La la should try this because they are generous with the la la . They also have 'Fire' Chicken ...very unique way of eating, should try this also but need to order 1 day in advance. This place is crowded at night even on a weekday night.
Some good food. Mainly good for the cheap and wide variety of beer. But closes quite early (9pm) and does not have many options for breakfast.

King of Fried Rice disappointing.
Rice did not have any flavour and even though it smells nice, the rice is completely bland and not worthy of a trip there.
SUPER COOL PLACE love the fooooodddd supper yumz i reco u try fatty bom bom🤤
Ambience is fairly alright, spectrum of food is above average however there is room for improvement on the cleanliness of the tables.
great food and ambience though it is a food court. all kinds of beer could be found there  only thing is the time it closes 10 pm .zichar is good
Good place for beer, but now cannot due to heightened alert phase, can only order take away
Dine with Family. Nice ambience

Nice place to chill out with local delights.
Good selection of beers at reasonable prices
The food and variety choices have increased so much. More lively. And good for beer and food.
Love the food and service, recommend to friends
A good variety of food - Chinese, Korean, India, etc etc, and the food is nice.
3 food stalls, including 1 halal Western food. A few other stalls have recently closed.
Stuffy, warm, not much stall. Most people are waiting for their takeaway order.
Chill place with beer buckets. Close at 10 tho
